name: Dream Shift
description:
Dream Shift is a solo print-and-play card game. It is designed to be quick and fun.

In Dream Shift, the player must battle his or her nightmares in a constantly shifting dream world. Each dream setting or nightmare is a manifestation of the dreamer's subconscious attempting to communicate with the conscious mind in order to resolve various issues. Maybe the dreamer needs to learn something about him- or herself. Perhaps he or she has some fear or guilt that must be overcome. The Dream deck contains both Setting and Nightmare cards. The player begins with one Setting and one Nightmare, and must resolve issues presented by these cards in order to draw a new Dream card to replace either the Setting or the Nightmare.

To do this, the player has access to Power cards. These allow the player to resolve issues on the Setting and Nightmare cards, which will shift either the Setting or the Nightmare and present new issues to resolve. The player must make careful use of his or her Power cards to strategically draw additional Power cards or to shift the dream. The game ends when the Dream deck is empty, or when the player is "stuck" with no Power cards to resolve the issues presented.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Blood Bowl: Skaven Team
description:
Skaven Team is part of the Blood Bowl Series!

Rules and a set of counters for Skaven teams for Blood Bowl (first edition) were published as a pull out section in White Dwarf issue #86 (Feb 1987).

Gameplay-wise, Skaven teams have faster players than most other teams, can't have Defensive or Kicking players and use a different Star Player Table, where the most common result is a Chaos mutation (a roll on the Mutations Table).

The rules also include an example of a veteran Skaven team, the Skaven Scramblers.

Microbadges:
- Blood Bowl fan
- Blood Bowl fan
- Blood Bowl fan
- Blood Bowl fan - Humans
- Blood Bowl fan - Norse
- Blood Bowl: Team Manager - The Card Game fan
- Blood Bowl fan - Chaos Dwarves
- Blood Bowl fan - Orcs&Goblins
- Blood Bowl fan - Chaos
- Blood Bowl fan - Amazons
- Blood Bowl fan - Halflings
- Blood Bowl fan - Vampires
- Blood Bowl fan - Dwarves
- Blood Bowl fan - Dark Elves
- Blood Bowl fan - Skaven
- Blood Bowl fan - Elves
- Blood Bowl fan - Wood Elves
- Blood Bowl fan - Lizardmen
- Blood Bowl fan - Undead
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Sports, Wargame

name: HorrorClix: Freddy vs. Jason Collectors Set
description:
We get Freddy Krueger, Freddy Nightmare Worm, Jason Voorhees, Jason Carrying Freddy's Head, and the final uberpiece, Freddy And Jason Together (featuring both figures on a single base). It is worth noting that the scenarios that come with the rulebook do not recommend using this last piece…

The figures are 28mm, and of fine quality, although the factory paint jobs leave a bit to be desired. And for those of you wishing to rebase, they'll come off easily enough (and provide SIX figures rather than five; the Jason Vs. Freddy piece can be separated).

Altogether, a neat tabletop game awaits. Make a neat main event for this coming Halloween, and a nice diversion from the usual zombie geek bingo events…

This is actually a Licensed Starter/Expansion style pack for Horrorclix, and doesn't really work as a stand alone game.
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pellinoria
description:
Welcome to Pellinoria, land of knights and dragons, jesters and jousts, gold and chivalry. The king will reward the chivalrous, while the queen favours the wealthy. Great fame and glory will be bestowed on those who manage to defeat one of the many dragons that prowl the land, but they will not be able to do so without the aid of a knight. Those seeking a gentler path may make a deal with the merchant, court the princess or gain a small favour from the jester. And the belligerent will seek to harm their opponents by banding with the black knight or by persuading a thief to perform his nefarious deeds. Can you become chief noble by the end of your time in Pellinoria?

The game is played over 4 years of 4 seasons each. Before each year, the cards are laid out so that each corresponds to a number. Then, during each season, the players roll their dice, assign pairs of them to cards that match the value rolled and take the relevant actions. At the end of the game, the player with most victory points is the winner.

name: Buurman & Buurman Het Bordspel
description:
Light family dice based game based on the Czech animation series "Pat & Mat", in Dutch called "Buurman & Buurman".

Each player has a tableau and their own set of 6 dice with which they try to fulfill jobs by rolling the tool-symbols shown on the job-cards. There are jobs in varying levels of difficulty, from 2 points (2 symbols) upto 25 points (6 symbols).

On your turn, one or more of the four jobs in the middle of the table can be fulfilled immediately or you can place dice on the cards in the hope to fulfill the job on the next turn. That is, unless someone else completes it before you or unless the black 7th die prohibits you from fulfilling the job due to various forms of bad luck which Buurman & Buurman were famous for.
Don't forget to call out "A Je To!" if such a card shows on the drawpile for an extra 5 points.

Collect 6 jobs in the tableau or a total value of 40 points to win.
categories: Dice, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Objective Shreveport!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Designer John Theissen has another compact operational sandbox for ACW gamers to play around in. While the game has some similarities to his MORE AGGRESSIVE ATTITUDES, important differences in scale and emphasis result in a unique experience that's specific to the factors that doomed the Union's 1864 Red River Campaign.

Each side has three Leaders whose presence is generally required to launch an attack, but there the similarities end. The Union army is larger but also more cumbersome, being dependent on slow-moving and vulnerable supply trains. A rigid leadership structure makes coordination difficult, and one of those leaders is going to sit on his hands in Alexandria for the first third of the game instead of advancing toward the Union objective: Shreveport.

The Confederates have less strength points to throw around, but they have a much more flexible command structure, and don't have to worry about their own supply. Slowing the Union advance (not that they need much help) and launching well-chosen attacks, supported by well-timed Special Events cards, is key for the beleaguered butternuts.

Within these parameters, there's ample room for players to experiment, with multiple ways to approach your objectives (and to frustrate your opponent's). There's only a handful of units on each side, but plenty of hexes to maneuver in. It's a challenging game, while remaining short enough to play in a single evening, and simple enough to serve as an excellent introduction to operational scale gaming.

name: Mystery Detective Vol. 1: Classic Cases
description:
Mystery Detective is a mystery solving party game that you can start playing almost as soon as you open the box.

One player, the Chief, takes one of the 100 illustrated cards and reads it to himself. The front of the card has the mystery, the back the solution. Then he reads the front of the card to the players and shows them the illustration. The other players are the detectives. Singly and together, they try to solve the mystery by asking the Chief questions. But he can only answer Yes, No, Close, or Not Relevant.

Here is the first mystery:
A woman dies because she was on the phone too long.

We often talk too long on the phone but don't die! What's going on?

The detectives discuss and try to form theories that can be proved or disproved by their questions:
A lovers' quarrel?
Was the woman killed by her husband? - no
By her lover?- no

Okay, maybe international espionage:
Was the woman a spy? - no, not relevant

Hmm. Maybe we can localize this.
Was the woman lying down?- no
Standing up? - no
Sitting? - YES!!

Now we're getting somewhere…

Bit by bit the detectives try to piece together the mystery. Often a question from one detective will give another an idea for a whole new line of questioning. There is no winner or loser but when you finally solve the mystery, you feel brilliant!

The mysteries, while not all crimes, are morbid and twisted and often very funny. You need to discuss, question and think outside of the box in order to solve them. Great fun, you can play almost anywhere, anytime. In the car, at the dinner table or at a gathering, all are perfect for this co-cop mystery solving game.

This volume contains 100 cases.
For Black Stories fans, this first volume includes new translations of Black Stories 1 and 2.

-description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Are you telling me this genius scientist can't get the first place?
description:
In この天才科学者が首席になれないとでもいうんですか？ — a.k.a., Are you telling me this genius scientist can't get the first place? — players are researching optics in order to graduate from an institution.

During the game, they combine transparent cards to generate and activate lenses to discover new energies, convert one material to another, develop unique character abilities, and (of course) score points. The player who earns the most victory points from research wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Ownership, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Reavers of Midgard: Finnish Linens Promo Cards
description:
A six card set for Reavers of Midgard! It adds six Finnish Linens cards to collect.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Follow, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Wazabi: Supplément Piment
description:
Wazabi: Supplément Piment, an expansion that can be used with all editions of Wazabi, includes eight dice and twenty cards with new effects to spice up gameplay and that require you to pay close attention during the turns of other players.

The additional components make it possible to have up to eight players in the game.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Potion Market
description:
Once a year, in the pale light of the moon, this perfectly normal village comes alive with magic. Tonight, you and your fellow villagers will prepare your cauldrons, fill them with magical ingredients, and set about brewing potions. The time for the annual potion market has arrived.

People have gathered from near and far to experience this mysterious night and enjoy its festivities. Of course, they are also eager to take home with them all manner of wondrous potions—potions they can only find here, tonight.

The magic will last until the sun’s first rays chase the stars from the sky. Brew your potions and market them wisely, and you’ll have made a fortune by the break of dawn.

—description from the designer

今宵は年に一度の街中に魔力が溢れる不思議な夜。
街の人たちは魔力を帯びた6つの素材と大釜を使ってポーション作りに励み、一夜限りのポーションマーケットが開かれます。

この不思議な夜を体験しようと世界中から観光客が訪れ、街中はお祭り騒ぎ。
もちろんお土産は、年に一度しか手に入らない魔法のポーションです。

さぁ、朝が来る前にたくさんのポーションを作って大金を稼ぎましょう。

—description from the designer (Japanese)
mechanics: Mancala, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Wunderwatschler
description:
Players must move their four pieces to the goal. The die is a regular 6 sided die but the odds are black and the evens are red. If you roll an even number you move one of your pieces forward, if you roll an odd you move a piece back.

Lots of chain reactions occur as you cannot occupy the same field so when you land on a space you push pieces forward.

In order to get to the "cave" you have to roll an exact number, but you may get pushed into the cave if someone lands on your space. Whoever gets all their pieces in the cave wins.

May win for most blood curdling cover ever created.

name: Zensū
description:
This is an abstract game played on a 6x9 board using flat pieces with their possible moves marked on them.

The aim is to cross your opponent’s border before they can cross into yours but, with pieces moving in four directions you have to keep your wits about you!

The way to win the game is to get one of your pieces to your opponent's back line.

name: Hordes: High Command – Immortal Tales
description:
Bolster your armies with Immortal Tales, the third expansion for Hordes: High Command!

Immortal Tales contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warlock cards, to bring new strategies to your Trollblood, Circle Orboros, Skorne, and Legion of Everblight decks.

Requires Hordes: High Command core set to play.

name: 遥かなる喜望峰 (Harukanaru Kibouhou)
description:
遥かなる喜望峰 (Harukanaru Kibouhou) is a re-implementation of an earlier Japanese game, combining both Discovery: The Era of Voyage and its expansion set 航海の時代 王家の書簡 (Kōkai no jidai ōke no shokan). In addition, publisher Arclight included extended rules for 'Pirates' and 'Nagasaki', which the original game did not have. Harukanaru Kibouhou means 'The Great Cape of Good Hope'.

As before, players take on the role of ambitious captains leading their fleet towards glory at sea. Through trading goods and commodity, investment and development, you accumulate reputation and influence among the islands. Build a foundation for your family’s wealth and prosperity!

The designer is uncredited as it is the publisher A.I.Lab.遊.

Note, this edition is not the same as the editions by EmperorS4 or Kobold Spieleverlag, which are versions of the original base game only.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Fresh Fruits
description:
Aunt Helga has sent you shopping with one command at the forefront: Buy the juiciest fruits!

But it won't be easy to bring them home in one piece as the heavy fruits must not be placed on top of the lighter ones — and of course you should buy exactly the fruits that Aunt Helga would like to have. Your challenge in Fresh Fruits is to pack your basket in just the right way with all the required fruits so that nothing is crushed and no juice is spilled. Whoever fulfills the most requirements will score best and win.
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Napoleon's Campaigns in Miniature: A wargamer's guide to the Napoleonic Wars 1796-1815
description: The empire strikes back with a vengeance in the latest edition of this widely acclaimed book which enables any reader to reverse the tables at Waterloo or avert the French disasters in Spain and Russia! Packed with information on every aspect of Napoleonic warfare, it shows the wargamer how to make his miniature battles look even more realistic and satisfying through a proper understanding of strategy, lines of communication, logistics and other essentials, down to the price of a musket ball or a pair of infantryman's boots. Stimulating and full of ideas, it is no wonder that this book is the one against which all others on the subject are judged.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Patrick Stephens Limited, Ugo Mursia Editore (Mursia)

name: Myth: Items Expansion I
description: A small deck of cards containing new treasures for Myth. These cards get shuffled into the existing deck.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove: Hollow Days and Plastic Reindeer Booster Pack
description:
A holiday themed booster pack.

This booster pack contains 1 Cul-De-Sac card, 6 Acts of Desperation cards, 3 punchboard standees, 3 Last Winter cards (including an updated Boogeyman reprint, and 5 bonus cards dividers).
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Modular Board, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: The Eternaut
description:
A deadly snowfall is killing everyone it touches, but not everyone has fallen victim to this mysterious threat. Four people have survived in a workshop, and now they're venturing into the world at the start of a survival adventure in which they must face menaces far more dangerous than the deadly snowflakes.

The Eternaut is a story-driven co-operative survival board game for 1-5 players set in Buenos Aires that uses simple game mechanisms to create a survival experience with strong narrative elements. You must build a team, gather items, fight enemies, resolve objectives, and decide how to proceed with your unique story.

Most of the entities in the game are marked with an Identification Number (called ID). When you want to instruct one of your Characters to interact with another entity (with another ID), you must play the correct Action card and read the matching paragraph, numbered with the combination of the 2 IDs. example: The player wants Simon to scavenge a metal cabinet, so they assign him a Rummage card. This action lets Simon (904) interact with the cabinet (124): the player must read the Paragraph 124-904 in the Storybook to discover the result of the interaction. Each Scenario has a dedicated Storybook, so the same interaction between two entities is completely different in distinct scenarios.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Steeplechase
description:
Played on a wooden board with wooden horses, jockeys and fences, Steeplechase has you trying to win a steeplechase event by outbluffing and outguessing your opponents. You race along the track to the finish line jumping hurdles on the way. Each round one player picks a disc with a movement number on it for all the players at the table. Each other player then gets to either play the disc he was given or attempt to get a better disc by swapping with another player. If you land on a hurdle, though, you can't move!

The first player across the finish line wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Adidoku: Pancho Villa
description:
Adidoku is a new generation of puzzles with a fun mix of characters, places and phrases. Guess the connections and stimulate your brain !

To resolve Adidoku (puzzle), distribute on a table all the pieces showing the "Arts" tiles side. Connect the pieces by checking the words and phrases that seem related. For example: connect "Freddy" with "Mercury" or "Frida" with "Kahlo".

"Palabretas" Mini game included. In Palabretas you compete to make 4 words before the others and achieve the highest number of points! You can use each image as one or several letters. Use an ICE to create dICE, or EAT to create mEAT, or BOot to create BOss. Increase your points with colors, hearts or clovers.

A game without turns and unexpected combinations!

name: Unter Verdacht
description:
Murder, theft, fraud...and more crime. In 8 curious criminal cases, you must pay attention for each detail.
Combine pictures (in comic style) and statements to determine the course of events. Will you be able to solve all cases?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ein Mord, ein Diebstahl, ein Betrug… Und viele weitere verbrecherische Machenschaften. In diesen 8 kuriosen Kriminal­fällen zählt jedes Detail. Kombiniert Bilder und Aussagen, um den Tathergang zu ermitteln. Könnt ihr die Fälle lösen?
Rekapituliert die Geschehnisse anhand von Bildern


8 spannende kuriose Fälle
rekonstruiert den Tathergang anhand von Bildern
drei unterschiedliche Schwierigkeitsgrade
auch für unterwegs geeignet
Startet sofort, keine Vorbereitung notwendig


—description from the publisher

name: Newton's Tree
description:
Get smart with Newton in this super fun game of balance and skill! Build newton’s tree by adding branches and keep it balanced as you add and pluck apples and move Newton around. Strategize and play your game cards wisely! Are you going to be the one to fumble? Remember…To the tree, quicker the tumble!

—description from the back of the box

name: The Frog Kiss
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

In Il Principe Ranocchio (The Frog Kiss), each player is a prince turned into a frog by the evil court sorcerer (who wants to marry the Princess with impunity). The objective of each player is return human again, but the only manner do so is to accumulate power by eating insects and then ... kiss the Princess!

The pond is represented by a playmat, on which the water lilies and the insects are placed. The frogs can hop hon themand eat the insects. Each player controls a frog with a rolling tongue, which can easily catch the insects.

During his turn, each frog has two actions (also identical) to choose from the 4 avalilable: jumping on an adjacent free water lily, bouncing on another frog to reach a free water lily, replace a free water lily, or roll the tongue to catch insects / kiss the Princess. But you can kiss the Princess only if you have collected a sufficient number of insects.

Each frog has its own asymmetric power and, every Princess needs a different collection of insects to be kissed and change the rules in a different way. Adapt your strategy to the actual Princess and to your power, and slow down the leader. May the prince with the longest tongue win!

Description from the publisher:

Ne 'Il Principe Ranocchio', ogni giocatore impersona un principe trasformato in un Ranocchio dal malvagio stregone di corte (che vuole sposare la Principessa impunemente). L'Obiettivo di ogni giocatore è tornare umano, ma per farlo deve accumulare potere mangiando insetti per poi ... baciare la Principessa!

Lo stagno è rappresentato da un tappetino playmat, su cui vengono piazzate le ninfee su cui i ranocchi possono saltellare e gli insetti che devono catturare. Ogni giocatore controlla un ranocchio con la lingua srotolabile, con cui può agevolmente acchiappare gli insetti.

Durante il proprio turno, ogni ranocchio ha due azioni (anche uguali) a scelta fra le 4 disponibili: saltare su una ninfea libera adiacente, rimbalzare su un'altro ranocchio per arrivare su una ninfea libere, ricollocare una ninfea libera, oppure srotolare la lingue per acchiappare degli insetti o ... baciare la principessa. E' possibile baciare la Principessa soltanto se si sono raccolti un numero adeguato di insetti.

Ogni Ranocchio ha il proprio potere ed ogni Principessa richiede una diversa collezione di insetti per essere baciata e modifica le regole in un modo diverso. Adeguate la vostra strategia alla Principessa in gioco e al vostro potere, e rallentate chi è in vantaggio. E che vinca il principe più linguacciuto!
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Crossing Fate: The Battle of Issus, November 333 BC
description:
Crossing Fate is an introductory level wargame of the Battle of Issus that was fought by the forces of Darius the Great, King of Persia and Alexander the Great of Macedon along with his Greek Allies. To insure the security of the Macedonian Hegemony, and to wrest control of the Persian Empire’s territories bordering on the Aegean and Mediterranean, Alexander launched an invasion of Anatolia. The first major battle was fought against the Persian satraps of Anatolia at the Granicus river. Alexander’s forces garnered a decisive victory, and in response Darius traveled west to personally organize his troops for a showdown with the Macedonian interloper. The two sides met along the Pinarus river that flows into the Gulf of Issus. The fates of two empires were about to collide.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: ESPN Trivia Night
description:
Face off against your friends and family in this high-octane sports trivia game! Draft sports categories you know you can dominate, or risk playing outside your comfort zone to net the big score. If you dropped the ball on your last answer, recover points in the active Instant Replay challenges. Outscore the opposing team or meet them in Sudden Death to decide the winner!

Teams take turns answering questions related to a wide range of topics in the sports world. Questions are worth those sweet sweet victory points and the key to winning - but don't worry if you can't answer "How many 3-point shots did Kareem Abdul-Jabbar make during his 20 seasons in the NBA?", that's where the dexterity challenges come in!

Miss a question? It's time for redemption by shooting a three pointer, getting one past the goalie, or kicking a 30 yard field goal in token-based dexterity challenges right on the tabletop! Successful shots will mean points for your team, and whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

-description from publisher

name: Tour Operator: Cities
description: Tour Operator: Cities is a mini-expansion that brings five new cities to the world of Tour Operator — and these aren't just average cities. Each of these cities has all five activities instead of just one or two!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Spearpoint 1943: Eastern Front – Heavy Weapons Expansion
description:
The Spearpoint 1943: Eastern Front - Heavy Weapons Expansion adds all new Soviet and German "heavies" to the mix for the Spearpoint 1943 Eastern Front card wargame. Fifty additional Unit Cards add heavy artillery, tanks, tank destroyers, self-propelled guns, and more crews for even more deck-building options for Eastern Front. Also includes card list cards and several promo cards.

This expansion was a successful Kickstarter stretch goal for project Spearpoint 1943: Eastern Front.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Jetpack Joyride: Collector Box
description:
Jetpack Joyride is a real-time competitive puzzle game adapted from the mobile game of the same name! Players need to fly their way through a lab using the polyomino tiles over a series of three rounds, avoiding obstacles and collecting coins along the way. Whoever has the most points at the end of the third round wins!

This edition contains Deluxe edition of the game, The Party expansion, Dry-Erase board and pen as well as couple of collector items: Barry's mini, metal coin, cotton bag, and poster.

This edition was available only during Kickstarter campaign of the game.
categories: Puzzle, Racing, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: Car Wars Supplement, The AADA Vehicle Guide: Volume 3
description:
From the back cover:

Here they are... the AADA's choice for the meanest vehicle designs of the year. From Division 5 to Division 100+, they're fully armed, completely described and ready to go.
This book brings you 78 brand-new designs, all compatible with the Car Wars Compendium rules and legal for AADA World Championship competition. From cycles to campers, from the tough little Fire Imp to the monstrous Polaris, every one is a highway warrior's dream.

And every one of these 78 new vehicles is represented by four counters, included with this book... a full color vehicle, a full color wreck, and black-and-white versions of both the new and wrecked car, to let you fly your own colors in the arena.
So fasten your seat belt, check out all vehicle systems, and hit the road for more Car Wars action. And never forget... no matter where you go... drive offensively!

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Car Wars Compendium
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Tarot of Loka
description:
It's a four-player trick-tacking card game for the entire family. Simple rules, sophisticated team-based gameplay, beautifully illustrated, with over forty new pieces of art. And yet very usable and very practical cards – it can be used either as The Tarot of Loka game, or as traditional Tarot, or as a set of normal playing cards.

The game is played in two teams of two players, sitting around table in alternating positions (as in bridge, for example...).

Two new cards have been added to the deck to make the deck unique and different from other trick-taking games.

In the basic rules, there is no following suit and the two extra cards have very simple rules. In the advanced rules, there is a following suit rule and the two cards play a much heavier effect on play, identifying one team as good and one as evil, thus associating that team with the two 'evil' suits and vice versa.

The players take tricks, winning them by playing a higher card of the led suit or by playing the highest trump (i.e. a major arcana). At the end of the game the cards taken by winning the tricks are added up (face cards, aces and some major arcana are worth more points).

name: Epic Picnic
description:
Epic Picnic is a fast and crazy card game inspired by a verbal memory game from childhood, corrupted with humor from adult life (ages 17+!). You might bring figgy pudding on a picnic, fashion a makeshift weapon out of Peter Piper's pickled pecker, or inherit a Nicaraguan death squad from your grandfather.

Best of all, it's super easy to pick up and play!

Players reveal cards from a common deck to represent the ridiculous and terrible things they are bringing on the picnic (or one of 9 other scenarios) while at the same time trying to stay focused and remember what everyone else is bringing in order. Miss just one card and you're out of the game in this last-man-standing, brain-hemorrhaging face-off!

The rules also contain several variations and plus an alternate method of play -- Picnic Frenzy -- where players recite just one card per turn, making for much faster gameplay. Played in rounds and featuring 5 second turns, it is perhaps even more challenging than the original!

name: Apocalypse in the East: The Rise of the First Caliphate 646-656 A.D.
description:
The accession of the Caliph Uthmãn b. Affan enabled Mu’ãwiyah b. Sufyan, his cousin and the formidable governor of Syria to construct a fleet and carry on the war against Byzantium. From the highlands of Armenia to the shores of Crete, the elite Syrian army and navy seeks to overwhelm the last stronghold of the Byzantine Empire, Constantinople.

Unfortunately for them, the new emperor, a callous youth named Constans, is equally determined to stop them. Coming to the throne in the wake of murder and revolt, the young sovereign commands only the battered remnants of the army, but it is now fighting on its home ground.

Apocalypse in the East by designer Jason Juneau, features yearly turns, regimental sized units, special rules on the Empress Fausta, and random events including the Monothelete Controversy, earthquakes, nepotism by Caliph Uthmãn, purges in the Byzantine high command and the introduction of Greek Fire. Can you take the helm of the Syrian army and navy and storm the greatest citadel on earth, or will you instead prevent it and maintain Byzantium’s role as Christendom’s eastern march?

name: Šurpu turpu
description:
Šurpu turpu (Back and forth) - the game about touring in Latvia.

Did you know there were underground lakes in Latvia? In which forests and swamps are the most exciting walking trails? In this game you will have the opportunity not only to find out about a number of interesting places in Latvia, but also to travel in your own way. You can use boats, trains, and even airplanes to travel, if you have enough tickets for it; if you don't, you'll have to stick to your feet. But watch out for other travelers. They are likely to put obstacles in place to be the first to travel Latvia!
—description from publisher (translated)

The game area is a map of Latvia, its territory is divided into 4 historical counties with a total of 60 viewing objects connected to different roads - pedestrians, railways, rivers and air. Each viewing object have its own information card with a description of it and a small bonus that the player receives after visiting it. To win, you have to visit 4 objects, one by one in each county, and complete the end-of-game task that the players roll out at the beginning of the game.

On his own move, a player can move on the card for up to 3 steps. Pedestrian roads are free, others need tickets. They can be obtained by stopping on a blank, unnumbered field. In the same way, you can get opportunity cards that can be played before you go, helping yourself or interfering with other players.

—user summary

name: Dice Settlers: Sierra West Promo
description: Promo for Dice Settlers included in Sierra West.
categories: American West, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Pet Me
description:
Story and Concept
Pet Wonderland is a beautiful pet park that is home to lovely pets.They are all very hungry and waiting for you to visit the Park.Master one and two digit division on the way.
With an awesome storytelling , we make sure you have hours of fun. At the same time, you will be mastering division like no one else. Go PET ME !!

Skills
• Division of 1&2-digit numbers without remainders
• Division as repeated subtraction
• Strategic Planning
• Forward Thinking
• Flexibility
• Hand-Eye Coordination

Practice Jump
4 times more math practice compared to classroom
At Logic Roots, we are a team of IIT and IIM alumni who are passionate about Math and are working hard to Reinvent How Kids Practice Math. Our math learning products are best used as educational gifts.
Through a combination of original board games, card games, computer programs, apps and Math activities we are helping students practice more and practice better. We are helping kids fall in love with Math

Target Group
Grade 1 to anyone who wants to enhance his division skills

Contents of the box
• 1 Gameboard
• 4 Play Pawns
• 1 Dice
• 1 Box of 55 Food Pieces
• 36 Pet Cards(12 Bone Cards, 12 Milk Cards ,and 12 Chilly Cards)
• 1 Box of 48 Pet Tags - 12 for each player
• 1 Bag of 50 Red Hearts & 30 Pink Hearts
• 1 rule book

How it will work
4 starting points for the 4 players. When you move to a group ,say parrots-pick up the top card from the stack of Pet cards.'Pet cards' tell a player the number of food pieces that she needs to feed to the parrots. This combined with, scientifically designed game rules work to increase the practice levels and fun at the same time.

name: Medium: Mind Control Promo Cards
description:
A pack of 8 identical cards.

Text says:
Play two cards from your hand (your partner plays none), using them to attempt to match. Afterward, draw back up to six cards.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

name: Bill Oddie's Great Bird Race Game
description:
Drive to the various locations on the board and indulge in some bird-spotting by picking up one of the bird cards relevant to that location. The cards are worth various points depending on their rarity.
The are also very rare birds that become available on occasion to whoever gets to them first.
The game is intended more as a fun way to learn about birds rather than a strategy game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Acronym
description:
This game is a Trivial Pursuit type game, with players trying to find the meanings of various acronyms in the categories: corporations, products and slogans, agencies, proverbs, science, sports and rebuses, movies and music.
In addition to acronyms the questions have anagrams and rebuses.

name: Cross Over
description:
Cross Over is a two-player game of thought and chance. Each player gets (10) pegs and they place them in their start line. Roll the die to determine move, some numbers require a choice of move. This is where the strategy comes in. You win when you remove all the pegs off your side before your opponent does. There is one catch your opponent will try to keep you full of pegs. Good Luck!

www.crossovergame.com

name: The Dark Crystal Card Game
description:
Each player selects a color (publically announced) and then the entire deck is shuffled and each player is dealt four cards from the deck (they may get cards of their own color, they may get cards of their opponent's colors). On your turn, you draw a card from the pile and then place a card onto the board. The card placed on the board must match the card/illustration of the card it is placed onto (cards feature illustrations of characters, creatures and objects from The Dark Crystal). The cards all have values of 1, 2, 3 and 5 on them. When a "Sun" card is played (on a player's turn), all visible cards are scored per suit/color (the "Sun" card may also be countered by a "Stop Sun" card).

The game continues until the last card from the deck is drawn and then there is a final scoring round.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Troja
description: Commercially-published variant of Chess. The major change is that pieces, apart from the king, can be attached to other pieces of the same player. The highest piece is called the Trojan figure and it is the one whose movement mode controls the movement of the conglomerate. Once attached, pieces may later be detached. As you might expect, there are also some special rules around pawn promotion, e.g. only queen per side is permitted.

name: Steve Canyon
description:
Based on the popular comic strip, Steve Canyon, this game lets up to four players fly their F-105 Thunderchiefs to three different air bases. The first person to complete this circuit wins.

Very luck driven, in that a roll of one die determines movement on the map and also altitude increments of 1,000 ft. Player choices amount to deciding what altitude to fly and which air field to visit next.

Random weather cards cause problems while flying over certain areas of the board or flying through certain altitudes. Fuel consumption is basically one unit every time the die is rolled, and running out of fuel can force a landing at an emergency air field or cause a pilot to bail out.

The game is interesting because of the scale plastic planes used as playing pieces (actual reproductions of the F-105) and in the cardboard 'control panels' which players use to keep track of altitude and fuel. The rules also include a two-page insert describing "the world's most powerful one-man airplane" in detail.

name: Macross: VF-1 Valkyrie
description:
Complexity level '6' on Tsukada's 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

"The Game of Dog Fight in Macross"

Fast-spaceship combat wargame based off the science fiction anime TV show. Macross (SDF-1 in the US Robotech) is noone around, so the Valkyrie ships must fight the alien ships themselves.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Itty Bitty Battles
description:
Itty Bitty Battles is a free-for-the-download Fantasy Wargame designed along the lines of "Swords and Sorcery" and other fantasy battle games. Has a somewhat unique speed-based initiative system where units locked in battle engage in a hierarchical fashion (spells first, missile weapons next, etc). Units move in formation with a leader counter commanding. The leader counters act like initiative chits. Combat resolution is fairly normal, a modified CRT system with major column shifts. IBB has a ton of stuff in it including a combat magic system for Priests and Wizards.

Download here: http://micro.brainiac.com/ibb.zip
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Bingo Is His Name-O
description:
A game for pre-school children (Ages 3 - 6). From the box:

"Play fetch with Bingo as he tells you where to move on the board. Be the first to pick up his toys and you win - and you get to listen to Bingo's favorite song!"

name: Orient
description: 3 Dimensional Chinese Checkers a fast-moving game. The playing field changes continuously throughout the play. With each roll of the dice, the center board is rotated to a new position. This results in a completely new set of play options for each turn. Players must remain on guard at all times in order to react to the shifting of playing patterns.

name: The Twizzle Game
description: This is a childs' bowling-type game. One would roll the 9 marbles down the circular ramp and then into a scoring gate which would flip up to reveal the points scored. A second ball into the same gated area would return the gate back to zero and no score.
publishers: Action Games and Toys Ltd, Schaper

name: Treasures of the Smithsonian: The Game
description:
(From the Rules)

To complete a treasure hunt of knowledge. All players are on a treasure hunt to assemble artifacts and knowledge from the different areas of the Smithsonian. Players can acquire an advantage as they learn more of the answers and improve their skill each time the game is played. One fun aspect of the game is that the winning treasure hunter receives a round of applause from all players.

(more detail)

There are 15 categories of trivia on each card, each of which corresponds to one of the museums, galleries, or research facilities in the Smithsonian Institution. The object of the game is to collect one treasure (answer a question correctly) from 6 of the categories then return to the starting space. Movement is made via a six sided die roll.

name: Pentaghastal
description:
The players are Paranormal Investigators in the 1920's, trying to foil the attempts of the Pentaghastal Society to summon the devil Yangoogilathl.

Play proceeds in a continuous 3-round cycle. Each round consists of an Auction Phase (one auction) and an Action Phase (executing one or several actions on the board). After every Third Round, a Scoring Round occurs. Power Cards are awarded, according to the distribution of Agents in each Site. Some of these Power Cards award a single Victory Point, which is needed to win the game. After 3 Rounds, the cycle begins again. The game ends immediately, if a player acquires the required number of Victory Point Cards or if, after a Scoring Round, there aren't enough new Power Cards to place 3 Power Cards for each Site. The game is a compelling race against the clock, as the players struggle to choose the right Auction Cards, effectively distribute their Agents on the game board, and win Power Cards that allow them to execute special actions early in the game (often, confounding teams of rival Agents), and award Victory Points later in the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Crash! the Bankrupt game
description:
Bilingual edition (Italian/English)

Crash! is a simple game. The object is to force every other player to go bankrupt (to lose all of his cards, both in hand and in play)
There are 2 kind of cards. Property cards (e.g. a flat in Manhattan, a farm in Australia, etc.) that can be accumulated for self protection. And Event or.Action Cards (Audit, Cocktail Party, Casino, etc.), used to draw more cards or force other player to lose cards and properties.

The last player left standing wins.

name: Tricolor: Rules for the Napoleonic Wargame
description:
This is one of the many TSR rules Booklets published during the mid-1970s. My copy is a 2nd print run dated 1975, but these rules were first printed in 1974. Note: there is NO mention of D&D products listed YET in the back page although the REST of their product line is. I mention this because in my 1975 2nd edition of Jedko's "the African Campaign", they list DUNGEON! as a part of their product line. TSR later on packaged some Jedco(new sp) games releases under their company logo which became the Wizard symbol.
This Rules Booklet has 50 pages including their Select Bibliography, 3-Musketry Tables(Point Blank, up to 6" distance, up to 12") with from 1-50 figures firing for each & uses a single 6-sided DIE, an Artillery Roundshot Fire Table, an Artillery Cannister Fire Table, a Melee Results Table, a Terrain Effects Table, & a Constructions Effects Table.
An INDEX lists the contents for this Booklet which are as follows: PART-1--Introduction; 1.Time/Distance/Troop Organization Scale; 2.Movement Trays; 3.Basic Units; 4.Formations; 5.Orders; 6.Sequence of Operations; 7.Movement; 8.Musketry Fire; 9.Melee; 10.Morale In General; 11.Morale due to the Accumulation of Casualties; 12.Artillery; 13. Terrain, Construction & Impedimentia; 14.the Infantry Square; 15.Dragoons; 16.Visibility(optional rules limiting visibility); 17.Appendix to the Rules A: Table of Elites; 18.Appendix to the Rules B: Nomenclature of the Five Major Power Armies.
PART-2--National Characteristics: 1.Introduction to National Characteristics; 2.Rules Reflecting N.C. in the game: the French Army; 3...the Russian Army; 4...the Austrian Army; 5...the Prussian Army; 6...the British Army; 7...the Minor Power Armies.
PART-3--Organization: Introduction to System of Organization--1; 1.Major Power Infantry Organization; 2.Major Power Cavalry Organization; 3.Major Power Units; System of Organization--2: 1.The Grande Armee of France circa 1812; 2.The Russian Army circa 1812; 3.The Austrian Army circa 1809; 4.The Prussian Army circa 1813; 5.The British Army circa 1805-1815; and a variety of Minor Power Armies including Spanish, Polish, Dutch, Italy, Naples, Westphalia, Bavaria, Saxony, Berg, Hesse-Dornstadt, Wurttemburg, Neuchatel, Nassau, Baden, Denmark, Sweden, & Hesse-Casse. The only thing lacking is the numerous and voluminous Uniforms colorings associated with this era. Osprey publishing has made an entire industry with just this Historical era although they do produce lots of books for many others as well.
Overall, a well detailed depiction of Napoleonic warfare which can be scaled to your liking from individuals to entire Armies if you prefer.
Note: The 1974 first ed. has the Gygax/Kaye Logo on the cover instead of the lizardman holding a staff. It does have D&D products listed in the back page along with the rest of their product line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Pentathlon
description:
In this game, each player runs a team of five athletes, one in each of the Pentathlon disciplines (Marathon, Cycling, Swimming, Sailing and Canoeing), hoping to win the gold in as many as possible.

Ten cards are dealt to each player. You start by drawing the top card of either the draw or discard piles, and end your turn by discarding a card --or by playing nothing and saying "Pass" (to build up your hand).

You may play tricks of three cards of any event suit to roll the two dice for your piece in that event. Free cards are used to round out incomplete tricks.

If you have a trick on the table from a previous turn, you may add the appropriate Good Start card to it --this gives you an extra roll of the dice. You may also play Bad Start cards on other players' tricks, to prevent them from playing Good Starts (but not from adding tricks).

A player who goes out (played all his cards, with or without discarding) gets a free dice roll in the event of his choice. The deal then passes left, and both the draw and discard piles are picked up and shuffled anew (as at game start).

No two pieces may occupy the same spot; if you cannot pass, you stop behind. As pieces pass the finish lines, medals are awarded as appropriate for that event.

Three players: the fourth team isn't used. Two players: Each player runs two teams; each trick is good for two separate rolls in that event, one per team.

Scoring: Gold is worth 8 points, silver 4 and bronze 2.

name: Fire Fight: Modern Skirmish Rules
description:
Fire Fight, Modern Miniature skirmish rules

These are a comprehensive set of rules for small unit actions since 1945. They are designed to give a playable game whilst recreating the uncertainty of modern warfare, to this end the ‘old fashioned’ method of drawing chits is used to control initiative whilst for playability the hit chance of some weapons has been reduced, however it still does not pay to advance in the open towards an alert sustain fire machine gun.
With these rules any action from the desperate battles of the Israeli War of Independence as described in 0 Jerusalem, to the siege of Hamburg from the Zone series can be fought, not just those in Vietnam on which many other rules concentrate.
I would like to thank the staff of Heroic Miniatures and Wallasey Immortals Wargame Club for their help in testing the rules.

A game turn is thirty seconds long, composed of a variable number of phases between five and ten seconds depending on the initiative of the troops. The ground scale is one centimeter equals one meter which is near enough one to one for 20mm or 1/76th figures. If you wish to use 1/200th a ground scale of five millimeters to one meter is more appropriate.

name: Sea Power
description:
Realistic game of modern naval warfare, without getting the player bogged down into too any technical details.

It is appreciated that modern naval vessels are equipped with highly sophisticated electronics and weapons systems, but their prime object is still to destroy enemy shipping or incoming missiles. It is therefore assumed that Ship’s Captains and Gunnery Officers will be aware of the best means to fight off incoming attacks and will use all available missiles and gunnery to its best advantage, as they close to tactical battle range.

A percentage system has been adopted and therefore a lair of percentage dice will be needed to play the game. The dice -one red (10’s) and one white or black (units) are always thrown in pairs (e.g. an 8 on the red dice and a 2 on the white or black dice represents a throw of 82%). All figures in the tables are basic percentage chance of hits or detection, after this has been amended by the tactical factors which may apply, the final score is arrived at. A throw of this percentage or less is sufficient. A short measuring tape is provided for use when moving ships but an expanding metal tape will be of use for measuring the ranges of long range weapons.
GROUND SCALE: 2 cm = 1 Nautical Mile
TIME SCALE : 1 move = 5 minutes

name: War Game Rules: Armour & Infantry – 1925-1950
description:
Miniature rules
Although our title gives precedence to armored warfare, this set of rules is equally suitable for combat between infantry companies, and is the first to make realistic provision for all the fringe areas such as communication, engineering, air attack, obstacle clearance, fighting in fortifications, off-table fire, air observation, target location, weather, all types of terrain, and the reaction of troops to combat stress.

The rules are designed to be equally suitable for the old favorite 1/72 scale models and figures and the newer scales down to 1/300 which are revolutionizing modern period war gaming.

The period covered by this set has been selected to include the rise of the fast tank and the independent armored formation, the Spanish, Abyssinian, Sino-Japanese, Russo-Japanese and Russo-Finnish Wars, all the campaigns of the second world war from the invasion of Poland to the Russian sweep through Japanese Manchuria, and the Korean War.
A companion set covers the period from 1950 to 1975, which sees the introduction of anti-tank guided missiles, helicopters, range finders, and efficient A.P.D.S., H.E.S.H. and H.E.A.T. ammunition for tank guns.
A third set covers the whole period from 1925 to 1975, but from the point of view of infantry platoon level combat, and is suitable for figures from 1/72 to 1/35 scale.

This particular period is a very complicated one, with old weapons being replaced by new in an ever proliferating series.
As usual, we include quick reference sheets to avoid leafing through the complete text in a frantic attempt to find the bit you want.
As it is impossible to include details of all weapons on a single sheet, it has instead those that are reasonably universal, together with blank spaces into which you can copy from the main text those others you want to use.
After all, not many wargamers habitually use both Centurions and 1920 vintage Vickers Mediums at the same time, but please don’t take this as a challenge!

We presume throughout that a player will have a general knowledge of the weapons he elects to use, and so include performance details only.

One change from our previous sets of rules is the use of alternate instead of simultaneous movement. This is partly due to the reduced validity of a strict time scale in tank versus tank engagements where an exchange of fire is normally completed and one tank disabled in 10 to 15 seconds at close range. It also speeds up play, giving a truer flavor of fast moving tank action, and enables you to tell at a glance which party in an exchange shoots first.

Other innovations include a one to one figure scale and an arithmetical instead of a logarithmic ground scale. A model or figure therefore always represents a single tank or man, not a platoon or section, and a millimeter measured on the table always represents one meter.
Metric measures are used because all campaigns were fought with metric maps, even the one inch ordnance survey has a 1,000 metro grid.

Finally, this is the first set of rules we have produced where we can claim relevant personal experience, one of us having served in the Desert and in Western Europe during the Second World War, and the other having been in turn a field engineer, a tank gunner with experience of Churchill and Sherman and later tanks, and an infantryman.

Includes the rule book and a Quick Reference Sheet
categories: Book, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Cluche
description: Cluché is played in 2-4 teams. Teams earn points by guessing clichés from clues given by teammates. Time limit is enforced by a 60 second sand timer.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Catnip!
description:
The cat and the mice are placed on the gameboard. The yellow tokens are set aside. The blue token is used in case of a tie. Players can move their mouse by tapping the wheel to the left or right. As the player turns the wheel, the turntable rotates the mouse.
As Claude, the cat, begins to moving around the gameboard, all players at the same time quickly turns their mousemover wheels, trying to keep their mice away from Claude's mouth. If a mouse is caught by Claude's teeth, then that mouse has been catnipped! All play stops.

The owner of the mouse takes a yellow token and places the mouse back on its turntable. The game continues untill all of the yellow tokens have been collected. The player with the fewest tokens wins the game and is the Big Cheese!

In case of a tie, the players have a play-off round. The first player caught by Claude's teeth takes the blue token. The other player wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ubluff
description: Be the first player to get rid of all your cards. The game consists of 2 dice and 51 playing cards. 2 for each even number combination of the dice and 3 for each odd combination of the dice.

name: Love, Sex and Romance Trivia Card Set
description:
This trivia card set is designed to be played as a stand alone game, or as a companion to such related games as Avalon Hill's Game of Trivia and Selchow and Righter's Trivial Pursuit. Contains 6 categories:
1 Passionate Pages
2 Sizzling Screen
3 Love Themes
4 Simply Shocking
5 Affairs of the Heart
6 Potpourri
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Memory, Trivia

name: Looney Tunes Smush 'Em
description:
In this Roll and Move game, players use Looney Tunes characters molded in play dough as player pieces. They may use game components to smush their player pieces to successfully deal with challenges.

The first player to stretch to the "That's all folks!" space wins.

From the box
It's a wacky race around the world of Looney Tunes. Mold your favorite Looney Tunes character in colorful smush 'em dough and you're off. But watch out, there are Acme devices waiting to smush you, a door to slide under, instant Martians to bowl over and the Tasmanian devil is waiting to twist you. Be first to stretch to the 'That's all Folks' winning space and you win.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strip Chocolate
description: Players roll dice and move around the board landing on either Strip (remove an article of clothing), Chocolate (draw a Chocolate card and paint the simple design on the body part if exposed or as close as possible with the body frosting and paintbrush provided), Dare (draw a Dare card and follow instructions on the card which can be to strip, kiss, massage or eat previously painted art), Kiss, Hug or Massage. The winner is the player with the most clothes when one of the players has completely stripped.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Saddle Club Trading Card Game
description: A Collectible Card Game set in the Saddle Club universe where players vie for Friendship points to become friends with the three Saddle Club members.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Novel-based

name: Supermarina
description:
Supermarina is a strategic simulation game which reminds episodes which happened on the Mediterranean sea during World war II. The Italian naval forces oppose the British naval forces from June 10th to October 27th 1940.

Objective is to interrupt merchant traffic, destroy merchant and war ships as well damage naval dockyards.
Players decide scenario length (full campaign, 3 to 4 days, 12 to 13 days or 23 to 24 days) and dices determine period for shorter scenarios.

The map depicts the entire Mediterranean Sea.

Difficulty level: 8 (the maximum on the IT rating)
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Top Ten College Basketball
description: Despite having individual players, for the most part, this game is really a team vs. team game. Dice are used to generate results, but, apart from an occasional reference to the individual players' ratings, the majority of the mechanics involve comparing team to team ratings.

name: Big Damn Robots
description: Big Damn Robots is a miniatures game of humongous robot combat for 2 or more players. Each person controls one or more mighty behemoths as it trudges across the battlefields of Dirt in search of truth, glory, and the right to be right.

name: Magnetic Balance Spiel
description:
Each player positions a magnetic ball on the playing field of 10 pits. The player who moves a ball yet placed loses.

It's also a solitaire game.

name: Bulls and Bears
description:
BULLS AND BEARS is based on the buying and selling of stocks in order to profit, either by a rise in the prices of stocks held, or by receipt of income in the form of dividends. Players hope, as in real life, that the prices of their particular holdings of stock will rise or that they will be able to “corner" a stock and force the other players to be penalized. Players buy and sell stocks from and to each other. Although much depends on the individual player’s luck he can increase his winnings by selling certain stocks and holding other stocks at the proper time. After a few games a player will learn the best way to buy and sell his stocks and to take advantage of the various opportunities which arise in the game. THE OBJECT of the game is for one player, by wisely manipulating his holdings, to acquire all the money and to become the owner of all the stock. THE WINNER of the game is the player remaining after the other players have been forced from the game by the loss of all their money and stock certificates.

THE GAME CONTENTS :1 x playing board , 2 x Dice , 6 x Wooden Playing Pieces in six different designs and colors , 72 x Share Certificates (9 certificates each of 8 different stocks) , 6 x Metal Chairs for Exchange Seats , 16 x Stock Pool Cards , 1 x Pack of Money in 3 x denominations ($1,000, $500, $100) , 2 x set of Rules
publishers: Copp Clark Publishing Company, Mario Fischel Toys & Games, Parker Brothers

name: Dinosaurs Not the Mama Card Game
description: This is a simple card game based on the Disney TV show. Players are dealt 4 Dinosaur Cards and the rest are placed on the table to form a draw pile next to the Point Cards. On a turn you can either trade a card with an opponent (if you want to and the opponent is willing), or simply draw a card from the stack. When you have 3 matching cards in your hand, you lay them down, then draw a Point Card and place it face up on the set. Some cards allow you to exchange Point Cards with an opponent in order to get a higher valued card. When all the Point Cards have been placed on sets, the player the highest point score wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cavaleiros do Zodíaco: Saga do Santuário
description:
Each player incarnates one of the Bronze Knights: Seiya, Shiryu, Hioga, Ikki or Shun. They will have to fight against many enemies (black, silver and golden knights) until the ultimate fight, against the Sanctuary Master.
Before each fight, the warriors prepare themselves advancing through a path where they can gain strength, special powers and elevate their cosmos level.
The fights are dice battles. Using the strength acquired, the knight can resist more before being defeated. Using special powers, the knight can change the results of the dice.
At the end, he who has the most elevated cosmos level will be the first to fight against the Master. If he wins the fight, he wins the game. If he looses, the next one in cosmos level will have the opportunity to fight against the Master. The player who first defeats the master is the winner. If no one defeats the Master, the Master wins.

name: Witch's Caldron
description:
One of Ral Partha's introductory miniature games, Witch's Caldron is essentially a miniatures dungeon crawl, with adventurers (led by a wizard) trying to explore the witch's cave and escape with valuable treasure. The witch, with a variety of monstrous servants, opposes them. The adventurers may explore in multiple parties from three entrances. The game includes spells, curses, magic gates, and HTH combat. Rules, charts, a map, two dice, and twenty miniatures.


from a merged game
The object of Witch's Caldron is for the Witch and her Servants to defend the treasures of her cave from the Wizard and his Adventurers. The Wizard has 20 turns to invade the Witch's cave and escape through the three Magic Gates (not from the cave) with as many treasures as possible. If within 20 turns, all of the treasures have been removed from two of the three Magic Gates, but the Witch's magic sword has not been captured and removed from the cave (immediate win for Wizard), the winner is determined by awarding the Wizard points for treasures removed from the cave and awarding the Witch points for Wizard's Adventurers killed. Combat results are determined by "casting spells" and rolling dice.
The playing board is 16 squares by 19 squares. The game includes 20 metal figurines, including the Witch and her eight Servants and the Wizard and his 10 Adventurers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mutants
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #26

Players try to conquer a planet using mutants that can be more or less specialized.

name: Les Sales mômes
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #35.

The players are bad children and try to commit as many mean tricks (bêtises) as possible in the village.

name: Putsch au Panador
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #43.

Six factions are fighting for the small Central American state of Panador : KGB, CIA, FUN (Front Uni Nationaliste), GAG (Groupe d'Action Gauchiste), drug barons and copper mine owners. Everyone wants to make as much money as possible, but not using the same means.

name: Sortez les flingues
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #48

The boss of the gang has been killed. Each player controls a "family" of mobsters. One of them is the murderer. He must kill the Boss. All the others must find him and kill him. All that is happening at the gang's headquarters.

name: Go Forward Rugby
description: Go Forward Rugby uses a rack and card system. The rack slides up and down the field Board to show where play currently is. If the rack moves past the Try Line at either end of the field a Try (Touch down) is scored. Players hold cards in their hands which they use to influence play in the rack. The Cards represent players on the field and special actions that they may do. The idea of the rack is that your opponent can see where you cards are, just not exactly which players they are. This means the game has a memory component to it. The game tries to focus on Rugby's ideas and leaves out many of the finer points in an effort to keep the game simple. The Game is currently free to download from the web as 4 small pdf files which include cut out plans to build the card rack.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Memory

name: Nah Dran!
description:
From the Piatnik Website:
"How tall was the tallest basketball player in the world? How many kilograms are there in a cubic meter of air at 1.000 km high? These and many other questions usually cannot be answered correctly. But we must choose one answer and hope that this answer is close enough to the right one."

name: Matilda
description:
This is a tank tactical wargame set in North Africa from 41-43 during world war 2.

Numerous scenarios.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

name: DAK the Desert
description:
DAK the Desert is campaign level wargame for North Africa in World War 2. This game published in the self-published edition (old) Game Journal volume 51.

Players control either Axis or Allied army in North Africa. Players manage unit organize, supply, movement and combat. Each combat unit represent battalion, regiment or brigade and they can operate individually, but they are organize into division for more efficient activation.

Each turn is a repeat of the unlimited number operation impulse. However, the each impulse must spend a supply point, and each combat is require extra supply point per involve formations. Reinforcements and supplies must purchase by transport points.

Winner determined by control of Benghazi, Tobruk and Alexandria. If either player controlled all three places at end of the turn, he can achieve sudden death victory. Alternatively, at the end of the game, the winner determined by the control situation.

name: Defence of the Sea Lane
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on naval battles during a hypothetical 3rd World War.
Published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku) in 1989.
Designed by Chikanori Nomata.

name: Campaign for Guadalcanal
description:
Campaign for Guadalcanal contains 96 counters, a 36 x 51 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 6 pages of rules (also in Japanese).

Turn length is a month and units are a ship or a squadron. For one or two players, playing time is two hours.
Players play battles in South Pacific 1942 (centered on the Solomon Islands).

Solitaire Suitability: High (on a scale of Low-Medium-High).

name: Principality
description:
A CCG where Angelic hosts battle out demons. Players play as team of angels – gold team and blue team. The first player to capture 3 of the 5 Deceiver cards win.

Each Deceiver cards has four sides and each side has a number, representing the Deceiver’s strength. Each archangel card has a single number, representing its own strength. Players must play sets of archangel cards next to each side of a Deceiver to equal or better the strength number printed on that side. When a player has played sufficient archangels to equal the strength number on the one side of a Deceiver, that side is covered. The first player to have all 4 sides, of a Deceiver covered has successfully "bound" the Deceiver and takes the card.

Each Deceiver card also has a few dice pictured on the center of the card, two red ones and a white one. During the end of the turn, a die is rolled. If you roll one of the numbers one the red ones, you must pick up a Minion card and immediately follow the instructions on that card. If the white is rolled, you most discard you highest vauled card that is currently in play. There are also good "special cards" that can be played as well during the game.

name: Milton
description: Milton is an electronic game where players try to complete phrases. It plays 3 different games but all of them have the same basic mechanics. On your turn, you press a red phrase button and listen as Milton speaks the start of a phrase like "Blink your". You then press one of the yellow answer buttons and listen to the response (in this case you're trying to find "eyes"). If you are correct, you take another turn. If you are incorrect, your turn ends and Milton ridicules you. When all the phrases have been matched with their endings, the player who made the most matches wins.

name: Mobile Suit Gundam
description:
This is a tactical miniatures type Japanese science fiction wargame set in the first Gundam series(0079).

Published by Bandai.

This is based off the Mobile Suit Z Gundam anime series and is part of the Mobile Suit Gundam family of games.

name: Starhound
description:
Starhound is a set of rules for simulating fighter to fighter deep space combat using miniatures. The rulebook consists of 21 pages and a single reference sheet made from card.

The rules present both a basic as well as an advanced game, with the advanced game adding homing missiles and crew experience into the mix.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Thorough-Bucks
description:
Horse racing game using statistics from real horses to simulate a horse racing season. Players attempt to purchase a stable of horses and enter them in races of varying distances. Each horse is rated from 6 furlongs to 12 furlongs with a number from 15 (no races at that distance) to 36 (world record. Players then enter horses in events for prize money, as well as, all players get to bet on the races.
Building a stable is fun but betting right will win you the game.
Similar to a lot of the stat based sports games.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Raffut à Faeris
description:
(From the website)

A game represents the day of the elections in Faeris. You lead a Mafia group and do all your best to favor your political parties allied. Your strategy is quite simple: manage that the most part of the District Representatives belong to the political parties who are favorable to you.

You're leading a Mafia Group and you're trying to bend the rules your way during Election Day in Faeris.
A touch of bluff, a grain of tactics. You'll have to discover and know how to use your opponents interests to increase your power in the Mob.

name: 7-Spot Yott
description:
According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games":

Five dice with card and joker faces are supplied. Player can throw up to three times and then must choose to score in one of twenty-two categories. Mostly poker hands.

name: Wish You Were Here...?
description:
WISH YOU WERE HERE...? is a travel trivia game based on Thames Television's holiday program of the same name.

Players take it in turns to answer questions valued at £25, £50, £100 or £200. The correct answering of a question earns money in the form of travelers' cheques and the opportunity to throw the dice to win one of six tokens that are collected on a postcard.

The winner is the first player to have a complete (i.e. with all six tokens) Wish you Were Here...? postcard and £2,000 or more in travelers cheques.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel, Trivia

name: Two Towers
description: Wargame of the fight between the good & evil forces at the end of the Third Age. One rules pamphlet, one map, one sheet of counters.

name: Share Mania
description:
Share Mania is a simple stock market dice game comprising a board, marker pieces, score pads and a set of five special dice (2 Share Dice, 2 Company Dice, 1 Market die).

The Basic Game:
Each turn a player rolls the two Company Dice and the two Share Dice to see which of the four Companies he may trade in and how many blocks of shares may be traded (each dice is marked 1, 2 or 3). When shares are bought or sold the price goes up or down one unit for every block of shares traded - with the value of the shares being tracked on the board. As the share price swings players attempt to buy low and sell high in order to generate the most profit.

The Advanced Game:
In the advanced game players are also allowed to take out loans and put options. Various random events, such as market trends are also introduced through the use of the Market Die.

For both versions of the game the values of the various trades are recorded on the score pads. In the basic game the winner is the first to accumulate 1 Million starting from a 100K stake. In the advanced game the target is 2 Million, but free of loans and put options.

name: Grand Poobah
description:
A "Spicy Dice" game.

Grand Poobah is a game for 2-3 players (2-5 with extra sets of dice) that require a set of Spicy Dice to play. Players build a "hand" over 3 turns and then compare their hands to a scoring die. As play progresses, players may attempt to strengthen their hands. As with all Spicy Dice games, the dice with red pips showing have special scoring or game play mechanics.

name: Rulettes for 16th Century Naval Warfare
description:
A "Rulette" is a small rules booklet, according to the publisher. The whole booklet is very short and the rules are very concise (not covering every possible detail), but still very playable.

This is a set of skirmish rules for wargaming, where one model equals one ship. (However, if transporting troops, a based group of figures represents 500 foot soldiers or 250 horse.)

Set largely in the Mediterranean Sea, it deals with both sailing and oared ships. Only a few of the ships have cannons - most do not, in this era - but most forts have them.

Rules are given for movement by oar and sail (wind is a factor), beaching, launching, shelter from the wind, and also for land units transported by these ships. Combat covered includes cannon fire, small arms fire, hand-to-hand fighting, and morale. Rules for terrain are covered, including islands, beaches, assaulting a fort, etc.

name: Ghetto
description:
"Ghetto is a game of mobility which simulates the pressures under which the urban poor live and the choices they face as they seek to improve their life situation. Players learn that the condition of their neighborhood affects all of them, whether or not they are concerned about it. They can improve neighborhood conditions by investing effort in community action."

Age or grade: Junior high - adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, player profiles, game sheet, dice, spinner, chance cards, victim cards, information sheets, block markers, player chips.

name: Shipping
description:
An Ahoy series game, published in England. The general idea of the game is to pick up and deliver as much cargo as possible.

With the capital gained you buy more harbour facilities, thereby collecting greater harbour dues.

The player having most capital, which includes face value of the port cards held, value of cargo and cash in hand at the end of the game is declared the winner.

If at any time during the game a player loses his ship, he may re-purchase it for 10,000.

This may entail selling some of his ports, which can be done by auctioning them among the players.

If he is unable to raise the necessary capital, he retires from the game.

Contents

1 x Game Board.

6 x Playing Pieces.

6 x Plans.

Money in Four Denominations.

1 x Pack of Met Report Cards.

1 x Pack of Owners Signal Cards.

1 x Pack of Lloyds Cards.

1 x Pack of Port Cards (or chips)

Bullion Cards (or chips)

Cargo Cards (or chips)

2 x Dice

1 x Set of Rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Square Grid

name: A Fenda do Bikini
description: A card game with the character Spongebob Squarepants. On their turns, players can put a character card on the table, buy more cards or score a location card. The goal is to score all the 8 locations of the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Combat Game
description:
This combat game has 2 colors: red & blue.

Each color has 21 cards: 1 president, 1 chief commander, 2 missiles, 2 fighter planes, 2 tankers, 2 sergeants, 2 commandos, 3 miners, 3 mines and 3 grenades.

This game can be played either by 2 or 3 persons.

The cards shall be equally distributed. The decision is taken according to ranks.

The president holds the highest rank followed by chief commander, missiles, fighter planes, tankers, sergeants, commandos, miners, mines and grenades. Mine and grenades will explode with anything but the mines don't explode each other. If the cards are of the same rank, these cards will be forfeited. (Mine and grenade can only be used once.)

There are other variants to this game which include:
East West Game, Tarzan, Ali Baba and World Fighter.

name: STREET WARriorS Collectible Card Game
description:
(From the Street Warriors Main Website)

The STREET WARriorS is a Collectible Card Game (CCG) where you battle against your opponent and use weapons like AK-47s, Brass Knuckles, Desert Eagles, Glocks, Knives and other deadly weapons...

Add extra excitement to the battle by strategically using MURPHY'S LAW cards like "Get Crunked!", "Pimps Up, Hos Down" and the "Race Card!"

Choose whether you want to be a "Good Guy" or a "Bad Guy", the choice is up to you.

Play as gangstas or crime bosses with groups like the Triad, Jamaican Posse, La Raza Escogida, Thugs, or Pimps. Or beat down the criminal element with law enforcement agencies like the ACU (Anti Crime Unit) or USU (United Security Unions). Don't wanna be a Johnny Law or a straight criminal? That's cool, play as a Freelancer... In fact you can mix and match to suit your style of play, with each group having their own distinct strengths and weaknesses...

The STREET WARriorS is heavily influenced by the Hip-Hop/Reggae/Heavy Metal/Punk music and lifestyle scenes. From the Tattoos to the Bling, we've blended a lot of real-world elements into the game and have gone through great lengths to provide players with an authentic Urban genre where you as the player can relate to the characters in the game.

The base Alpha set will be launching June 30th, 2005 at Origins. In the Alpha Set there are 9 Holofoil Boss Cards, 84 Low Level Character Cards, 23 High Level Character Cards, 2 Assassin Character Cards, 47 Murphy's Law Cards, 34 Equipment Cards, 34 Holofoil Character Cards, and 2 Never to be Printed Again Cards, bringing the Alpha Set total to 235 Cards.

name: History of the Samurai
description:
This game recreates the turbulent 500 year period of Japanese history starting from the 12th century end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Edo period in the 17th century.
Each player becomes a historical figure, controls their generals, and tries to rewrite the 20th century history books by having the most influence throughout time.

This game, like the Avalon Hill "History of the World", is designed to be playable by 2-6 players, but the rules are written for a standard game of 5 players.

Contains

a map
counters
96 cards


(from the translation and BGG user's description)
