name: Escape from Westerville State
description:
From the publisher:

Westerville is alive! The loonies are loose!
The loonies are loose in this fun combination of Role Playing and board games. You play the crazy patients of Westerville State Hospital as they begin their frantic bid for freedom.

A fun tactical board or miniatures game for 2 or more players who like to Role Play on the looney side. Dice not included.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Fusil & Fortress
description:
"Being an Account of the Art of War During the Time of His Grace The Duke of Marlborough"

Introduction

Fusil and Fortress is a Systems Analysis Classic Series game which offers the player an incredible amount of detail while providing a game which is easy to learn, interesting to read, and challenging to play. Fusil and Fortress is designed as a two-part game. Sections one through nine contain the rules required to play the tactical game, with Section three devoted to history, tactics, and organization. Sections ten through fourteen contain the rules for siege warfare, supply, engineering, and administration. Fusil and Fortress is not designed as a multi-level game in which you must learn more and more complicated rules. Once you have read the game, you can play it. We do this for two reasons. Our games are clearly written and our design staff feels that the wargamer has a lot more common sense than many games give him credit for. As an added bonus, Fusil and Fortress is designed to be played with or without an umpire.

We feel that Fusil and Fortress will be one of the most engaging games you have ever played. The reason for this is that all our designers are wargamers and understand problems with rules.

Designer's Notes

Because Fusil and Fortress is the first commercial wargame to effectively address warfare in the early 18th Century, the design staff felt that it was appropriate to discuss certain elements of game construction because of the radical departure from traditional game mechanics.

In most games, actual formations are sacrificed in order to cram the appropriate number of figures in the proper space. Thus, a one-deep line of figures may represent a two- or three-deep line of actual soldiers. While this method of game design may be perfectly acceptable for other eras, it would not be for the early 18th Century. Linear Infantry formations and numbers of ranks were of paramount importance and it would be impossible to use one rank of figures to represent more than one rank. Therefore, we have sacrificed a little space for accuracy and detail unknown in any other game. The upshot is that a unit will operate in the correct linear space in the proper number of ranks, but it will occupy an area slightly deeper than it actually would have. The rules have been formulated to mitigate this depth.

This unique design enables Fusil and Fortress to demonstrate the differences in the Dutch, Swedish, and French methods of musketry in a way you can actually see so that you can make them work the way they actually did.

The rules for artillery have also been designed to accurately represent the "fall of shot" and the occasional ricochet. The windage gauge is normally placed near the target which results in a smaller angular deviation of shot as the range increases. The inaccuracy of this method is obvious, and we have corrected it. Because of the design of the artillery firing system in Fusil and Fortress, no artificial additions for enfilade fire or other tactical advantages are needed.

The siege rules are a wargaming first and we do not believe that anything like them can be found anywhere. We have done everything possible to create in miniature the Vauban method of siegecraft and fortification. In conjunction with these unique combat and siege rules, we have also provided every last detail for engineering, supply, and administration, so that you can even "pay" your troops if you want to. You do not have to use all the information in Fusil and Fortress to have an exciting early 18th Century wargame, but when you do want information, it is there.

We feel that keeping these design differences in mind will help you understand the game better and enjoy it more. Good gaming.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Potala
description:
A Strategy Game for Enlightened Minds

For over 1,000 years, Tibet's Potala Palace has been a center of knowledge, meditation and peace. As the seat of the Tibetan government, Potala has been the home of Dalai Lamas, Tibetan Kings and countless generations of Buddhist monks.

Deep within the Palace is a Secret Garden where Buddhist Elders bring student monks to test them in the arts of focus, meditation and concentration. On the floor of the garden is etched a grid of 312 squares. Here, 2-4 students at a time are challenged to place colored stones on the grid, with the ultimate goal of placing more stones than the others. Their work is guided by two deceptively simple rules...

In addition, as the stones are placed, an Elder walks silently around the perimeter of the garden, keeping a tally of all he sees...

Online Play


Cycloops (turn-based)

name: Endeavor
description:
Endeavor is a trick-taking strategy card game for 2 players. A special deck is used that represents four Chinese empires. Each hand, one Empire is favored. With only 20 cards in the deck, each card and each play is important. Conquer your opponent by being the first to win 7 victory points.

Artwork by Wei Li and Brandon Leach.

Online Play


CCG Workshop (no longer available)

name: Indirigans-1
description:
This is an unofficial expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is the description on the cover:

Includes – the following rules:
- Far Side phasers
- boomerang torpedoes
- fuser mechanisms
- boomerang racks
- Indirigan special rules

Historical background for the Indirigans:
- Indirigans history
- Far Side political map
- Indirigan Tribe profiles
- 4 historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- ship descriptions for 24 Indirigan units
- a boomerang tracking chart
- boomerang declaration cards

Also included: 24 Companion SSDs

Expands:

Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Iron Stars: The Merchant War
description:
The Merchant War is the first supplement for Iron Stars. Here, you will find much to expand upon the basic Iron Stars game, including:

* A detailed history of the Merchant War of 1908-1909 between the United Kingdom and Austria-Hungary;
* The introduction of fast attack craft and His Majesty's Space Station Celestial Queen;
* One dozen new ship designs, including the German Äthermarine and Austro-Hungarian Sternmarine;
* Six new scenarios covering actions of the Merchant War;
* More information about Martians by the best-known chronicler of the Invasion, H. G. Wells;
* Additional rules for combat, including crew casualties and searchlights;
* New special equipment, such as machine guns and poison gas;
* Errata for the original Iron Stars rulebook; and
* Rules for including freighters and Q-ships in your games.

In addition, The Merchant War includes counters for the ships involved in the scenarios provided and an additional mine template.

name: Arcadia
description:
A tile-laying and -stacking game, a basic set consists of 40 hexagonal tiles worth different numbers of points. The tile are ridged so that three tiles together can form a base for a fourth tile to sit upon them.

Gameplay consists of playing tiles from a "hand" of three tiles. Tiles laid on top of other tiles are required to have the same pattern inscribed on them as the tile making up their base. Tiles placed above the first level score depending on the point value of the tile played and the level it was played on .

Sets come in a single color, and different sets come in different colors, allowing for expansion and more advanced play in which color also becomes a factor for scoring.

name: Krebiz-2
description:
This is the description on the cover:

Includes advanced Krebiz rules:
- Fighter Sabots
- The Krill series fighter
- Capsule Auxiliary Packs

Historical background for the Krebiz:
- Krebiz campaign notes
- Krebiz timeline and planetary system
- More historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- Ship descriptions for an additional 85 units
- The all-new Kraken old style dreadnought
- Three additional refits
- Defense satellites
- Bases

Also included: 30 pages of Companion SSDs displaying 35 Krebiz units

Expands

Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Krebiz-3
description:
This is the description on the cover:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- Krebiz X-1 improved technology
- Krebiz X-1 ship descriptions

Historical background for the Krebiz:
- Two Krebiz campaign games:
- The War of Annihilation, and
- The Krebiz Scavenger Hunt

Technical information including:
- ship descriptions for the Krebiz X-1 units
- Krebiz F&E build costs
- Krebiz campaign notes

Also included: 32 pages of Companion SSDs displaying 35 Krebiz units

Expands

Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: ChessWar
description:
(from web site)

ChessWar is a strategic game for two players. It is meant to be played on a standard chessboard with standard chess pieces although it can also be used on any kind of battlefield made of squares. It is NOT chess with dice and some extra rules! Instead, it is strategic game played with chess pieces. So, pieces are not automatically captured, some pieces (units) have ranged attacks and all your pieces (units) may move during your turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Namutoni
description:
On a board with 11 x 11 squares stands between the middle and one corner the fort NAMUTONI, built of 8 double-cube-sized cuboids: four corners/towers standing upright and four "walls" on the longer sides. So the fort has the size of a large 4 x 4 square enclosing 4 squares like a court.
From the two sides of the boards opposing the fort two players start from given starting points with four “tourists” to reach the fort.
The “tourists move in a kind of three-dimensional “knight-move”, so, after two steps on the same level it can jump one step vertically, or even after one step on the same level two steps vertically. This means that on the flat “desert” they have to cross first on their way to the fort, the figures are quite lame. For this there are four “helping stones”, which can be used as a stair. But you can not just put them wherever you want, but on the imaginary cross-points constituted by two movable strategic bars on the side of the board. Each of these bars contains three marks, so there are nine cross points where you can build “helping stones”.
In each turn a player can move one of his “tourists”, one “helping stone” or one bar to constitute new points.
The player who first enters the fort with three of his figures, one of them on a tower, is winning the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Square Grid, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Saggsen-Gadan: De säggs'schn Siedler / Catan-OFFENSIVE in Chemnitz
description:
"Saggsen Gadan, de Säggs'schen Siedler" or "Saggsen Gadan, the Settlers of Sax'ny"

What do you do when 2 major German game institutions both celebrate a 10 year anniversary in the same year? You throw one heck of a party and you invite all who want to come and join in. And when they leave, you give them a thank-you present.

On the 10th of September 2005, the Deutsche Spielemuseum (the German Game Museum and brainchild of Peter Lemcke) celebrated in style in its current hometown of Chemnitz, in the German state of Saxony, by attempting to break a world record in conjunction with that other birthday kid, the "Settlers of Catan". A more than 300 meter long game table was erected, offering room for 1000 Settler players, who all could participate on one gigantic Settlers map, using 17,500 Settlers' hexagons in the process. As it happened, 816 participants sat down to invade the ribbon island and the record stood.

To mark the occasion, a commemorative Settler expansion, themed on the German state of Saxony, was issued by Kosmos, in a limited edition of 1000, one for each participant. Klaus Teuber was on hand to sign his life away.

Saggsen Gadan presented two new scenarios for Settlers, both requiring game pieces from the basic set to play. Special game pieces needed for these Saxony scenarios were also included, ready to cut out. Instead of the usual variable game-set-up of the basic game, the two scenarios both use a ready-made map. There is one scenario map printed on each side of the expansion sheet, in the same vein as the game boards from boxed historical theme set expansions.

1. Saggsen-Gadan:
For this game variant, players must colonize Saggsen using the usual building and resource trading mechanisms. Through progressive development, different manufacturers can be founded, whose products subsequently can be turned into victory points. But be warned: Saggsen is sliced up by many rivers, that can only be crossed at bridges. To become King of Saggsen you will have to make your influence count in the seven regions of the state. Who is the first to obtain 10 victory points?

2. Catan-Offensive in Chemnitz - a quick scenario for 2-3 players:
By utilizing the resources obtained through building and trading, players aim to populate the city of Chemnitz bit by bit. As the game progresses, players can obtain colorful postcards of historical buildings, museums and leisure facilities. These postcards can then be exchanged for victory points. Karl Marx, after whom the city was known in its East German days when it was called Karl-Marx-Stadt, now takes over the role of Joker/Robber.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands:

CATAN

name: Anime Madness
description:
A Game of Improbable Occurrences...

Enter a Realm where Anime and Reality Unite...

Introduction...
You are the president of a grossly huge anime producing MegaCorp, and as the president of a grossly huge anime producing MegaCorp, you feel it is your duty to decimate the other grossly huge anime producing MegaCorps. To do this, you are employing the best animators (as well as the cheapest) you can find. These animators churn out image after image, but with one problem. They don't have a script! Luckily the inventors working (slaving) for you have developed the first and only Anime Plotting Device(TM).

As the characters of your various anime are added to your highly advanced, computerized environment, they appear in a fully constructed three-dimensional holographic matrix, awaiting your every whim! Unfortunately, this same system was also sold to your competitors (Your poor scientists were immediately executed, of course), and you are now forced (by contract, naturally) to share the warehouse-sized holographic matrix with your sworn enemies...

Being the sleazy MegaCorp president that you are, you decide to sabotage your competitor by slipping strange plots into their episodes, as well as trying to advertise your own shows by adding your characters in to kick some anime butt. Your competitors waste no time in retaliating. Soon, a malfunction in the Anime Plotting Device(TM) leads to a startling discovery: the anime has become tangible, physical. The anime is real!

Desperately, both you and your competitors hire insanely overpriced engineers to fix the problem. The characters themselves, luckily, do not realize that they are real, and continue to do your bidding. They still appear in the matrix as normal - through the scanning of the animators drawings. They just do real property damage now. Your competitors, never to be out done, do the same. In a fit of desperation, you find yourself forced to bring occasional live humans into the unstable matrix to help, fight, and eventually to die. They die only because, once something has entered the matrix, it's in there until it's dead. Your best director found this out a little late for your liking. After tangling with a 20mm anti-tank cannon wielding BU-11 Model Combat Boomer with a troubled past, he became but a memory.

...

Object of the game...
Anime Madness(TM) is a game for two or more players, with plenty of room for house variants. The object of Anime Madness(TM) is to become the reigning MegaCorp by doing one of two things. You may either drive your opponent from 20 Ratings Points down to 0, becoming the only thing on television, or you may raise your Ratings Points up to 40, becoming the coolest thing on television.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 007 Underwater Battle from Thunderball
description:
A rare James Bond themed board game based on the underwater battle sequence from the movie Thunderball - Largo v. James Bond!

The game features some attention getting components. These include colorful plastic scuba swimmer figures on clear plastic pedestals with metal bases. There are also similarly mounted shark figures. The battle takes place on a glossy seascape mapboard. Rules are printed inside the lid.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Scuba-Opoly
description: This is the original version of Scuba-Opoly. Play one of your favorite board games with a diving twist. Players collect research dives, trade them for data collection centers, go on treasure hunts and become DAN oxygen instructors.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Starfight: Star Captains
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The STAR CAPTAINS expansion set for the popular Starfight game is not a game itself, you need at least the STARFIGHT base rules in order to play this expansion.

This is not an advanced game, however, these rules will make the game last longer and add a bit of complexity to the whole mechanism.

With this expansion, your ships will now have a captain and a crew!

Some rules have been modified to work best with this expansion, however you can incorporate these modifications in your game even if you do not use the STAR CAPTAINS expansion.

This PDF contains
• A rule sheet
• 4 crew sheets
• The new fire modifier table

Expands:

Starfight
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Starfight: Drakus Empire Captains
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Welcome to the DRAKUS EMPIRE CAPTAINS expansion set for the popular Starfight© game. This is not a game itself, you need at least the STARFIGHT base rules, the STAR CAPTAINS expansion and the EXPANSION PACK I in order to play with this expansion.

In this expansion, you will find four Drakus Empire captains and some new orders for this faction.

This PDF contains
• A rule sheet
• 4 crew sheets

Expands:

Starfight
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Starfight: Mohrg Empire Captains
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Welcome to the MOHRG EMPIRE CAPTAINS expansion set for the popular STARFIGHT© game. This is not a game itself, you need at least the STARFIGHT base rules, the STAR CAPTAINS expansion and the EXPANSION PACK V in order to play with this expansion.

In this expansion, you will find four Drakus Empire captains and some new orders for this faction.

This PDF contains
• A rulesheet
• 4 crew sheets

Expands:

Starfight
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Treppauf: Treppab
description:
The "board" is a 3-dimensional house. The players are family members who have to reach different destinations with dice to accomplish certain household chores (like washing dishes). The first one to finish all his chores and reaching the swimming pool before another player manages to tack further work on him, wins.
The whole gaming materials are bilingual, in French and German.

Under license from Seven Towns Ltd., London

name: Tannenberg
description:
The opening days of World War One in the East.

Test Series Game 8. Sister game to Dunnigan's 1914. Designed at the same time as the 1914: Revision Kit; uses the 1914 system.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Plastic Ships and Fuzzy Men
description:
The sixth installment in the Fuzzy Heroes line sends you favorite stuffed animals out to see. It introduces rules for ship building, ship-to-ship combat and even pirate-talk for beginners.
The rules are separate from the main Fuzzy Heroes rule set, but they greatly complement each other.
Another fine installment in this humorous line will make you want to dig out your childhood favorites and head to the nearest toy store to pick up that big pirate ship you never had.

Expands:

Fuzzy Heroes
categories: Animals, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Iron Stars: Southern Front
description:
Southern Front is the second supplement for Iron Stars, the game of space combat in an age of steam and steel. In this book players will find additional game mechanics and background material that extends our semi historical timeline through the pivotal year of 1912:


An overview of world history from the close of the Merchant War through the Antarctic crisis;
Nearly four dozen new ether ship designs, covering the space forces of South America, Italy, Turkey, and Spain, along with additional ships from Britain and Japan, and the introduction of the Soviet space forces;
Coverage of the Falklands War between the British Empire and the A.B.C. Powers (Argentina, Brazil, and Chile), including nine new scenarios;
"The Red One”, a short story by Jack London;
A new space station, HMSS Diamond Rock;
Rules for boarding parties and shipboard combat;
New special equipment, such as star shells and heat rays; and
Rules for orbital bombardment of surface targets.


This should be more than enough to keep your ether navies occupied as the world marches inexorably towards the Great War.

Southern Front includes nine (9) sheets of counters and templates for use with star shells and orbital bombardment.

name: Knights of the Round Table
description:
A sort of a proto-RPG using miniatures, set in the world of "Le Morte d'Arthur," which can be used to fight stand-alone melees, or to play extended campaigns.

Included are:
-rules for 1 on 1 melees and jousts that involves choosing cards representing various attacks or defenses. Percentage dice are used to determine combat results, your chance to hit being determined by your and your opponent's choice of card. The severity of the result is determined by the amount which your roll exceeds the base chance to hit

-simplified rules for combats involving multiple combatants

-rules for limited campaigns(lasting a few hours) and for longer campaigns of perhaps indefinite length. The extended ("full") campaign includes rules for warfare and conquest and enable players to play enchanters as well as knights. There are encounter tables and many rules designed to capture the flavor of the Arthurian mythos.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vampire Requiem
description: Battle it out with Vampires, beasts, demons and even humans to try and establish dominance over your foes in this unique and superbly illustrated card game.

name: Let's Go Hike
description: Let's Go Hike is a simple 'spin & move' game set in the Boundary Waters Canoe Area. Players select from an assortment of forest creature markers such as 'Shirley Squirrel' or 'Matthew Mallard', and race from the Gunflint Trail Ranger Station to the goal: Moon Lake campsite.

name: Fox Two Reheat!
description:
Air combat 1950 to the Present Day

Current Edition: 1.1

52 pages; recommended scale 1/300, 1/600, 1/700; complexity: 7/10; level of detail: 7/10; avg game length 1-1½ hours; dice required: D10, D6

View Summary of Contents

These rules simulate tactical level jet fighter combat from 1950 to the present day. They are specifically designed for jet versus jet combat and unlike other products that go into too much detail, each player can handle several aircraft. The rules operate in three dimensions while only physically using two, height being indicated beside an aircraft.

There are guns, air to air rockets, Infra Red and Radar guided air to air missiles, SAM sites, etc. Data for over 200 aircraft in use by many nations from the 1950’s onward are included.

The skill of aircrew is very important and the system provides for this. The players can decide how good the crew are by deciding the level of training they think is appropriate, though a random system for skill generation is also provided.

Radar and electronics are handled within the rules by means of a Tech Level system that allows for systems to be improved or obsolete within the game, but without extra complication. Ground attacks are possible as part of the game mission mix, though the effect of the attack will depend on using the right weapon. SAM and AAA sites are also included.

Note

The game rules were developed specifically with jet fighters in mind and the data calculation reflects this. We took a decision NOT to include propeller driven aircraft (with a very few specific exceptions), and this has provoked comment from some users, especially if fighting the Korean war.

Summary of Contents

INTRODUCTION: Scales; Definitions and concepts; Technology Levels; Designers’ Notes

MEN AND MACHINES: Aircrew Training and Skills; Skill Rolls; Dazed, Wounded or Dead Aircrew; Crew Survival; Aircrew Experience; Aircraft Capability; Equipping Stores; Miscellaneous Stores; Jettisoning Stores; Destruction of Aircraft

SETTING UP A GAME, DEPLOYMENT: Points Values; Organizing a Game; Starting the Game; Deploying Surface Targets; Deploying aircraft; Off Table Reserves; Air Superiority Missions; Ground Attack Missions; Intrusion Missions; Interception Missions; Rearming and Repairs; Victory and Defeat

SEQUENCE OF PLAY: Ending the Game; Summary of Crew Activities and Skill Rolls

FLIGHT FUNDAMENTALS: Formations and Movement; The Effect of Altitude on Performance; Speed and Fuel Use; Order of Movement Actions; Movement; Turning; Effects of Damage on Turning; Climbing; Zoom Climb; Climbing Half Loop; Diving; Diving Half Loop; Displacing Models and mid air collisions

GAME ARCS

RADAR AND DETECTION: Contact Markers; Detection—Visual; Detection—Search Radar; Detection of Objects on the Ground; Losing Contact

SHOOTING GUNS AND AIR TO AIR ROCKETS: Guns; Arcs of Fire; Lines of Fire; Target Priority and Timing; Aircrew Shooting; Shooting Procedure; Modifiers; Hitting the Target; Multi-barrel weapons; Automatic Hit Bonus; Ammunition Supply; Damaging the Target; Critical Hits; Effect of Formations on Shooting; Air to Air salvo rockets; AIR-2 Genie air to air nuclear missile

SHOOTING AIR TO AIR MISSILES: Air to Air Missiles; Obtaining a Lock; Losing a Lock; ECM Aircraft; Breaking a Lock; Firing Missiles; Damaging the Target

ATTACKING A SURFACE TARGET: Spotting the Target; Identifying the Target; Attack and Ammunition Types; Attacking an Identified Target; Defensive Fire; Attacking an Unidentified Target; Ground defenses; Unlisted Air to Ground Weapons

GROUND DEFENSES: AAA Guns; Air defense Zones; SAM Batteries

AIRCRAFT DATA: Understanding the Aircraft Data Tables; Filling in the Aircraft Record Sheets; Data for Civilian and Transport Aircraft; Data for Combat Aircraft; Aircraft in Action

TABLES: Payload types and location; Miscellaneous Equipment; Surface to Air Missiles; Air to Air Missiles; Air to Surface Weapons

1 AND 2 SEATER RECORD SHEET; LARGE AIRCRAFT RECORD SHEET
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Devil's Deeds
description:
From the Rules :

"There is a job open in hell for a nasty devil like you. But you has grown to like working on earth and desperately wants to avoid going down to hell again. You must be bad enough to keep your job, but not bad enough to get a new job. A devilish challenge."

A card game made by a new Swedish designer.

name: Parodi
description: The game consists of cards, each of which contains two lines from more or less famous German poems (in the widest sense, from the classics to advertising slogans). These cards have to be combined into new creative output, with the other players judging the quality of the results. Winning is secondary to a good laugh.

name: Kaskade
description: Nice little 'Stacking Game' by a small game company that specialized in 'wooden games'. Game consists of 48 round wooden sticks and a die. Beginning of the game all wooden pieces lie next to each other flat on the table. On his turn a player has to roll the die and put the rolled number of wooden pieces from either end on top of the others. If this causes some sticks to "roll away" etc. the player collects one penalty stick that scores negative points according to its color. Once a player reaches a certain number of points the player with the lowest score wins.

name: Sexta
description:
3 possible moves:
- Move or insert 1 of your stones
- Move 1 part of the board.
- Rotate 1 part of the board

The starting formation for the board is a square and all 4 tiles had to be connected all the time (at least touching edge by edge). The goal of the game is to get 6 stones in a row.

name: Head1liners
description:
This game contains 386 pictures. The goal is to create the "best" headline for each picture. All the players vote and the player receiving the most votes gets to move up.
each player plays every time to create the funniest, most interesting or zaniest headline for the image.
The winner is the person that gets to the finish line by receiving the most votes for their head1lines.
If a player gets too far ahead they play with a handicap to keep the game competitive for players of all ranges.
This is a green game made from recycled materials.

name: Perception: The Ultimate Word Game
description:
Thinking fun for all the Family

Perception is a game of words- secret words- that only you or your partner know - ONE WORD clues are given as to what that secret word may be - Does your partner have the perception to guess what it is from the clues you give!

Ages 12 and over.

name: Pancake!: Women's College Volleyball
description:
Quick-playing but detailed simulations of womens college volleyball. Instant download, print and play game.

Features Easy to set up & play: Just shuffle the action cards and play. (If you want to keep score, enter the player and team names onto the provided score sheet

All play derived from 100 "action cards": Each card is 2-sided.

Statistically accurate: Every division I college team from the 2005-2006 season, along with the players, are rated in every possible statistical category.

Each team and player rated in several categories: Every statistic you would expect to be covered is here. Service aces, service errors, reception errors, kills, attack errors, blocks (both solo & assisted), block errors, digs, ball handling errors and assists are all accounted for.

Keep score as you play and compile stats.

Optional injury and ejection system

Game Contents
Complete rule book, including a detailed description of a partial sample game, useful as a tutorial.

Set of action cards, ready for printing

Score sheet

Injury and ejection chart

Team cards, divided by conference. Each conference is printed on one separate .pdf file, all organized within division.

name: Mischief Mini Golf Card Game
description:
Mischief makes miniature golf even more fun!

In Mischief, players are dealt 3 cards at the start of a round of Mini Golf. While playing a real-world round of mini golf, players will have opportunities to play cards on themselves or their opponents. These cards enhance the play of the game creating a fun and competitive round of Mini Golf like you've never experienced before. Every hole players draw more cards, so there are always 3 cards in your hand to choose from. Because of the wide variety of cards included, no two games are ever quite the same. As an added bonus, Mischief can also be used as a standard deck of playing cards.

Mischief also includes between hole mini-games to help pass the time in line.

name: Zion
description: ZION was produced by the "Later Day Saints - Mormons" and advertised as a family quiz game with separate questions for adults and children. Originally published by Bookcraft in 1959. Over 600 questions on the Bible, Book of Mormon, Church History and miscellaneous subjects. Includes a game board making it easier to keep track of who is winning. Also included are questions for children so the whole family can play. Great for Family Night, Seminary, Sunday School or Primary.

name: Cowpens: Battles of the American War of Independence – Volume 2
description:
A DTP wargame based on the earlier Vimeiro game by the same game designer, and is the second in the American Revolutionary War series after Hobkirk Hill. Components are similar to Hobkirk Hill.

Components:
13" x 19" Map
128 die-cut Counters
Rulebook
Charts and Tables

All components come in a ziploc bag.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: BattleFront
description:
BattleFront is a Cardgame for 2 players set during the WWII conflict.

The players fight for victory during battles on 5 different fronts:
- right
- right/center
- center
- left/center
- left
Win the first to achieve definitive victory on 3 of the 5 fronts.

Players draws their cards from a common card deck made of 70 cards.
The cards are divided into 7 categories, each of them is composed by 10 cards with a value from 1 to 10.
The 7 categories are:
- Leader
- Troops
- Planes
- Tanks
- Ballistic
- Strategy
- Fortifications

Each turn consists of 3 different phases:
1.Logistic
2.Line Up
3.Battle

LOGISTIC
Each player draw 7 cards.

LINE UP
Place 1 card on the board. (one each player)

BATTLE
Sum the force (value on each cards) to decide who wins on different “fronts”.

The front is considered “secured” after 3 wins in a row.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War I, World War II

name: Castile
description:
If you like a subtle game of strategy, you and your opponent will love being engaged in the game of Castile (the rules are calling it Castille).

A square board, divided into five territories, provides the battle area in which players attempt to capture three of the territories and place their flag. The first player to capture three territories wins.

Reimplemented by:
Turnier
Claim

name: Phoenician Sea Trader
description:
Card and Board game for 2+ players.
Players represents sea trader of Ancient Times.
They have to buy and sell different materials (Oils, Spices, Silk, etc).
Some City Ports pay well for specific types of materials and some other Ports sell them for high prices.
Travel with your ship across the board but be aware of Tornadoes and Pirates.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
The winner is the one who collects 25 money. (earned with trades).
categories: Economic, Exploration, Negotiation, Print & Play, Transportation

name: How to Host a Scavenger Hunt: Sports Safari
description: Teams compete to collect items of varying point values (ticket stub from a sporting event, e.g) and to take photographs of the team in certain venues. Gather back at the host's house for dinner and a review of the photos.

name: How to Host a Scavenger Hunt: Traveler Safari
description: Teams compete to collect items of varying point values (room key from a hotel, e.g) and to take photographs of the team in certain venues. Gather back at the host's house for dinner and a review of the photos.

name: Fire on the Mountain: Battle of South Mountain September 14, 1862
description:
During Robert E. Lee's first invasion of the North, Lee learned of a threatening Federal advance East of Hagerstown, Maryland. Because Stonewall Jackson was besieging Harper' Ferry, he instructed Daniel Harvey Hill to hold the South Mountain passes in the rugged Blue Ridge, just East of Boonsboro. It was essential to delay McClellan’s progress so Jackson would have time to take Harper's Ferry and reunite his scattered divisions before the Army of the Potomac caught him unprepared.

Despite strong defensive features the numerically superior Federal forces should have overwhelmed the rebels but the inaction of Pleasonton and Burnside squandered their advantage. In the end Lee's defense of the South Mountain passes cost him 2800 casualties as opposed to the Federal losses of 2300 and led directly to the fearful slaughter at Antietam.

Fire on the Mountain concentrates on the action around Turner's Gap and Fox Gap, emphasizing the difficulty of mountainous terrain and the seesaw nature of the battle into which reinforcements continue to trickle and the effects of officer casualties. The game uses simple mechanics to simulate movement, artillery, cavalry, leaders, and difficult terrain, with a unique combat system that allows the game to move quickly while still simulating the tense nature of the battle.


Game scale
Unit size: Brigades
Game Turn: represents 1 hour
Hex Scale:300 yds per hex
Playtime: 2 and 1/2 to 3 hours
Complexity: Low to Moderate

name: Trivial Pursuit: Edición Real Madrid
description:
This Trivial Pursuit edition is dedicated to the best soccer club in XX century (FIFA award)

The mechanics of the game are similar to other Trivial Pursuit games, but questions are about history and players of Real Madrid.

The game is in Spanish and the components in the box are:

Game Board
1 die
450 Question & Answer Cards
4 Player pieces

name: Swordplay:  Rising Sun
description:
Battle For The Honor And Glory Of Your House!

Swordplay: Rising Sun is a fast paced non-collectible card game of martial arts combat. Face your opponents in hand to hand combat using a wide variety of kicks, punches and more exotic maneuvers. Wield a variety of classic martial arts weapons including Sai, Throwing Stars and more. Build your Chi to unleash devastating attacks on your opponents bringing honor to your house.

Includes: 60 full-color cards (2 Heroes and a 58 card Combat Deck), dice, damage markers and rules for two player duels, multi-player battles and combining this game with other swordplay games for cross-era battles.

name: The Brusilov Offensive: Imperial Russia's Last Campaign, 1916
description:
The Brusilov Offensive
Imperial Russia's Last Campaign, 1916

In mid-May 1916, the Allies were faced with two crises. At Verdun the French army was gradually being bled to death, and in Trentino, the Italian army was rapidly nearing its breaking point. As in August 1914, the Allies sent out a call of au secours to the Russians.

The Russians responded on 4 June with an offensive along the entire line of General Brusilov's Southwest Front. This operation resulted in the capture of some 150,000 square miles of territory, inflicted losses of over 3/4 million, and force the Central Powers to weaken their offensives. As great as it was, however, the Brusilov Offensive was not the strategically decisive victory the Russians needed to stave off internal collapse. In the game the Russian player must break through the Central Powers line and encircle masses of enemy troops, while the Central Powers Player must make careful withdrawals and timely counterattacks. For both Players, the game is demanding and requires coherent planning and careful execution.

name: Penal Battalion
description:
You find yourself part of a Penal Battalion somewhere on the Eastern Front during World War II. Your unit's current job is clearing minefields. You can't exactly refuse to work, but there's no need to rush headlong into eager compliance with every order, is there?

Penal Battalion is a very simple solitaire card game of strategy. The object is straightforward: if you go BOOM, you lose. If you survive through the whole deck, you "win," and get to do the same thing tomorrow...

Published in Panzer Digest #1. Requires a standard deck of 52 playing cards and several markers (pennies, buttons, etc).

name: Mexican Rails
description:
The Mexican Rails kit was originally conceived as an expansion to Empire Builder and available directly from Mayfair. It includes some new cards, tokens, and a map of Mexico that could be aligned with the Empire Builder board, but all the components were black & white copies packed in a 9×12 envelope with a Mexican Rails sticker on it. Rather than upgrade to production quality similar to the base game, the board, loads, and cards were incorporated into North American Rails.

It was also published in Games International (Issue 7 – July 1989) magazine.

Expands:

Empire Builder
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Lancaster and York
description: Lancaster & York is a card game simulation of the War of the Roses in England 1455-1485. Players accumulate troops and noble supporters by recruitment and intrigue. The losing side attempts to start a revolt to bring the King to battle. Winner of the battle becomes the new king and starts chopping off Heads. Players share a common deck. Win by remaining King for 5 turns or killing off 5 enemy Heirs. A complete copy of the rules and cards is available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/LAY.html

name: 1558: Hanfrieds Erbe
description:
The players are brought into the year 1558 and face each other as citizens and students. With strategy and a little luck they try to push through their interests in the blossoming university town of Jena.
Designer Prof. Ingo Althöfer developed “1558 - Hanfrieds inheritance” exclusively for the Jenaer university's 450 year anniversary. A short game, not only for the break between two lectures. Printed on ecological hemp cloth. Unusually packed in a silver aluminum cylinder. Limited Edition.

The special reason for using hemp cloth for the board was a word joke (hemp = Hanf in German): Hanfried == Han(f)fried == Hanf-Fried. The price of the game was exactly 15.58 Euro, motivated by the year 1558 when Jena University was founded.
Information from the designer: I realized one very personal copy with wooden board (instead of hemp cloth) where the (neutral) Hanfried piece is a real silver coin. Two pictures of this item are found in the picture gallery.

name: Krazy Golf
description: Plays 18 holes of golf with cards.

name: Pacific 1942 Admiral
description:
Pacific 1942 Admiral is the cornerstone of the Pacific 1942 naval game as it is the basic version of the game consisting of high-quality wooden battle units and original hexagonal sextets used in all Pacific 1942 games. No miniatures!

This board game will move you into the area of Pacific battles during World War II. You will be suprised by variability of this game in which you can sail the battleships with cannons,command aircraft carriers with aircraft and troopships to transport your infantry. And you will have a tough objective - conquer four Pacific islands.
Pacific 1942 Admiral was "refurbished, rewritten and reloaded" in 2011.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Duel of Eagles
description:
Duel of Eagles is a set of miniatures rules designed for 1/300th scale miniature aircraft. It covers 1939-1945, and has plane statistics for a variety of aircraft in the WW2 time frame.

The movement system is hexless, and allows the player to tighten turns by utilizing changes in altitude.

Basic campaign rules are included.

name: Varialand
description: This spiel gut award winner enables young children to become familiar with creating images, pattern recognition, building vocabulary, and tile placement. The purpose of the game is to build a new creation using colorful tiles that represent animals, grass, sky, water, river pieces, and much more. Each of the 80 tiles is made of thick, chunky, high quality beechwood with colorful glossy illustrations. This is an excellent way to prepare the youngest of children for tile placement games such as Carcassonne.

name: Nightmare Hunter
description: Players fight strange monsters in two worlds--the real world and the dream world--with different strengths in each place. This game has several two-sided location cards, where one side shows the real world version and the other side shows the dream world version. These locations are the battlegrounds, against monsters like the Wandering Stuffed Toy. Special cards use dream imagery, like Psycho Slip (doorways hovering in space), Escape (from monster), and Corridor of a Dream (running on a moebius strip).

name: So spielt die Welt
description:
Scheduled for Essen 2007

"Bambus Spiele No 2"
This book offers a glimpse into the boardgame scene of Northern Ireland, Finland, Poland, Israel, Madagascar, Japan, Thailand, Singapore, Australia, USA (extra chapter about Hawaii) and Brazil.
It also offers rules of local games and games from Michael Schacht, Günter Cornett, Rudi Hoffman, Joli Quentin Kansil and others.

name: Brief 'n' Brisk College Basketball
description:
Fast-Action Games created many "quick-play" sports simulations where the outcome of a contest could be decided with just one or two dice rolls. These games made it easy to play an entire series of games in a matter of just a few minutes.

This game covers college basketball back to 1892. Like all of the team sports games in this line, a few simple numbers, devised from team statistics, enable the player to recreate an entire season in a short period of time.

Fast-Action Game Description
COLLEGE BRIEF ’N’ BRISK BASKETBALL
This innovative game features top teams EVERY year since 1892; 20 of the TOP teams EVERY vear since 1900 are included! You can recreate NCAA and NIT tournaments! Or Stage DREAM TOURNAMENTS to determine the GREATEST college team of all-time!! Imagine 1968 UCLA vs 1956 SAN FRANCISCO! Or 1948 KENTUCKY vs 1990 (INLY! Limitless possibilities! Over 3,000 teams are included!
Complete game costs only $15 postpaid

name: Kursk: Choque de titanes
description:
Reproduce el combate por la población de Projorovka el 12.7.43,que tuvo lugar durante la batalla de kursk.
Wargame basico de iniciación.
Incluye reglas,tablas,tablero de 40x90 cm i un total de 50 piezas.Cada hexagono representa 250 mts.

Plays the fight for the people of Projorovka the July 12, 1943, which took place during the battle of Kursk.
Wargame basic.
Includes rules, tables, board 40x90 cm and 50 counters.
One hex=250mts.

name: Paper Football Card Game
description:
Do you remember playing the paper football game that got you in trouble in class growing up?
Now there is a different twist of competitive strategy added when playing this Paper Football Card Game.
Players can make offense and defense plays and create fumbles and interceptions on their opponent.
Also, kick off returns, challenged plays, point conversions and field goal attempts,are all part of the game.

Game Includes:
100 cards,signature paper football, and rules.
Also, while supples last your order will include a Turf Card which is used to help
kick the paper football for field goal and extra point attempts on slick surfaces.

Check out our website at www.rayzorsharpent.com

name: Master Europa 102: Western Front – Invasion
description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module covers the game Second Front. It contains 143 new counters for use with the logistics system.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Batalha das Ardenas
description: Wargame on the Battle of the Bulge, fought in Belgium in December 1944. Parte of the "II Guerra Mundial" series of wargames published in Brazil in 1981.

name: Tour du Monde en Vespa
description:
Players travel across a colorful map of the world on their Vespa motor scooters, facing hazards such as accidents, tire punctures, and breakdowns.

The game includes 6 metal Vespa game pieces, folding world map game board, rules sheet in French, spinner, 5 wooden continental character figures, one standard six-sided die, one special six-sided "stoplight" die, 6 Vespa Club Card passport folders, 6 South passport cards, 6 North passport cards, 30 continental character cards, 30 metal gasoline tokens, 20 metal repair tokens, and 5 full tank tokens.

There are reportedly at least five versions of the game, apparently only varying in box styles, except for one version with rules and components printed in Italian.
publishers: Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Editrice Giochi

name: 3P2K
description:
3P2K, or Plain and Precious Parts 2000 is a sequel to the 1984 LDS game, Celestial Pursuit. The game is designed to be played by two teams, but it can also be played by four individual players. The goal is to be the first to get four Touchstones by answering trivia questions correctly. The game includes 2,000 trivia questions in four categories. Book of Mormon, Bible, Hymns, and Prophets/Prophecy. Categories are chosen by rolling a die (which the game refers to as the "perfect polyhedron."

In the basic version of the game, players need only collect four touchstones to win. In the advanced version, players need to collect one touchstone from each category.

The answers to all questions are referenced to the scripture or hymn they come from so that players can study subjects they didn't know.

The author originally wanted to reprint Celestial Pursuit, but felt that the questions and rules were too complex for family play so he created 3P2K instead.

From the Publisher:
"3P2K has long been on the mind of one of Celestial Pursuit's authors. Realizing from his own family the need for Gospel-based alternatives to the modern world's fast-paced entertainments, the author created Plain & Precious Parts 2000, or 3P2K.

The 1984 version of Celestial Pursuit seemed too difficult and timebound in its adult questions and too complex in its rules to simply be reprinted. 3P2K was therefore created to best serve LDS families in the year 2000 and beyond by emphasizing gospel principles and naturally creating opportunities for doctrinal discussion.

By focusing on four basic areas of Gospel knowledge (Bible, Book of Mormon, Hymns, Prophets & Prophecy), 3P2K simplifies question content and lends timelessness to referenced answers. Specific attention was given to the idea of plain & precious parts of doctrine as the questions were written. Many questions are based on truths learned from the Joseph Smith Translation of the Bible and from footnote references in the LDS Scriptures. Providing both adult and child cards allows family participation from the simplest Sunbeam to the sagest scriptorian."

Related game:

Celestial Pursuit

name: Boom: The Card Game
description: Boom is a card game (for 2 or more players), which sees players avoiding a Bomb that could explode at any moment. Players will use cards from their hand to get rid of the Bomb, should it come their way, by passing it to another player. If a player receives the Bomb and cannot pass it to another player, they ‘explode’ and are out of the game. Also if a player runs out of cards, they are also out of the game. The last player remaining will win the game.

name: Isle Royale Adventures
description:
"Experience the adventure and romance of Isle Royale National Park...yesterday and today!"

This game provides players the opportunity to explore the geography and history of IRNP as a boardgame. It's a standard roll-and-move format, on a large 14x40 inch roll-up board. All players start at one end of the island. Four dice (provided) are rolled, and players use the value on a single die or pairs of dice to see if they can equal the mileage to proceed to the next location. Water routes are sometimes available, and you can use those if you roll trips or a four-straight in three rolls, Yahtzee-fashion. There are penalties for being landed on.

The locations are campgrounds, scenic sights, fire lookouts, etc., with each type worth so many points to the player landing there or passing by. Points are tallied on a provided pad with a provided pencil. Some sights allowed the drawing of a Fortune Card, which can add or subtract additional points.

The board is very attractive and informative, and the four pawns with the game are solid copper lathe-turned figures. I imagine the game-play might be just a notch above the average roll-and-move, due to the complexity of the path network, the varying values of the stops, and the "Can't Stop"-ish dice selection mechanic.

name: Ming
description:
Ming is an original chess-like strategy game. It is played on a board with 7 x 7 squares.
Every player has 7 figures (1 emperor, 1 mandarin, 2 generals, 3 monks) that vary in height. In the course of a game, own and opponent's marbles are added to the figures. These define the distance a figure can move and in which way (diagonal or horizontal and vertical).

The game is won in one of three ways:
1) Conquer your opponents emperor;
2) Reach the opponents starting line or
3) Conquer seven marbles of your opponents colour.

name: Eprion
description:
There is a place with no time or space, wandering on the eternity of an inexistent reality. The beginning of everything and the converge of nothing. Welcome a new era of fantasy, heroism and eternal battles. The Eprion era.

In a very distant world called Eprion, two races must face each other in a great battle. The game comes with two sets of cards and figures. The cards can be creatures or spells. Each creature card has an associated figure that can be played in the board. The board is composed by 6 modular boards which must be placed at the beginning of the game: forest, ice, desert, swamp, lake and plain. The position in which they are placed is very relevant, since the creatures abilities are affected by the kind of landscape they are standing in.
The object of the game is to be the first one in defeating the adversary’s leader, which is protected by 2 gemstones and his army.

Eprion is not just a game. It comes with a very well written book with the story of this world where you can learn about the story of almost every character of the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Blütentanz
description:
Content:
12 butterflies, 4 catapults, 2 bloom basis pieces, 1 bloom platform

The players try to toss their butterflies with the help of
catapults to the bloom platform skillfully.
The players who succeeds first to place all butterflies on the bloom wins the game.

name: The Lone Tank
description:
The game is set during World War Two, where you are a German tank commander who has to get his battle-worn tank safely back to friendly faces. The only way back is through a small village, but this contains elements of enemy infantry.

It is a card driven game, and there are two types of card. Terrain cards, which is the pack you are trying to go through as quickly as possible, where the last card is always the Bridge card. There are also Event cards which mainly contain enemy soldiers. Each card has an activation number, the activation level is decided by shuffling activation cards into the Terrain deck. So the further into the village you go the more likely you are to meet enemy opposition.

You give orders to your crew, spending order points. Example: prepare main tank gun, load main tank gun, move turret, observe etc. Your tank creates noise which attracts enemy soldiers and the terrain you move over may also have a bearing on this as well.

Combat is a series of dice rolls, not everyone's favourite part of the game but most wargamers will be okay with this. Also included are the use of Schürzen (side skirts), Zimmerit paste, PIAT attacks, a Sherman, and tank traps.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Pharaoh's Heir
description:
The setting is ancient Egypt. Pharaoh is dying, and, in a break from tradition, has decided that he will name an heir who will best serve Egypt's interests rather than hand the nation over to his handsome but rather dim-witted first-born son. Each player is the leader of a powerful Egyptian Noble Family with the ambition to rise to the level of Pharaoh. Rival Families will provide stiff competition, and all will have to contend with the force of nature that dictates the pattern of Egyptian life -- the River Nile. In flood the Nile can provide increased harvests but may also damage structures, whereas severe drought will cause starvation and suffering.

Pharaoh has issued several decrees. He demands a great harvest, sufficient people to build yet another mighty monument to himself upon his death (most likely a pyramid, although occasionally the Pharaohs preferred big cat-like things), as well as in increase in the worship of (read: sacrifice to) his favorite gods. In return for excelling in these areas of ancient Egyptian life, Pharaoh is willing to make you his heir. Oh, yes, one last thing -- Pharaoh also rewards the Families that develop the most valuable buildings and the most desirable land districts...

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Thrilling Expeditions: Valley of the Thunder Lizard
description:
Thrilling Expeditions: Valley of the Thunder Lizard allows players to play big game hunters in a lost valley populated with creatures from before the rise of man, or have their pirates going ashore on an island where Neanderthals battle Saurians, or time traveling tourists suddenly stranded in Earth’s distant past.

This title adds dinosaurs not only to the .45 Adventure system, but to Gloire: Swashbuckling Adventure in the Age of Kings and Fantastic Worlds also. In addition, the book provides a Big Game Hunter archetype for each of the three game systems.

There are four multi-part scenarios as well as stats for over 20 different dinosaurs and mega fauna. Plus, there are rules to add new dinosaurs not covered in this book. There are also archetypes for early man and a race of dinosaur-men called Saurians.

The Valley of the Thunder Lizard is the first of the Thrilling Expeditions series of supplements. These supplements will be heavy on scenarios with at least one scenario for each game system.

Expands:

.45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era
Gloire: Swashbuckling Adventure in the Age of Kings
Fantastic Worlds
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Wildfire
description:
Author's Description:

Version 1.1 of the Wildfire rules system, a generic rule set for 15mm science fiction skirmishes (the rules are easily adapted for other scales). Employing a simple and intuitive yet tactical counters-based system with full rules for infantry and vehicles, Wildfire includes a complete design system to let you create forces from your imagination or based on a film or book. An optional background, the Second Sphere, is also included. One hundred and five pages of science fiction action!

Expanded by:

Wildfire Overkill

name: Nana Shogi
description:
Billed as "The World's Smallest Shogi Variant," Nana Shogi is played on a 3x3 board with two identical sets of three pieces. Rules are similar to the parent game, Shogi, but some pieces are cubes that can be promoted through a cycle of four faces taken from several other Shogi variants.

The Three Types of Pieces

A conventional Shogi king
An orthogonally-moving piece (Rook/Chariot/Swallow's Wings/Go-between)
A diagonally-moving piece (Bishop/Tile General/Cat's Sword/Dog)

name: Aztekz
description:
From the publisher's website:

Free the lost souls!

Lots of lost souls wander around the old Aztec's pyramid. As a chief, you have to earn your right to rest in that pyramid. Free as many souls as you can to obtain your last sleep's place.

Each player has a chief and two slaves. The chief moves very slowly but can steal collected souls from other player's slaves. The slaves are fast and can collect souls to bring them to their chief. But the pyramid's maze is changing with every turn and your just-so-well-constructed escape-way is not blocked. Keep cool, because the more souls you deliver to your chief at once, the more score. But be warned: If you're too greedy, it may be over too fast and you'll end up with nothing.

Aztekz is a very complex collecting-game with very simple rules and a lot of strategic possibilities. Quick to learn, always tricky and challenging.

name: Dead Heat: The Game of Professional Zombie Racing
description:
Zombie racing! Just saying it causes you to say "What the…" When some were saying "Why?" Jim Bob Joe was saying "Why not?"

Civilizations have always been judged by their sports. Since before the gladiatorial contests in ancient Rome, man has been defined by his sport of choice.

Zombie racing. What more can you say?

Dead Heat is competitive on two levels. Not only can players race the Zeds, they can bet on them too! But wait, there's more!

Marvel (laugh your butt off) as highly trained Zombies (the fresher the better) streak down the track (OK, shuffle) in their quest for the gold (dinner). But these finely tuned athletes (hungry) aren't alone. Each Zombie is assisted by a loyal trainer (baiter) who desires only to share in their triumph (make a buck) all in the name of glory (because they have no other marketable skills).
Zombie racing… the name says it all!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Trivial Pursuit: 50 Jahre Deutschland
description:
Germany turned 50 in 1999 so thats a good reason to party!
1800 Questions (and Answers) from 1949 to 1999 are celebrating the History of East and West Germany.
publishers: Hasbro, Horn Abbot International, Parker Spiele

name: Game of Oil
description:
This exclusively equipped pre-war boardgame simulates the exploration of oil fields and the drilling for oil.

As the box lid says: Suspense - Exitement - Speculation !!!

The contents are a lot of drilling rigs, oil tanks and game pawns, all made of wood in 6 different colours. Add a lot of company shares and money chips made of thick cardboard and you have a heavy game !

Gameplay was really good for its time, it's driven by an extremely large spinner (10 x 10 inches with 32 segments)and the amount of risk the players may take in drilling and how much shares they deal out to minimize their losses but on the other side also their wins.
It's up to your feeling to find a good balance for all this !

name: Exam 101
description:
It’s the end of the year and with it comes the inevitable finals. You want to succeed. Did you study enough? Are you ready to do anything to do well? Really? Be careful though, the teacher is roaming the class and his pet are telling him everything that happens. Players are students secretly choosing an action, which will allow them to draw, exchange or play cards to score points. The riskier the action, the better the results but also the greater the consequences for failing or getting caught.

This print and play game was initially developed as Exam 101 (above). However it is also available in 2 other skins: "Shiver me Timbers!" (Pirate theme) and "The lair of Dr. Uptonogood" (Spy theme).

Rules and Print and play files coming soon.
categories: Bluffing, Pirates, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wildfire Overkill
description:
Wildfire Overkill, the first expansion to the Wildfire science fiction miniatures skirmish game! At 50 pages and available in book and pdf form, Overkill includes a small number of rules clarifications from the main rulebook based on player feedback, followed by a whole host of optional rules to enrich your games including: playing in 25mm, new weapon types, stealth and camouflage, tracking devices, troop dispositions and leaders, targeting priorities and more! Finally, six army lists are provided detailing example troops, vehicles and weapons from your favorite science fiction fims and books for easy 'pick up and play' gaming. Wildfire Overkill takes science fiction skirmish gaming to the next level - why not come along for the ride?

Expands:

Wildfire
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Montcalm and Wolfe on Top of the Rock
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper 25mm figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules. Each British base or stand represents a formation of 100 men while the French are formed in bases or stands of 150 men.

“The battle for Quebec 1759 was a part of the Seven Years War in North America between the England and France. The British General Wolfe sailed up the St Lawrence River with over 250 ships and boats in late June of 1759 from the fortress Louisbourg. The British knew very little about the City of Quebec, which they sent General Wolfe to attack, other than that the city was the capital of New France."

"When General Wolfe and his soldiers landed on the Isle d' Orleans they discovered that the City of Quebec sat on top of a 350 foot cliff over looking the St Lawrence River . . . On September 13th General Wolfe made the amphibious landing that led his soldiers up to the Plains of Abraham. The whale boats and flat bottom barges took Wolfe's 4,800 men over in two trips. When General Montcalm woke in the morning he found out that the British were just outside the City on the Plains of Abraham.”

The designer’s foreward notes: “Not all of the rules listed below apply to this battle. These rules were written to be a general set of rules to cover the entire musket era of warfare.”

“The battle for Quebec can be looked at in three different view points. These three view points are the campaign for Quebec, the greater battle for Quebec, and the lesser battle for Quebec. I have chosen the lesser battle showing the center wings of both sides forces where the main and decisive fighting took place at the Plains of Abraham on top of the rock.”
categories: Age of Reason, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Day of the Dreadnoughts
description:
“In the early 1900's Germany began to build a fleet of warships to challenge the mighty British navy. When World War I began both sides anticipated a decisive battle of dreadnoughts that would leave one side in control of the Atlantic."

"The two fleets met in 1916 at the Battle of Jutland. The conflict was marked by poor visibility and communications errors that created confusion on both sides. The battle was not decisive. Although Germany claimed victory her fleet was unable to defeat the British.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on the floor if possible, or two 7.5x5 foot tables may be used. Free print-and-play paper miniatures (flats) are provided for use with the rules.

The game uses a simplified order of battle that does not include cruisers, destroyers, and pre-dreadnought battleships. The German fleet consists of five Battle Cruisers and sixteen Battleships. The British fleet is composed of seven Battle Cruisers and twenty-four Battleships.

Website for free rules and basic equipment: http://www.juniorgeneral.org/naval/jutland.html
categories: Educational, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Battles of the Middle Ages: Blonde he was and Beautiful – Benevento, 1266 AD and Tagliacozzo, 1268 AD
description:
Fourth entry in the Battles of Middle Ages series, featuring the battles of Benevento 1266 AD and Tagliacozzo 1268 AD, opposing the lasts of the Hohenstaufen against Charles of Anjou, champion of the Pope.

Battles of the Middle Ages is an easy to learn war gaming system that recreates several of the most famous battles of the Medieval period of history, from the end of the Dark Ages to the dawning of Renaissance. These games are designed to be fast and furious, easy to learn, and to play but with enough historical research to make them true to the history.

Benevento, 1266
The battle of Benevento is one of the most important battles of the long, vicious struggle of strength between the Papacy and the Ghibellin dynasty of the Hohenstaufen family. After the death of Frederic II, King of the Two Sicilies his bastard son, Manfredi d’Altavilla, raised an army against Pope Clement IV. After a fierce battle, Manfredi was defeated and died in battle. He was made immortal by Dante Alighieri, who put him in Purgatory and said of him “Biondo era, e bello, e di nobile aspetto”.

Tagliacozzo, 1268
This battle may be considered the end of the Ghibellines, with the defeat of the last heir of the Hohenstaufen family, Conradin of Svabia. Similar to the earlier battle of Beneventor, it was mostly a clash of knights, resolved by the cunning of Charles of Anjou, who was not reluctant to sacrifice two-thirds of his army to surprise the Ghibellins who thought they had already won the battle before it was even fought (and acted accordingly).

Originally, available only as print & play through Wargamesdownloads.com.
A second edition was published by High Flying Dice Games. The rules were extensively re-written for clarity and bring into compliance with the other games in the Battles of the Middle Ages Series. The Benevento game has a new variant scenario. In addition, the second edition features new artwork
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, TCS Games

name: Hansel and Gretel
description:
This game is for children Ages 4 - 8.

The game feature films based on well-known fairy tales children trying to escape from the house of witch Baba Jaga and she tries to catch them gingery house is full of mysterious lanes. Flying brooms and magic bullets of witch Baba Jaga ensure an exciting game.

Game is published in Polish and Lithuanian languages.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: They Couldn't Hit an Elephant
description:
"They Couldn't Hit an Elephant at this distance" were the last words of Federal general John Sedgwick, seconds before he was mortally wounded at the Battle of Spotsylvania in 1864.

They Couldn't Hit An Elephant is designed to deal with divisional- or corp-sized encounters in a normal club evening, the basic manoeuvre element being either the regiment or brigade (depending on the level of game chosen).

Based in part on previous Lardie rules I Ain't Been Shot Mum! and La Feu Sacre, TCHAE looks to provide enjoyable American Civil War miniatures gaming in typical Lardie "Play the period, not the rules" fashion.

The turn sequence is card driven, so each commander has a card in the game deck and he takes his turn when his card comes up. Depending on his quality he will have a certain number of command points (variable by dice roll) to use in that turn. Easy things take few command points, more complex things take more points.

The rules are designed to play quickly, each scale ten minute turn should, with a couple of games under your belt, take no more than ten minutes of real time, so there will be less down time than many "IGOUGO" rule systems.

name: Mathrix
description:
Goal & Play

Remove all but one coin by formulating mathematical equations using strings of coins. The coins that make up these equations must be orthogonally adjacent to one another (no gaps), but may be read in any of the four cardinal directions: left–right, right–left, up–down or down–up. Null coins have a value of zero, and ace coins have a value of one. Once an equation has been formulated, remove any one coin from the string that made up that equation (your choice). For example, in the above diagram, starting at space d2 and reading down–up: 2 + 2 = 4. With that equation, you could choose to remove any one of the three coins at d2, d3 or d4.

Repeat until only one coin remains (in which case you win) or until there are two or more coins remaining, none of which can be removed (in which case you lose). After learning the basics and winning a few games, keep track of your best time!

name: Retro Pak I
description:
Scenario Pack Contents

8 scenarios
Cover Sheet
Back informational sheet


7 European and one Pacific theater scenarios. These are older out of print Critical Hit scenarios that have been reworked and updated. Critical hit says that this is first of a series of reworked, updated and renamed scenario packs.

One of the scenarios is Guadalcanal, another early war, eastern front 1941. The rest are mid-late war. All of the scenarios even the Guadalcanal one feature tanks, and several of the scenarios feature well known and/or heavy tanks, the Panther, Tigers, Tiger IIs, JgPz V, SU-152, JgdPz V, ISU-122, and the Joseph Stalin II.

As with all scenario packs this is not a complete game, Ownership of Beyond Valor, Yanks, Gung Ho, Code of Bushido as well as Geomorphic boards 2,6,9,17,37,41,42, 44,46,47,48,49 is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Price of Freedom: Your Own Private Idaho
description:
Your Own Private Idaho is an expansion module for the game The Price of Freedom from West End Games which can be played either as a role-playing game or as a hex and counter wargame.

Your Own Private Idaho includes rules for helicopters and anti-aircraft weapons, new maps, and a detailed scenario.
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Suwalszczyzna 1939
description:
This battle took part in northeastern Poland near the border with Lithuania, during the 1939 invasion.


Wikipedia: Suwałki Region

name: Wolkenbilder
description:
The sheep are on their way home, into their pen. The sky fills with clouds. There are often lovely things to be seen within their shapes.

A childrens game, somehow related to Pictionary. Instead of drawing with a pencil, the players in turn create images with the cloud tiles in the game. Either "draw" an item shown on a randomly drawn card; or (advanced rules) think up any item and draw it. The other players have to guess what the image is intended to show; if somebody manages to identify it correctly, both he and the active player gain one point.

Points are counted on a track, showing the way home for the sheep. First player to reach the barn wins.

name: Rank
description:
In Rank, players are attempting to amass the largest, strongest army. Over the course of the game, the seasons change, and players gain abilities based on the season, allowing them to recruit figures into their armies and raise their rank; all while keeping the other player?s forces from getting too large.

Rank is a card game featuring easy to grasp rules coupled with deep strategy. Each of the various cards enable five separate actions, depending on the phase, or season, the game is currently in.

This is the first Edition of Rank, and is presented in a portable Small Box box, and each of the 25 available copies are signed and numbered.

http://www.smallboxgames.com/rank.html

name: Armored Assault: Armored Reserves
description:
A Vehicle Compendium for Armored Assault

This is a vehicle compendium designed to supplement Iron Crown Enterprises' Space Master series of games. It provides a number of vehicle designs which adventurers may meet in their travels, use, or wish to purchase. It includes the specs for:

2 Trucks
3 Carriers
6 MIRCs
3 Robotic Vehicles
2 Scouts
2 Armored Cars
2 Walkers
2 Jumptanks
3 Battle Tanks
2 Explorers
2 Dropships
1 Control Center
4 Armor Suits
6 Aerocraft
10 Scenarios

It also includes 180 new full-color counters.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation

name: I spy Flip 5
description:
For the speedy spy on the go! Just flip 5 picture tokens and search for matches. With pictures on both sides, it's never the same game twice!

The first player to win 5 rounds is the game winner.

Easily portable box makes this a great travel game!

4 versions of play
Helps develop observation, dexterity and social skills

name: PGH-4
description: PGH-4 is played on a 4x4 board with two players. The goal of the game is to get your 4 pieces in a row, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally. Players alternate taking turns adding one of their pieces on the board from any of the 16 edges of the board. If a piece (of either player) already exists there, it is pushed forward in the same direction, possibly pushing another piece and so on. Pieces can fall of the board this way in which case it's returned to its owner. If a piece fell of the board, a move immediately in the absolute opposite direction is forbidden.

name: A Call to Arms: The Earth/Minbari War
description:
An 64 page softcover expansion for A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat.

Contains background on the war as well as a collection of notable personalities with rules for there use in the game, new ships for the Earth Alliance and the Minbari Federation a collection of 20 scenarios and a painting guide.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Cat Burglar
description:
Each player is a Cat Burglar (literally, a cat wearing a burglar mask), attempting to sneak into a mansion to steal some valuable jewels from the safe. If a player runs into a Police Dog (again, literally a dog dressed like a police officer) or triggers the alarm, they lose a life. Lose 9 lives, and it's game-over for that player. The first player to remove the jewels from the safe wins.

The game uses a roll-and-move mechanic. On his turn, a player rolls the dice, and may then decide either to move his Cat Burglar, or to move one of the two Police Dogs.

The board is assembled from four large puzzle-piece shaped segments, which depict various rooms inside the mansion. A plastic dial is inserted into each corner of the board, which players use to track lives. A fifth board section, made from plastic, depicts the vault room, and sits in the middle of the board. This section has a safe which the players must crack, and several of the spaces on the middle section are alarmed.

The key feature of the game is the plastic "vault room" which sits in the middle of the board. All the spaces in the vault room are potentially alarmed - There are small metal contacts embedded in each space.
