Some of them are decoys, and some will trigger an alarm when the metal base of the cat burglar pieces comes into contact, completing an electronic circuit. The safe itself is a dexterity mini-game; although players are given the combination for the lock at the start of the game, if their hand shakes, or they get the combination slightly wrong, it triggers an alarm.

The game includes:

4 Mansion Room puzzle-piece board sections
4 Coloured plastic Cat Burglar pieces with a metal base
2 Plastic Police Dog pieces
4 Plastic Gems (one of each player colour)
4 Plastic dials for tracking lives (one of each player colour)
1 Plastic vault room plus battery cover
1 Plastic safe core plus lid
Dice
Rulebook

name: Minuteman: The American Revolution in the North
description:
Minuteman: The American Revolution in the North was included in Issue #2 of SDC's CONFLICT Magazine. The game covers American Revolution conflict in the Northern colonies from July 1775 through potentially December of 1779. Voluntary combat for adjacent units, with volley combat being decided on a matrix table weighing unit types and total strength factors against a die roll (similar to Lou Zocchi's Luftwaffe combat table). Additional "bayonet" combat also possible, based upon net relative strengths of attacker/defender, with terrain and die roll bonuses.

Advanced rules allow for "command counters" to replace units on the map, allowing for unknown unit strength.

According to the designer notes published within the magazine, the game was a prototype design being prepared for Avalon Hill, and CONFLICT Magazine was being authorized to distribute it "...to assure that the test version will appear with a minimum of error and/or distortion. We want your assistance in making this the kind of game which belongs in the Avalon Hill lineup." The subscribers and other play testers were encouraged to submit their critiques of the game to Lou Zocchi, and the six best would receive copies of the final game published by Avalon Hill.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Shinsengumi Chronicle
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #1.

"Shinsengumi" is a special police force organized by the last Shogunate government to protect it's representatives (1864-69).
(Shinsengumi)

This game covers the fight between the Shinsengumi and the Shogunate opponents in Kyoto.

name: Publius Crassus in Aquitania
description:
An expansion for Caesar: Conquest of Gaul, this expansion module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr11. These battles cover the period when Publius Crassus was sent by Caesar to subjugate Aquitania.

Battles:

Sos, 56 B.C.
Aquitani Camp, 56 B.C.

name: Vendimia
description:
Vendimia is about the wine production, from the cellar until it is served as part of a great meal.

Players represent Chilean wine producers that will have to cultivate different strains, produce wine and sell it depending on the demand for that specific turn.

In the process they will have to deal with drought, floods, and other obstacles that will endanger their business.

The player which manages to collect more money will be the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement
publishers: Aldebaran Games, AZ Games [La Araña y el Zapato]

name: Chips Olympiade
description: This game is based on the traditional concept where you flip a plastic chip by pushing its edge with another chip. However, the author has added an entire sports stadium with different disciplines, which are very well designed. For the high jump, for instance, you actually have to flip your chip over a bar that is raised each round. There are also more jumps and different running competitions. For each of these you can gather points which determine the overall winner.

name: RunAway Train
description:
The train car you are on has broken away from the rest of the train, slowed to a stop, and now is heading back down the hill, towards the Train Station that's overlooking a canyon. The car is barely moving, but seems to be picking up speed, the smart thing to do would be to jump now...but, there still some time and the car is not moving that fast yet, you are sure you can toss off some your suitcases (with all your ill-gotten gains) before you have to jump. Too bad the other passengers seem to have the same idea.

The object of the game is to score the most points by getting your suitcases off the train car. Suitcases have a point value from 1-7 points. There are also bonuses and score multipliers that can increase the points earned. You will at some point want to get your passenger off the train, because if the train does crash (which is very, very likely) you don't want to be on it.

name: Marooned Part I: Open Sea
description:
Your ship has been sunk and your stranded in the middle of the open sea. Survive the attacks of the sharks and the krakens in this area and make it to the island you've spotted off in the distance.

See the files section for the rules and the pictures section for the playerboard and dice labels.

Open Sea is a free, solitaire, print and play dice game. Enjoy and let's hear your suggestions.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Plus and Minus (+ / -)
description:
Collect the most or the least endangered species. The +/- dice decides. This will force you to do all kinds of twists and use all the tricks you have available to win the game.

You can choose 1 out of 4 endangered species as your species. Purpose of the game is to collect the most or the least of your species. It all depends on the +/- is a fun combination of luck, strategy and action.

name: Formula Dé: Laguna Seca
description:
A fan made expansion map for Formula De based on the Laguna Seca Raceway. The file for the map is currently located in the Formula De file section here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/fileinfo/34328.

Designers note: At the time I designed this track, I didn't realize that there was already one available based on this course (Monterey). So, I'd suggest you go ahead and try and find a copy of the original track. It wasn't my intention to remake any course that had already been published.

name: Bohemian Rhapsody: 1622 – The Battles of Wimpfen and Hochst
description:
Third in entry in TCS print & play series on the 30 years war, it depicts two different battles (Wimpfen and Hochst) fought between May and June 1622.
Each battle feature a single A4 map, and around 40 counters.
It uses a chit drawing activation system and derives most of its other rules from the old SPI's 30 Years War quadrigame of the Seventies.
Simple, introductive stuff, very fast to set up and play.
Very good also in solitaire.

name: Kursk 1943: The Southern Pincer
description:
Main issue contained in Alea Magazine issue#33 (September 2009).

Kursk 1943: The Southern Pincer, is a brigade-regiment-battalion simulation of the Kursk offensive in the Southern sector of the Kursk salient by the Fourth Panzer Army.

Ownership of previous issue Alea Magazine #31 depicting The Northern Pincer is necessary to play the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: DBR Army Lists Book 3
description: Armies of the Eastward Colonial Expansion and of the European Enlightenment
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Classic BattleTech: Combat Operations
description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Universe to Conquer
The FedCom Civil War:

•89 Federated Suns regiments/RCT/Militia units
•75 Lyran Alliance regiments/RCT/Militia units
•41 mercenary regiments
•8 ComStar Divisions
•11 Draconis Combine regiments
•2 Capellan Confederation regiments . . .
. . . all fought across a thousand light years on well over a hundred worlds for five long years. Now you can recreate it!

The Classic BattleTech Combat Operations rules expansion is simply the most comprehensive rules system for campaign play ever published for BattleTech.

War and Its Makers: Ever wonder how war is really waged in the Thirty-first century? Wonder no more!

BattleTech Operations Rules: Here's all the rules you ever wanted for creating, running, and playing any type and size military force, from lance to RCT, House or merc.

AeroTech 2 Operations Rules: Expanded rules to provide additional depth of play for any AeroTech 2 game, as well as completely integrated BattleTech and AeroTech 2 play!

Infantry Platoon Construction: Create almost any type of standard infantry platoon found in the BattleTech universe!

Strategic Game: A rules framework that allows you to run grand-scale campaigns utilizing every aspect of warfare - combat, technology, subterfuge and assassination, politics and more. Now you too can play your favorite Successor Lord!

Faction Force Tables: Comprehensive tables of units available, by major era, to every major and minor faction in the BattleTech universe. Here's your chance to build that Star League division to take back Terra!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Laugh and Lie Down
description: This game is essentially for five players. It is played with a standard deck of cards. Each player gets eight cards, the remainders are placed on the table. At each turn a player captures one or more table cards by pairing them with one or more cards of the same rank from his hand (there are some other ways to win cards as well). When he can no longer do so he must throw his hand in by adding his cards face up to those still on the table and ceasing play. Play continues till all but one player have finished. The last player and those who have won more than eight cards get money from the pot, those who have won less than eight cards pays into the pot.

name: Hammerin' Iron 2
description:
This supplement to the game Hammerin' Iron (1992) describes itself as more of an expansion than a rewrite. It is intended to be played with 1/600 scale miniatures, although conversions to other scales would be relatively straightforward.

Hammerin' Iron 2 is a set of rules designed to covers river conflicts of the American Civil War, 1861 to 1865.

This rules system uses a hex movement system that is described as original to Peter Pig. This system requires that each ship miniature be placed upon a 5.5" hexagon cutout. The hexagons are used as a 'floating' hex grid radiating from each ship miniature. These hexes offer the ease of a hex grid in regulating movement, but since rotations of odd angles (for example, 34 or 52 degrees rotation) are possible, this system is free of the constraints of a traditional grid which would limit ships to 60 degree rotations.

Combat is based on a dice-pool system, in which to-hit modifiers affect the number of dice rolled. Each dice result of 5 or 6 (on a d6) is a potential hit, which is then tested against armor deflection. Potential hits not successfully deflected score hull hits.

A major change in this rules system compared to the first edition is the omission of the ship schematics and crew counters (in which individual crew counters were moved about the ship to allocate crew to various ship functions). However, if one views Hammerin' Iron 2 as an "expansion" rather than "rewrite", then one is open to include the crew and schematic rules from 1st edition in the Hammerin' Iron 2 rules.

Equipment (in addition to the rules) required for play include:

Ship models (1/600 scale preferred)
approximately 12 hexagons cut from 5.5-inch plastic or cardboard circles
approximately 16 six-sided dice
cardstock or felt cutouts to represent sandbars, shallows, shorelines etc
cotton (white or black) to represent damage to ships
notepaper and pencil
order cards (can be cut from rulebook, or alternatively prepared from cardstock)
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Draughts for 4
description:
Originally called 'Dammen voor 4'.

Translated box text:

Checkers for 4 is much more than just checkers: young, old, novice or expert, everybody can play! Play individually or 2-against-2 and prepare for a dynamic family game full of surprises...

1. Everybody's in!
Whether playing with two, three or four players, everybody is in with Checkers for 4! Ideal for families and friends, at home or on holiday.

2. Individual and team play
Go for the challenge: Play individually and go head to head, in pairs with players from different levels or gang up to defeat the so-called 'Checkers King'!

3. Great introduction to checkers
Checkers for 4 is a fun way to get introduced to the game of checkers. The classic rules still apply and you can team up to play against a single experienced player. Learn and win at the same time!

4. A challenge for checkers experts
More opponents from varying levels on a single board requires good analysis, prediction en constantly adapting your style of play. In short, a real challenge for experienced players.

name: Attack! 7-8 Player Expansion
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Attack! 7-8 player Expansion is a set of Black and White runners (both naval and land units) for the new rule set.

Please note: You need Attack! and Attack! Deluxe Expansion to use the Attack! 7-8 player Expansion.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Negotiation, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sisyphos
description:
Two player game in which one player plays Sisyphos and tries to roll stones into the other player's corner, while the other player plays the mountain spirits that try to prevent Sisyphos from achieving his goal.
Movement is limited to moving one square ahead in one of three directions. When a piece lands on an opponent's piece, the opponent's piece is temporarily out of the game, but can later re-enter in the corner square, or near it.
The spirits win when one of them reaches the opposing corner square, or if Sisyphos cannot move one of his stones into their corner within 50 turns. If Sisyphos manages in time, he is the winner.

name: Dragon Jewels
description:
The players collect jewels from the dragon's cave and place them in their jewels box. The first player to collect 4 of each color (red, blue and yellow) wins. If the dragon catches the player he chases them to the exit.

The game uses a mechanic of common control where each player controls the dragon on their turn.

name: Ocaso Zombie
description:
TONIGHT, THE DEAD WALK AGAIN ... THEY ARE HUNGRY FOR YOU!

Fear invades you as you move, unsure of what just lies around the corner... hold your breath, don´t make a noise, yo feel as if the beating of your heart you will delate you, perhaps the next building is safe, or maybe you are haeding towards a trap, but you know you can't stop, you must continue moving forward, looking for a way out.

Explore the city, moving through the zombie infested streets, you will discover the different locations as you go forward; collect weapons that will help you eliminate the hordes of voracious zombies chasing you. look for items that are necesary in your espae in one of the vehicles ... flee before they turn you into another one of the walking dead!

PLAYERS
4 players, ages 12 and older

COMPONENTS
64 playing cards:
8 characters cards
22 locations cards
30 situations/items cards
4 life points tracking cards
36 zombie counters:
12 1 zombie counters
12 3 zombies counters
12 6 zombies counters
4 life points tracking counters
4 playing pieces
2 dice (not included in the PRINT'n'PLAY version)

OCASO ZOMBIE (ZOMBIE SUNSET)
The goal of the game is to survive the ZOMBIE SUNSET, obtaining the resources needed to use any of the ways out.

The game ends in two ways:
1. All players are killed (If there are no more ALIVE players, the game ends, even if there are still players in ZOMBIE state).
2. All players (ALIVE) escape from the city.

THE CARDS
CHARACTERS:
In them you will find the different features of your character, and some special skills to enhance your offense, defense or other actions.

LOCATIONS:
These are cards that from the game map, in them you will find red arrows that indicate the access points of each locations, you can join the cards together with each other with this access points, allowing you to create a different map for each game.

SITUATIONS AND ITEMS:
In these cards you will find different scenenarios that you must solve to move through the different locations, and you will also
categories: Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Tracktrick
description:
This game is played with parts of two standard deck of cards and 18 poker chips or other counters. One each of A, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and Queen from one of the deck is arranged in a 3x3 grid with the Queen in the middle but otherwise randomly. These "scorecards" form the board.
The cards A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6 from the other deck are shuffled and each player is dealt 12 cards. They reveal one of them simultaneously. If two or three are of the same suit then that suit is trump. If all three are different then the trump suit is the fourth one - that is, the suit that nobody chose. However, if any two are of the same rank then the hand is played at no trump.
Then tricks are played, and at the end of the play players puts a counters on the scorecards representing the number of tricks they won (Queen represents 0). If it's occupied by an opponent's counter, return it to its owner and substitute one of your own, if two of you win the same number, and the appropriate scorecard is either blank or occupied by the third player, leave it unchanged.
You win a game by finishing with three counters in a row, whether horizontally, vertically or diagonally, after everyone has recorded their score. If two or all three players achieve this simultaneously, the winner is the player whose line of three cards has the highest total face value.

name: Battalions In Crisis! Module I: 1943
description:
From the cover:

Vehicles and Equipment

Scenarios for: Tunis, Sicily, Kursk, Salerno and Tarawa

Inside:

This package contains 45 more vehicles plus additional weapons to use with Battalions In Crisis! Each theatre of operations in 1943 is represented with a historical scenario, The scenarios range in complexity from one player on a side to large scale engagements requiring three or four players on a side. We hope you find the information in this module interesting, useful and enjoyable.

User:

Contains some of the more useful vehicles such as the Pz IV H and PZ V D, Stug IIIg, T34/85, Sherman Firefly, M3 halftrack, M4A3E8 and even the LVT1A and LVT2. Handheld antitank launchers have been updated to distinguish Pzf30 and Pzf60 and differences in performance for all the other types. Germany has gained the Pak 43 88mm, UK the 17pdr and USA the 76mm. Basically the equipment you would expect from this period.

There is also a small notes on play and erratta section which corrects rules on movement and infantry anti-tank.

All fits neatly in the original three ring binder.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Bar Trek...the pub crawl game!!
description: Players go from pub to pub collecting beer mats and drink tokens, with the occasional visit to a betting shop when short of cash. The game ends when one player has collected six different beer mats. The player with the most drink vouchers at the end is the winner. Source:Game Rules
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Blades of Crimson
description:
Dark Ages skirmish rules for armies of up to around 30 figures, intended for Vikings, Saxons, Normans, Picts, Welsh, and Irish armies. Figures move and fight individually, but must remain within a command radius of their leader. Initiative is decided by drawing playing cards (one side plays red, the other black, with some cards triggering special events).

Six sided and average dice are required, and each army figures are classified as one of the following: Lord, Warrior, Freeman, Armed peasant, Non-combatant. Heroes and berserkers can also appear when certain cards are turned over.

Published in Practical Wargamer magazine, May/June 1993 issue. The author acknowledges Howard Whitehouse's Long Serpent rules for sea battles as an inspiration.

name: Reptile Island!
description:
A group of three Victorian era adventurers have shipwrecked on an unexplored jungle island. After building a raft from the remnants of their ship and securing it at the shore, they search the rocky beach for their scattered possessions. Panic ensues as two enormous, shrieking Dimetrodons appear between the explorers and the raft. Can the explorers escape this island? Reptile Island! is a cinematic miniature skirmish game for 1-5 players in 25mm-28mm scale.

Reptile Island! was created as part of a contest for the lostworldsafari yahoo group wherein the challenge was to design a set of Victorian era dinosaur hunting rules that could fit on a postcard.

(Source: Designer Summary)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Baseball Heroes
description:
Baseball Heroes is a two player baseball card game, designed by Luke Morris, that captures the psychological battle between pitcher and batter.

Three teams with 36 unique players line up to hit eachother out of the park! The pitching player and batting player try to psych-out eachother into striking out or throwing a bad pitch to be hammered away for a home run.

Baseball Heroes is a light game but includes rules for outfield and infield fielding, dropped catches, bunts, base stealing, double plays, errors, runs, balls, strikes, bullpens and more. Each batter has his strengths and weaknesses and each pitcher has his list of balls he can pitch.

Baseball Heroes is also available with full Japanese rules.

name: ...And One for All!
description:
...And One for All is a free skirmish miniatures game made for use with Three Musketeers miniatures.

From the publisher's website:

The object of ...And One For All! is to recreate the feel of swashbuckling films such as the 1970’s "Three Musketeers". It does this by encouraging you to perform swashbuckling actions about the table with your figures. The more actions a figure makes, the more dice it rolls in combat!
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Away, Boarders!
description:
Subtitle: Rules for 18th and early 19th Century Naval Wargaming On the Great Lakes

From the introduction:

Away, Boarders! is an historical wargame designed to recreate the battles between the small warships of various nations that fought on the Great Lakes during the 18th and early 19th centuries.

Each player takes the role of the commander of a ship, and makes decisions about how his ship will maneuver and what tasks his crew will perform, with the object of defeating his opponents (or, perhaps, just surviving the ordeal of combat to fight again another day).

The game is played in a repeating sequence of actions, performed in a specific order each turn by the players. The sequence, which represents the events that would take place in about the amount of time it would take a typical gun crew in the 18th century to load and fire a large cannon, is repeated until the victory conditions of one side have been achieved, or all the ships of one side have been lost or have fled.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: AirWar: C21
description:
Contemporary air combat miniature rules that strives to achieve the fine balance between playability and detail. Suitable for 2 or more air gamers to reenact historical or hypothetical air war scenarios. The rulebook includes "Strange Stuff" notes on equipment from Science Fiction for encounters with UFO's or 'special project' aircraft. Any scale miniatures or aircraft counters will suffice. A hex map or hex grid mat will be required.

From the back cover of the book:

"Airwar: C21 is a set of introductory modern air combat rules which combine playability and realism in an attempt to provide gamers with a simple yet challenging game of modern air warfare - retaining the spirit of the genre, without sacrificing the speed and excitement.

Utilising a unique 2D system to recreate the 3D maneuvers of dogfighting, AirWar: C21 is a perfect introduction for the newcomer to the fun of air wargaming as well as great for the more experienced 'old hand' looking for a simple yet enjoyable set of rules to introduce his 'groundpounder' friends to war in the skies."

name: Cedar Creek 1864
description:
Cedar Creek 1864 is a small simulation of an American Civil war battle fought in October 19th 1864 between five Confederate divisions (Ramseur, Pegram, Evans, Kershaw and Wharton) and nine Union divisions (Wheaton, Getty, Keiffer, Mcmillan, Birge,Thoburn, Hayes, Merrit and Custer).

The wargame is based on the rules of Bull Run 1861 (Vae Victis 89), the major changes are the gaming scale, activation per division, rout rules, cavalry role and no operational move.

One turn represents 1h30 (duration 9 turns)
The turn is divided in 4 phases :
1) Initiative phase
2) Player 1 moves 0 to 2 divisions then player 2 (repeated 3 times)
3) Continuation phase (possible new movement phases depending on dice roll up to 5 times in the whole turn)
4) Administration phase (rout and rally)

The player with the most victory points (from inflicted casualties to the enemy and controlled locations) wins the game.
One counter represents a brigade.
There are 98 unmounted counters (51 units + 47 markers), 84 counters are double-sided.
The small map (29 x 21 cm) represents the country area around Middletown and is divided in zones.

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis website.

name: Zomboree
description:
Zomboree is a large group social card game (6 - 16 people) where players take on the roles of various survivors in a town under seige by zombies. Each turn is affected by an event card drawn for that day. Each turn is divided into two phases: Day and Night. A 90 second timer is provided with the game to provide a fair length for both phases.

During setup, survivor cards will be handed out. One of the survivors will be Patient Zero and become a zombie at the end of the first day. Each survivor starts with one item. After everyone has an item, the group elects their leader. Since no one knows anyone else's role, it is possible to elect Patient Zero as the group's leader. Anytime the leader becomes a zombie, the survivors must elect a new leader before beginning the day phase.

During the day the elected leader of the survivors draws resource cards and the survivors discuss how to divide them up. Some of the Survivors, however, are infected and will eventually join the Zombies attacking the Survivors. At the end of each day, players check their character cards to see if they have become a zombie.

During the night, the players who have become zombies play attack cards of various types against the remaining survivors. The survivors must work together to defend themselves using the resources they found during the day to resist and shunt off zombie attacks in order to survive. Those who cannot stop or deflect a zombie attack, become zombies who will get a zombie attack card the next night.

The game's scenario runs for one week's time, from Sunday to Saturday. Each turn an event card shapes both the day and night phases. Each day the survivors use their drawn resources to make a plan for resisting the zombies. Each night the zombies attack the survivors and try to wipe them out. The game ends after the night phase on Saturday when those still alive win by surviving the zombie apocalypse, or else when all survivors are dead (or undead, as it were).
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simulation, Trading, Voting

name: Drake's Ambition
description:
This is self-published strategy level wargame based on Japanese TV animation "Aura Battler Dunbine".
This game cover war between Ciela side and Drake side in the world of Byston Well.

A player manage a treasury, and assigns it in the development of the weapon and the military operations.
A game purpose is to ruin the country of the opponent side.
The turn order of the military operations depends on a chit-pull system. The performance of the weapon and pilot's and captain's ability influence a battle greatly.

Components (Second edition)

1 rulebook
462 counters
1 map (A3 size)
5 national administration sheets
1 game administration sheet
1 reference sheet
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Kings Court
description:
Kings Court is a Western Chess variant played on a large 8X12 board.

The game incorporates the standard array of King, Queen, 2 knights, 2 bishops and 2 rook.

Kings Court then adds two Chancellor and two jester pieces.

From the game company's website:

THE CHANCELLOR-Has two possible moves (1) it can move one or two square in any direction. (2) it can move one square on the rank or file and then while still moving away from the square from which it started, moves one square on the diagonals. This is not a line move but a move from point to point and can not be obstructed by any other piece. See figure 1.

THE JESTER- Moves one or two squares on the diagonals. Unlike the Bishop the Jester can change directions while in motion, if desired. It may not return to the square from which it stared in the same move. See figure 2. For the first move from its initial square the jester may jump two square diagonally. All pieces with the exception of the Pawn, capture in the way it can legally move.

The King is also afforded an additional special move;

KING'S FLIGHT- is a move made by the King when in check by the Chancellor. The move is executed by moving the King two squares in any direction instead of its usual one square.

name: Император 3 (Emperor 3)
description:
This fantasy-themed miniatures wargame is set on a hexagonal map with dimensions of 5X7 hexes with special 2 hexes marked as "castles". The goal of this game is to defeat all enemy forces or capture his "castle" hex.
Player may reinforce their armies by purchasing additional units during the game process. Also players may build walls and towers on hex borders to defend their castles.

This game is developed based on ideas from Император and Император 2 games.

Components:
32 warrior miniatures
10 plasic bases with flag and 3 slots for units
12 plastic towers
16 plastic walls
20 gold tokens
1 game map
1 rulebook
1 die
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Variable Player Powers

name: German Shepherd-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

STRONG, FEARLESS, INTELLIGENT, LOYAL... MEET THE GERMAN SHEPHERD!

The German Shepherd is hailed as the world’s leading police, guard, and military dog, but there is so much more to this outstanding dog. Originating in 1899 in Germany, the breed first gained international recognition at the decline of World War I. Later, the fame associated with Rin-Tin-Tin and Strongheart shot the popularity of the German Shepherd sky-high. A loving family companion, herder and show competitor, the German Shepherd is one of the most popular breeds in the world.

GERMAN SHEPHERD-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE GERMAN SHEPHERDS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO GERMAN SHEPHERDS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show or going in for vaccinations! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Geschlossene Gesellschaft
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where players try to score the most points by covering square or rectangular groups of fields in an 8x8 board; each coloured field scores 1 point. Of course each player plays a different colour/symbol, and there can be no overlaps. The game should be played in several rounds, each one with a different starting player.

Each turn players throw a die and colour the corresponding number of fields on the board; these must be orthogonally connected and so build a group, which doesn't have to be a straight line. Players can decide when to stop throwing - if a player can't colour the mandatory squares after a throw they leave the round with no score.
mechanics: Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Wonderful World of Disney Trivia Add-on Pack (Adult)
description: More challenging questions for adults covering the whole wide world of Disney
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3050 Upgrade
description:
Publisher Blurb:

More ’Mechs For The Battlefield...
You’ve grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Total Warfare to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: 3050 Upgrade and want to deploy some of those ’Mechs and vehicles on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you!

Record Sheets: 3050 Upgrade contains more than 85 pre-printed ’Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than a dozen vehicle sheets bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready-to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum introduces fire and artillery, providing a sneak peak of all the advanced rules options provided in Tactical Operations.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Österreich-Spiel
description:
A trivial game with 990 questions about Austria.

The game board shows Austria, divided in 32 squares. Every square has a matching tile; tiles are drawn when a player takes his turn. On his turn he also has to answer a question about Austria, drawn from the deck of trivia cards. If he answers correctly, he puts that tile on the corresponding space on the board and moves his pawn forward. As soon as all tiles are on the board, the game is over and the player whose pawn has advanced the most spaces is the winner.
Special tiles award extra points or penalties to the drawing player. There are two types of questions - the blue ones are easy and the red ones are hard. Players have to agree which set they want to use.

name: Valkampanj
description:
Card game with no luck where each player plays with either hearts, spades, clubs or diamonds. So each player has a set of 13 cards, and each set has the same value. The players clockwise play a card and try to win sticks, but the sticks are individually not worth the same amount of points. The first stick is worth 1 point + 1 point for every card played in this stick. The winner of the second stick receives 2 points for the stick + 1 point for every card in that stick and so on. When one player plays his last card it is the last stick, and thereafter the results are calculated.

This card game was invented by Dan Glimne in 1991 inspired by the Swedish parliament elections at that time. It was published in his book Nya spel (1994) and later also in Kortspelshandboken (2005) and Lilla Korstspelshandboken (2006).

name: The Ben Johnson Dope Game
description:
Card game where each player is a runner in a 100 meter race. The cards (ordinary deck of 52 cards) are shuffled and each player receives 13 cards face down. The players now look at them and sort out 4 cards and from these 4 cards he decides whether to use 1,2,3 or all 4 of them to use in the race. They are used to determine the result of the player. Spades are not allowed to use among these 4 cards. They are instead among the the rest of the cards (9 cards) which are placed face down in front of the player. If a player accuses another player for being doped, he then chooses to look at one (or maybe 2 or up to 4 cards depending on how many cards the player used for the race) of his 9 face down cards, and if any of these cards is a spade, the player is doped and disqualified.

This card game was invented by Dan Glimne in 1988 inspired by Ben Johnson´s Olympic doping scandal at that time. It was published in Spielbox magazine (1989), Games Review Monthly (1989), Dan Glimne book, Nya Spel (1994) and later also in Kortspelshandboken (2005) and Lilla Korstspelshandboken (2006). It was also published in a Swedish Daily Newspaper (1988).
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck
publishers: (Unknown), Eden Publications, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Battles by Gaslight
description:
Battles by Gaslight is based on the popular Gaslight Victorian science fiction rules, but is designed to allow players to fight larger battles with several players each controlling four or more units. Game mechanics have been streamlined to allow players to control more units; however, the flavor of Gaslight has been retained. 48 pages.

Units in Gaslight generally consist of ten figures led by one or more Main Characters, in Battles by Gaslight this is expanded so that a player will control three or four entire units each led by a (Main Character) Commander which are in turn led by an overall Army Commander. A player may also control vehicles and their crews. The games are a combination of unit actions and individual heroism in the tradition of adventure novels and swashbuckling films.

Command and control is accomplished now through a combination die roll and card-draw turn system. Movement is based on moving entire units as they activate, keeping them within distance of their Commander. Firing is done by units as a whole now instead of individual figures like in Gaslight (although Main Character Commanders may fire separately) and the firing procedure is still very streamlined. Morale is handled in a similar fashion to Gaslight with minor adjustments.

The authors made the specific design choice not to build their own world for these rules. Instead the rules allow for the use of any vehicles, weapons, and creatures that players desire for their personal perception of Victorian science fiction.

name: Anima Tactics: Luzbell
description:
Publisher Blurb:

After Luzbell's magical abilities manifested at an early age she was sent to the church to train and focus her abilities in the proper way. She has progressed rapidly not only showing an aptitude for innovative applications of light magic but also devouring alchemical teachings at a pace her instructors find somewhat intimidating. Luzbell may be young, but she is a rising star in the Church's firmament.

Mystic - Light Church - Level 40

Holy Reflection (Magic, Dodge) - It can only be used against Ranged Attacks. If Luzbell dodges successfully, the attack is redirected to any enemy unit that would be within the distance of the attack if it where performed by Luzbell. This attack keeps all of the attributes of the original attacker, but Luzbell must make a new attack roll.

Holy Cut (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance 16 inches. Damage +2.
Limit: Once per Turn.

Divine Shield (Magic, Dodge) - May be used after the roll for the attack.

Mirror Jump (Magic, Effect) - Relocate a friendly unit within Luzbell’s control zone to any other position within her control zone even if the unit is engaged in combat, or into base-to-base contact.
Limit: Once per Turn.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Azriel
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The name of the Inquisitor Azriel has become legend among the ranks of the 13th Cardinal’s agents. Gifted with skills only equal to his malice toward anyone who defies the Abel’s Church, this dark hunter travels thoughout Gaïa killing his master’s enemies without regret or pity.

Warrior - Dark Church - Level 50

Invite Hell (Ki, Attack) - +5 Attack.

Promised Pain (Ki, Attack, Reactive) - +5 Attack. Promised Pain can be used only in the moment that Azriel sustains damage from an enemy unit and must target the same character that had attacked him.

Wings of Sin (Ki, Attack) - +6 Attack. If Wings of Sin causes damage, target unit suffers Lv2 Doom, Effect 15. To use this attack, Azriel must have 6 or fewer Life points.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Dallifant
description:
Dallifant is a game of pattern recognition for children ages 4-8.

Each player gets 5 chips (the white one is a spare), and you spread out the elephants so that everyone can see and reach them. One player rolls the two dice, and all players look for the elephant that shows the two colours that were rolled. If you spot it, place one of your chips on it. The first player's chip stays on the elephant, everyone else has to take theirs back.

If there was no chip on this elephant previously, nothing happens. If it had one of your chips on it already, both chips stay on it, and this colour combination is ignored from now on (i.e., there cannot be more than two chips on an elephant). If someone else's chip was on it, they receive their chip back and yours stays on. The next player then rolls the dice, etc.

Whoever gets rid of their 5 chips first, wins.

Two more things:
1) You can hold a chip in your hand, but not hover above the elephants before the dice are rolled.
2) It is recommended that whoever rolls the dice calls out the colours.

name: Aufgepaßt!
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must score the most possible points after marking the fifth dot (later cross) on a row or column of an 8x8 board.

A round consists of two phases: in the first phase players mark in turns a square on the board with a dot - the first one to mark the fifth square in a row, column or main diagonal scores as many points as dots drawn by the other players in that row, column or main diagonal. In the second phase players mark free squares in similar fashion but with crosses; the first player to mark the fifth cross in a row, column or main diagonal scores as many points as crosses drawn by the other players in that row, column or main diagonal.

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Reinforcements
description: Additional counters and maps for either Babylon 5 Wars or Fleet Action! This product includes one of the blue 42x30 hex maps from the Core Rules Boxed Set, plus the four countersheets from the Core Rules, Earth Wars, and League-1, plus the long-awaited Second Edition color countersheet for the War of Retribution! Also included (while supplies last) is one random extra sheet from our massive stockpiles!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Cities of Gold: Africa and the Americas 1494-1698 – Field of Glory Renaissance Gaming Companion
description:
Follow Cortés and Pizarro in a quest for El Dorado or stand against the onrush of European expansion and colonialism with Cities of Gold, the sixth Field of Glory Renaissance Companion. With artwork, maps and historical overviews, Cities of Gold journeys from the mountain stronghold of Machu Picchu and the great city of Tenochtitlan, to the forests and lakes of North America and the deserts and jungles of Africa, to bring you the forces and foes of the Aztecs, Incas, Tuaregs and Conquistadors. this is an expansion book for Field of Glory Renaissance and follows the mechanic described there.
Army list covered here are:
Arawak
Carib
Aztecs
Tlaxcalan, Huaxtec or Otomi
Tarascan
Zapotec or Mixtec
Chinantec
Mayan
Inca
Mapuche or Araucanian
Amazonian Forest Tribes
Tupi
Pueblo Culture
Chichimec
Natchez
South-easter Woodlands Culture
Timucuan
Eastern Woodland Culture
Plains Culture
Pacific North-west Culture
Colonial Spanish
Dutch or English Colonial American
Colonial French
English West Indies Expedition
Buccaneer
Oromo
West Sudanese
Central African
Central Sudanese
Funj or Fur
West African Forest
Mossi
Tuareg
Aviz Potuguese
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Lupus in Tabula: The Jack-o'-Lantern
description:
At the beginning of the game one player is given the jack-o'-lantern. That player places it face up in front of them, next to their character.

At the beginning of each subsequent round the moderator starts with the jack-o'-lantern phase. During this phase the player with this card (even if a ghost) opens their eyes and silently points to another player. The moderator answers with a thumbs-up if the player pointed to a seer or medium. or with a thumbs-down if not.

The moderator then calls the end of the phase and the player closes their eyes. At the end of each day the jack-o'-lantern is passed to the player on their left.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: DV Games, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Monopoly: Schwäbische Alb
description: The famous Monopoly now themed around Swabia in southwest Germany. Monopoly game play, only the theme is - like all themed Monopoly versions - resembles the new region.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Subtilla
description:
Subtilla is a two-player, head-to-head naval battle game. Each player has a sub, five boats, and a base on his side of the board. A player wins by either destroying all five of the opponent's boats, or by occupying both spaces of the opponent's base at the end of the opponent's turn.

Battles between ships involve dice-rolling, and the subs have special stealth, movement, and torpedo rules.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Matt Worden Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Der flotte Igel Ignaz
description:
Objective: Own a house or 30.000 cash or holding 4 shares of facilities and cars with no accommodations
- acting by turn/'Roll and Move' promotional game -
Each player is throwing the die, moving (with a '6' another turn), trying to catch the hedgehog (as companion who increases income...), following instructions of the space he/she is landing on, spinning if allowed...
produced by Ravensburger
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Anima Tactics: Elhaim, Maiden of Light
description:
The Elhaim, or Maidens of Light, are luminous powers born of pure light before the war in heaven. Many believe them to be angels, whose powers will be essential to saving Gaia from the dark.

Light Summon Warrior/Mystic
Level 40 version
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 15 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Light
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 8 | Shock: -1
Innate Abilities: Flight, Immunity (Poison).
Defensive Mastery: Performing Basic Counterattacks costs Elhaim two action points instead of three.
o - Light Flash (Magic, Effect) All enemy Units in base-to-base contact with Elhaim suffer Blind lv.1. Effect 15.
Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Healing Light (Magic, Effect) A friendly Unit inside Elhaim's Control Zone gains Healing Lv.2.
ooo - Wings of Withdrawal (Ki, Attack) +2 Attack / +2 Damage. If this attack hits, Elhaim may automatically escape
from any hand-to-hand combat she is engaged in and move up to 8 Inches. Elhaim can use this movement even if
she has already moved this turn.
o - Light Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) Distance (8 Inches). This attack can only be used immediately after successfully
escaping from combat due to the Wings of Withdrawal skill.

Level 50 version
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP: 15 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Light
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 8 | Shock: -3
Innate Abilities: Flight, Immunity (Poison).
Defensive Mastery: Performing Basic Counterattacks costs Elhaim two action points instead of three.
o - Light Flash (Magic, Effect) All enemy Units in base-to-base contact with Elhaim suffer Blind lv.1. Effect 15.
Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Healing Light (Magic, Effect) A friendly Unit inside Elhaim's Control Zone gains Healing Lv.2.
ooo - Wings of Withdrawal (Ki, Attack) +2 Attack / +2 Damage. If this attack hits, Elhaim may automatically escape
from any hand-to-hand combat she is engaged in and move up to 8 Inches. Elhaim can use this movement even if
she has already moved this turn.
o - Light Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) Distance (8 Inches). This attack can only be used immediately after successfully
escaping from combat due to the Wings of Withdrawal skill.
ooo - Catastrophic Light (Magic, Ranged Attack) Distance (16 Inch). +2 Damage. If this attack hits its target, all Units
within 3 inches of the target also suffer the attack.

name: Anima Tactics: Ignis, Fire Demon
description:
Capricious, ephemeral, and somewhat mean spirited- Fire Demons summoned to Gaia can be challenging for a Summoner to control. If their mercurial natures can be contained and channeled, their destructive potential is inarguable.

Dark Summon Warrior
Level 20 version
At 3 | Dm 8 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 18 | Re 9 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 40 | Bind: 1 | Stability: 7 | Shock: 0
Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance.
Fire Aura: Any enemy Character that comes into base-to-base contact with Ignis for the first time in a game loses 3 Life Points. Effect 15.
Ash Veil: Any Ranged Attack that targets Ignis or has a Line of Fire that passes within 2 inches of him gets -2 attack.
ooo - Inferno (Magic, Attack)
Inferno ignores the defender's Armor.

Level 30 version
At 3 | Dm 8 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 18 | Re 9 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 40 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 7 | Shock: 0
Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance, Critical Mastery.
Fire Aura: Any enemy Character that comes into base-to-base contact with Ignis for the first time in a game loses 3 Life Points. Effect 15.
Ash Veil: Any Ranged Attack that targets Ignis or has a Line of Fire that passes within 2 inches of him gets -2 attack.
ooo - Inferno (Magic, Attack)
Inferno ignores the defender's Armor.

name: Das Segler-Spiel
description:
Objective:
be the first to pass finish line
- acting/moving by turn/ -
1. prepare race circuit - place buoys no 1,2,3 & target area
2. your boat has to sail past on the larboard side - counterclockwise
3. arrange your sails & spinnaker during the race to optimize your speed - allowed moves: adjacent areas
4. follow instructions of weather/event cards
options:
define fixed wind direction or
wind blows out of different directions at the same time

content: 1 board, 1 wind-wheel, 1 needle (marker), 6 yachts, 6 large markers (show set sails), 6 small markers ( show set spinnaker), 3 black markers (show defect sails), 6 speed charts, 126 weather/event cards

name: Striker League Champions
description:
A spin-off board game from the company's table football game of Striker and Super Striker.

On the face of it, a roll and move game. Each player starts with a million pounds and two random player cards. The players are rated from 1 to 4 and the total of your ratings will decide how many shots you can take when you play a match.

When you have to play a match, you must use the plastic base in the middle of the board. Depending on their level of players, both sides will get a set number of attempts to score goals. A Striker footballer is used to take the kick whilst your opponent operates the goalkeeper. In effect, it is a penalty shoot-out. Then the opposition gets a kick whilst you operate the goalie. The winning side score points in the league. When a pre-set number of matches have been played, the player at the top of the league, wins.

name: Anima Tactics: Ophiel
description:
Ophiel Akerontes Zeros, favourite son of the darkness, is the youngest and most ambitious of all the lords of Samael. Despite being the last to join the Circle of Fallen Angels, in only two decades he has become one of the most powerful and active members of the Circle. He is a gloomy figure who enjoys using his shadowy network of agents to advance his agenda of absolute chaos.

Dark Samael Warrior/Mystic Leader - Lv. 70

At 6 | Dm 6 | Df 9 | Ar 3 | LP: 16 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5

oo - Dark Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (12 inches). If this Ranged Attack causes damage, the target suffers Blind Lv1. Effect 14.

ooo - Devouring Darkness (Magic, Effect)
Target an enemy unit within 16 inches of Ophiel. That character and all units within 3 inches lose 1 Action Point and cannot Walk, Run, or Charge this turn. Effect 14. Difficulty: 3+

ooo - End of Eternity (Ki, Attack)

+ 3 Attack / +3 Damage.

ooooo - Godless World (Ki, Attack)

+ 5 Attack / +5 Damage. Roll two dice and keep the highest result.

name: Roman Invasion of Britain
description:
A board game for 2-4 players about Roman expansion into British Isles circa 43-84 AD.
The map is Britannia divided into native Tribal regions with a resistance level.
It's a cooperative game, the Romans players against a Briton's Tribe deck. Be careful, Romans can be allies against Briton but the victory points are individuals (if a player needs help for a battle from another player, he must share the victory points with him).
The game ends when all regions have been captured.
To play you need 1D6, Capture and Victory Tokens, 2 decks of cards (Roman and Briton) and a map of course.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Kart sur Glace: White Kart
description:
An extension for the game "Kart Sur Glace". These many small extensions to add together or not in the game.

- one more Kart (you can play to 6 players)

- 6 Bonus like...
"Wind" : opposing karts turned upside
"SnowStorm" (malus): reverse its position with the last of the race
"Twister": you add and move a token "Twister" or move a token already present (you lose a card Action if you hit a token "Twister")

- 6 new "MegaPowwaa" for the 6 karts
Now, you choose a card "MegaPowaaa" from the two cards available.
Examples:
Orange: mechanical arm // telekinesis
Red: scrambler // scanner

- new type of game :
Kart Ghost
In turn, all players can move free "kart ghost".
If it hits a kart, the kart is on the roof.

&

Kart Flag
A team game, like the "Catch Flag" in Paintball or "LaserQuest"

- Pit Stop Card:
Fill card "bonus" and take a "Action Card"

- White Card (Bonus & Mega Powwaa):
for your imagination...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Racing
mechanics: Action Points, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kette
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must score the most possible points by filling a row or column of an 8x8 board with their own symbol over several rounds.

During a round players throw a dice in their turn and then tick a space on the board with their symbol (dot, circle, square or cross); the points in the dice mark the distance this space must have to either the player's starting row (at one of the sides of the board) or one of the spaces occupied by the player, and the way to that space must be free (if there are occupied spaces in between they must include the player's own symbol).

When a line is filled with one symbol each player gets a point per own symbol included in the line and the player to end the round gets one extra point. A game includes a number of rounds to be agreed.

name: Para-Leader
description:
Para - Leader introduces paratrooper and glider carried units to Panzer Leader and Panzer Leader 1940 in 10 new scenarios (situations 31 - 40).

The game adds rules conserning the drop of paratroopers and gliders while it introduces the concept of sticks (small units that comrpise, when matched together, a regular paratrooper unit).

Although the "Designer's Notes" in Panzer Leader state the difficulties regarding the tactical simulation of paratroop action (mainly because of the lack of proper intel) the designer of Para - Leader refers to this arguement as "not completely valid" due to the fact that all units on the board are open to both players thus, self negating this military inteligence chaos.

Components:
- 141 Allied, German and aircraft counters
- 10 scenarios
- Rules and designer notes

Published in The GENERAL Vol.20,No.2 (July/August 1983).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Nyota: Longzhong Plan
description:
“Nyota” is card game with theme of The Three Kingdoms in China.
In the game, players build States by cards that represent famous Warrior or Strategist or State and Army.
Charactor illustrations are cute, but the game has unique system of strategic and produced.

Game System

The player starts a game with some army corps markers and prestige markers equally.
First Player draw and face-up a card from top of deck, and the game progresses by making a bid for it. The deck is constructed according to a flow of the history in 3 seasons. Card type is three, by Warrior, Land, Event. The player gets a Warrior using prestige, gets Land by attacking it by army corps.
Warrior has special card effect and army corps marker. Land has VP, defence strength and army corps marker. The event card strikes the land of other users and affects the development of the game.
Warrior are Guan Yu, Zhuge Liang, Zhao Yun etc. Warrior Lu Bu appear in game by an event.
Player use prestige to get a Warrior, can thereby strengthen army corps. Using cooperated army corps, prestige is restored by catching Land. But the army corps which player used to obtain land cannot leave the Land for a while. Meanwhile, player must think protection of Land.The growth strategy is necessary, too.
Land of high VP and excellent Warrior appear late in the game. Therefore a bid is exciting.

name: Phantoms of the Ice: Elfenwizard
description:
This is a one card mini expansion which was given out by the German online game store "Adam Spielt".

The expansion consists of a new defense named Elfenwizard and a rules card. Elfenwizard has only a value of "1" but if you have Elfenwizard in your team, you may perform two actions each turn.

name: Power Play Hockey
description:
Statistical game, allowing you to replay Ice Hockey matches. As usual with this publisher, teams are rated for skills such as Shooting, Defense, Assists, Saves, and so on. Once an option has been chosen, dice are rolled to see if the chosen action succeeds or, if it fails, to see if the opposition gain control of the puck. Most goals wins.

My copy suggests that Gamecraft, another statistical sport game publisher, made this game first but I have never seen it. Usually with Valgames, Bob Valvano designs the game but in this case, I guess he didn't.

name: Ancient Egypt Go Fish for Art
description:
Go Fish for Great Art!

Discover Ancient Egypt as you play "Go Fish" and "Concentration" card games! Learn about their gods, goddesses, the great pharaohs, how mummies were made, and more. There are dramatic images and facts on every playing card, and a fact-packed companion book included with the game.

A deck of 36 museum-quality playing cards and a guide to the artists. Ages 7 to adult.

From the publisher:
Play a new version of "Go Fish", honing your skills of strategy and memory, and discover Ancient Egypt as you play. Learn about their gods, goddesses, the great pharaohs, how mummies were made, and more. There are dramatic images and facts on every playing card, and a fact-packed companion book included with the game. The cards can also be used to play Concentration and various memory games.

Learning skills:
• Strategic thinking
• Concentration
• Classification
• Art appreciation
• Symbol translation
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Spurs and Sprockets
description:
Spurs and Sprockets is a perfect information, abstract strategy game for two players. Players have eight matching tiles that they take turns placing orthogonally into a 4 X 4 grid, in an attempt to link three or four in a row. There is no board in Spurs and Sprockets so the grid grows organically, based on the placement of tiles.

Spurs and Sprockets comes with sixteen tiles and rules for four different ways of playing, ranging from a simple Tic-Tac-Toe-like game where players gain 8 points for four in a row and 3 points for each set of three in a row, to a game where every placement of a tile may result in an attack and removal of another tile.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Ouro de Tolo Diamante Encrustado
description: A small expansion for Ouro de Tolo. A new mineral is added: a diamond-encrusted. If you have only one you can earn 12 gold. But if you have two you lose everything.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: X-Com: UFO Express
description:
Designed for the June 2012 24-Hour Game Design Contest, this game aims to summarize the classic computer game 'X-Com - Enemy Unknown" into a quick game that can be played in about 15 minutes.

X-Com - UFO Express is a Solitaire game, where players take on the role of the leader of an X-Com squad - An elite team enlisted to save earth from the incoming alien threat. The game takes place in 2 phases. Players first need to neutralize the alien threat around the world (by playing through 12 increasingly difficult encounters), and then storming the alien base at the end to eliminate the threat.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: China: Priest and Emperor
description:
Number 12 -- the last -- in a year-long series of monthly releases of expansion maps for the China/Web of Power family of games. Another map set in China, but with very different geography.

Released officially June 2012 at michaelschacht.net.

Map download available at michaelschacht.net/p/chinaSpecialmap.jpg.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Die alten Rittersleut
description:
This is the google Translation of the german game description:

In several rounds of play, the Knights try individually or jointly to the respective places on the board to achieve victory. Failing that, they get handkerchiefs as favors and can move onto the barrel fields of the board towards the castle. Whoever reaches the castle, and has the most favorable evidence, winner of the rivalry.

In the middleage the players fights to get points to get to the castle. There are some fights I have to solve alone, other fights must be solved by all the players together. The player with the most points win the game.

name: 2024-An Olympic Undertaking
description:
A game designed for the 2012 Solitaire Print and Play contest.

The year is 2014, and you've been hired to get the construction projects for the 2024 Olympics back on track. The previous supervisor randomly approved project sites without building anything, ran off with most of the money, and has left the city unhappy. Can you successfully get the Olympics buildings built on time, and turn a profit on the investment?

Players start with an unimproved city on a 20 x 20 grid, and must plan for the construction of 6 Olympic Complexes, housing for the athletes, hotels for the fans, all while trying to improve the mood of the city.

The player must evaluate locations based upon the price of the property, the proximity to other locations, and in reaction to 10 random event cards. Some events describe extra unforeseen costs, while others provide revenue generating opportunities.

Generating revenue is very important, since the player will acquire a significant debt from the purchase of the properties and costs of construction. At the end of the game, the player will perform calculations to see how efficient their city became, hopefully earning more money than they spent.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Tetragon2
description:
Tetragon2 is an abstract strategy game for 2 that can play very quick, or take longer, (15 mn to an hour") depending on the match up. Tetragon2 is a game of creation, and the first player to create two tetragons wins...possibly, the other player gets one more move!

The play pieces are triangle in shape, made of maple and walnut, real hard wood! Each player has 9 wood triangles, there is no capturing and no jumping, the pieces move in a variety of ways, forward one square, sideways one square, backwards one square, or diagonal as far as you can go without pivoting or hitting another piece. Tetragons in the center four squares are 10 points, and anywhere else they are 5 points.

name: Endless: Fantasy Tactics
description:
Endless: Fantasy Tactics is a tactical miniatures game designed by On The Lamb Games. With a focus on boutique style miniatures and an art aesthetic harkening back to console RPGs of the 90s, you can build your own custom team of knights, wizards, and monsters. Equip them with items and pick their abilities. Fight it out in story scenarios, or recreations of your favorite games. A standard game takes about 20 to 30 minutes to play with 5-10 miniatures and uses a D6 pool-based system of gameplay.

Endless uses 40mm miniatures on a 25mm/1” square grid. Unlike most other miniatures games, Endless does not feature faction specific models. All models are available for use by any player, and can easily be mixed and matched to suit any personal taste or play-style.

name: Arche Extra Mix 2
description: Arche Extra Mix 2 includes even more animals for you to board in the card game Ark before the floods come and cleanse the Earth of everything that isn't bolted down. How could you have missed all these animals the first two times you looked? And what have you overlooked this time?!

name: Aeronef Over the Aegean: Wrath of the Syren
description:
From the Introduction:

In comparison to the, often tumultuous, clashes over Western Europe and the Atlantic, tensions in South Eastern Europe did not gain international attention. Nevertheless, the intersection of the Tsar’s domain, Austro-Hungarian territory and the Ottoman Empire was a nexus of instability fuelled by long standing ethnic and religious differences as much as foreign policies.

Aeronef Over The Aegean: Wrath of the Syren is a mini-campaign of linked Aeronef scenarios following the adventures of Hungarian Baron Lantoz as he takes his flagship, the Syren, on a mission of vengeance, against the Turks, for his slain family.

The three scenarios provided will present different challenges to both players: The Hungarian player must preserve his ship and crew from one battle to the next, choosing which engagements to pursue and which to avoid. The Turkish player must battle through some deliberately unbalanced scenarios initially, keeping an eye on the overall picture. The scenarios themselves are short with limited numbers of vessels, enabling players to resolve this mini-campaign in a single evening.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Paranormal Investigators
description:
Paranormal Investigators is an homage to the classic "Monster Hunter" television shows. Straight from the tabloid headlines, these unsolved mysteries, urban legends, and other phenomena are here to be finally solved or debunked by your Investigators.

Assembling your own teams of Paranormal Investigators (or PI's, for short), players must rely on the diverse backgrounds of their PI’s to solve a host of strange Case Files. Once solved, these cases can be saved for the end of the game or used to solve larger cases and gain strategic advantages over your opponent.

Players begin the game with only a couple of Investigators and a handful of Paranormal Aid cards. Each PI has their own unique background in various paranormal fields. Certain PI's also have a "Debunk" background, which allows players to attempt to solve a case by debunking it. Paranormal Aids can be used to add a background to a PI or increase it. Players also have the option of using these aids (as well as any solved cases they have) to enlist additional PI's or perform other actions, such as allowing PI's to add their backgrounds through partnering.

Players take turns revealing cases on a Case Files card layout and attempting to solve them. These cases cover many paranormal backgrounds (cryptozoology, unexplained phenomenon, supernatural, extraterrestrial, demonic, and cursed) with five levels for each one. Each level needs the equal and matching background to solve it (for example, a Level 5 Supernatural Case File needs a combined Supernatural background of 5 to solve it). Each level on a Case File also equals the number of points it is worth at the end of the game.

At first, players will only be able to solve a limited number of these cases. But, as they enlist more PI's and use their aids/solved cases, players will slowly be able to solve larger ones. While the larger cases are worth the most towards victory, they also have powerful secondary abilities (like abducting an opponent's PI or stealing one of their solved cases). Players must weigh their options when doing this since cases that have their secondary abilities used are discarded and can't be added to a player's end game total.

The player that does the best job of building their team of Paranormal Investigators and managing the most strategic use of their Paranormal Aids and solved Case Files will end the game with the largest number of combined Case File points and be declared the winner.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Eben Emael
description: Eben Emael is a solitaire, tactical-level wargame simulating the German glider assault of the Belgian fortress on May 10, 1940. The game uses point-to-point movement, turns representing approximately eight minutes, and squad-sized units. The player--representing the Germans--must first get his gliders to the target safely, and then, after landing, neutralize all the gun points atop the fortress in eight turns or less. Includes: complete rules, 57 color, thick card uncut counters, mapsheet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: MacGuffin
description:
To bomb or not to bomb. That is the question.

In this little odd bluffing game, players need to avoid the bomb detonating. At the start of round, the start player chooses right or left and hands a face-down bomb to that player and announces the number on the card. But, the player can bluff as to what number is on the card. As the bomb proceeds around the table, players have to choose between adding to the bomb and passing it on or stopping and checking the bomb pile. If the sum of numbers on the cards is over 10, then the bomb goes off, and the player who try hand bomb cards over to next player takes all bomb cards.

At the end of game, a player who have most many bomb cards loses.

name: Star Wars: El Imperio Contraataca
description:
Spanish boardgame with the theme of The Empire Strikes Back.

A board 'Maze' that has four major zones that contain threat cards in rooms of the maze. Each threat has a minimum that must be rolled to defeat it. By defeating threats players collect points. Once a minimum of 20,000 points are accumulated the player must face Darth Vader. Some cards have bonuses that will add to a players combat strength.

All moves are different colored Luke Skywalkers.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monster Moos!
description:
Play as an interdimensional cowboy on the move searching for unique cows. You've come across "The Field", a plane that seems to attract 4 particular monstrous Moos! But these Moos are difficult to capture and you need special tools if you want to stand a chance against the other cowboys who have also discovered The Field.

Pull together 3 tools to specifically utilize against the different types of Moo. You can wield an EMP Rifle to take down Cyborg Moos, or trail Zombie Moos along with a Brain on a Stick. You might need a Steel Stetson to protect yourself against Dragon Moos, a Puzzle Box to trap Ghost Moos and don't leave your Faithful Companion at home, he'll help you round up any Moo you want!

Capture 25 different Moos, or get a pedigree herd of 15 on one type to win against the other cowboys.

This is a game with entry level tactical play. Choices are available in every step. It is meant to be a fun game for anyone to play and accessible to all levels of experience. Specifically, the game is designed to help bring players who have not had much experience with tactical play into the broader gaming market. The steps of the game are as follows:

Rustle: Draw the top two off of the deck, or one off the discard pile. If there are not enough cards in the deck, shuffle the discard pile, place it face down and continue.

Round-up: Wrangle cows and play action cards or sit-a-spell. If you choose to wrangle or play action cards you may play as many as you are able (including multiple sets of tools). To sit-a-spell you may discard any number of cards from your hand at once and draw that number from the deck. If you sit-a-spell you may not play cards, and you may not sit-a spell if you have played any cards.

Portal: Roll the Moo Dice. (A 6 sided die with 1 color for each Moo type and two opposite faces colored black). Place one Moo of each indicated type in the field according to the Moo Placement Rules. If all four dice show black then a Stampede has occurred.

Mosey: Move one Moo of each color in the field one space if possible. If there are no Moos in the field, or if none of the Moos can be moved, then skip this phase. If there is only one Moo of a color in the field you must still move that Moo.

After the Mosey phase, if you have more than 7 cards in hand, discard in the order you choose until you only have 7.

name: Prosterno
description:
Prosterno is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in March 2010. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. The pawn under attack must jump horizontally or vertically over an empty square to the next square of the same color behind it and when it is not possible it is taken off the board.

The goal of the game is to reach the opponent's side of the board or to eliminate all the opponent's pawns.
Each player has 9 pawns at the beginning of the match
The capturing is obligatory
1. The pawns can move only diagonally, one square at a time in four directions.
2. When two or more opposing pawns are in adjacent squares, then:
a. The pawn under attack must jump horizontally or
vertically over an empty square to the next
square of the same colour behind it, but should
remain on the same straight line as the
attacking pawn.
b. If the pawn cannot escape to the second square
(because it is already occupied or if it is at the edge of
the board), it is taken off the board.
c. If the escape brings the escaping pawn into contact
with an opponent’s pawn, it must attack it in
the same move.

name: Weekend in Vegas
description: Weekend in Vegas is a fun romp through America's playground. Games can range from a 12 turn game(short game) to a 48 turn game (an actual weekend in Vegas). Players choose a character at random who each have some special attributes that give them an edge. The object of Weekend in Vegas is to accumulate the most points before the end of the game. Players gain points by completing various objectives in the game such as seeing shows, riding attractions, dining out on the town and even partying at the clubs. As players scramble around town trying to get it all done they will find it will take cash, comps and even a little luck in order survive a Weekend in Vegas
categories: Exploration, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlecards: World Conflict – Western European Campaign: Expansion Pack 1
description:
This 20 card expansion set includes these new cards
British Ultra Code Crackers
British OSS Agents
British Sherman Firefly Tank
British Special Air Service
German Waffen SS
French Resistance Infantry
Italian Aquila Class Fleet Carrier
Arms Race Conflict Card
Air Raid Conflict Card
Lack of Valor Conflict Card
Military Industrial Complex Conflict Card

and extras of
British 40mm Bofors
British 17 Pound Gun
German Flak 128
German U-boat
German Infantry
German ME-410 Fighter Bomber
Military Buildup 5/2 Conflict Card
Military Buildup 4/2 Conflict Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Kolossus
description:
In the days when the world was still young, a race appeared full of splendor, dignity and beauty. They lived in harmony with their world and the power of their artifacts flowed through everyone and everything. Thus it happened that they isolated the mysterious essence of time itself and put it in twelve mighty crystals to keep it there. In the center of a hovering island, they created the enormous Citadel of Time where they used the pulsing power of the crystals to find out what was, what is and what will be to change the way of the universe.

For milleniums, this sign was anticipated and dreaded. Darkness fell over the island as two of the four suns eclipsed. The colossuses would come to posses the astral body of their creator. The Citadel of Time would fall...

In Kolossus, each player starts at one corner of the world with five warriors, two guardians, and one mighty colossus, with players pairing into alliances. The creatures have different strengths and abilities to move across the map, and using their abilities wisely is the key to success. With the use of mana, players can enhance their creatures' abilities to make them harder to beat or to hit stronger.

The aim of the players is to reach the Citadel of Time and control it as long as possible because the alliance controlling the Citadel receives a time crystal for every turn it does so. To win, an alliance needs to have the most time crystals at the end of the game or to expel all creatures from one side from the island.

name: Rifugio Uitbreiding 5-6 personen
description:
Expands Rifugio to be playable with 5 or 6 players.

Also adds Secret Tunnels, which allow instant travel over larger distances.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Station Fall
description:
Stake your claim in Martian diamonds by deploying a fleet of mining stations to Mars. In Station Fall, dice represent mining stations that attack their competition while falling through the Martian atmosphere. After landing, these stations work in groups to mine diamonds from specific geological formations. The first player to control six mines wins in this lightly strategic game of dice rolling and area control.
