mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Klash
description:
Each player has a character deck of cards and 3 lives (3 heart tokens). Players simultaneously flip their cards face up the fastest as possible in order to find a special Tech. There are some symbols printed on each Tech cards.

Players go on flipping cards up until they gather all the symbols in a specific order. The first player who does that Klashes his opponents with his Tech and a new round starts.

Most of the Tech cards have special powers that trigger when the Tech is achieved. In addition, each Tech grants points and the first player who scores 10 points wins the game.

If a player fails to achieve his Tech (i. e. they flipped the wrong symbol), he loses 1 life (heart token). When a player has no more life, he's out of the game.

This card game might be the fastest card game of the world!
categories: Card Game, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: Calantsoog
description:
This small free, print-and-play game is a preview for the Napoleonic Operations system game "Batavia" and depicts the British seaborne invasion of Callantsoog (Batavian Republic — modern Netherlands) in 1799, lead by Lieutenant-General Sir Ralph Abercromby.

The Second Coalition’s grand strategy for 1799 called for an Anglo-Russian landing in the pro-French Batavian Republic. The landing was to coincide with offensives by Erzherzog Karl on the Rhine and General Suvarov in Italy. At the dawn of August 27th, after almost a week of sailing up and down the Dutch coast, the invasion fleet commanded by the Duke of York dropped anchor outside a hamlet called Callantsoog (note the actual spelling is with two "ll").

The mechanics of the game are based in the Napoleonic Operations system, a simple operational level (division/brigade scale, 1500 meters per hex and three turns per day) set of rules with 16 pages, whose major interest consists in its original simulation of the flow of the operational Orders through the chain of command of the contending forces, along with the particular initiative of the generals involved in battle.

The previous game in this series was Bailen.
(<http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/54417/bailen>;)

name: Gads Hill 1874: 1. Expansion – Railway Station
description:
Description from the publisher:

Gads Hill 1874: 1. Expansion – Railway Station contains additional clue cards and markers. With this material, the "Station" building and the "Cemetery" and "Bison Field" locations can be placed by the players, which makes the game more difficult as only three markers of each type are available, but the players who do so receive more victory points for these placements.

With these additional items, Gads Hill 1874 is also now playable with five players.
categories: American West, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Scan Cycle Resource
description:
The Scan Cycle Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in "The Trouble with Tribbles" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 5 Squadron Points.

When using this resource, you place 5 Scan tokens on it at the beginning of the game. Afterwards, once per round, when one of your ships performs an action, you can place of those tokens by that ship (even if it already has a Scan token). Once all 5 tokens are spent, the resource is removed from the game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: The Legend of Sabao
description:
The Legend of Sabao is the first game of a business game series based on the history of the Tang Danasty. Sabao is the leader of a merchant caravan, and the story of this game is based on a Buddhist fable.

Through the mechanisms of worker placement and area control, players travel into the world of one thousand years ago to act as a Sabao and gain as much profit as possible while undergoing a long and dangerous journey. You have to balance the resources you have, and sometimes make tough calls, perhaps even sacrificing to maintain the best for the caravan and gain the most profit.

•••

《萨薄传奇》是预计的大唐商人系列里的第一部，游戏类型是区域控制+工人放置，玩家人数2-6人。游戏的题材来源于历史上唐人对商主的称谓和一个萨薄燃臂引路的佛教故事。
萨薄（bao2声）在古代的商人里，代表的不单是关于经商，更是一种可靠的担当。玩家在游戏里扮演一只商队的首领，带着自己的伙计，游走与长城内外，和其他玩家去竞争这样一个在大唐商人眼里非比寻常的地位。
要成为被尊称为萨薄的商主，就要比一般的商人要更加严格地维护整个商队的利益，带领他们度过难关寻找商机，甚至有时候必须做出牺牲取舍，来完成目标。

name: In the Trenches: Through Fire and Flames
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Through Fire and Flames is BY FAR the largest battle pack Tiny Battle Publishing has ever released for its popular In the Trenches system. The third battle pack for In the Trenches, Through Fire and Flames brings FIVE new battle maps and SEVEN scenarios to the table, including Whittlesey’s Brave, The Lost Battalion, The Kaiserschlacht, the first tank on tank battle, and more. The seven historical scenarios include the British, French, Germans, Americans and let’s not forget, the Bulgarians! The game’s namesake is born from the German flamethrowers that are added, raising the corrugated lethality of the counter mix. Battle with Schneider, MKIV, and A7V tanks. Bombard enemy positions with mortars and artillery, rake the advancing infantry with machine guns, and infiltrate enemy lines with Stosstruppen.

Designed by John Gorkowski, In the Trenches enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. ITT challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulse-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspires historically accurate play without forcing decisions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Et-y-mon
description:
Etymon is a fun and exciting word game that tests your knowledge of word and phrase origins.

—description from the publisher

Four "origins" for the word or phrase are listed with three creatively written, and one generally accepted as the true origin. Each player or team must see through the false origins, and bet points according to the certainty of their selected answer. The player/team with the most points after ten cards wins

Contains 120 cards with unique word or phrase origins

—user summary
categories: Educational, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Pizza Express
description:
Pizza Express is a cooperative game of observation and quick reflexes.
The head pizza maker has been absent and the players, who are his assistants, must realize the pizzas without him.
A player, who plays the role of coordinator, takes the orders and talk to other players, who will try to realize more pizzas as possible, taking the right ingredients on the table before time runs out.
If the players, after several rounds, complete all the requested pizzas before the head comes back, win!
The game features 4 modes of play:
1) cooperative version, described above;
2) single-handed: the player plays both roles, taking the orders and trying to complete them;
3) teams: competitive version in which 2-4 teams try to complete the pizzas before the others;
4) all against all: competitive version in which everyone plays alone.

name: Steel Arena: Cryochamber Promo Tile
description:
The Cryochamber is special promo tile that was given to those who purchased Steel Arena at Essen Spiel'16.

Cryochamber is a speed II Generation module tile. Just add it to the corresponding pile during setup. It can be placed to the battlefield only as a random tile. When activating this tile cool down any one of your modules.
Keep in mind that you still can't use any module more than once during your turn.

name: Mime Control
description:
Description from the publihser:

Mime Control is a fresh and lively twist on classic charades. Short instructions and intense gameplay make this one ideal for parties and energetic groups of friends looking for a few laughs. In the game, players must work together with a partner to get the crowd to guess the four items on the card before the time expires. Only one player sees the card. That player stays out of view to everyone except their partner and acts out the items on the card. The partner mimics every action to try to get the crowd to guess correctly. Points are awarded for correct guesses. Opposing teams get a chance to steal points on each round. Everyone is either acting or guessing on every turn, so there is never any down-time, sitting around twiddling your thumbs.

name: Shabono
description:
Shabono takes the players to the rain forest of Venezuela.
The shaman of an Indigenous tribe plays with the village children the popular and traditional Shabono game.

The settlement of the villagers consists of a coherent ring of individual huts, called Shabono. In this central open space of Shabono the children have to prove to the shaman who is the fastest collector among them. At the same time the shaman pours coins from a tree trunk with animal motifs, which the children must collect as quickly as possible.

At Shabono the players perceive the roles of the Indigenous children as well as the tasks of the shaman.
The aim is to collect the animal motifs as quickly as possible and to reach as many points as possible, because the coins have different values.

But the shaman is also guardian of the time and determines by his skill how long the respective collection lasts. In addition, the shaman, with the hand of the "coin of the quick hand", indicates with which hand to be collected.

The game Shabono is played in two rounds. In each round, each player is once a shaman.

In the first round the players must collect coins of an animal motif.

In the second round, the players must collect coins from two different animal motifs. It can happen that two players have to collect the same animal motif. The colored toucan must always be collected by each player.

In the game with the special coins, the players also have the opportunity to influence the game through various actions of the coins.

name: Mission im Lesedschungel
description: Deep in the jungle there are a lot of adventures for the players. Hunt the ruby of the maharadja, rare animals and even more. There are 15 goals the children can choose for the game. To win the children have to discover secrets, hunt animals and catch criminals. Only if they read the hints carefully and understand they they’ve got a chance to get to their goal. They have to play as a team and read out the hints on the cardboards they get. The tiptoi pen always supports the players and plays authentic sounds and stories of the jungle to create a great ambience around the table.

name: Hong Kong Dim Sum
description:
HK Dim Sum is a reaction game for 2-5 bright minds.
Dozens of customers are waiting for their dishes. Now, freshly cooked Dim Sum are ready. Who Can help customers to get their required Dim Sum?

In this game, try as fast as you can to get the matched Dim Sum Card. Whoever possesses the most Dim Sum Cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Popkarts!
description:
Ladies and Gentlemen…Start Your Popkarts!

Popkarts is a fast-paced racing game that blends the nostalgia of classic videogame kart racers into an action packed board game that plays in 30-60 minutes. In Popkarts, 1-6 players take turns moving their pit crew clockwise on a speedometer to generate move points. Move points are then spent to move their Popkart forward on the game board in a sprint through Hollyland for first place!

All players begin the game with Sponsor tokens that provide one time benefits during play allowing players to pull off speed defying combos. Power-Up cards collected during the race further the action with devastating attacks such as 3 Blind Mice and a Rocket Launcher and the always favorite, Kingmaker. In Popkarts, the player furthest past the finish line at the end of a round wins the game and the title "Popkarts Racing Champion!"
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That

name: Fly! Kiwi!
description:
It's serious! The earth was hit by a flood! Everyone is flying and running away! It's true!
However, there are still birds left behind on the ground!
What are you doing! Ostrich! Penguin! Kiwi! It's true! It's true!

Each player has a balloon card indicating the pattern of his country, turning one piece per turn and tying it to the straps that comes from his favorite animal.
If all the straps are filled with balloons, that bird will fly away, to the country of the most prolific balloons!
The kiwi has special abilities. Once you acquire Mr. Kiwi, that player can go for balloons in other countries once. So the second half of the game when each player owns a kiwi, is very thrilling!

name: Stratego Legends: Landor's Legion
description:
Stratego Legends takes the familiar game play of Stratego and expands it into something new. In addition to ranks, all pieces now have powers as well. Some fly, some teleport. Some perform better in the marshes or in the mountains. Others have powerful death curses that provide long-lasting effects to the battle. There are over 200 different pieces in the universe, each with its special function.

Stratego Legends is an "optionally collectible" game.

Stratego Legends: Landor's Legion is a booster pack containing 15 beige army playing pieces.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Bravehart
description:
Gran juego de estrategia y conquista feudal.

A game of strategy and feudal conquest.
Roll and move to buy properties and build castles. You can buy castles from other players buying battle cards. If you lose your last coin, you are out of the game. The last player with money is the winner.

name: Blend Off!: Mystery Twisters
description:
Blend it like Becca has introduced their summer menu: the Mystery Twisters. For a limited time, pick your favorite fruit smoothie, and Becca will add a secret "twist."

The Mystery Twisters are added to the deck per the normal rules: always add the orange card, and then add whatever colors you are playing. Unlike the Surprise Me card, there is one restriction to the Mystery Twisters: the 4th fruit must be different than the other 3, and the durian does not count!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: DC HeroClix: Streets of Gotham – Birds of Prey
description: Standalone set for HeroClix. Can be played as a starter set or as an expansion. Includes Oracle, Black Canary, Lady Blackhawk, Hawk, Dove, Huntress and cards for all characters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Team Yankee: Charlie's Chieftains – British Armored Squadron
description:
Contains five plastic Chieftain Main Battle Tanks, two plastic two Lynx helicopters, six resin tank commander figures, eight rare-earth magnets, two decal sheets, six unit cards and one printed cardboard Artillery & Salvo template.

C Squadron, 17th/21st Lancers, and the Irish Guardsmen supporting them made their last-minute preparations, each man checking his weapons one more time and going through the little rituals that had become talismans against violent death.

After days of hard fighting, they were worn and frayed, no longer so eager to test themselves in battle. Their expressions were grim and hard. The coming battle was not going to be easy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dixon to Carrier: Scratch One Flattop
description:
Description from the publisher:

“All the tension on the carrier exploded the moment we heard Comdr. Dixon's voice come in strong and clear: ‘Scratch one flattop! Dixon to carrier: Scratch one flattop.’” -- Stanley Johnston, war correspondent for The Chicago Tribune, on the sinking of the Shōhō

The Japanese Empire invincibly thundered across the Pacific Ocean in the months after their surprise attack at Pearl Harbor. Scrambling in defense, the Americans gained intelligence of impending Japanese invasions across the Coral Sea, and moved two fleet carriers to oppose. The war's first great carrier battles ensued; the Americans would deliver the initial blow on 7 May 1942 when aircraft from the carrier Yorktown sank the Japanese light carrier Shōhō.

Dixon to Carrier: Scratch One Flattop! from designer Esteban Fernandez is a co-op game where each player takes control of one or more Douglas SBD Dauntless dive bombers from the USS Yorktown carrier. The objective of the game is to find, and sink, the Japanese aircraft carrier IJN Shōhō. The Japanese Navy wins if the players lose a certain number of planes or if the USS Yorktown is sunk.

Now you can attempt to recreate those fateful days in May. The stern days of Japanese naval supremacy must be challenged; will you succeed, or end in a watery grave?
categories: Dice, Real-time, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Munchkin Imaginary Friend
description:
You may not be able to see your Munchkin Imaginary Friend, but that doesn't mean he can't help you! Once.

Official Rule: You may tear the blister away from the backing to release your Munchkin Imaginary Friend whenever you are in combat. He will give you a +10 combat bonus for that fight, after which you can't find him again to put him back in his case. He's free! Free! FREE!!!!

name: Commissioner Victor: Case of Elusive Smugglers
description:
Early in the morning, two men in black suits came to the precinct. They promptly asked, "Where is Victor’'s office?" After receiving information, they came to the door and entered without even knocking. After an hour, they quietly left the office and precinct. From this moment I knew that this is some serious business. At the meeting in the board room, everything became clear. These sad gentlemen gave Commissioner information about the warehouse, which is being used as a dead drop location for gang of smugglers. The warehouse is full of crates, so each detective has been tasked to check packets with different cargo. The time is running out — get out and catch the smugglers!

Commissioner Victor: Case of Elusive Smugglers is a logic game for 2-4 players who try to group crates with the same cargo, ultimately stopping the shipment of illicit goods. Players take turns in clockwise order. During their turn, a player chooses one of visible move tiles, then they resolve this tile so at least one of their crates move. Move tiles come in two types:


Direction tile: The player moves the entire row (left/right tiles) or column (up/down tiles) in the direction shown on the tile. The structures "wrap around", so moving down places the crates on the bottom row at the top.
Rotation tiles: The player rotates four tiles in the direction shown on the tile.


The player who groups their crates first wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Pick a Brick
description:
Description from the publisher:

Players take turns picking bricks and removing them from the wall. But be careful not to make the wall collapse as the nesting hen will tumble to the ground. Pick your brick wisely for if you choose the wrong brick and remove it too briskly the hen will fall and you will lose the game. Pick a Brick is a fun and smart game for all ages for 2-4 players.

name: Chaos Cove
description:
A resounding bell tolls, signaling the epic battle that awaits. Ever vigilant, you assemble your team, scour your stockpiles for supplies, and arm yourselves to confront the ruthless hordes of barbarian and pirate invaders. Engage in competition with fellow players to etch your name into the annals of town legend. However, cooperation could be crucial to keep Chaos Cove from the brink of oblivion. And once victory is achieved, revel in triumph by tapping into barrels of the finest rum, throwing a legendary party the world will talk about for ages!

Experience Martin Wallace at his best with this highly interactive worker placement game. Command the unique abilities of each of Chaos Cove's 16 valiant heroes, harnessing their talents, capitalizing on location perks, and amassing the essential resources to combat increasingly formidable invaders. Accumulate victory points by triumphing in both land and sea battles, erecting mighty forts, deploying rugged ships, and hosting epic rum-soaked celebrations. Marvel at the exquisite craftsmanship of the 16 charming hero meeples, each brought to life by the unparalleled artistry of Mr. Cuddington.

But here's the twist that sets this game apart: every hero in Chaos Cove is distinctive with their own special ability. With 16 unique heroes to choose from, every player has the chance to step into the shoes of each hero during the game, making each playthrough an exciting and unique adventure. And don’t forget the locations, each one offering a different strategic advantage. The dynamic interplay of hero placement and location choice leads to extraordinary interactions that position you for victory over the relentless pirates and marauding barbarians.

Should the town of Chaos Cove withstand four harrowing rounds without succumbing to the invaders, a protector of Chaos Cove shall rise. Do you possess the mettle and strategy required to be the protector of Chaos Cove? Outwit your foes as you embark on an unforgettable journey to become the stuff of legends in the beloved town of Chaos Cove!

Description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Multi-Use Cards, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: 侍鳥 (Samurai Dori)
description:
侍鳥 (Samurai Dori) is a Japanese dexterity game. The publisher gives an alternate name — "Samurai-Dori ～Wings of Bushido～" — to reflect the activity. The first edition was published in 2016 in Japanese but a new edition is being prepared for SPIEL '17, with English, German and French rules. The game includes printed cubes which the players arrange in more or less challenging targets. It's important that players are respectful, and they must bow before making their shots.

投扇興 (Tōsenkyō), created in Japan during the Edo period, is a traditional target practice game in which you have to throw a folding fan at a target placed on a stand and knock it down. Samurai Dori has simpler rules than Tōsenkyō. We have arranged the gameplay to make it easier for anyone to play. The cubes and targets represent animals, and folding fans are hunting birds. You compete to see who can hunt the most animals. You can play eight different scenarios depending on how you arrange the three cubes. Even though it is a simple game, it has a deep feel to it, which even children and older people can enjoy.

•••

日本の江戸時代から伝わる伝統的な遊び「投扇興（とうせんきょう）」は、台の上の的に向かって扇を投げ、的を倒して遊ぶ射的ゲームです。侍鳥はこの投扇興をよりシンプルなルールにし、誰でも簡単に遊べるようアレンジした新しい遊びです。箱と的を動物に、扇を動物を狩る鳥に見立てて、動物をどれだけ多く狩れるかを競います。3つの箱を組み合わせることで全8ステージが遊べます。シンプルですが奥が深く、子供からお年寄りまで楽しめるゲームです。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game, Renaissance

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series I – Scenario 05: Steal the Plans
description:
The scouts have confirmed our biggest fears; The Dynasty has built a super-weapon capable of massive destruction. And even worse; it appears ready to strike any day now.

The good news: There is a weak spot.

The bad news: We need you to find it.

In connection with the events of our game That Snow Moon (and not Star Wars: Rogue One at all), our Pocket Universe characters must steal the plans to prevent the evil bad guys from developing a superweapon that could destroy the world. It's also the debut of two new characters in the Twin Stars line, Princess Roux Jaezmina and Grant Rockgardner.

—description from the publisher


Steal the Plans is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.


This game was originally given out as a monthly reward from Button Shy's Board Game of the Month Club May 2017 package.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Nefarious: ... Only More So
description: "This copies the other Twist(s). If that wouldn't change anything, replace the other Twist on the game board."

name: Nefarious: Ancillary Products
description: "After playing an INVENTION, Gain 1 per card in your hand."

name: Stratego Legends: Kralc's Horde
description:
Stratego Legends takes the familiar game play of Stratego and expands it into something new. In addition to ranks, all pieces now have powers as well. Some fly, some teleport. Some perform better in the marshes or in the mountains. Others have powerful death curses that provide long-lasting effects to the battle. There are over 200 different pieces in the universe, each with its special function.

Stratego Legends is an "optionally collectible" game.

Stratego Legends: Kralc's Horde is a booster pack containing 15 grey army playing pieces.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Rasher
description:
A smart, vibrant and dynamic racing game. You accelerate, crash against opponents, sabotage other cars, put traps on the speedway, launch missiles, and have a lot of fun! It's a wacky race where all the players are the "Dick Dastardly"!

In the Rasher game all players manage cards that can be actions against opponents ("Take That"), defenses for attacks received or to move around the track. The number of cards caught at a time, offers many strategic possibilities for the player to decide his next actions. But the player can also leave some cards stored for later use.

There are 1, 2, 3, or 4 house motion cards that can be combined with other actions like jumping obstacles, stealing opponents' cards, using side saws, and more. Even if your car is damaged by missiles or collisions, you can still use repairs to continue running, non-stop.

The modular board allows you create a racing circuits with number of laps defined by the players: whoever arrives first wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Ninja Soul
description:
Ninja Soul is a microgame consisting of eight cards. Each player gets dealt one card face down. During their turn, a player can either look at their own card, exchange a card with another player or reveal the card in front of them, executing the action the card contains.
When a player executes the effect of the "winning" card, they get three points, all other survivors receive one point. First player to reach ten points is the winner.

name: Aquatico
description:
As a nation with a vast aquatic ecosystem, Indonesia understands well the importance of educating its people to protect its aquatic ecosystem, both marine and fresh water.

Aquatico is designed to introduce the content of the aquatic ecosystem and the bio-diversity that dwells in it to its players. The gameplay is suitable for family with young children.

name: Complex Atomic Compilers
description:
Complex Atomic Compilers is a party game for software engineers who work on compilers.

Similar to Cards Against Humanity, players take turns drawing prompts and soliciting answers from the other players. The player with the best answer will get a compiler point. The player with the most compiler points at the end will win with entry into the Compiler Club.

The game also includes some blank prompt and answer cards for players to create their own.

Complex Atomic Compilers was previously known as Cards Against Compilers.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Battle of Waterloo, 1815
description: This is an elementary game for beginners of wargaming, included in Command Magazine Japan extra "Wargame Handbook 2015". Components are simple: One 353mm × 500mm (13.9″ × 19.7″) map, one counter sheet (90 counters) and one rule leaflet (4 pages).

name: Word Slam: DSP-Edition
description:
Word Slam: DSP-Edition adds ten new cards to the game.

New cards with designers, games etc.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Spies in Shanghai
description:
Spies in Shanghai is a party game for 4-8 players within 15 minutes. Players are either CCP Spies or KMT Secret Agents in Shanghai city in 1930s. Spies need to collect classified files after exchanging information. Be aware of assassination, steal, and leak from under covered Secret Agents.

There are 8 character cards and 10 information cards in the game. Everyone randomly chooses 1 character and 1 information card. He/she doesn't know each other in the beginning. There are two rounds of exchanging information phase and then the head of spies needs to reveal himself and find other underground spies. If he can find other spies and collect at least 6 secret files in the information cards, the spies win the game.

《上海地下黨》是一款適合4-8位玩家的派對遊戲，玩家扮演1930代上海市的共產黨地下黨和國民黨特務，地下黨員交換情報來收集機密文件以贏得勝利，小心各種特務會利用暗殺、竊取和洩密的手段來阻止你們。

遊戲共有8張角色牌和10張機密牌，每位玩家隨機選擇1張角色牌和1張情報牌，玩家不知道彼此的真實身份，經過兩回合交換手中的情報牌後，地下黨頭子必須找出隱藏的其他地下黨員，若是地下黨成功收集到6份機密文件，則贏得遊戲的勝利。
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Itty Bitty Dungeon Delve
description:
Itty Bitty Dungeon Delve is an 18 card tableau manipulation for 2 players. Each player represents a new adventurer exploring the cavernous rooms of a dungeon. Each is looking to gain experience and reach level 5 first, and they do so by rearranging the cards representing each individual cavern in the dungeon.

Players reveal cards from their cavern to rearrange facedown cards or gain knowledge of what the cards may be. At the end of the round they gain experience equal points from their cavern. If a player ends the turn with "The Smiter" card, they may instead choose another cavern to explore.

The first player to reach Level 5 wins!

—description from the designer

name: Chrononauts: German Cake Promo Card
description:
This special Artifact card was designed to work in original Chrononauts, but you can use it in EAC by house rule agreement before the games starts.

When used with EAC, since the TimeLine is totally different, it is freely playable, and also counts as a dessert food item for 4 Missions.

Text says:
"Cannot be played or stolen if [Hitler is alive]. Once in play, it can be discarded at any time and used as a Memo. Cannot be used to stop theft of cake with Get There First." (I.e. it can't be used up to prevent itself from being stolen)

This card debuted as a promo card at Dragon*Con 2002, but was added to the original game during the 3rd printing.
It was also available for purchase by itself from the Looney Labs webstore
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Elven Union Pitch & Dugout Set
description:
A double-sided card Blood Bowl pitch, complete with matching dug-outs, this is the perfect place for your Elven Union teams to play. One side features a perfectly manicured grass pitch with an Elven Union symbol delicately mown into the centre, the other is a frozen field entirely covered in ice by the swirling winds of magic. The dug-outs are themed to match, with opulent marble boxes and gems everywhere – they feature score trackers, reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury boxes, Down trackers for both halves, and a re-roll tracker.

The pitch is made to the same specifications as the board included with the Blood Bowl boxed game, and includes rules for playing on a frozen pitch.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: This That & Everything: Places
description:
In this rapid-fire game, players race to describe a wide variety of Places for their teammates to guess.

—descripton from the publisher

name: Dungeon Crawler: Unbound Delve Pack 1 – Keldorna
description:
To expand your collection further you can pick up one of the five Delve Packs. These non-random packs contain 52 cards, now printed in the USA, with new Adventurers, Quests and a mix of new cards and useful copies of cards from the Unbound Starter to bolster both your Dungeon and your Crawler decks. There is Keldorna (filled with traps), Stonehold (focusing on Undead and Goblins), Outlands (focusing on terrain), Sylvan Woods (focusing on poison), and Barren Mountains (focusing on Stealth and big monsters). The Delve Packs have been reconstructed as v2.0 to work better with 1 full set games instead of a randomized format intended for up to 4 copies of the game. Check the specific game format rules to see limitations on how many copies of each card you can have in a deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Dungeon Crawler: Unbound Delve Pack 2 – Stonehold
description:
To expand your collection further you can pick up one of the five Delve Packs. These non-random packs contain 52 cards, now printed in the USA, with new Adventurers, Quests and a mix of new cards and useful copies of cards from the Unbound Starter to bolster both your Dungeon and your Crawler decks. There is Keldorna (filled with traps), Stonehold (focusing on Undead and Goblins), Outlands (focusing on terrain), Sylvan Woods (focusing on poison), and Barren Mountains (focusing on Stealth and big monsters). The Delve Packs have been reconstructed as v2.0 to work better with 1 full set games instead of a randomized format intended for up to 4 copies of the game. Check the specific game format rules to see limitations on how many copies of each card you can have in a deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

description:
To expand your collection further you can pick up one of the five Delve Packs. Check the specific game format rules to see limitations on how many copies of each card you can have in a deck.

Source: Gifted Vision (Publisher)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Zero
description:
Discard all the cards before the other players.

In the basic game, the cards are divided equally among 4 colours (red, blue, yellow, green) and 4 characters (mom, dad, male puppy and female puppy.) You can discard a card just if it follows one of these two simple rules:

You can discard a card of a colour on one of the same colours;
You may discard a card with a certain character on one that depicts the same character.


Characters are identified both for their clothes and for a typical object (shown at the top left of the card).
Other characterizing elements are the number of fingerprints and the number in the upper right, which will become relevant only for older children.

The player who first discards all their cards wins.

In the Advanced game, you can also play with special cards with funny effects:
We advise you to insert them gradually in 3 progressive steps, but you are absolutely free to introduce them in an order chosen by you, perhaps by reason of the younger players' preferences towards a character rather than another. All special cards have a bottom part with showing colours on which they can be played, and an upper part which shows their effect on the next player's turn. The only exception is the wolf, which has a special effect.
The Special cards are organized in three difficulties steps. This allows to introduce into the game the complexity by following the need of the children.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Photonic Cannon
description:
This card is the competitive prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Trap Travesty."

Unique Federation Weapon (10 SP)
As an attack, you may spend your Target Lock token, remove the cannon from play, and suffer 2 damage to your hull to perform a 10 die attack at a target at range 3.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: FroGo
description:
Four player 'checkers' style game. Each player tries to move their frogs to the opposite corner of the board, stacking and obstructing your opponents frogs at the same time.

Each player has 1 king (moves any direction), 1 queen (moves diagonally and carries frog stacks), 1 princess (moves diagonally), 2 knights (move vertically/horizontally and carry frog stacks) and 2 soldiers (move vertically/horizontally). On a player’s turn, they can move one frog.

The first player to move their seven frogs to the goal, located on the opposite corner of the board from their start position, wins the game.

name: Panic Mode!
description:
Panic Mode! is a cooperative Disaster Recovery card game for up to 8 players. In 25 minutes your doors will open for business, your website will start to hit peak hours, newspapers will be published, blogs will be posted and it will be another day. The problem is your systems are down!

The Mainframe, Morale and Customer Satisfaction tracking cards start at zero. You and your team must work together to recover all three to their safe zones by playing cards. Cards will either increment or decrement one or more tracking cards, and cards may align with your assigned role to have an additional effect.

If players can get all tracking cards to their safe zones in 25 minutes, they win!

name: Glyph: Villains Champion
description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph: Villains further expands the options available to players for customizing their group of Champions with a trio of devilish characters: the Soul Eater, Blood Mage, and Ice Witch.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: NUKED: Warmonger
description:
An expansion for the card game NUKED. Adds new elements to the original game like new attack and defend cards, as well as a the ft mechanic and new Fate cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: MystiQuest
description:
MystiQuest tells of epic clashes between ancient gods, fought on the banks of the Styx, the infernal river. Gods, heroes, monsters and mythological creatures battle with all their power, fighting during the day and spending the night celebrating.

Is a trading card game, but very close to the Living Card Games, thanks to the use of Planks, tokens and the possibility to implement long-term strategies.

Each player has a board representing the fortress, on which he places the card of his Supreme Nume (or Prime) and the three heralds chosen to defend it. The heralds also represent Defence Points: if they are eliminated or used, the Prime is forced to take the field and expose himself in person. The winner first eliminates the Prime opponent.

It is interesting to note that the heralds can be chosen before starting the game and this allows you to plan very specific and different strategies according to the opponent you will have to face.

Mystic energy is represented by plastic gems. After playing a card you must take the gems from your well and place them on it. The gems on the card indicate the attack value, the defense value and the card’s hit points. As a result, a card with three gems, deals three damage and can take three damage before it dies out, if it takes a damage it loses a gem and then inflicts only two damage from that moment.

During the confrontation phase the player on duty plays his own cards, sends them to the attack and uses his own prodigies to try to defeat the enemy ranks and force the Prime opponent to take the field.

At the end of the turn there is the breath phase. Temples, Prime and some other specific cards "breathe" and give mystical energy back to their well, so you can add new gems. Then it is up to the opponent to repeat the same sequence until one of the two Prime is defeated.

Another interesting feature is the possibility of playing in teams, even with "asymmetric" solutions: one against two, two against three, two against four, etc. thanks to the gaming system that automatically self-balances.

For the setting the mythological theme was chosen as an alternative to the now too widespread Fantasy. Currently it is possible to play with three Pantheon:
- Ancient Greeks
- Ancient Egyptians
- Vikings
The Japanese pantheon is already being prepared.



MystiQuest racconta di epici scontri fra antiche divinità, combattuti sulle rive dello Stige, il fiume infernale. Dei, eroi, mostri e creature mitologiche si danno battaglia con tutta la loro potenza, combattendo di giorno e passando la notte a festeggiare.E’ un gioco di carte collezionabili, ma molto vicino ai Living Card Games grazie all’utilizzo di Plance, gettoni e la possibilità di attuare strategie a lungo termine.
Ogni giocatore ha una plancia che rappresenta la fortezza, su cui posiziona la carta del proprio Nume Supremo (o Prime) e i tre araldi scelti per difenderlo. Gli araldi rappresentano anche Punti Ferita del Prime, infatti se vengono eliminati o utilizzati, il Prime è costretto a scendere in campo ed esporsi in prima persona. Vince chi per primo elimina il Prime avversario.

E’ interessante notare che gli araldi possono essere scelti prima di iniziare la partita e questo ti permette di pianificare strategie molto precise e diverse a seconda dell’avversario che dovrai affrontare.

L’energia mistica è rappresentata da gemme di plastica. Dopo aver giocato una carta devi prelevare dal tuo pozzo le gemme indicate e posarle su di essa. Le gemme sulla carta indicano il valore di attacco, il valore di difesa e i punti ferita della carta. Di conseguenza una carta con tre gemme, infligge tre danni e può subire tre danni prima di estinguersi, se subisce un danno perde una gemma e quindi da quel momento infligge solo due danni.

Durante la fase del confronto il giocatore di turno gioca le proprie carte, le manda all’attacco e usa i propri prodigi per cercare di sconfiggere le schiere nemiche e costringere il Prime avversario a scendere in campo.
Alla fine del turno c’è la fase del respiro. I templi, i Prime e alcune altre carte specifiche “respirano” e ridanno energia mistica al proprio pozzo e quindi puoi aggiungere nuove gemme. Poi tocca all’avversario che ripete la stessa sequenza finché uno dei due Prime non viene sconfitto.

Un'altra interessante caratteristica è la possibilità di giocare in squadre, anche con soluzioni “asimmetriche”: uno contro due, due contro tre, due contro 4, ecc. grazie al sistema di gioco che automaticamente si auto bilancia.

Per l’ambientazione è stato scelto il tema mitologico in alternativa all’ormai fin troppo diffuso Fantasy. Attualmente è possibile giocare con tre Pantheon :
- Antichi Greci
- Antichi Egizi
- Vichinghi
E’ già in preparazione il panteon giapponese.

name: Egge on Thine Face
description:
Who cares for Russian Roulette? Those with true nerves of steel are willing to smash eggs on their heads, not knowing whether the eggs are raw, boiled, or rotten. In this game, you and your friends will be selecting and breaking eggs (or cards with eggs on, at least!) and whoever remains the cleanest will be the winner.

Each round, players are dealt a card with an egg on, and starting with the first player, they all declare what is on their card, though everyone has to say the same thing as the first player. The cards are then placed in the centre of the table, along with an unknown extra card. After a countdown, everyone grabs a card and finds out what sort of egg they have chosen, scoring from 0 to 2 points of "mess".

The raw and rotten egg cards are kept by the players who took them, and the rest are reshuffled for the next round. When there are not enough cards for a new round, the game is over and whoever is the least messy is the winner.

Multiple sets of cards can be combined to allow more players to join in.

-description from designer

name: Iron Debris System: Space Battles in the 22nd-23rd Century
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese animation series "Space Battleship Yamato"(also called Cosmoship Yamato or Star Blazers).

This game revised from War Against White Comet, mainly improved missile combat and aerial combat rules, and added Dark Star Cluster ships and scenaros.

Players manage a star-fleet of Earth Federation, Gamilus, Imperial Comet or Dark Star Cluster. Each ship unit represent a space warship, and each aircraft unit represent 9 to 20 space aircrafts.

In each turn, players activate by random order for chit-pull engine. Activate number per turn is determined by Command Points and ship's energy value. Excellent ship like Yamato will activate more numbers than opponent per turn.
Battle has three ways: fire combat, missile combat, aircraft action. You can also use super weapons like wave cannon with optional rules.

Victory conditions are set for each scenario. The game contains 14 scenarios.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: La Belle Lucie
description:
La Belle Lucie is one of the harder solitaire games to play, having a lot of "luck of the draw" in place. It's other names are "The Fan", "Three Shuffles and a Draw", "Alexander the Great", and/or "Trefoil".

It's a single player card game where the point of the game is to transfer all cards from the tableau to the four foundations. The only action taken by the player will be moving a card from one "fan" of many, to another one in descending order (e.g. 7 of clubs on top of 8 of clubs)

From the start all cards are visible in the tableau, but this doesn't mean the game can be won with strategy. More times than not, the game will not be beat because of unlucky draws. Such as kings being the top card of fans, or higher cards being on the bottom of the fan while the higher card of that suit is on top of the fan.

name: Speedrone: Fly or Die
description:
Speedrone: Fly or Die is a board game about mad deadly races between high-tech drones in a near future (2050). The goal is to win the race with your drone collecting as many Acceleration cards you can.

In this period the military technologies become common and spread among civil people. Children and adults from every class of the society begin to build their own fighting drones in order to run in clandestine and official races. To achieve victory they are ready to do everything legal and illegal: there was no chance for pity or alliances, but only for the dangerous gadgets that drones equip.

Speedrone: Fly or Die! it's a modular game: with a box you can play up to 5 players, with two boxes up to 10 and with 3 boxes up to 15 and so on. It's very simple and you do not need any extra components: the manual included in Speedrone - fly or die! - already contains everything you need to know.

The game-play is very simple: every player acts in a specific order that changes during the game, draws cards and plays every cards he/she wants. Acceleration cards drive you to the victory, other cards like Shellfire force you to lose positions; many cards protect drones from the deadly gadgets of the game and other cards called Event tell you in which situation you are in that round. There are a lot of cards and a high combination of strategies in Speedrone.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Fighting, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: The Last Frontier
description:
1. Roll the die. Move as many spaces as the die indicates. (Boats, planes, and Whales are the same as squares and circles, and are counted as one move.) When starting, a player may move in any direction they choose. from villages or cities a player may move in any direction, even retracing the previous route, but a player may not change direction between cities or villages (the circles are not the only points of direction change.)

2. When a player lands on a city or village ( circles) they receive the Commerce or Adventure card for that place. The points or dollars are then added to that players score. Each card is worth different amounts of dollars or points. The points are converted to dollars for scoring purposes as follows:
1 Adventure point = $100.00

If a player rolls the die and lands on a place already occupied, the player occupying that place is "bumped" to the nearest Hazard. The "Bumped" player then has to select a Hazard card and follow the instructions on it for his/her next move. A player may choose to "Homestead". (Decision can be made after a roll, and only twice in each game.) lose one turn each time you become a Homesteader.

3. Any player Landing on a plane may "Fly" to any city or village on the game board.

4. Any player landing on a Hazard selects a hazard card follows the instructions. Once used, the cards are returned to the stack face up on the bottom.

5. Commerce and Adventure cards are kept by the players when received (if the game is not complete by the time the cards are out, players will return their cards to the Banker and continue the game to completion.)

6. The first player to accumulate $5,000.00 and returns to starting point wins the game!

(Note)
If two players are playing, we suggest the score be raised to $10,000.00 to make it more interesting and challenging.

When one player reaches the $5,000.00 or ($10,000.00) point, it's up to the rest of the players to prevent him/her from returning to the starting point by whatever means they can.

name: Scubi Sea Saga: The Logic Game for All Ages
description:
Immerse yourself in the colorful underwater world of Scubi the seahorse in Scubi Sea Saga: The Logic Game for All Ages.

Accompany Scubi through the magical coral reef and rescue his friends from the dangers of the deep sea. Collect valuable points before the Great White Shark goes hunting. What are you waiting for? On your marks, get set, dive!

The app guides the gameplay and provides help when you need it, along with new features and more tactical options.

•••

Tauche ein in die bunte Unterwasserwelt von Scubi dem Seepferdchen. Begleite Scubi durch das zauberhafte Korallenriff und rette so viele seinerFreunde vor den Gefahren des tiefen Meeres.Sammle wertvolle Punkte bevor der große weiße Hai auf Jagd geht. Worauf wartest du noch? Auf die Plätze, fertig, abtauchen!

Mehr Spielspaß: Auspacken und sofort losspielen! Die App unterstützt genau dann wenn Fragen auftauchen.

Mehr Dynamik: Zusätzliche Funktionen in der App sorgen für mehr taktische Möglichkeiten.

Mehr Action: Die App steuert den Spielablauf und sorgt für noch mehr Action beim Spielen.

Mehr Abwechslung: App-Updates sorgen für neue Features und zusätzliche Spielvarianten.

name: Serpents
description:
Serpents is a tarot sized, secret identity, card game. Serpents puts a fresh spin on classic secret-identity games like Mafia and Werewolf. Play using our rules out of the box, or throw them out and use your own. Our team has taken measures to ensure this deck is flexible enough to play a range of unique hidden-identity games — known or as yet unwritten — and allows you to cater any existing version to your liking. Mix and match your favorite roles and start lying to your closest friends and family.

One player will serve as The Fortune Teller. Remaining players will either be Innocents, striving collectively for survival using logic and deduction, or Serpents, fork-tongued deceivers, eliminating travelers from the game using pretense and lies. Only the Fortune Teller knows the true identity of each player. He alone will attend the players on their journey, acting as both moderator and story-teller.

name: Cookie Rookie
description: Cookie Rookie is a simple family game. During the game, players will collect 5 different styles of cookies through a simple addition formula. Additional bonuses will be provided according to the types being collected, the player who scores the highest point in the end will win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Witless Wizards: Trecker Promo Set
description: A set of three additional cards to add to the choice of mini decks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Crown de Fleur
description:
Crown de Fleur is a tile removal solitaire puzzle game. House Fleur has taken control of the kingdom and as the royal florist you must pick all the flowers in the estuary to create a crown for the coronation ceremony.

The estuary is setup in a 4 x 5 tile grid with blue cubes around the outer tiles and green cubes on the interior tiles. The game is played by placing 1 tile to the estuary and matching flower edges to pick up any matching adjacent flower tiles. The matched tiles are added to you stockpile and the placed tile remains in the estuary. Play continues until there is only 1 single tile remaining at which you pay 1 cube to remove the final tile. Once the estuary is cleared then you have completed the puzzle.

name: Hopfen und Malz: Gott Erhalt's
description:
Each player brews a certain beer with his two characters (master brewer and trainee) according to an original recipe.
The master brewer procures the required raw materials for the beer on the raw material ring, while the trainee goes through all the brewery departments as part of his training and does the necessary work on the brewing process on site. The winner is the player whose freshly brewed beer first flows out of the tap.

—description from the publisher

name: Arenaverse: Homeworlds
description:
Building on the success of Ophidian 2360, this release features a completely new/updated rulebook, expanded card pool for multiplayer support, durable storage box, dice, tokens, and more! Arenaverse: Homeworlds is a fully upgraded and self-contained experience!

Take your team of gladiators and crush your opponents!

Arenaverse: Homeworlds features unique momentum-based mechanics, allowing players to chain together actions to form combinations, as well as gaining the favor of the crowd. But be careful, your opponent can also 'cash in' some of their popularity with the crowd to break up your combos! With multiple paths to victory and main characters that can level up throughout the game, gaining new abilities, every game is a story of action and mayhem!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Hexdominup
description:
Hexdominup is a game that uses the Double-seven binary-coding hexdominoes set by Nestorgames.

Double-seven binary-coding hexdominoes includes 36 tiles (with numbers from 0 to 7) composed of two adjacent hexagons. Instead of the standard ‘pips’, this set uses a special concentric binary representation. A central pip equals 1, a small circle equals 2 and a big circle equals 4.

Hexdominup is a game for 2 to 4 players, derived from Dominup, by the same designer.

There are two types of placements in Hexdominup. In both cases the tile must be aligned with an imaginary hexagonal grid:


‘Climb’ placement: The tile is placed atop two adjacent tiles of the same level, so that the numbers (symbols) of the placed tile match the symbols underneath (one of each supporting tile).
‘Expand’ placement: The tile is placed on the table and adjacent to at least one tile already placed. The values of adjacent hexagons don’t need to match.


How to play

Randomly distribute the tiles face-down among the players (as in dominoes).

The player with the double-7 starts by placing it in the middle of the playing surface.

Starting with the second player, players take turns in anticlockwise order doing all of the following steps in order until the game end condition is reached:


If you can make a climb placement with at least one of your tiles, then you must do so. You can choose which tile to place, as long as the placement is legal. Repeat this action until you can’t make any more climb placements.
If you have at least one tile left, then make one expand placement.


If, at the end of your turn, you have no tiles left, then you’ve won and the game ends. However, the other players can continue playing to determine 2nd, 3rd, and 4th place if they wish.

Variant: Misere Hexdominup. In this variant, the player who runs out of tiles first loses.

—description from the publisher

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Luna Lovegood Lion Hat
description:
A Gen Con 2018 exclusive.

Luna attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry from 1992-1999 and was sorted into Ravenclaw House. In her fourth year, Luna joined Dumbledore's Army, an organization taught and led by Harry Potter, of which she became an important member. She participated in the Battle of the Department of Mysteries and the Battle of the Astronomy Tower, and co-led the reconstituted Dumbledore's Army when Hogwarts fell under the control of Lord Voldemort.

Contains: 1 resin miniature (unassembled and unpainted), 1 plastic base, and 1 character card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Catch Me!
description:
Catch Me! is a simple card game for 2 to 6 players. Each player receives a stack of face down cards displaying patterns in different colours. In the middle of the table there's a wooden stick up for grabs. Every round, a player turns over one of their face down cards. If two players have cards of the same pattern in front of them, both players compete to "catch" the stick first. The loser of this duel receives the winner's active cards to add to their stack. Whoever gets rid of all their cards first wins the game!

Duel cards are included as a variant.

—user summary

name: Tumblin' Monkeys Raptors Jurassic World
description:
The object is to not let any raptors fall down the enclosure during your turn. Create a web of colored sticks across the tree and place the raptors inside the enclosure. Then roll the die and take turns removing one stick at a time—whichever color stick the die indicates. Be careful because one false move will cause raptors to fall and then you have to add them to your pile! The player to drop the fewest raptors wins!

However, if a player causes Blue to fall, that player wins the game even if he has more raptors than other players.

Game comes with 1 bright yellow, translucent plastic palm tree so you can see the raptors wriggle as you try to catch their tails on plastic sticks. Also included are 30 raptors, 30 multiple colored sticks, and a special die.

name: Citizen
description:
Win Citizen by being the first player to pass your Cause through both chambers of the real 116th United States Congress. All 535 actual members take the place of dice, who are controlled by their documented voting history, seniority, and campaign contributors. Using the framework designed by our founders, advance your Cause or hinder your opponents’ by building Citizen card hands that contain alliances of the actual faces, forces, and fates that built our nation. Use your skills to earn additional powers, all while avoiding the fallout from ambitious opponents, conflicted officials, and unexpected twists of Circumstance cards.

Citizen gives you multiple paths to victory based on a wide variety of strategic considerations including Cause challenge level, deck building and drafting skills, use of powers and other resources during play, hand construction, impact selection, and more. Players' stories intertwine differently with every session so you'll never play the same game twice.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Political
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Voting

name: Speed Chess
description:
In Speed Chess, you have only six pieces with which to play: three pawns, a knight, a bishop and a king. It requires fewer moves, but also a great deal of skill in order to trap the opponent's king. Since the chess board is not square, it presents opportunities for new strategies and clever moves. Furthermore, Speed Chess is much faster than traditional chess, which means you will need to think fast to keep your opponent in...umm...check!

—description from the publisher

name: Discovery: The Evolution Game – Antiquity
description:
Discovery is a card game in which you will retrace the major steps in the evolution of humanity.

Each card represents an innovation or major breakthrough in our history. Each one builds on previous discoveries, called prerequisites, and paves the way for new discoveries.

During a game, you will build together the "Discovery Tree" by each placing cards in turns. Discovery allows you, with a same deck of cards, to play several different types of games (from beginner level to expert). Depending on the type of game, the goal can be either to be the first to empty your hand (games with no points), or to collect the maxim number of points (you earn points each time you place a card).

In all games, each player starts with 5 cards. During your turn, you can place a card in the Discovery Tree if all its prerequisites have already been placed, or if it has no prerequisite (the starting cards). Once placed, a card benefits all players who can then use it as a prerequisite to place their own cards. The game ends as soon as the stack is empty and a player empties his hand.

Discovery is thus a semi-collaborative game which, like the evolutionary process, combines both collaboration and competition.

The Antiquity deck can be played as a stand alone game, or as an extension of the Prehistory deck (2019 edition).

Discovery is a game for adults and kids, from 6 years old, and ideal to play with the whole family. It can be played as a solitary game or with up to 9 players. Game plays range from intense and fast 15 minutes, to long strategic game (~60 minutes), depending on the type of game and the number of players.

-description from publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Civilization, Educational, Exploration, Memory, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Get Billy the Kid!
description:
Billy the Kid is wanted – Dead or Alive!

The governor of New Mexico Territory has put a $ 500 bounty on the head of outlaw William H. Bonney, and the Sheriff of Lincoln County, Pat Garrett, aims to collect it.

To stay alive, the Kid is rustling cattle for gold in Arizona and New Mexico. But some big guns are on his tail, including Doc Holliday and Wyatt Earp.

In an era where there's a fine line between an outlaw and a lawman, you have to know who your real friends are and who has your back. A little gold may help your friends decide which side they're on.

Will the Kid continue to evade the law or will he finally get what's coming to him?

Description:

Get Billy the Kid! is a social deduction card game in which secret characters investigate each other to unmask the outlaw. Once the Kid is revealed, the game explodes into a wild west chase and shootout!

In the first part of the game, players pick through a deck of cards to build a good hand and to investigate the other players. When they play a card, they can ask a question or look at someone's hand or do other actions to try and determine who is who at the table. After the characters are revealed, you play special cards to try and arrest the outlaw. But it won't be easy to arrest the Kid as he has special escape cards, pistols and a little TNT!

If Billy the Kid (or any Outlaw) is alive at the end of 7 rounds and has at least one Gold card, he wins the game. If the Kid eliminates the Lawmen, he wins the game. If the Lawmen eliminate the Kid (or all Outlaws), they win the game.


Get Billy the Kid! is the second in the 'Get!' series. Get Adler! Deduction Card Game was the first.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Wizna 1939
description:
"Wizna 1939" covers the battle of Wizna fought during the Second World War Polish campaign between Polish garrison of the Wizna and German 10th Armored Division at 8-9 september 1939. Despite the desperate odds, Poles managaed to stop Germans for almost three days, thanks to the muddy terrain and bunkers.

Battle is often called "Polish Thermopylae". A Sabaton wrote a song about this battle titled "40:1".

Wizna 1939 contains three scenarios: two historical ones and one hypothetical that allows Polish player to use more units. Game uses "B-35" battalion/company scale system.

Wizna 1939 was published in the 42 issue of "Taktyka i Strategia", a Polish wargaming magazine.

name: Gangster Paradise
description:
You play a mob boss who manages a clan and tries to defeat other clans by gathering the most money.

In Gangster Paradise, you collect money which you have to launder so that it counts for your score.
On your turn, you will be able to negotiate with your opponents in order to exchange anything you own: money or cards.

Play lasts 8 rounds, divided into 5 phases: each player plays the first phase, then all play a second phase, etc.

During phase 1, each clan collects its own type of goods.
During phase 2, players participate in as many auctions as there are players less one, each collecting 1 good among those offered, the last player receiving money.
During phase 3, players sell their goods, trying to make sets of different goods.
During phase 4, players will hire new gang members, by paying sets of similar goods. Members of different types will trigger special effects during the game.
During phase 5, players first launder their dirty money, collect some extra money and pay their gang members’ salaries.

When all 8 rounds have been played, laundered money is counted and the winner declared.

name: Cornered
description:
Cornered is one of several games playable with the Katarenga board and pieces. This game is invented by the author of Katarenga.

Cornered is played on just one quarter of the board, which starts empty. The first pawn may be placed anywhere, but each subsequent pawn must be placed in such a way that it could be captured by the previous one. The last player able to place a pawn wins, and scores 1 point for each and every pawn on the board.

Play up to a target score of 15 points, which will usually take two or three games to reach (or more, if you tend to resign early).
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Sweet Treats!
description:
It’s time for a party, and everyone’s hungry! Two to four players ages 5 and up compete to collect the tastiest sets of treats to please their guests. Will it be chocolate and pineapple? Or doughnuts and ice cream?

Sweet Treats! is a children's set collection card game. Players take turns drawing delicious doughnuts and charming cupcakes from a row of cards, aiming to gather enough matching flavors to score big points. Bright colors help kindergartners begin matching as they learn to read, and simple scoring is built upon starting arithmetic.

Older players may use the advanced rules to build sets in a two-dimensional grid, allowing savvy collectors to spread a single card across two sets for high-scoring combinations. They may also use optional rules for secret information, forcing players to study each other in pursuit of high-value treats. The rules also include a solitaire puzzle option for big kids, or as a cooperative experience with younger players.

Designed as part of the 2018 Children’s Print and Play Game Design Contest.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Plug the Gap (fan expansion for MBT (Second Edition))
description:
NOTE: This game is no longer for sale

***All briefings and maps can be downloaded from the files section of this page for free. The maps should be printed on 12 x 18 inch paper to produce an 11 x 17 inch map.***

Mind the Gap depicts a never fought 1979/80 engagement in the Fulda Gap using Jim Day's and GMT’s MBT Game pitting an M60A3 Tank Company from the 11th Armored Cavalry Regiment “The Black Horse” against a reinforced Motorized Rifle Battalion equipped with BMP-2 and T-64BV Tanks acting as a Regimental Advance Guard which has penetrated the Regiment's screen line while the rest of the Corps moves into position.

The scenario reflects my experience as a Platoon Leader in the gap as a tank and armored cavalry platoon leader and troop XO in the 1st Squadron, 11th ACR stationed in Fulda from January 1977 – December 1979. The game is not balanced although players may balance it as they deem fit. The actual fight was not; we had a healthy respect for the quantity, if not the quality, of the enemy.

The objective for the Soviet Player is to move 51%+ off the map's West Edge while the US player attempts to destroy the enemy advance guard and restore the screen line.

To play the game, you must have a copy of the initial GMT MBT Game. The expansion includes 9 11 x 17 maps scaled at 100 meters per hex (the same scale as the MBT game), a Scenario Briefing, a B Troop Battle Book and a Soviet Battle book with deployment instructions and order of battle listing, and a small errata sheet. The map is based on a period map of the battle area and utilizes contours to depict elevation.

The map will be mailed to customers and the files may be downloaded from this site.

Expansion sets are not required (BAOR, FRG, and the forthcoming Canadian supplement) provide additional vehicle counters as well as leaders. A list of substitute counters is provided to enable the player to field the complete order of battle for both sides or the players can use some of the expansion set vehicles or combine sets to complete the order of battle.

Mind the Gap can be played with two players but may be more interesting if played with up to 6 players on the US side (CO and the five platoon leaders), and 6 on the USSR side (Battalion Commander and 4 company commanders), and a referee.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Iron Magicians: The Search for the Magic Crystals
description:
Iron Magicians is an interactive, pick-your-panel graphic novel for middle grade readers, full of adventure, magic, and fun!

In a steampunk version of nineteenth-century Paris, magical mana crystals have replaced steam and coal to power the machines and gadgets that make the city tick. On the eve of the Universal Exhibition of 1889, France seeks to demonstrate its power by unveiling a new secret weapon: the imposing Eiffel Tower, built with magic by Gustave Eiffel himself. But then disaster strikes--the mana crystals needed to power the tower are discovered missing!

You are a talented student in technomagy, the artful blend of magic and science. You are tasked with the mission of finding enough mana crystals to operate the tower. It's up to you to harness your intelligence, bravery, and skill to fulfill this secret mission.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ediciones MasQueOca, FoxGames, Makaka Editions, Quirk Books

name: Labyrinth Runner
description:
In this in-hand, cards-only solo deck management game, you are a runner who went for a morning jog in the wrong labyrinth. Now, three doors and a rampaging Minotaur stand between you and the escape tunnel at the center of the maze.

Your goal as the player is to find and discard all three door cards from the deck before you discard three Minotaur cards.

Each turn, you'll choose to uncover either the left or right side of the next card in the deck, and the side you reveal will have a symbol that tells you whether you'll need to turn the card you moved before placing it back in the deck. Then choose one of two possible locations to place the card back in the deck, and repeat with the next card until you either escape...or fall to the Minotaur.

With convenient in-hand play, simple but deep deck management, dynamically scaling difficulty, three game modes to try, and easy pausing, this is a deathtrap you'll never want to leave home without!

This game was developed as an entry in the 2019 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest, where it won several awards, including:

#2 Best Cards-Only Game
#3 Most Innovative Mechanism
#7 Best Solitaire Game


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Maze, Memory, Mythology, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building

name: SNAGGIT: The  Speed Reaction Card Game with a Whisker of Bluff
description:
SNAGGIT is a speed reaction game with a whisker of bluff.

SNAG (verb) to catch, grab or seize quickly.
Can you be the quickest to snag as many cards as possible before the game ends. Cards have a unique animal picture, a movement icon (one of 5) and a habitat icon. In each turn there is a challenge. For match challenges you use the icons to snag cards that are the same as or different to habitat or movement. In call out challenges you need to be quick witted. Shout out as you snag cards with the 'biggest', 'quickest' or 'strongest' attributes. This is not just about size or speed but anything that is correct. So a scorpion has the strongest poison compared to a cow, horse, dragonfly and snail.

SNAGGIT is quick, easy and socially interactive for all ages.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game

name: Kanyimajo
description:
“We’re very afraid to enter! The castle of the Colorsnatching Witch is frightening!
The evil witch had attempted stealing the rainbow before and leaving the world colorless – and she hadn’t managed to... until now!
The Kanyitos are trapped inside the castle, and can’t help humankind anymore. Marahuero, the witch’s cat, helped us get in and told us how to save them. Now it’s too late to turn back. We have only three days to rescue them and get away!”

Kanyimajo is a card game in which you’ll be trying to free the Kanyitos and Kanyikats from the claws of the evil Coloursnatching Witch (Bruja Robacolores).
You’ll have to collect kokeshi-doll amulets, jewels and flowers of many colours to break the witch’s spell, and confide with the Amaterasu and Izanami to break free.
Only the boldest may manage to win the game – that is, if they don’t come across the evil witch thrice!

—description from the publisher

In the Kanyito universe, Kanyitos are creatures which control feelings through the use of color.

The evil Coloursnatching Witch, Kuroi Majo, has decided to kidnap them to make the world devoid of color and positive feelings. Marahuero, the witch’s cat, has decided to aid you in rescuing them.

To set a Kanyito free, you’ll need to find amongst the cards an amulet, a flower and a Kanyito of the same color.
Some of the Kanyitos have been transformed into Kanyikats, Kanyito cats, for which you’ll have to find a jewel and a kokeshi-doll instead.

The evil Witch will be chasing you, hidden in the deck. If you come across her three times, she’ll banish you from the castle!

name: Nyanko Pirates
description:
In にゃんこパイレーツ (Nyanko Pirates), you are a bunch of adventurous pussycat pirates that go on a journey along the shores of multiple islands where danger and treasures await you. Will you dare fight for treasures by yourself, or will you take someone else with you? Two adventurers' worth of shields and swords might be of great help to succeed in beating the danger, but it also means sharing everything you find!

•••

君は有名なにゃんこパイレーツになりたいにゃ！このため、準備をして、冒険へ出て、宝を集めて、にゃんこの世界で最も金持ちを目指すにゃ！ただ、色々な危険が待ってるにゃ。冒険へ出る前に、1人で行くか、他のパイレーツと協力して2人で行くか、よく考えないといけにゃい！さあ、賢く計画して、冒険へ出発だにゃ！

On your turn, you will roll the three original dice. These dice will give you different opportunities like gathering shields and swords, and you will need those if you want to face the dangers between you and the beautiful treasures these islands have to offer! The dice will also let you know the minimum number of dangers you will have to fight to reach the treasures. Each card from the Island deck of cards is either a danger, or an item that you won't be able to get in any other way. If you succeed in beating these dangers, you will get all the treasures! But beware, going by yourself might be very dangerous. Should you invite someone else to go along with you? If so, you have to keep in mind that you won't be able to keep all the treasures for yourself... yes, you will have to share with your lucky partner! Oh, and remember, failing while going through these adventures that await you also means that all your competitors will be able to steal the treasures you put to safety during your run!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Blume: Tools
description: Mini expansion given to backers during the Blume Kickstarter. Adds 8 unique tool cards and glove tokens.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Big 6
description:
Big 6 is the fast-thinking bidding game.

Rattle off your answers in this rapid response topics game. You've got just 30 seconds to give the number of answers you have predicted and successfully bid for - the tactic is whether to bid high or low. Dare you outbid your rivals and go for the Big 6? Fail to reach you target and you blow the lot.

If you match your prediction you win a card of the chosen category - the categories are Words, Numbers, People, Places, Things, Random. Collect six of one category card or one of all six to win.

-description from designer

name: King's Gambit
description:
Once upon a time, the King decided to talk a nice walk through the forest. As the day drew on, the King wandered deeper and deeper into the forest until suddenly he found himself lost and separated from his Guards. "I'm lost! I'm lost!" shouted the King. The King's Guards heard the King's cry for help, but they too were lost in the ever changing forest. They searched frantically for hours for the King, but to no avail. They were not the only ones in the forest that day searching for the King for unbeknownst to them...there were Assassins afoot!
