On his turn the player must pick-up all Puppy Stuff cards from 1 Location and redistribute all the cards in a clockwise order from the Location where he picked them up.

Of the Puppy Stuff card(s) picked up in a Location, exactly 1 Puppy Stuff card must be dropped in the next Location clockwise, the next Puppy Stuff card in the next Location clockwise and so on until there are no more Puppy Stuff cards to drop

If the player's Order card pattern now matches with the Puppy Stuff cards in front of him, he has succeeded in his ordering task and that player scores the Order card by putting it to the side and drawing another Order card.

The first player to score 5 Order cards wins the game.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Evangelion Card Game: EV-01
description:
Evangelion Card Game Shinji Ikari & Rei Ayanami Set EV-01

EVANGELION Card Game is a compilation featuring EVANGELION!
Choose your favorite characters to build a deck or play to win with a powerful, custom deck!
For fans of EVANGELION and fans of card games and board games alike, this is a card game that everyone will enjoy!

Game System: Chrono Clash System
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go.
Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!

-From the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Where in the World?
description: Place the deck of 50 cards facedown in the middle. One player begins as the guessers. Another players draws a card from the pile and gives clues. There are three clues on each card. The first is the hardest level and is worth 3 points. The second is medium difficulty level and is worth 2 points. The last is the easiest level and is worth 1 point. The questions are asked in order and the guesser and can try to guess the location after each clue. If the guesser guesses correctly, they score points according to the number of clues needed (1=3, 2=2, 3=1). If the location is not guessed, the player does not score points. The next player then becomes the guesser and a new card is drawn. The first player to score 15 points wins.

name: Match 5 Trivia Game
description:
The lead player chooses a match 5 card from their hand of 7 cards and reads it aloud to the other players.
All players (including the lead player) then secretly write their 5 answers down on the score sheet.
Players should have their answers written within a couple of minutes. Install a timer if you see fit.
The lead player reads off his or her answers one at a time.
Each time a player matches the lead player they get a point. The lead player need only match a single player to receive a point (5 points max).

—description from the rulebook

name: The Hussite Trilogy Adventure Game: Tower of Fools
description:
Hussite Trilogy the Adventure Game is a strategy board game, in which 2-4 players will test their tactical prowess in a plenty of missions. Explore two game modes (Adventure Mode and Competitive Mode) and embark on a journey in medieval Europe full of fantasy!

HTAG is a board game adaptation of Andrzej Sapkowski's novel series. Events told in the books and the game happen in Year Of Our Lord 1420 in Silesia and Bohemia, torn apart by conflicts of political, religious and utterly private nature. In HTAG you can recruit a company of heroes known from the novel and pursue dangerous quests. Adventure Mode allows you to recreate events told in the novel (or even to change their course) - follow the footsteps of Reynevan and his friends! Competitive Mode will give you an opportunity to demand a trial by combat and challenge other players in several missions, i.e.: rescuing a prisoner, treasure hunt or drinking contest at a local fair.

Gameplay in HTAG is based on a character activation system and d6 rolls, which are supplemented by decks of Adventure Cards. Both players alternate in activating their respective characters, performing actions in order to acquire objectives. Opposing teams meet in combat based on an intuitive system in which characters' Attributes are tested through d6 rolls. Players can also strengthen their attacks or weaken the enemy with Adventure Cards played from their hands. Soon a cautious player will discover a potential of combining characters' Abilities with their faction's Adventure Decks. This knowledge will be your power over friends and foes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Lee at Gettysburg
description:
The battle of Gettysburg is the most famous of America’s blood soaked 4 year long Civil War. Although the historical battle took place over 3 days, the game should take no more than an hour to complete.

Lee at Gettysburg is the first of a series of small introductory level Civil War board wargames that gradually build in complexity. They are intended to serve as an introduction for younger players while still providing a quick and fun little game for more experienced players.

name: Tanto Cuore: Winter Romance – Promo Card Set #5
description:
With the release of Winter Romance, Arclight released five promo cards which included three extended art cards, a new private maid, and a new concept: an alternate text card.

PR39: Leopold Niebling (Extended Art)
PR40: Beverly Snowfeldt (Extended Art)
PR41: Monica Lindolph (New - Private Maid)
PR42: Friends (Extended Art)
PR45: Do-Over (Alternate Text - Drama)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: SMAKdraw
description:
SMAKdraw is not your average drawing game. It's a SMAKtalking drawing and guessing game that promotes fun and interaction.

What is SMAKdraw?
SMAK a wordcard onto the Guesser's back using our special High 5 Hand.
Flip the timer, and everyone else draws.
Times up! The guesser turns around, and the SMAKtalking begins!
The Guesser chooses the most and least helpful drawings and then reveals his guess. If the guess is correct then the guesser scores along with the chosen drawer(s). If incorrect the chosen drawer(s) have a chance to give a one word hint to help the guesser. If correct, then those players and the Guesser score 1 point each. The player or players that drew a picture that helped the least can defend and explain how their drawing resembles the wordcard. The guesser and all other players become the Jury. The Jury votes and 1 point is awarded to each drawing or drawings that received 50% or more in favor. The players that had no chance for a point in this round can elect to earn a Bonus point and compete in the challenge that is rolled with the special dice.

The Goal of the game is for every player to be involved at all times and for everyone to interact and share laughs.

This game was designed to include mechanics that High 5 has used in interactive team building events since 2001.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Voting

name: Roll Crawl
description:
The land is in peril! Two brave heroes, along with their trusty companion, must take on enemies of progressing difficulty, along with a challenging final boss, using only their wits and their abilities. Each player rolls 3 dice for their character, using push-your-luck mechanics to try to activate their most powerful abilities, or settle for whatever damage they can get, depending on their strategy.

Roll Crawl is a 1 to 2 player print and play game, with two heroes trying to activate their own abilities to reduce the health of their opponents to zero. They can forego activating their own abilities and combine their dice to active the abilities of their companion. But whatever you do, deal as much damage as you can. Your opponents are ready to hit back, with more dice than you. The more health they have, the more dice they roll, so players must be strategic about deciding when it is the right time to push their luck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stunt Kites
description:
It is a breezy beautiful day, so grab your kite and show off your skills. You and your opponent will be flying dual-line stunt kites, pulling off spectacular tricks in a timed routine. Maintain control of the two strings and use the wind to maneuver your kite. Put on the best show by chaining together tricks and you’ll win the judges over.

Stunt Kites is a 2 player worker placement micro game. Use your hands to push and pull your kite into position to perform tricks and earn points. The player that earns the most points by the end of the game wins.

The game is played in rounds and on their turn a player places one of their two Hand cards on a central Pilot card. These Hand cards act as workers and can block out actions from the other player. The placement of the worker allows movement and rotation of a player's Kite card on a grid. If the kite is in the required position and orientation on their grid, they can perform a trick earning them points. Players can plan to do more tricks but must be careful to not get caught with unperformed tricks at the end of the game as those result in penalties.

When there are no Trick cards left in the Trick deck, the Final Trick is revealed. When either player lands that trick, they claim it and the game ends immediately. The player that scored the most points from tricks after applying penalties wins.

—description from the designer

name: Tropic Race
description:
Get your monkey racers to safety from the erupting volcano, by crossing the dangerous river, and avoiding the hungry lion.

By rolling a 10-sided die, players get to move their own team of 4-6 monkeys towards the safe space, or move the lion on it's search for a monkey snack, or move the turtles, ferrying monkeys along the river. The game is won by the first player to get their whole team of monkeys to safety.

Tropic Race is the childrens version of the family game Arctic Race by danspil released in 2020.

Tropic Race is a new take on traditional roll and move games like Pachisi, with a lot of player interaction, and the choice to take different paths along the race, some more risky than others.

-description from designer
mechanics: Bias, Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Death Cube
description:
In Death Cube, you are trying not to be crushed by blocks — or to crush people with blocks — depending on your role that turn.

The game takes place in a 4x5 grid that bears the numbers 1-20. Each turn, five spaces are covered on this grid based on whichever of the forty puzzle cards is chosen at random. If you are the "organizer", you are then presented with two pentominoes — i.e., five connected cubes — from a set of five pentominoes, and you have 24 seconds in which to decide how to fit these two pentominoes into the remaining 15 spaces of the grid. (The two are chosen at random from four possible choices, which means the game includes 160 total puzzles.)

If you're not the organizer, then you are a "participant", and you want to find a safe square among those 15 spaces where you will not be crushed by a block. Some squares will definitely be safe based on the pentominoes in the challenge, whereas other squares will be safe only depending on how the organizer decides to place the blocks. When you've made your choice, grab the numbered tile matching your chosen space so that no one else can take it.

name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Secret Cabal 2020 Promo Pack
description:
Promo pack of five new cards released for "The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast is at Full Froth in 2020!" Kickstarter campaign.

Unconfirmed: They are added to the side and first come, first serve.

Gloomshroom Cave
Troll's Pantry
Lost in the Mine
Dungeon
Styx Power
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Nautical
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Werewolf: The Apocalypse – RETALIATION
description:
A new violent, mature and Visceral roleplaying board gameboard game set in the World of Darkness.

Intended for solo play as well as up to four players, Werewolf: The Apocalypse — RETALIATION takes place in Yosemite Valley, following a deadly battle that left your pack all but decimated. With only a full lunar cycle to recover, rebuild your Caern, and prepare for your final revenge against Wyrm entities, your choices will weigh heavily upon the fate of your characters.

The game includes immersive branching scenarios, intense combats, mesmerizing investigations, beautiful minis, and a profound roleplaying experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Monopoly: Horses and Ponies
description:
This is a re-implementation of classic Monopoly, where players buy and develop sections of the board as they pass. In this game, the places on the board are horse breeds, and the player can build stalls and stables to develop their purchased sections of the board.

Board comes with special player tokens: Riding boot, Horseshoe, Feed bucket, Wheel barrow, Jockey cap, Horse brush.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Who's The C***?
description:
Step right up, ladies and gentlemen, and grab yourself the party game of the year!

Can you guess Who's The Cunt by process of elimination?
There are big cunts, little cunts, rude cunts, hairy cunts, bald cunts and old cunts. Cunts in hats, cunts in glasses, red, puffy cunts and cunts that could definitely use a trim.

We've got 24 glorious cunts for you to choose from!
Folks, we've got more cunts than you can poke a stick at. One thing's for sure - they're slippery cunts, and it's going to takes some real detective work to sniff them out!

—description from the designer

An adults-only party game remarkably similar to Guess Who.
Players attempt to determine which character the other player is playing as - All while hoping they don't get discovered themselves!
The game presents itself as being quite quality - Which is surprising given the nature of the humour.

The game was released in Australia early 2021.

—user summary

name: Geek Out! Video Games
description:
Geek Out! is the game of mind-challenging fun that finds out once and for all which player is the reigning geek authority on your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends and family.

Geek Out! Video Games will have you and your friends geeking out about your favorite video games!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Trivia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Happy Hopping
description:
What a hustle and bustle! In Happy Hopping, the frogs jump into the ponds left and right. Everyone is on the hunt for colorful mosquitoes. Whose frogs can catch the most of them?

Over the course of eight rounds, the players try to complete tasks to collect chips. There are speed rounds, in which you need to be quicker than the other players, and normal rounds, in which all frogs may perform one jump. If the goal of a round is met, players gain frog chips – with the fastest players gaining a ladybug chip on top. They show mosquitoes in different colors. After the last round, a scoring tile determines which mosquito color scores points. Whoever has the most mosquitoes of that color, wins.

Happy Hopping cleverly integrates the game box into the game and jumping aids makes it easier for younger players to perform good jumps.

—description from the publisher

name: Desafío Vocablos
description:
A creative game to make words by combining letters and syllables responding to different "challenges".

Three forms of play: "challenge", "challenge sung" and "challenge yourself". In all the modes you will have to find words, depending on the challenge, to get many points. It can also be played in solo mode.

name: クロ密 (Kuromitsu)
description:
In クロ密 (Kuromitsu), the players are creating a hybrid word-search/crossword puzzle grid, and trying to score the most points.

Each player is given a different colored pencil, and a set of categories is laid out in a circle. After some initial seeding, a player rolls a die, which determines the category of word to be added. Then, in real-time, the first player to shout out a word in the category determines the word that will be written by each player on their board. Afterwards, the papers are passed to the left, and the process is repeated.

Once a player is unable to write a word on their sheet the game ends. Each player scores points based upon how many times their colored pencil has written letters on each sheet.

name: まじかる☆ベーカリー 今日から財閥っ (Magical ☆ Bakery: A conglomerate from today)
description:
Build up your conglomerate of shops that will propel you to victory

Each turn, players use dice and resources to build buildings that offer them various rewards to help them progress their conglomerate. Once a player reaches 20 points, the last round is triggered, and the player with the most points is the winner

The game revolves around resource gathering, clever combo creation (using the buildings), and dice manipulation to help you to be the ultimate victor

Players receive 2 dice (one character ability gets 3 dice)
They then use the dice to either take a card, or roll the dice to use the number to build a card
They can also use a dice to gather resources
Some buildings let them change / manipulate the dice values.

name: Golden Journal Number 37: Heavy Metal – German and British Heavy Tanks
description:
The giant drawing-board tanks of Britain and Germany clash on the battlefields of 1946 Belgium. Featuring Panzer Maus, the Tiger III, the Black Prince and the Tortoise. With 49 die-cut and mounted pieces and seven new scenarios.

Published in Golden Journal Number 37.

To play all of the scenarios requires:

Maps from:
Elsenborn Ridge
Liberation 1944

Pieces from:
Elsenborn Ridge
Liberation 1944
An Army at Dawn
Fire in the Steppe

This takes place in the Avalanche Press alternate history "Long War" setting.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Православни Хероји (Orthodox Heroes)
description:
Players play alternately. They use their deck of cards made up of saints, buildings and prayer cards.
There is also a common group of cards that bring negative points and they are activated as soon as the condition is met - sins.
By activating the blessings of the saints as well as by fulfilling the conditions of the buildings and prayers, points are collected. The first player to collect 100 points wins.

—user summary

"Orthodox Heroes" is a new social card game. The goal of this game is to achieve faith and get acquainted with the Orthodox elements. For all ages.

—description from the designer (translated)

"Православни Хероји" су нова друштвена картична игра. Циљ ове игре је постизање вере и упознавање са православнм елементима. За све узрасте.
—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Timer, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Income

name: Gather Round! Alice in the Wonder Museum
description:
"Gather the characters from Alice's story and start your own little funny tale!"

In Gather Round! Alice in the Wonder Museum, each player has a hand of cards featuring small and large portraits of seven characters from the books by Lewis Carrol. The game has a whimsical graphic design, utilizing the original illustrations by John Tenniel.

The goal is to have a hand of five cards where every small portrait matches a large portrait. Upon building a complete hand, the player scores a point for each small portrait in their hand. The first player to 20 points wins.

Each player keeps four cards in their hand. On your turn, you draw from the deck or the discards of other players. Trying to build a set of matching cards in hand is a puzzle, with each card having one large portrait and one to three small portraits. If your turn ends without creating a completed hand, discard one card face up in front of you. Be careful, because other players will be able to choose from your discards, but you cannot.
mechanics: Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Kleine Fische ganz groß!
description:
Boardgame following basic rules and theme of the Card Game Kleine Fische.

25 randomly drawn cards, which are either fish cards or cave cards, are laid out face down on a game board. The aim of the game is for the players to score the most points by collecting fish and treasure.
The players diving through the sea, starting from the boat adjacent to the playing field, which can be moved as first step. The diver (players figure)can always move to neighbouring fields, but must keep to the swimming direction. As soon as the diver reaches a fish card, he uncovers it and decides whether to stop or continue swimming.
If he continues to swim, the next fish card must be turned over. You have to stop your turn as soon as a fish type is revealed twice. You then lose both of this type.
There are also caves to be explored. You need to uncovered as many fish as the number on the cave card indicates, before exploring it. If this is successful, the diver receives the advantage of the cave card.
As soon as you end (freely or forced to), the 2nd phase is carried out. In this phase, the octopus is moved depending on the number of octopus symbols on the revealed fish cards. As soon as the octopus lands on a field with a diver, it tries to steal a fish from the diver. This is done like in the origiginal card game by a setting a number of cards and rolling a dice from the active player. In case of success (equal or higher the number) the octopus robes this number of cards for the active player. With a -1 he loses 1 card, which he has to give to the robbed player.

The active player now gets all cards which are open.
The places are refilled from a stack. The game ends when this is not possible for all empty fields.
From the fish cards only the highest card from each fish type counts. The points from the treasure cards and from the fish cards are added.
The player with the highest points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Blast from the Past
description:
The 80s were a decade of big hair, MTV, video games, outrageous clothing, and fun. The Valley Falls High School “Class of '86” is having a Blast From the Past reunion to relive the glory days of their youth and see old friends that they’ve lost touch with over the years. The reunion is a roaring success until the principal is found strangled to death in his office. Only someone attending the reunion could have killed him. But who? And why? Take a nostalgic step back into the 80s, find out who killed the principal of Valley Falls High School, and experience a Blast From the Past!

Difficulty Rating – 8/10

name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares RPG
description:
Welcome to Tanares, a high-fantasy campaign setting for the 5th Edition of the world’s greatest roleplaying game. With almost 1,000 pages, the book set features an abundantly detailed world, four unique, bold, extensively playtested new classes, four original races, hundreds of unique illustrations, and hundreds of subclasses, spells, feats, and backgrounds — plus more. Working also as an expansion to Arena: The Contest and Tanares Adventures, you can experience the power of these new features as new classes, sub-classes, and races as the miniatures also come with everything you need to play them on our board games too.

Behold the majesty of the new Gold Dragon and the new, fearsome Penumbral Dragon, ready for the fight on Boss Vs. Boss mode, found on the Dragon Collection Expansion. Meet the warlords from Arena: The Contest, in new, exclusive miniatures, complete with new cards. Face the terror of the new foes from the Penumbral Plane and complete your 3d scenery collection with the new Scenario Pack.

In Tanares, whenever war was waged, the bloodshed summoned a powerful, frenzied Dragon that buried the civilizations involved, resetting History and forever changing the landscape. This dystopian world is kept together and on a short leash by an Empire that forbids large armed gatherings. Under this decree, and without many high-level adventurers out there, your Team may become one of the most powerful units in the world. Build an Adventure Team Sheet, earn Career Points and level up, design a headquarters and flag.

Effect real change to all aspects of the scenario, be it with your 5E party or through the Solo Mode, a 300+ card deck that lets 1-4 players live and play the Adventure without a GM! Become a Hero, change the world's fate, and take your game to the next level.

name: Паўстанцы (Rebels)
description:
Historical card game which helps you to return back to the times of 1863 Kościuszko Uprising in Belarus. You can take either a role of one of the famous persons (Kościuszko himself, Valery Urubleŭski or Mikhail Myravyov) or ordinary Belarusan citizen who still can impact the rebellion progress.

The game is based upon people interactions, pointing out and defending your opinion. Cheating, bluffing, deceiving and butchering one another is a player's right.

Translated from publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Spell Spud
description:
A long forgotten power has reemerged, a conduit of great magic and ruin. Though dangerous and hot to the touch, you cannot resist the chance to control it. Willing wizards, are you ready to duel your friends to emerge victorious and unlock the secrets hidden within...the Spell Spud???

Spell Spud is a 2-6 player elimination game in which players pass around the hot potato while trying to avoid burning their hands. Cast spells, trap your foes, and be the last wizard standing to gain victory in this easy to learn, but surprisingly deep, card game!

Each player chooses a unique pair of hands to represent themselves. When it’s your turn, you get to choose which hand you hold the potato with. If a Hand is burned, it’s flipped to the ‘Burned’ side. If it’s burned again, it’s out. With two hands, players have a chance to come back if they’ve had a rough start.

The potato is the core of the game. Each player starts their turn with it in their possession, allowing them access to their actions while also placing them at risk of being burned.

Players can take two actions during their turn. You may use an action to draw from the Spell Deck, which holds several useful spells to defend yourself from harm or place your foes into dangerous situations. But, it also costs an action to cast most spells, so think ahead to utilize your actions most effectively.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Blabel: Language Pack
description: 36 new language cards that add flavor to the game, bringing different sounding languages and 288 new possible dictionaries.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Word Game

name: Tokyo Highway 2 + 4 Kit
description:
This is an upgrade kit for 2-player Tokyo Highway (2016) and 4-player Tokyo Highway (2018) to make a 6-player version of Tokyo Highway.

Adds 2 extra buildings and sets of 10 green and purple cars.

Requires the road and pillar components from the 2-player version and all the components of the 4-player version to play. Or just use as alternative colored cars for your 2-4 players games!

name: Soldier Emperor: Byzantium Eternal
description:
Our 40th issue tells an unusual tale of alternative history. The Byzantine Empire met its end in 1453, when the Ottoman Turks stormed its ancient capital, Constantinople, and the last emperor died fighting somewhere amidst the carnage. A few outposts would fall over the coming decades, and the Empire would never rise again.

In Byzantium Eternal, we add the Byzantines to our Soldier Emperor game, a Byzantine Empire that never fell. The Empire faced long odds in 1453, but it had miraculously survived even worse odds before. While it’s indeed improbably that the Empire could have survived another 350 years, it was just as improbable for it to have muddled through the previous 350.

name: Chapter 3: The Tinker's Trinket
description:
An escape room experience from the Curious Correspondence Club. The first season is broken into 12 chapters, of which, The Tinker's Trinket is the third.

You will work through a series of puzzles to solve each chapter at your own pace with a digital hint system available if needed.

In this chapter, you take a trip to the Open Bazaar Trading Commission and meet a mysterious tinker with a peculiar trinket. He has promised to share a secret with you if you can figure out his name.

You must repair the trinket, discover his name, and gain access to the knowledge he has to share to help your hunt for the 12 lost shards.

---

Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

name: Kinh Lược 1698
description:
Kinh Luoc is a tile laying game for 2-4 players. You are a Cai Bo - an officer supporting Nguyen Huu Canh on his mission to the South. You will be given rights to construct ports and cities, reclaiming forests and plowing fields for immigrants. Do your job well and you will have the love of people.

Summary of game

The game takes place in 3 rounds, each round will have build phase and reward phase. You will try to earn as many points as you can , the player with the most VP at the end of round 3 is the winner.

To set up, each randomly takes 5 tiles from a set of 15 tiles in his color. On your turn, you play a single tile to the table if it meets 2 requirements: connect with a same type building already existing and connect with at least 1 tile of another player. (These conditions may be reviewed separately). The game will be played from left to right. After each player has played 4 project tiles, they discard face up the 5th tile and end the round
At the end of the round, players will collect VPs

Special tile: TAX POST TILE. It is a special project tile as it can connect with all 4 types of Building Zone. When a Tax Post is placed to the table it will collect 1 VP from each project tile that connects with it

At the end of the game, players are awarded a bonus point for:
Connect every project tile of them on the City (5 VPs)
Discard Tax Post (3 VPs)

—description from the publisher (translated)

“Kinh Lược là trò chơi đặt thẻ dành cho 2-4 người chơi. Bạn sẽ là một Cai bộ hỗ trợ Nguyễn Hữu Cảnh đi vào phía Nam. Bạn sẽ được trao quyền xây dựng, quy hoạch các trấn, phủ, khai hoang rừng và phát ruộng cho người dân. Hãy làm tốt công việc của mình và bạn sẽ có được sự tin tưởng của người dân

Tóm tắt trò chơi

Trò chơi diễn ra trong 3 vòng, mỗi vòng sẽ có giai đoạn xây dựng và giai đoạn nhận thưởng. Bạn sẽ cần kiếm được nhiều điểm nhất có thể, người chơi có nhiều VPs nhất ở cuối vòng 3 là người chiến thắng.

Để chuẩn bị, mỗi người lấy ngẫu nhiên 5 thẻ từ bộ 15 thẻ có màu của mình. Trong lượt của mình, bạn đặt một thẻ duy nhất lên bàn và phải đáp ứng được 2 yêu cầu: kết nối với khu vực phát triển cùng loại đã có và kết nối với ít nhất 1 ô của người chơi khác. (Các điều kiện này có thể được xem xét riêng). Chơi lần lượt từ trái sang phải. Sau khi mỗi người chơi đặt 4 thẻ phát triển của mình, họ loại bỏ thẻ thứ 5 còn lại và kết thúc vòng chơi
Vào cuối vòng, người chơi sẽ thu thập VPs

Thẻ đặc biệt: THẺ ĐỒN THUẾ. Nó là một loại thẻ đặc biệt vì nó có thể kết nối với tất cả 4 loại Khu vực xây dựng. Khi một thẻ Đồn Thuế được xuống, nó sẽ thu thập 1 VP từ mỗi ô dự án kết nối với nó

Khi kết thúc trò chơi, người chơi được thưởng điểm cho:
Kết nối mọi ô dự án của chúng trên Thành phố (5 VP)
Bỏ Bưu điện (3 VP)”

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Asuryani Cards – Aircraft and Aces
description:
Keep track of your Asuryani aircraft, weapons and upgrades, ground assets, and two Ace pilots along with their unique aircraft with this essential reference card pack.

This pack contains the following cards:

21 Asuryani Aircraft cards make ideal references for your Nightwing and Phoenix Bomber aircraft. Also includes the ‘Shadow Reaver’ and ‘Crimson Warrior’ named aircraft

23 Aircraft Upgrade cards (including Holo-field, Spirit Stone, Mindsight, and Star Engines)

35 Aircraft Weapon cards (including Twin Bright Lances, Twin Scatter Lasers, Twin Missile Launchers, Twin Starcannon, Twin Pulse Lasers, Nightfire Plasma Missile Array, and Nightfire Krak Missile Array)

4 Ground Defence cards (including Pulsar Platform and Night Spinner Platform)

8 Asuryani Ace cards (including Aleth Neth and Jin Lyaia and 6 additional Ace Ability cards)

name: Stella: Dixit Universe – 5 "Personality" card Promo
description:
Promo card Given with the game at launch.
all "Name Cards" feature a real or fictional personality.

*Sherlock Holmes / Aretha Franklin
*Pelé / Mulan
*Cthulhu / Cleopatra
*Gandhi / Mona Lisa
*Walt Disney / Marie Curie

name: King's Colour
description:
King's Color is a chess variant, played on a tri-colored hex-hex board. Each king is confined to a 3x3 castle surrounded by a wall. The other pieces are rooks or bishops, which promote to queens. The big twist to this game is that when the king moves onto a different color, all the rooks become bishops, and all the bishops on the new color become rooks.

Capturing is limited to pieces inside the castle, which influences the game to be oriented around checkmate rather than attrition.

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Robot Revolution
description:
Expansion contains:

- 19 Miniatures: 1x Intergalactic Ninja Assassin Claptrap, 4x Kamikaze Claptraps, 6x Punk-Stabby Claptraps, 8x Partisan Claptraps
- 40 new double sided game hexes
- All game cards needed to play
- Bounty scenarios
- Crush the Revolution campaign

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Pe Tang 1900
description: Pe Tang 1900 is a solitaire wargame depicting the 57 day siege of the Catholic Cathedral in Peking by the Boxer rebels in 1900. The Cathedral, packed with fleeing Catholic Chinese, was defended by 12 Italian sailors under the command of Sottotenente di Vascello Angelo Olivieri and about 40 French soldiers under the command of the Enseigne de Vaisseau Paul Henry. Their courage and resilience managed to save many lives until the relief of the Cathedral by Japanese soldiers on August 16th, 1900. The player’s mission is to defend the Cathedral and resist up to the end of turn 12, when the relief column will arrive.

name: Infernal Machine: Dawn of Submarine Warfare
description:
The time: late evening
The date: 17 February 1864
The Place: Breach Inlet, South Carolina

Standing in the submarine’s forward hatch, Lieutenant George E. Dixon pulled his cap down and tightened up his oilskin watch coat. The February sea cut through to his bones. This was the third night he ventured from behind Battery Marshall on Sullivan’s Island, and his seven-man crew was grumpy from having had no luck spotting, let alone attacking even one of the Yankee warships blockading Charleston harbor.

Dixon fingered the dented $20 gold piece in his trouser pocket. It was a gift from Queenie, his sweetheart, a keepsake that already earned its place aboard ship. A few months earlier at a wooded tangle of a place called Shiloh, the coin stopped a minie ball from shattering his leg. The dent reminded him how fickle fate and fortune are in this war, and it reminded him of home. He had that coin engraved “Shiloh April 6th, 1862. My life Preserver” and added his initials “G.E.D.”, so sure was he of the coin’s power.
Well, tonight that power was napping. Frustrated and cold, Dixon took one last look to the southeast through his telescope. The weather wasn’t likely to improve and he hoped that this would be the night he and the crew of the “CSS Hunley” would strike a blow against the Yankee blockade.

Here now… was that a light?
There!
And once again, low and to the south-southeast. A light!

He rapped the coin against the hull to startle the men. “Look sharp,” he muttered. Then, in a voice low and tense, he said “Look sharp and prepare to crank!”

Game Overview

Infernal Machine: Dawn of Submarine Warfare is a solitaire board game that casts the player in the role of inventor/entrepreneur in mid-19th century America. The game is set during a historical moment when the business environment has gotten rather dynamic – it is the tumultuous landscape of the American Civil War. The player’s task is to design, build, and put to use a submarine during that war.

Infernal Machine can be played either in scenario form or campaign. In a campaign, you can choose the city or port where the project’s machine shop will be located. Since construction materials and labor costs money, your role as entrepreneur comes into play as you seek out Investors to join your team; their cash will provide the funds that help your Fishboat take shape. As Inventor, your design gives form and substance to the size and shape of your submarine, and to its capabilities. Will it carry a snorkel? Will its prow be an armored ram? Will it have dive planes? Will it push a spar torpedo? Will it be powered by the muscle strength of a crew cranking the propeller or will you install a boiler engine?

To bring blueprints to life, you will need to hire Mechanics, whose engineering expertise keeps the machine’s construction on schedule. Once assembly is complete, your Mechanics can join the crew, using their repair capability to keep the machinery and the vessel running smoothly. Journeymen can also lend a hand on the shop floor and inside the Fishboat, while Sailors bring nautical know-how as well as sheer brawn.

While that machine shop is busy with the submarine’s construction, the game reminds you that the war drags on and it is an unstable business environment. Prices for materials and labor fluctuate. Current events can affect your construction schedule and your machine shop’s performance. Public, and even personal circumstances may force your hand. You may decide to push your Fishboat into the water before you feel it is optimal, or push your crew into battle with little training.

In this game you assign crew, taking their characteristics into consideration, such as morale, strength, engineering expertise. Your first mission will most likely be a simple affair, propelling the infernal machine forward, submerging, turning about, and returning to the surface. It will garner valuable experience that improves your crew’s Training Level. But even that simple affair could prove treacherous. Will the Fishboat drift? Will it sink and become irretrievable? Will your crew panic in the dark as they breathe in the exhalation of their comrades in that cramped machine? Will you be forced to evacuate the crew and salvage the Fishboat later? Will the crew survive the ordeal?

Later missions will be directed at the enemy. In this game, you may play either side, Union or Confederate. There are a variety of missions and targets. Will your Fishboat be aimed at the Federal blockade? Will it pull a mine at the end of a rope, or push a torpedo at the end of a spar? Will the crew survive contact with the enemy? Will they survive their own weapon’s detonation? Perhaps the nature of the mission will be quite different. Will you carry a spy into enemy territory? Will your Fishboat unload a raiding party?

Secrecy is vital. Will you send your machine out under a moonless sky? That will help conceal crew and machine but it will make navigation difficult. Will you limit the number of machinists and investors, thereby reducing the chance of rumor or gossip leaking out? Too few and you compromise your machine’s capabilities. Your Fishboat’s chances are much better if that machine is kept a secret, but it is a cantankerous machine that will punish mistakes.

A successful mission means your coffers will be filled with prize money. This is a capitalist’s war, and the War Department is offering juicy bounties. In contrast, there are many ways to fail. Coming back without making contact with the enemy is one way, but it could be far worse. Will you add the names of your crew to the Rolls of the Missing?

Scenarios and Campaign

Historical scenarios use only part of the rules to present such events as the CSS Hunley’s successful attack outside Charleston Harbor in 1864. It was the first time a submarine sank its target, a landmark event in military history. The heart of the game is the campaign, which allows you to design and build your Infernal Machine, select a crew, train that crew, and perform missions against the enemy. You manage funds and personnel, and navigate the fortunes of war as well as the waterways in enemy territory. A scenario will take approximately two hours to play while a campaign can last several gaming sessions as it spans the calendar from 1861 to the end of the war in 1865.

Sequence of Play

Each monthly turn gives you an opportunity to recruit personnel (Investors, Mechanics, Journeymen, or Sailors), each represented by a deck of cards. Each recruit comes with one or more benefits as well as costs or drawbacks. An Investor, for example, may be a generous provider of funds, but he may insist on being the captain of the ship. Does he know what he’s doing?! A Sailor may prove to be strong and cool under pressure, but he may be clumsy. Will that clumsiness jeopardize his crewmates?

Each turn also provides you an opportunity to work on your Fishboat. You purchase Bulkheads and other major sections of the submarine, each represented by tiles. They cost funds and require engineering expertise to incorporate into a seaworthy vessel. You also purchase a variety of mechanisms as you make decisions about the capability of your Fishboat.

Recruitment and Building is followed by the passage of time when the Month marker is moved forward on the calendar. Debts must be paid, if you have any, and you must check the Fortunes of War table to see if something unexpected happens that month. Will prices rise? Will one of your Journeymen get engaged and leave your shop? Will the enemy shell the wharf where your Fishboat is waiting to go into action? Will you get an offer to use your machine shop to make parts for the War Department, giving you a contract and additional funds? Will the enemy capture the town, forcing you to move to another location? Each month has its own table of random events, and there is one set used when playing Union and another when playing Confederate. This adds to the feel of the historical experience while also increasing replayability. The Confederate experience is quite different from playing the Union. The latter is an industrial business environment while the Confederacy’s economy gradually spirals into oblivion.

Each month you have the option to finish the turn by taking your seaworthy Fishboat into action. There are four Action Boards in the box, each providing its own unique historical and nautical conditions (Charleston, Mobile, New Orleans, and the James River from City Point to Richmond).

You setup a mission by establishing meteorological conditions on the Action Board (drift direction, drift intensity, visibility, and weather), and assign each crewman a position inside your Fishboat. Will you call off the mission because the current is too strong? Will you wait for a better opportunity, or will you push ahead despite the risk?

Your submarine will move from one space to the next as it executes its mission. During a mission you assign jobs to each crewman (crank, repair, rally, or operating a mechanism). This is new technology and the submarine is an untried machine, so malfunctions are likely and you will assign crew to manage and hopefully repair them. In many cases, just getting out there and locating a target is a victory of sorts, and getting the crew back home can feel like a triumph. Of course, your mandate is to do more than make contact with the enemy and survive. To gain prize money, you will have to prove your machine’s efficacy against the enemy. It’s an old story: higher the risk, greater the reward.

If you manage to navigate your machine and crew to make contact with its target, action shifts to the Tactical Board. There, the Fishboat closes in and you hope conditions are right so that it remains concealed. Decisions you made leading up to this tense moment have put your crew in a good position, or maybe in a bad one. In either case, history is watching.

Game Components
4 Actions Boards (12” x 18”),
1 Mechanics Board (8” x 18”),
1 Tactical Board (8.5” x 11”),
3 Countersheets (including boat tiles),
3 Card Decks (Recruits, Navigation, Discovery),
2 d10 dice
Booklets and Player Aids

-description from publisher's website
categories: Civil War, Dice, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Uesugi Civil War: Battle of Sanemakihara
description:
Uesugi Civil War is a wargame based on the Battle of Sanemakihara that took place between Yamanouchi Uesugi clan and Ōgigayatsu Uesugi clan on February 5, 1488 in the current city of Isehara.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uesugi_clan

Yamanouchi Uesugi clan invaded with a large army of 1,000 cavalry, but Ōgigayatsu Uesugi clan, who had only 200 cavalry, defeated Yamanouchi Uesugi clan by taking advantage of the terrain.
This game recreates this battle with a total of 44 playing pieces and an easy-to-understand map connecting key points with roads.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Creators of the First Dawn
description:
Creators Of The First Dawn is a turn-based building strategy game for 2-6 players.

And so it begins, the first morning on a new world. Equipped with omnipotent magic powers and armies of underlings, each player slips into the role of a deity in the struggle for supremacy. With only their goal in mind, they endanger their own creation and set the world ablaze.

Into an empty universe, players create a three-dimensional game world. The players acquire resources in order to conquer the territory of the other players with their forces. At the same time, their god can cast more powerful spells turn by turn and thus decisively influence the game.

The goal of the game is to defeat all of the opponents' units so that their god cannot return to the world. One's own tactics and the behavior of the opponents always give the game captivating twists and make the events unpredictable.

The turn-based building system gives new players the opportunity to gradually familiarize themselves with it during their first game. But Creators Of The First Dawn also offers new challenges to experienced players. The basic rules can be supplemented with modifications to freely shape the level of complexity of the game and shift the tactical focus according to one's own wishes.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, City Building, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Automatic Resource Growth, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Pieces as Map, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Battle of Bubaigawara
description:
This is an issue game of "Bushi Life" #3, depicts the Battle of Bubaigawara, a samurai battle between Nitta Yoshisada and Hōjō Yasuie on May 15 and 16, 1333. This battle was a part of the decisive Kōzuke-Musashi Campaign during the Genkō War in Japan that ultimately ended the Kamakura Shogunate.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Bubaigawara

name: Chameleon
description:
A solid wood game for two persons. Every player tries to collect 6 tiles in different colors (red, blue, green, yellow, purple and light green).

The rules are simple. Roll the (normal) dice and rotate the big wooden dice around one of it's edges on the board so many times. If it stops above a tile with the same color as the dice shows take it. Please note that no player can cross a tile more than two times or select tiles of the same color more than once. Who first owns all six different tiles wins.

—user summary

name: Grand Slam Tennis
description:
Sports simulation that allows realistic Tournament Play and Season Play in a reasonable time scale, while still giving ALL the features that come in to effect during ATP / WTA Tennis seasons. You can play Singles or Doubles, Seasons, Tournaments, on-off matches. World Team Tennis, Davis Cup, Federation Cup, or Hopman Cup matches or Tournaments or any other Contests you wish.

The game comes with the options of playing a set-by-set mode, game-by-game mode or instant match results mode where the outcome is determined by the roll of a few dice. Men and women players are rated for each year to give realistic scores but still with the possibility of generating shock results.

The first Sportsreplays set release was the Australian Open 2012 Edition including updated ratings as at January 30th 2012.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Thakhi: la senda de los dioses
description:
You help a brave archaeologist to collect Aymara objects of great historical and cultural value. This objects are hidden inside an Andes labyrinth wish is about to collapse.

Explore the labyrinth and rescue the objects before a collapse buries them forever in time.

Objective of the game
Go through the Chakanas inside the labyrinth to earn points and reach the exit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Measurement Movement, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Movement Template, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories 3
description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Dagon star zone and 2nd battle of Tiamat Star zone.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Pokémon All Stars Get Everyone & Battle Game
description:
Introducing a Pokémon board game base on the Nintendo Pokémon franchise that everyone can enjoy getting and battle. Player starts the game from the starting square and becomes a Pokémon Trainer (Boys&Girls). Roll the dice in order like "Sugoroku" and proceed while following the instructions to collect Pokémon, item cards and event cards.

Collect over 200 Pokémon and challenge the awaited rival(Cards)!!The player who challenges the awaited rival and defeats it first wins.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: On the Underground: Engineering Crew
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Setup: Place on engineering crew tile per player next to the board and return the extras to the box.

Gameplay: A player may spend one of their actions to take an engineering crew tile. Each player may hold at most 1 of these tiles. It may be spend to take a branch tile or place a track token. Doing so does not cost an action.

name: Captain Sonar: Mission Vectrum
description:
Mission Vectrum is a mini-expansion for Captain Sonar and contains three different sea cards that can be played individually or as a coherent campaign. Each sea card is included four times: two times for the radio operators and two times for the captains.

With its 3 missions, the Vectrum campaign make you dive you into a thrilling adventure. A cutting-edge military-scientific conglomerate has recruited experienced crews to test their new equipment in real conditions. Welcome to the Vectrum Campaign, which will take you from Chicago to New York to end with a climax on a secret mission! The Vectrum campaign includes 3 missions, which can be played consecutively in a “campaign” mode, or individually, with their specific rules and constraints.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Nautical, Real-time
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Line Drawing, Real-Time, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Moodboard
description:
The aim of the game is to receive as many like points as possible.

In each round of the game one of the players becomes The Client. The Client gives a brief valid for all the "Agencies" (the other players), and then puts on the table a set of random "Visual Cards" each one showing a picture.

Once the brief is established, each Agency has to propose a creative and effective moodboard, able to capture the fascination (and therefore the likes) of The Client, using some of the Visual Cards taken from the table .

A game lasts as many rounds as there are players (each player plays the role of the client once).

At the end of the game, each player adds up the number of likes received and whoever has the most likes wins the game.

name: A Bug On The Motherboard
description:
You are a fly stuck in a computer!

Roll dice to move about the motherboard to collect Energy. Use that energy to power up the computer components (cpu, graphics card, etc.) and use capacitors to strategically assemble the components on your motherboard for extra points, but watch out! Resistors can pop and you can cause a short circuit and get Zapped!

Can you fully assemble your Motherboard before you get fried?! Or get some of your techy friends and compete to build you motherboard or varying boards and score the most points!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: The Alamo
description: Knight Designs’ “The Alamo,” a 6mm miniatures playset including figures, buildings and rules. The rules include movement, firing tables, melee, morale and painting instructions for the figures. The rules could be used with any 6mm scale Alamo game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Deck EXPRESS
description:
The majestic steam engine waits in the yard. As train moguls, you will invest in emerging railroad companies, build track, and collect rewards from the bank. The game moves as fast as a train on new tracks. Only the wealthiest investor will end victorious.

—description from the rulebook

Deck Express is a railroad investment game. Players take one of four possible actions on their turn including buying shares, building track, paying dividends, and taking a loan. Investments in wealthy companies with locomotives will earn more. To win, have as much money as possible before the bank runs out.

All you need is a deck of cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Investment, Stock Holding, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Violent Dark
description:
Violent Dark (formerly Anomaly) is a 32mm co-op or head-to-head game that pits the crew of a massive corporation’s ship or planetary facility against the threats of the galaxy that lurk and prey beyond The Dark. A game is played with 3-5 miniatures per side on a 2’×2′ area.

Violent Dark can be played as a solo game, a player will have control of four crew models to complete the selected mission against an A.I. driven threat; a multiplayer game allowing each player to activate and choose the destiny of a single or multiple crew models against an A.I. threat; or a One vs Many scenario for someone to play as the Threat itself! One person playing the chosen threat and four players controlling a crew model.

Violent Dark pits four crew against a threat that the players choose before the game begins. The core game provides everything necessary to play the core five missions. Missions are played on a two foot by two foot play area and filled with terrain as well as selected or randomly chosen environmental conditions. Players will also randomly choose a Plan B. These represent sub objectives the players may try to accomplish for minor and moral victories.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Traitor Game

name: Gluty Bear and the Wurst Truck
description:
Late evening in the Black Forest. The hungry lumberjacks gather for some grilled wurst. Can the gluten-
intolerant bear steal one? Or will it end up with a bread roll and a belly ache?

Gluty Bear and the Wurst Truck is a mini card game of just 7 cards. The objective is to either eat the wurst being the bear or to eat the wurst and bun as a lumberjack (fork).

Players have just one card on their hands which they repeatedly swap in secret with two cards lying in middle of the table. They try to track where the wurst and everything else is and wait in patience for the right moment to dive in with either bear or fork in order to eat.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander — Quantum Quandrix Deck
description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a blue-green deck with a creature token theme, featuring Adrix and Nev, Twincasters as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Quantum Quandrix" is based on Quandrix College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: River Trek
description:
River Trek is a strategy game of placing trading posts and moving stacks of explorers along the path of a river.

On your turn, you pick up a stack of explorers, called a caravan, and move it mancala-style by dropping the explorers one at a time off the bottom of the stack as it travels forward. Each explorer dropped on a space earns money if a trading post of the same color is on the space, so other players may earn money on your move. Drop an explorer on a river crossing, and it washes downstream to the previous river crossing. Drop an explorer on an animal token, and the owner of that explorer receives a special ability.

When a caravan reaches the source of the river, the game ends and the player who has made the most money along the way wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Income, Mancala, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Uwaga, spoiler!
description:
Uwaga, spoiler! ("Watch out, spoiler!") is the party game for real cinephiles. Check, if you can describe well-known films or tv series without spoilers. And you have only 60 seconds for that! Time, start!

How to describe a movie without spoilers?
That's what "Uwaga, spoiler!" game is about. Draw a card, choose one of two titles, tell about it to your team, without using forbidden words. Who'll be the best reviewer?

And now something for real geeks, pro mode!
Try to describe a title without naming actors, character's names! No time for boredom, try new game modes!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Uwaga, Spoiler! to gra towarzyska dla prawdziwych kinomaniaków. Sprawdź, czy potrafisz opisać znane tytuły bez używania spoilerów. Masz na to tylko 60 sekund! Czas, start!

Jak opowiadać o filmach i serialach tak, by nie zdradzić zbyt wiele?

Na tym właśnie polega wyzwanie gry Uwaga, Spoiler! Wylosuj kartę z tytułem i przedstaw go swojej drużynie, nie używając zakazanych słów! Kto okaże się najlepszym recenzentem?

A teraz coś dla prawdziwych geeków!

Spróbujcie przedstawić tytuł bez wymieniania imion aktorów i bohaterów oraz nazw własnych. Możecie wymyślać nowe zasady gry. Tu nie ma mowy o nudzie!

W grze Uwaga, Spoiler! Waszym zadaniem jest umiejętne naprowadzenie drużyny na wskazany na karcie film lub serial. Do każdego tytułu dodana jest lista spoilerów, których użycie oznacza utratę punktów, więc uważaj na to, co mówisz! Musisz wykazać się kreatywnością i umiejętnie przybliżyć treść danego tytułu, tak aby Twoja drużyna zdobyła jak najwięcej punktów. Macie na to zaledwie 60 sekund. Tylko bez spoilerów, proszę!

Każdy ma takiego znajomego, który jest na bieżąco ze wszystkimi serialami i zna wszystkie filmy. Macie dość spoilerów? Wyzwijcie go na pojedynek o tytuł najlepszego recenzenta! Zagrajcie w Uwaga, Spoiler i przetestujcie swoją filmową wiedzę!

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Marvel Battleworld Series 3: Ultimate Armory Battleball
description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos!

Battleworld is a revolutionary cooperative, expandable, collectible adventure game featuring dozens of characters from all over the Marvel Universe! Players get to crack open the mysterious Thanostones during the course of play to reveal the mystery character inside for a constant sense of surprise and delight!

Series 3 introduces us to brand new locations, battles, and exciting new game mechanics that will continue to challenge players and test their strategies!
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Anthromancer
description:
Anthromancer is a tabletop game system that features a suite of original neoclassical strategy and chance games, as well as an original oracle. It is primarily organized around a 2-4 player abstract strategy game called 'Mercenarium'.

In Mercenarium, players take turns placing and moving cards with various edge values in an attempt to overcome the edge values of opposing cards and capture them. The first player to capture 5 cards wins. Captures can be spent to gain control of enemy cards which pivot to the orientation of the buyer, changing the relative strengths on the battlefield and subverting enemy plans. In addition, each player is dealt 1 of 15 unique 'hymn' cards, which grant powerful abilities that dramatically alter the board state.

The game feels a bit like chess, but with far less predictability, due to the randomness of the deck and the asymmetrical powers of the hymns. Skill is gained by learning to predict patterns of movement, and being willing to take risks.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game, Static Capture, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Cards of the Dead: The Board Game
description:
Cards of the Dead: The Board Game is an adaptation of the “Cards of the Dead” video game.

A survival game for 1-3 players in a city infested by Zombies.

The game offers an experience that differs from the video game, and can be played both solo and with multiple players.

In Cards of the Dead: The Board Game players must take control of one of the Survivors and make it out of the city alive over the course of three days.

Players are advised to explore the interiors of places like the Supermarket where they will need to stock up with equipment and resources in order to remain alive throughout the game.

At the same time, they will need to contain the Zombies who infest the city and its vicinity, before being surrounded and falling prey to their incessant hunger…

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Munchkin Dungeon: Cute as a Button Bookmarks
description: Kickstarter exclusive bookmark pack (8) with the "Cute as a Button" expansion. These are in addition to the 4 bookmarks from the "Box of Holding" from the same Kickstarter.
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Steve Jackson Games

name: 18BF: The Big Four
description:
18BF is a game in the 18xx series set in Great Britain.

A game of route building and running trains to make money. The player with the most assets (cash and share value) at the end wins.

Corporations start out small and grow into larger ones through growth, merger and/or acquisition. Then, later in the game, these larger corporations can merge to form systems: the "Big Four".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: The James O'Brien Mystery Hour Game
description:
The informative, witty, conversational, argumentative game, based on James O’Brien’s Mystery Hour on LBC Radio.

One player acts as the ‘Host’ and asks the trivia questions. Other players have to write their answers on their answer pad, or if they’re not able to do this, they can choose one of the two answers now given by the host. One true, and one false. The host can also choose their own false answer if they please.

Any player getting the correct answer without choosing the one given by the host gets 3 points, any correct answer from the Host’s choices gets 1 point. If players instead choose the wrong answer from the Host, the host gets 2 points.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end, OR the player who reaches 35 points on the score track before all questions are answered.

name: 静かなる論理 (Quiet Logic)
description:
Quiet Logic is a real-time deduction game for exactly 4 players which takes around 5 minutes to play. The game consists of 10 cards which have a different number on both sides.

Each player is given 2 cards, 1 is placed in the center of the table, and 1 is hidden from view.

After looking at both sides of their cards, players decide which sides to place face up on the table and then space them according to some provided principles.

When all players are ready, the game begins and the first person who thinks they have determined the hidden card will write down their guess and check the card. The first person to successfully guess both sides of the hidden card wins.

name: Abszolút képtelen sztorik
description:
Abszolút képtelen sztorik is the third game in the word-and story-related Abszolút series published by book and game publisher Pagony.

In the game box you'll find 30 two-sided story cards (with 9 elements of a story, numbered), 9 number cards, cards to vote for each player, a notebook and a story book.

Draw one of the number cards. Everyone looks at their story card and writes the first (in later rounds, next) sentence for the story. They read it aloud and players vote with cards (0 to 3 points) for the best sentence (including their own). The sentence that gets the highest score will be written in the storybook. The player who wrote this sentence scores 3 points, everyone else scores as many points as the number they assigned to the winning player.

Keep writing the story this way, eventually using all the number cards. (For a shorter game, only certain numbers are used.) The player with the most points total wins, but of course it's the story that you've written together that matters.

name: Yoncollon Duel
description:
Yonocollon Die are specialized dice with four faces. While each die has a primitive shape, when combined they form a fun, innovative and flexible game play system. Players can cast two dice which allows them to move their player token(s) in a variety of ways.

In order to expand the usage of this new dice form I invented a short, repeatable and fun game. The game I created is a 1x5 spaces game called "Yoncollon Duel".

The goal of the game is to be first to move your three pieces from your side to the opposite side.

Players : 2
Board : 1x5 board
Pieces : Players have 3 pieces each.
Bet chips : Players have 5 discs each.
Dice : a pair of classic speed dice and modern speed dice. Players decide which dice edition to use before the game.
Game goal : Be the first player to move your three pieces from your side to the opposite side.
Decide first player and then alternate turns. Players cast two dice then move their piece(s) by the moving rule below at their turn.

A: Move one piece with sum of dice pip(s).
B : Move two pieces according to each die pip(s). Players can decide their first move pip(s).
Pieces must land on open spaces jumping other pieces on the board and must reach the opposite side exactly. If player has no legal place to move at his turn, then he loses the game. If players have only one piece, moving a piece by either one of dice pips is considered a legal move.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Santa Gor
description:
The Santa Gor is an official free print & play bonus hero for the Legends of Andor base game and its expansions. He can carry almost no items, but leaves a free gift for the other heroes whenever he arrives at a building.

He was released on Christmas 2021 and can be played using the archer's green materials.

Each time the Santa Gor ends his move action on a space with a building, he may place any item from the merchant's inventory (except the witch's brew) on that space. That item can only be picked up by another hero. The Santa Gor can only place one item per building space.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: 茶の間のきまぐれねこさま (As the Cat Says)
description:
A family-friendly party card game with simple rules & reversal elements.

Here we are is cat café which is topic of the street. You are the staff of this shop. Cats are relaxing around. When the time goes by slowly, one of the staff whispered, "Who is most liked by them?"

You do everything to the cats. Of course, to be the most favorite of the cats in this shop.

--from the publisher

Each round, the staff of this cat café must try and guess what the cat is going to want from them. You'll know which of the four cat decks is going to be drawn from next, and if you've been paying attention, you should have an idea of the cards left in that deck. You'll play one of your four prediction cards, and either gain or lose the cat's favorability.

But be careful which prediction card you play, because you only have one of each! You can play your 'Leave Me Alone' card to avoid losing favorability, and to return all your cards back to your hand.

You also have a 'Full Power' card you can use when you're really confident in your prediction. If you guessed right, you can get a favorability bonus - either +5, +15, x3, or even x4 - depending on where you are on the scoring track. But the 'Full Power' card has to rest for a while before it can be used again, so choose wisely!

The staff member who the cats like best wins!
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Hand Management, Memory

name: KISS Rommel
description:
Or Keep It Simple Stupid!

It's 1941-42 you are in charge of perhaps the entire Deutsches Afrika Korps or 8th Army! Most units equate to battalions giving about a dozen bases per Division. At this level of gaming only large tactically vital positions such as hilltop positions for a battalion become relevant, not looking for a hull-down position for a single tank!

The side that is moving will usually get in the first shot, so mobility is often better than standing still. In the desert it is easy to use space to pull back and blast the enemy at ranges where they cannot get at you.

—description from the rulesbook

An optional campaign system is also included.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: American Mogul
description:
The industrial revolution marked a turning point in American history. The transition from handmade items to large-scale factories with industrial machinery made it possible to produce products at an epic scale. It also turned a handful of already industrious men into even more; it turned them into American moguls. Will you be one of them?

In American Mogul, players are captains of industry throughout the length of the industrial revolution in the United States, with each attempting to corner markets in the emerging states. Done through a brutally tight action-selection mechanism in which no action can be chosen twice in a round, the game is palpably tense as players struggle to get the right contracts, the best companies, and the edge in every market.

American Mogul is a follow up to 2013's Global Mogul, using the same core systems and adding more to it. Players now have captain cards that give each player a unique starting position and a special ability. Event cards make every play unique and interesting, but rather than random events, each player chooses an event during initial set-up. Players also choose a unique endgame scoring condition for each game, adding even more to the variability. Finally, a new action allows players to donate money to their own private foundations, then watch that money grow as the public matches donations and the interest accrues from round to round. The more players grow their foundations, the more special abilities they unlock. In a game that's brutally tight on money, how much will you give away? Will you be a philanthropist or a robber baron?
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Events, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Disney Kingdomania: Game Ball
description:
Disney Kingdomania takes place inside a make-believe, 8-bit video game that's experiencing glitches that are mixing up the levels. Players must patch the glitches before it's "Game Over" for the characters and their digital game world.

Disney Kingdomania: Game Ball contains 12 level tiles and two characters from a set of 26, including Buzz Lightyear, Mickey Mouse, Stitch, Princess Tiana, and rare "glitched" character figures. You can play a game solely with these components, or you can combine these components with those in other Game Balls or one or more Disney Kingdomania: Super Game Packs.

name: Woddle
description:
Seven letter cards and the box as a target!
Combine luck and strategy in this card game for the whole family.
Be infinitely creative with letters to win.

Turn over a theme card.
Can you think of a word that fits the theme?
Then throw the correct letter card on the box.
The challenge gets even bigger with the different Woddle Modes.

Who knows, you might be the Woddle winner?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Word Game

name: Chomp Champ
description:
The Chomp Champ! Game from Mudpuppy is a fun twist on the classic game of spoons. Collect 4-of-a-kind and grab a shark tile, all other players then race to grab a shark tile, trying not to be the player left without one. Lose 6 shark teeth tokens and you're out! A wonderful new addition to game nights everywhere!

The jawsome game of fast-acting fun!
Includes: 40 cards, 4 shark tiles, 30 shark tooth tokens, instructions
Shaped box: 6.75 x 7.75 x 1.75", 17 x 20 x 4.5 cm
3-5 players, Ages 5+


—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering – Throne of Eldraine Planeswalker Deck: Rowan, Fearless Sparkmage
description:
This Magic: The Gathering starter deck is ready to play right out of the box. Battle a few times to master your deck’s strategy, then open the 2 included booster packs to customize it.

Rowan inspires great loyalty in those who follow her. Attack relentlessly, using abilities to power up your cards, then use Rowan herself to push through the final points of damage and finish off your opponent.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Cancelled On Scene: EMS Card Game
description: You already know how to play it. It's like that one game with the black and white cards... you know - the one for normal people. So slide your gloves on and get ready for a product that my mother described as "honestly concerning". Play it at the station, at the nurses desk while taking a break from playing poker, while you're dodging calls, or with your friends over drinks in what little off time you have. If you work in health care, fire, or EMS, you'll appreciate the reality behind the twisted jokes, and hopefully open a dialogue to talk about the darker aspects of the job with your peers. Through humor comes healing.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Medical, Party Game

name: FAIL
description:
Fantasy Animals In Links

A quick 2 player card game where players take turn choosing animals to make a better link of animals than the other player.

Each card have an animal depicted and half symbols on each of the left and right border of it. Matching symbols earns you points while failing to do so do not.

Every time you chose a card it must be placed directly to the right or left of your already chosen cards.

The setup of cards alternate between cards faced down and cards faced up, giving the players some but not full information on what lies ahead.

—description from the designer

name: Magic: The Gathering – War of the Spark Planeswalker Deck: Gideon, the Oathsworn
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Gideon Jura is a stalwart hero who never hesitates to throw himself between his allies and danger. Rally a massive army, then lead them into battle and vanquish your opponent in a single overwhelming attack.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Dom Pierre: Connoisseur Expansion
