description:
This expansion consists of the stretch goals and is filled to the brim with upgraded components and more game play content!

Featuring new wooden casks and barrels to replace your small action and score tokens. Includes deluxe worker meeples, metal coins, and a beautiful new velour bag! There are also added gameplay options such as Goal cards that add events and the Terrior expansion!

-description from the back of the box

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2019: Merciless Rage
description: Anje Falkenrath headlines this red-black preconstructed Commander deck themed around the Madness mechanic. Merciless Rage includes a 100-card deck, a foil oversized display commander, 10 double-sided tokens, and a cardboard deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Superclub: SL Benfica Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date SL Benfica first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate SL Benfica fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: The Two Heirs: Royal Advisers Promo
description:
This mini expansion consists of 9 cards, 3 each in the 3 resource colors. Each game you use 1 card of each color.

When you own more buildings in a color than your opponent you have more influence over the matching advisor. It is turned towards you, so you can use its special ability.

name: Kopi King: Sugar Cane Bonus Pack
description: A promo deck of cards including 2 order cards for a sugar cane juice and additional ingredients (4 sugar canes and 2 ice cubes).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Dreadful Circus: Coachmen Mini Expansion
description: Sometimes it doesn't matter what wonders are hidden in the wagon. Sometimes it's more important who's at the helm... Every Coachman has a unique skill that changes the way you use you Wagon in the game.

name: Air Mail: Promo Cards
description:
10 (5 in English, 5 in Spanish) new Cards Postal service decree.
These cards mix with those present in the basic games and bring new objectives.

Was available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Dice War
description:
A war-style, dice rolling, action-card playing, battle to the final point!

The thrill of rolling five dice is a priceless feeling known to Manny – but when met with savage, high-speed card playing, Dice War sparked a fire unlike any table game you’ve ever played. Even the best dice rollers are in danger when the action cards come out…

Using familiar dice combinations like three of a kind, large straight, and full house – each round is a battle for the best role. But have any chance at the win, you must strategically flip action cards on opponents. Enemies will be made, friendships me waiver – get ready to experience the new way to roll.

name: キングダム盤上大戦 (Kingdom Banjo Taisen)
description:
Two players boardgame based on Japanese famous comic and animation series "Kingdom". Banjo Taisen means epic battle on the board.

The basic setting of the game is abstract, and does not represent specific battles in the story, but the general and tactics cards give it a "Kingdom" feel.
Both players have the same number of Troops, Generals and Tactics cards. Depending on the stage of the rules, the size of the battlefield board and the number of pieces can be changed.

In each turn, player can move a single piece or a stack of pieces, play a tactical card, draw a new tactical card or place reserve piece in own camp zone.

A battle occurs when the pieces enter a square with an opponent's pieces, and each player uses their own strength to remove the opponent's pieces. The strength is based on the number of pieces, and is determined by the effects of facing, general cards and tactical cards.

The player who first eliminates the opponent's commander-in-chief or occupies the opponent's headquarters wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Foramina
description:
HEADS. Those of us who have one know how hard they work. They sniff, chew, listen, salivate, look around, kiss, spit, sing karaoke, get slapped, and so much more. I love elbows as much as anyone, but on a good day, my favorite elbow barely does half of these things.

When a head makes up its mind to do something, it needs to pick the right cranial nerve and send a signal through a hole in the skull called a foramen. (The plural of foramen is “foramina” for some reason.)

In Foramina, you and up to three friends each build a tableau of cranial nerves. By rolling dice you activate the cranial nerves with the same number as your roll, hopefully earning axons. You can then spend axons to gain more cranial nerves and eventually purchasing foramina. The first player to three foramina wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Random Production

name: Axolotl Dice
description:
Gain as many dice, rerolls, and multipliers as possible for the final big roll! High Score Wins! Axolotl Dice? More like that’s a lotta dice!

The game is played over 12 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most dice, rerolls, and multipliers by advancing on the 18 number tracks. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, using the dice however each player determines. At the end of the game, each player will make a final Big Roll depending on how many dice they gained. The player with the highest score wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Lawyer Up: Season 2 – Private Eye: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

3 promo cards for case #04 from Lawyer Up: Season 2.

Incudes 1 defendant (Tom Vasel) and 2 allies (Zee Garcia and Mike Dilisio).

Tom Vasel: Can only be called by the defense
Called: Attempt to solve the case. If you get the Crime Scene correct, sway 2 bias.

Zee Garcia: If you solve a clue, remove all red herrings from another clue

Mike Dilisio: If you solve a clue, discard 1 planted evidence from your opponent's examination.

name: Sellswords & Spellslingers: Beasts of Norindaal
description:
Beasts of Norindaal is a supplement for Sellswords and Spellslingers that features 39 new and dangerous monsters for players to encounter on their adventures.

From Demonspiders of Zag and Eldritch Bone Guardians to Blue-Feathered Beasts and deadly Catfolk Assassins, this supplement also has six random tables for Wandering Monster generation and a full scenario, Beasts of Norindaal.

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Mordsgaudi
description:
Mordsgaudi: In the Alps the two villages Obersteissbruch and Untersteissbruch do not like each other. Inbetween the two villages lies the Restaurant Jodelhoh with its charismatic owner Jodl Franz. One night six strangers appear and Jodl Franz gets quite nervous. Nobody can trust anybody and then somebody is gone missing. Has the mountain ghost gotten to him? Put on some warm cloths and go to investigate!

It's a 6 player murder mystery game were you can lie, betray, investigate and accuse! Included in the mix is a cook book to fully enjoy a perfect crime dinner evening.

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Wizard
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Wizard all the way from 1st to 24th level.
It contains updated skill and treasure cards from the complete campaign sets (Ruins of Thandar, The lost Village, Watery Grave and two unknown ones)
So in the future, if you own all 5 campaign sets, you dont need this Deck.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Thief
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Thief all the way from 1st to 24th level.
It contains updated skill and treasure cards from the complete campaign sets (Ruins of Thandar, The lost Village, Watery Grave and two unknown ones)
So in the future, if you own all 5 campaign sets, you dont need this Deck.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Words Apart
description:
In Words Apart it's you and your teammates against the game! You and your fellow players must work together to generate clues that describe a hilarious and filthy target word.

In each round a new target player and target word are selected. Every other player writes a clue on their whiteboard to help the target player guess what the target word could be. Be creative, translations, rhymes, or derivatives of the target word are invalid!
Originality is key in this game, as any duplicate words will be erased.

The target player has one guess at the target word, every correct guess is worth one point, every incorrect guess is one point to the game. The game ends when either the players or the game reach 5 points!

name: Albuera 1811: Beresford vs. Soult
description:
Albuera 1811: Beresford vs. Soult depicts the fiercest battle of the Peninsula War. Both engaged armies suffered terrible losses. Players can check if success could be achieved with lower cost.

Rules concentrate on infantry maneuvers on Napoleonic battlefield. It is important to form battalion into proper array in the right time. Intuitively Line gives advantages during musketry fire and Column is powerful in hand-to-hand fighting. Important is also placing an infantry battalion regarding to neighboring units. Flank-to-flank deployment gives farther bonuses in ranged combat and forms solid order of the whole army. An infantry battalion can detach a company of skirmishers. It is useful for screening battalion's main body and harass enemy units with volleys. The best form of defense against cavalry is Square. In the box are rectangle counters. They represent line with broad front. This simply solution shows British 2-row line historical advantage over French 3-row - rectangle counters occurs more often in allied army.

Cavalry aspect is not so detailed, so cavalry is simply deployed in line formation.

Artillery can move or fire. Of course horse artillery can do both actions during one activation. The biggest advantage is a range of fire.

Command and control is simple. Players have certain Activation Chits and select some of them. Activation Chits of both players are placed in one Activation Pool. Blindly drawn Chit indicates formation which can move and initiate close combat. Melee is very bloody – both sides suffer losses, but the risk must be taken, because won clashes give Victory Points.

Non-activated units do not move, but they are allowed to fire. Thanks to that the whole board is used and crucial events can happen everywhere, not only in activated map sector. The most common effect of fire combat is Morale Check. If unsuccessful, unit can withdraw – decision is up to the opposing player, so both players are involved for the whole gameplay.

Generally random factor is big, but players can feel reality of Napoleonic battlefield. The winner is player who properly deploys his units and uses opportunities given by Fate of War.

Game scale:
One game turn – 15 minutes of real time
One hex – 150 meters
One strength point – 100 infantrymen or cavalrymen
One artillery counter – from 1 to 8 guns

-description from designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Ranklotzen: 4 Spieler Edition
description:
Aim of the game is always to build a tower in the order of colors required by a playing card as quickly as possible, either alone or in a team (depending on the mode), and then to be the first to place your hand on the construction acceptance card. The first player to collect 10 points in the form of playing cards wins.

3 different game modes ensure a lot of variety and limitless fun.

Includes 20 building blocks made of beech wood

name: 1940: The Last Days of May -- A Panzer Grenadier Campaign Study
description:
1940: The Last Days of May is a Panzer Grenadier Campaign Study. with 11 scenarios from the final days of the German invasion of France, in two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. You’ll need Panzer Grenadier: 1940 The Fall of France and Road to Dunkirk to play all of the scenarios.

The scenarios come from the updating of 1940: The Fall of France to the fourth edition Panzer Grenadier rules. There wasn't enough room in the new playbook format for all of the scenarios, so the extra scenarios became this Campaign Study.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Magical Forest
description:
The goal of the Magical Forest board game is for players to populate the forest with special creatures. However, this is not as simple a task as it seems. Mushrooms only feel good in a community, while magic trees like to live with a couple. The unicorn can be a propitiator for witches and fairies. And the dwarf likes to rest under the mushrooms, in the shade of the trees.

At the beginning of the game, everyone gets their own forest board, then we put together the pine tree elements - everyone has to put them in the same places! No more tiles can be placed on fields with such a pine tree. Then, each player must put 5 tiles of each character (dwarf, magic tree, mushroom, unicorn, fairy, witch) into the canvas bag and shake the bag well.

The game will last for 5 rounds and players will place 6 tiles on their board in each round - 2 tiles are placed face down first, then flipped over when everyone is done. After that, everyone passes the other cards to the left. This will continue until the bag is empty.
Note: It is advisable to place the received tiles in such a way that they will be worth as many points as possible. The rulebook describes in detail which magic creature has what extra

The scoring sheet for the game also helps with scoring at the end of the game. Whoever has the most points will win.

The game can be played in several ways: in addition to the basic game, there are target cards at different levels of difficulty, which can also be added to the game as difficulty. Among the target cards, the easy and the hard ones can always be obtained by the person who succeeds in completing the task first, and the medium-level card is dealt at the end of the game to the player who has the most magical creatures of the type requested by the target card.

A thoughtful, somewhat strategic board game with nice graphics, in which cards are passed using a drafting technique.

name: 広辞苑かるた (Dictionary Karuta: Kojien)
description:
There are countless entries in the dictionary. There are many words that you don't know. Let's find words you haven't seen yet!

One person reads the explanation card aloud, and the other person picks up the correct word card. Whoever gets the most wins.

—description from the publisher

広辞苑に載っている項目は、二十五万。その中には、知らない言葉もたくさんあります。さあ、まだ見ぬ言葉を見つけましょう！

一人が読み札を読み上げ、他の人はそれに合った取り札をいち早く取ります。たくさん取った人の勝ちです。

—description from the publisher (Japanese)

name: Goat Lords 2
description:
Goat Lords 2 by Gatwick Games - New Card Games for Families, Adults, Teens, and Kids

The Sequel to the #1 Voted Goat Game of The Year! ? ‣ Get ready for the most exciting Goat game of your life! Expect high drama, uncontrollable laughter & fast action strategy in this wildly popular card game. Ages 8+ | 2-6 player

Goat Lords 2 is a standalone game that brings more goat fun and craziness to the table! Play it by itself, or combine it with the original Goat Lords for the most epic adventure of your life

The goal of Goat Lords is to gather the biggest goat herd. You do so by stacking pairs of matching goat cards in front of you and stealing opponent's goats before the draw pile runs out.

Knowing how to play your cards, when to hold 'em, and who to attack greatly affect how many points you end up when the last goat is played.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Nimbus
description:
Nimbus is an abstract, high strategy, dynamic board game designed by Neural Forge. The goal in Nimbus is to eliminate your opponent's Nimbus piece by moving your pieces around the board, however you can change the movement mode of one of your pieces every turn, resulting in a challenging tactical experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

name: Pete the Cat: Pizza Pie Game
description:
Based on the New York Times Best-seller Pete the Cat

Cooperative game using a spin-and-move mechanic. Move the number of spaces resulting on the spinner. Land on a green space and collect that many pizza toppings. Land on a red space and give back that many. Land on a pizza+ space, take two toppings and give them to any other player.

When one person collects five toppings, they are allowed to place them on the pizza. The game ends when all toppings are successfully collected from the box and placed on the pizza!

name: Minerały: Promo 5 – Kruszec (Antracyt)
description: This expansion adds 1 tile – Ore(Anthracite). It works as a normal anthricite except that when you have it at the end of the game and you have more minerals than anyone else, every mineral is worth one point more.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 24 Days Escape: 3D Adventskalender – Sherlock Holmes im Schatten des Big Ben
description:
Sherlock Holmes has received an invitation to the clocktower of Westminster. Upon arrival, he is confronted with an unsolved crime from his past.

To play this 3D advent calendar, you first assemble an 86cm/34 inch model of the clocktower in which the story is set.
Over the course of 24 days you find mysterious objects and clues that help you find out what happened 20 years ago. Each solved puzzle brings you another step closer to the solution of the puzzle.

name: Monsters Deck 2
description: Monsters Deck is a collection of 25 tarot-sized cards, each with a monster for Four Against Darkness. Monsters Deck - 2 contains all the classic monsters from the core rulebook adapted for all levels with the Highest Character Level mechanic (HCL). Use the highest Level in your party plus the bonus shown for the monster’s Level. Use these cards whenever you would roll on a table to determine which Vermin, Minion, Boss or Weird Monster you encounter. Instead of rolling, draw a card from the appropriate deck, play it and then reshuffle it into the deck. You can combine monster decks together, expanding the variation of encounters with every new set released.

name: Snowfall Over Mountains
description:
Discover the beauty of nature in the peaceful silence that fills the mountains in the wake of freshly fallen snow. Set out from your cabin to follow paths, look for animal tracks, and find plants amidst a new winter morning. Enjoy the solitude of a calm walk through the snow.

Explore the mountains around your cabin by placing and connecting tiles with different features. Find ways to earn points through goals for arranging animal tracks, ponds, trees, and shrubs in your environment.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Lovestruck
description:
You have just been selected to appear as a contestant on a new reality dating show. While every contestant on the show claims to be looking for love, some contestants are actually just trying to get famous. Your goal is to figure out who is who and couple up with the right contestant at the end of the show.

Every round (“Episode”) of LOVESTRUCK has dates that help you get to know the other contestants by playing Action Cards. Dates that result in LOVE grant you additional Action Cards and allow you to couple up with other contestants. Dates that result in DRAMA grant you additional Screen Time. Some Action Cards also have Special Actions that can help you get chosen for dates, gain more Screen Time, or even sabotage other couples.

The show culminates in a Season Finale where the final couples are decided and you decide who you want to leave the show with (or you leave the show alone). Match correctly and you get your picture-perfect romance (at least for 6-8 months after the show airs). Match incorrectly and you may go home alone, or worse, with someone who isn’t who you think they are.

—description from the designer

name: SLY
description:
Players try to protect their Hens at the Hen House while also playing their Foxes to gobble up opponents' Hens.

On your turn, perform ONE of THREE ACTIONS:
LAY: Place a card from your hand (face down)
to any unoccupied space at a Hen House.

EXPOSE: Choose one facedown card at the Hen House belonging to an
opponent, declare that you believe it’s their Fox, then flip it
face up. If it’s a Fox, take it and place it in front of you to score
at the end of the game. If it’s a Hen, it becomes Safe and scores points based on the value of the Hen House Space.

3. REVEAL: Select cards around the Hen House(s) and flip
them face up ONE AT A TIME.
OUTCOMES FROM REVEAL: The owner of the Fox gobbles (takes) the
highest ranked Hen and places it in front of themself. The highest
ranked remaining Hen becomes Safe - rotate it to the √ side.
Return any remaining Foxes and Hens to their owners' hands.
HENS ONLY: Only the highest ranked Hen becomes Safe. Return
the others to their owners' hands.
FOXES ONLY: Return all Foxes to their owners' hands.
TIED HENS or MULTIPLE FOXES: If tied Hens or multiple Foxes
are revealed, the Active Player's card is ranked higher,
followed by the player to their left, and so on.

The game ends immediately when either occurs:
• A player holds just 1 card in their hand at the start of their turn.
Then, flip over all face down cards around the Hen House(s).
Foxes around Hen Houses have no value. All Hens there are Safe.
• All card spaces at the Hen House(s) are occupied, AND face up.
SCORING:
1. Owners of Safe Hens at Hen House(s) earn points relative to
the 1, 2, 3 or 4 valued spaces around the Hen House.
2. Gobbled Hens are worth their face value. If you gobbled a Hen
of your own, it is negative points instead.
3. Captured Foxes are worth points equal to the number of
players (2, 3 or 4)

The player with the most points from Safe Hens, exposed enemy Foxes, and gobbled Hens will be the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Mayan Curse
description:
A group of archeologists just made the headlines. After decoding an ancient Mayan manuscript, they found the location of a secret temple in the jungles of El Salvador. The document revealed the existence of an unknown secret city, that can only be seen from the top of a large, circular temple.
The secret passage to reach the temple is a set of very large stone slabs sitting on stone rolls. These sit above an ancient river, believed to be a passage from the living world to the Underworld…

Slide stone slabs and race to create a path to discover stelae (monuments) and perhaps even ascend the temple to view the ancient city. But beware of the boulders that will be triggered along the way. They may trap you forever if you don’t move quickly!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Pattern Movement, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Race, Slide/Push, Variable Set-up

name: Upin & Ipin Ke Sana Ke Sini
description:
The game is based on Malaysia longest-running animated series of five-year-old twin brothers name Upin & Ipin.

In Upin & Ipin Ke Sana Ke Sini, players will embark on various adventure with Upin, Ipin and friends in their village Kampung Durian Runtuh. Players will move any character depends on the scenario objective and collect as many Ayam Goreng Tokens as possible.

The base game use a unique worker placement, action selection and hand management mechanics. Players choose 3 out of 10 possible scenarios where each scenario present different objective and additional twist. Scenarios challenge players differently like involve in a race or areal control battle between two teams or pick-up and delivery competition or deduction or 1 vs all or even a cooperative objective.

Players accumulate the Ayam Goreng victory points token and after 3 scenarios who have the most is the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Exploration, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Endangered Rescue! #1: Galápagos Penguins
description:
As the host of the conservation TV show WildWorld, you’re currently in the Galápagos Islands filming a special in order to bring attention to the plight of the endangered Galápagos Penguin. Suddenly, your production tent is ransacked. Your hopes of helping the penguins are in jeopardy and time is running out to complete your production. Who did this? What are their motivations? You’ll have to act quickly to solve puzzles, fix equipment, and navigate the island in order to finish your show and help save the Galápagos Penguin

Galápagos Penguins, title #1 in the Endangered Rescue line, is an escape room style game in just 18 cards! As a group, you will solve a series of puzzles to unravel a mystery.

When you have solved a puzzle, you will enter the answer into the companion web app (compatible with all smart phones and computers) and it will check whether you are correct. If you are, the app will tell you which card or cards to take next.

The app also contains a graduated hint system, so if you get stuck you can get just a small hint about the current puzzle to get moving again without giving too much away.

Puzzles may test your perception, wordplay, and lateral thinking. English language fluency is required.

Most groups take about an hour to solve the game. You can write on the cards to help solve puzzles, but this is not required (or you could use penny sleeves) and the game is otherwise non-destructable. So while you can't play again yourself, you could give the used game to someone else to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Environmental, Puzzle

name: Tørnquists Quizrace
description: Tørnquists Quizrace is a trivia game where your knowledge plays a significant role, but where you also influence the race to the finish line through smart choices. Everyone gets the same questions, and everyone has access to the same opportunities along the way. The question is, what do you do with these opportunities? Do you sprint ahead and hope to create a gap between you and those behind, or do you stay further back and save opportunities in the hope of making a move towards the end? Tørnquists Quizrace is the game that maintains the excitement until the very end.
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Questions and Answers, Race, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Lairen: La historia
description:
In Lairen, two players will dive into an epic battle between good and evil for the control of Lairen, a magical and medieval land full of discord and mysteries to explore.

Players collect cards and build decks out of their collection to duel against an opponent's deck. With those cards, players will try to win the game by either reducing opponent's life from twenty to zero or by making the opponent run out of cards to draw.

An important part of the game is deck construction, which is done prior to the actual game by selecting what cards are included in a particular deck. Each player will have two decks: A "Kingdom" deck with between 45 and 60 cards (exact amount to be chosen by the player), this deck is composed of three types of cards: Action, Unit and Monument cards. The second deck, known as a "Vault", is composed of 15 Treasure cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Tags

name: CogDrive Neon
description:
In the Valkyrie Incident of 3030, CogDrives (mechanized battle suits) were used extensively in the conflict to turn the tides of war.

In CogDrive Neon, two players compete to recruit and deploy CogDrive cards to unify their reserves and win the clash. This is a deck building game utilizing multi-use cards which provide multiple paths to scoring, and at the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

Each CogDrive drive can be used to recruit additional CogDrive cards for the player's deck, discarded for a special ability, or played to the player's side of the Clash. Each CogDrive features one of four colors, and the OverDrive mechanic allows players to get even more out of their played CogDrive cards.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Triominos Conquest
description:
Triominos Conquest features the classic Triominos gameplay with a twist! Score the most points by conquering the largest area.

In addition to the triangular Triomino tiles that feature numbers at each corner, the game includes three types of "conquest" cover pieces: Triohex, Triotri, and Triodia — that is, a colored hexagon that covers six tiles, a colored triangle that covers four tiles, and a colored diamond that covers two tiles. Each player has their own set of conquest pieces.

On a turn, you must place a Triomino from your hand next to one or more Triominos in the playing area so that the numbers on the Triomino you place match the numbers on each adjacent edge it touches. If this placement creates the shape of one of your conquest pieces, you can place that conquest piece on these tiles to claim them; if your tile placement creates a shape that includes a smaller conquest piece, you can replace the smaller conquest piece with your larger one and return the smaller piece to its owner.

Once all the tiles have been placed, sum the numbers on the tiles under your conquest pieces to determine your score. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: Cloudship
description: Cloudship is a co-operative dexterity game about watering flowers from your magical Cloudship. Each turn, roll dice to see which areas need water, which you will drop from the ship suspended above the playfield. But dropping extra water, or hailstones, may keep you from completing before the storms arrive!

name: Panda Poker
description:
パンダポーカー (Panda Poker) is a card game from Japan, roughly styled on Texas Hold'em Poker but with Pandas.

The publisher says:
There are no suits or numbers on the cards, only pandas of various patterns depicted. Some are real, some are complicated fakes.

The game is played by memorising the two cards in the hand in an instant, and then selecting five cards from seven in front of you (including five cards that are later revealed). In this way, you create a Poker hand such as one pair, followed by betting and competing for chips. This is a party game where memory and bluffing are important.

テキサスホールデム風パンダポーカー
ルールは大体テキサスホールデム。カードにはスートや数字がなく、描かれているのは色々な柄のパンダだけ。本物もいれば、ややこしい偽物もいる。これを手札2枚を一瞬で記憶して、後に公開される5枚を含む7枚から5枚を選びワンペアなどの役を作り、チップをベットし競り合います。 記憶力やブラフが大事なパーティゲームです。
description by publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Jewels for the Emperor Penguin
description: The Emperor Penguin looooves jewelry! In Jewels for the Emperor Penguin, each player takes charge of a five-member penguin guild that must scale the icy walls of the Valley of the Emperor Penguin, gathering gems — emeralds, rubies, sapphires, and diamonds — and making advantageous exchanges to acquire the specific gem-recipes needed to claim objective cards that represent the fantastic jewelry the Emperor Penguin covets.
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pieces as Map, Set Collection

name: Attract
description:
Attract is a 2P game in which you battle over control of 5 areas. In the basic game, you want to win control of 3 of the areas; in the alternate rules, the areas are worth a certain point value and you want to win control of more points.

The general outline of the game play is the same in both situations. Chips numbered 1 to 4 in three colors are shuffled and placed face down on a tile. On your turn, either take a chip and place it on a vertices between two cards on your side (or either end) or look at two chips on the tile and put one of them back face up.

The game ends when both players have placed 12 chips on their side.
publishers: Banjo Yugi Seisakujo BGM (盤上遊戯製作所 BGM)

name: Club Fight
description:
Club Fight is a quick solitaire game played with a traditional deck of cards. Using the 13 cards of the club deck, you must clear all the remaining cards of the deck from a 3x3 grid, using six types of actions available to you. However, each of the other suits has the ability to block one of your action types, if cards of the same suit appear at least three times in the grid.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Алиби: Роковой круиз (Alibi: Murder on the Nile)
description:
Alibi is a murder mystery game series inspired by dinner parties with a crime theme, designed for players aged 14 and above.

In the game Alibi: Murder on the Nile there is a scenario of a vacation on the river, which ends in tragedy.

All five players are suspects, and through clues and discussions, they must reconstruct the events while concealing or revealing the secrets of the story.

In Alibi, it is important to carefully follow the order of card decks. If there are six (or more) players, the Detective (or investigation team) comes into play. With only four players, one innocent suspect deck will be removed from the game.

No one knows who the killer is — not even the guilty party — until the final phase of the game, which begins with the Revelation when each player learns their guilt or innocence from their own deck of cards. At this point, all players provide their reconstruction of the events before the voting. Will the killer manage to direct the suspicions of other players towards an innocent person to win the game?

A mystery to experience firsthand in an innovative blend of board game and role-playing game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Olympikos
description:
Who hasn't dreamed of participating in the Olympic Games? Through an original game of idea association, discover the various Olympic and Paralympic sports. Imagination, deduction, and risk-taking will be the three necessary ingredients to shine in this game!

Each round, 5 sports are revealed. A Coach draws 6 Clue cards. Using these cards, they must guess 3 sports among the 5 visible ones.
For each sport, the Coach plays a Clue card, which can be placed in two different ways: vertically for a very good clue, horizontally for an average clue.
Once the three Clue cards are played, the other players will then try to figure out which sport corresponds to each clue. But be careful not to rush!

Olympikos
• Family game
• +8 years
• 2-6 players
• Approximately 20 minutes
• Difficulty: Easy
Description
• Association of ideas and taking risks
• Game that suits both athletes and non-athletes
• Game changes linked to anti-doping control
• A booklet of anecdotes about the sports present in the game, also, interviews of Olympic athletes.
• 28 Sports cards (double-sided)
• 71 Clue cards
• 6 Scoreboard cards
• 6 Flag Bearer cards
• 30 Delegation cards
• 5 Ring cards
• 1 Anti-Doping Control card
• 3 Medal cards (bronze, silver, and gold)

name: Premier de cordée
description:
Two players are alpinists competing to reach the top of the mountain. Every player has five pegs (climbers) of their colour connected by a string (rope). On their turn, a player can move one peg and place it in a hole on their side of the mountain, but the reach is limited by the string and other pegs. Players can also push each other out.

Whoever is the first to reach the top of the mountain, becomes the winner.

name: Inori
description:
In the Inori Valley, villages are built under a giant sacred tree in which live spirits. All year long, village chiefs make offerings to these spirits and assemble altars in the hope of becoming the Great Tree Guardian for the next year.

For each of the four seasons composing a complete play of Inori, players place their offering markers on the spirit cards or on altars for the Great Tree. This allow them to activate abilities, victory points or obtain favor tokens. At the end of a season, Spirit card with all spaces occupied gain bonus points and are replaced, creating new opportunities.

At the end of the game, offerings for the Great Tree give points according to their color, for players having the most favors of each color.

The Guardian of the Great Tree for the next year is the player with the most points.

— description from the distributor (translated)

name: Save Yogino
description:
In Save Yogino we should help the alien Yogino to find the spheres of his device and recall his ship. There are two modes of play: cooperative or competitive. A pinch of memory will help us finding the spheres in the woods which will come out on the dice from turn to turn. However, Agent M will try to prevent us from activating the device by chasing us relentlessly, it will be a race against time, will we be able to save Yogino?

In save Yogino dovremo aiutare l’alieno Yogino a trovare le sfere del suo dispositivo e richiamare la sua nave. Ci sono due modalità di gioco cooperativo o competitivo. Un pizzico di memoria ci aiuterà a ritrovare le sfere nel bosco che di turno in turno usciranno sui dadi, L’agente M però cercherà di impedirci di attivare il dispositivo inseguendoci senza sosta, sarà una corsa contro il tempo, riusciremo a salvare Yogino?

name: Merchant's Solitaire
description:
Using a standard deck of playing cards, players manage their shop's inventory and negotiate trades with customers who arrive with specific demands and offers. Each interaction involves four steps: assessing the customer's offer, crafting a suitable counteroffer from the available items in the shop, verifying the trade's legitimacy, and restocking the shop shelves.

Successful trades earn positive feedback from customers, enhancing the player's standing within the guild. However, failure to meet customer demands or declining trade offers can lead to negative feedback, resulting in a loss of guild standing. If a player's standing falls too low, they face immediate removal from the guild.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lone Wolf: The Battle for Magnamund
description:
Greywood Publishing have teamed up with Gary Chalk, the original artist for the first 8 Lone Wolf books, to bring you Lone Wolf: The Battle for Magnamund.

You are Lone Wolf, the last of the Kai Lords. Or perhaps you are Prince Pelathar, heir to the throne of Sommerlund. Or maybe you are the infamous Giak warrior Kootak, sent by the Darklords to raze the land. Now you can be all of these... in a hand-painted (by Gary) tabletop wargame.

Battle for Magnamund is a fantasy wargame for two or more players. Each battle pits good against evil, and players may control either an entire army or a single brigade on one side at a time. The goal is to allow you to re-create any battle or scenario from the classic Lone Wolf books, and the game comes with pre-made scenarios to start you on your way.

The core game set consists of flat cardboard figures (3 mm thick and die-cut) in a plastic base, played on card maps that are grid-based and modular. The maps are the same material as in Cry Havoc, a previous (and popular) game of Gary's. In addition to being fun, Battle for Magnamund is a showcase for Gary Chalk's inimitable 2-D artwork: all components are illustrated by hand.

name: Werwölfe Vollmondnacht: Nachwuchs-Gerber
description:
This is a promo item for Werwölfe Vollmondnacht (One Night Ultimate Werewolf) containing the Junior Tanner character given out for free in Essen 2018.

In those trying times being a tanner was not easy. Still, there was one individual who wanted to take over and get rid of his master once and for all ...

Flow of the game:
The apprentice tanner can be combined with any of the roles from the main game or its expansions. Depending on whether the tanner from "One Night Ultimate Werewolf" is used the apprentice tanner's role during the game changes.

Rules of play:
(apprentice tanner, wakes up at night **)

The apprentice tanner is called during the night phase and opens his eyes. The tanner, with eyes closed, lifts his thumb so his apprentice can identify him.

If the tanner is in the game:
The apprentice wants to take over the tanner's job. He wins if the tanner is lynched during the vote (Should that be the case, the tanner also wins).

If the tanner is not in the game:
(because the card has not been drawn or has not been used)
The apprentice tanner has already taken over the role of his master and has realized that being a tanner is not as fulfilling as he expected ... like his predecessor he wins if he's lynched during the vote.
mechanics: Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #17
description:
CWC Berlin 2014 Special is a small expansion of the Settlers of Catan base game, given to contestants at the 2014 Catan World Championship.

After distributing the remaining terrain hexes and number tokens according to the game rules, the Berlin hex "Brandenburg Gate" replaces the desert and the Berlin hex "Museum for Communication" replaces the hex that received the 2 token; the 2 token is removed from the game. The "Berlin Bear" replaces the robber (malicious gossip has it that Berlin's heraldic animal is collecting resources for the completion of the Berlin airport).

When a 7 is rolled, the resulting actions are carried out according to the normal rules. Afterwards, each player with a settlement or city at a corner of a Berlin hex receives the resource produced by the terrain hex the "Berlin bear" was moved to. A player who has various settlements or cities adjacent to a Berlin hex still only gets 1 resource.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Warmachine: High Command – Colossal Warfare
description:
Bolster your armies with Colossal Warfare, the third expansion for Warmachine: High Command!

Colossal Warfare contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Cygnar, Khador, Protectorate of Menoth, and Cryx decks.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.

name: Factions
description:
Enter a world where every decision you make will have lasting consequences. Customize the board, your faction and your strategies!

Factions has been designed to provide you with an accessible yet deep, highly customizable, tabletop wargame. You take on the role of a military leader in one of four (base game) competing Factions and will need all your planning, tactics and cunning to dominate in this deeply immersive game. The many levels of customization available in FACTIONS means the replay value is extremely high, and every game brings a new set of challenges for you to enjoy.

name: マケランディア (Macelandia)
description:
マケランディア (Macelandia) is a team-based strategy simulation card game.

The players are divided into a light side and a dark side, and fight as a commander who protects the castle and the fortress placed on the map.

The commander is required to be strategic to utilize the benefits of the land on the vast continent of the Macelandia. Players must deduce from limited information what might be in the enemy's hand. And above all, co-operation with friends is the key to victory. The end of this story is in your hands

In the past, there was a continent called Macelandia in this world. The powers believing in the God of Light and the powers believing in the Dark God fought over and over again across the continent. After a long battle of death, Rumei, the fairy of light, sealed the king of the dark king, Siose, in the cave of The White Nights. This war is called Maceraki War and became a legend.

Then after 500 years of peace, the sinister prophecy came to be whispered in the kingdom of acid light Gard. When the moons overlap and the dark king wakes up from a long sleep, he will lead the army of the dark and rise up again.

The battle between light and dark, the connection between the two great powers, is about to begin again ...

Macelandia is a strategy simulation card game that realizes a simple but deep game system.

The player chooses only three actions: attack, reinforcement, and standby.
However, there are clever rules such as the difference in the role of Castle and Samurai assigned to players, and the Expedition rule, when sending cards to a distance.

Elements of strategy, mystery and co-operation are included in simple rules, and 4 to 8 people can enjoy a hot and serious game.

When you lose, cry out "Macelandia!"
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: 四畳半ペーパー賽系 (Four-and-a-Half Tatami Mat Galaxy)
description:
In 四畳半ペーパー賽系 (Yojōhan Pēpā Saikei), roughly "Four and a half tatami mat room", players are experiencing their last 12 months of school life and trying to balance their school work, hobbies, friends, love life, and a part time job.

A deck of polyomino cards and a roll of 5 dice determine what shapes the players may color in on their mats each turn. The first shape may be filled in anywhere, but future shapes must be adjacent to previous ones, and same colored shapes may not be adjacent.

In each game, a selection of event cards will give players points for meeting certain objectives, and each color of dice has a different scoring algorithm. Some accomplishments, such as completing each mat of their room, will also earn the player money that they color in on their wallet and can spend for certain bonuses.

After 12 rounds, the player with the most points wins.
publishers: ハレルヤロックボーイ (Hallelujah Rockboy)

name: Confabulation
description:
The main goal of Confabulation is to score points by spelling words.
First, a category card is drawn and a category is chosen. This can be done by playing the categories in order, or by rolling a die or otherwise randomly selecting one if just one round is to be played.
Second, each player is dealt 6 word cards, which have 3x3 grids of letters on them. A timer is set for three minutes. The players will use their own hand of cards to spell words in the selected category until the time runs out.
The players can rearrange the cards as much as they would like; the cards can be rotated or overlapped. Players write down each word once they find it, then they can rearrange the cards (they don't have to preserve the configuration that allowed them to spell the word).
When spelling words, any adjacent letters may be used, including diagonally-connected letters (similar to the mechanics of the game Boggle). Letters may only be used once in any given word.
At the end of the round, points are counted. 3- and 4-letter words are worth one point, 5-letter words are worth 2 points, 6-letter words are worth 3 points, 7-letter words are worth 4 points, etc.
Plural words do not count unless the word is naturally plural (eg. pants). Spelling the word 'mountains', for example, would count only as the 8-letter word 'mountain'.
Proper nouns DO count if it makes sense in the category. (For example, if the category is 'science terms' then the word 'Einstein' would be allowed).

Players can challenge the spelling of another player's word. If the spelling is incorrect, the word does not count.
Players can play as many or as few rounds as they want.

Alternative scoring:
Instead of totaling the score of all words at the end of the round, the player who spelled the longest word in the three-minute time period is the winner.

Alternative gameplay:
Players can adjust the number of cards dealt to each player or the amount of time in a round.

—description from the designer

name: Aristotle's Elements and Space
description:
Aristotle’s Elements and Space is a Greek themed, interactive card game that is fun for the whole family and sure to keep you on your toes. Lay down your cards featuring Ancient Greek philosophers, mathematicians, and gods and compete with your friends to see which element will triumph. Best for 3-5 players ages 10+, it only takes 10 minutes to learn and 15 minutes to play. Choose your cards carefully, call an element of surprise when you’re feeling lucky, and watch out that no one steals your tokens: Open up a box of fun and battle to reign victorious over the table.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Advantage Token, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking, Voting

name: Despistas
description:
Two teams facing each other in a crazy game in which each leader gives clues to the opposing team... what a fuss!

Will you be able to give clues that are specific enough for your team, but seemingly irrelevant so that your rival doesn't intercept them?


Dos equipos enfrentados en un loco juego en el que cada líder da pistas al equipo contrario… ¡Qué jaleo!

¿Seréis capaces de dar pistas lo suficientemente concretas para vuestro equipo, pero aparentemente irrelevantes para que no las intercepte el rival?

name: Tri-Cross
description:
An abstract strategy game played on three rows and columns that cross in the centre with pieces of various strengths and powers ("chess-like").

Players begin with hidden pieces, described as a "poker-like element" by the designer -- challenges between players will reveal the pieces, at which point various captures may be made. As stated, the winner is the player who controls the center for four consecutive turns.

Tri-Cross is a classic game of strategy for the 21st century that can be learned quickly and played within a short period of time. Tri-Cross has five variations of play and can be played with 2-4 players individually or by teams.

name: Hetzen nach Schätzen
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The notorious pirate Captain Sabertooth is looking for a new crew member — but not just any pirate wannabe can join him. If the players want to be hired by Cap'n Sabertooth in Hetzen nach Schätzen, they'll have to prove to him how clever they are and join him on a treasure hunt! They need to run as fast as they can from one treasure chest to another to get rid of their pirate cards. Whoever first discards all of his pirate cards at the treasure chests correctly, then picks up Pirate Fex from the compass card wins this fast-paced treasure hunt!

name: Open Season
description:
In Open Season, you play as a monster — a little cruel, but wishing to do things right — who has decided to take revenge on the groups of adventurers who come to disturb their peace. After getting rid of them, you still have to decorate your living room properly, so you try to assemble a nice collection of heads on the wall.

The game takes place over 11 or 9 rounds, then players score. Players take turns clockwise, doing the following on their turn:

1. Fill the market to five face up cards.
2. Take a card from the market, and place it on a free space on their board.
3. Trigger any bonus actions; these three actions are associated with the top three slots of your player board, and you trigger one when you place a card in your reserve matching a person associated with one of the three actions. If by activating a bonus action, a new card is placed in your reserve, it can trigger another bonus action.

On your player board

All slots in the top row must contain different peoples and/or face down cards.
The two cards on either side of the "Different" symbol must be of different peoples and/or face down cards.
All slots in the bottom row must contain different peoples and/or face down cards.


After nine rounds, the game ends, then players count their points.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: Doomworks
description:
As a mad scientist you're tired of the world laughing at your devious and diabolical attempts to rule the world. So you're calling in a little help in making your doomsday machines that much more "doomier". Scientists of various disciplines are willing to help you out with your machine, but be cautious. Some scientists will sabotage your machine, making harder to finish - and some scientists are a bit thumb-fingered. Too many mistakes and the world will end a bit early, whether anyone wants it to or not.

Players collect scientists of various disciplines: biologists, volcanologists, chemists, engineers, and occultists work together to activate different machine components. As players take turns either drawing or assigning scientists, the Doommakers - scientists the bring about the apocalypse early - make critical mistakes. Too may mistakes, and the game ends, possibly without any completed machines.

When the game ends, the player with the most points wins. Players earn points through activating components, point bonuses on components, and point modifiers found on your original machine.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Millimemory
description: In Millimemory / ミリメモリー, players try to remember the length of everyday household items. Each player has an unmarked ruler to estimate the length and begins the game at 100 points. Players lose 1 point for each millimeter they are off the correct length. Players are eliminated when they run out of points, and the last player in the game wins.
publishers: Arclight Games, とどのつまり (Todonotsumari)

name: Expedition: Deluxe Edition
description:
Expedition is a cooperative adventure game for 1-6 players ages 10+. Expedition can be played with or without a GM, and is enjoyed by players of all experiences levels.

Powered by a free companion app with over 100 quests (and growing), there’s always something new to play. Adventures range from short family-friendly comedies to whole-night epics and multi-night campaigns. The app even has online multiplayer, so you can play with friends no matter where they are.

-from the back of the box

Expedition: The Roleplaying Card Game is a fast RPG that expedites character creation and combat, allowing adventurers to immediately jump into the action.

Expedition uses an open source, cross-platform app that is free on iOS, Android, and web browsers. The app comes with a variety of pre-built adventures and also provides tools for you to create and tell your own stories. The game makes use of a unique card-based system for combat. Each player has a deck of eight unique ability cards. Every turn, each player draws three cards, then chooses one to play. This must be done quickly, however, because the app times combat; if your party takes too long, you suffer additional damage! This simulates the hectic nature of battle and balances the time spent role-playing and performing combat.

The Deluxe Edition includes everything you need to play Expedition, plus The Horror and The Future expansions. It also features upgraded components: thicker cards, custom clips and a larger, future-proof box.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: La Bataille de Valmy
description: Simple variation of the Napoleon's Last Battles system depicting the Franco-Prussian engagement at the start of the Revolutionary War on 20 September 1792. Colorful 78x56cm map at a scale of 400m per hex, and double-sided units at regimental and battalion level. The game has simple formation rules, but is low-complexity with no facing rules. The 19-page rulebook, in French, contains historical commentary, OBs, examples of play, but only 8 pages of actual rules. Not much chrome, for instance to simulate the famous French cannonade!

name: Pari
description: Players add cards to mathematical equations in the middle of the table. A player who can complete a correct equation scores points. A player who cannot achieve this will add cards to existing equations to make them more complex and harder to complete for other players. Cards are either number cards (one digit, can be combined to form higher numbers) or operator cards (=, +, -, x, /).

name: Hellweg westfalicus: Free Choice Mini-Expansion
description:
Postcard mini-expansion (available for download from the designer's website in German or English)

Free Choice is a new merchandise card

The owner of the card can freely choose when stocking up or when placing a Merchandise token in a town with two trading houses one which trading house there he places a token.

But he may still place a merchandise token only in a city where he already has merchandise token(s)

name: The Fight: We gonna fight them all!
description:
Welcome to The Fight!

You and your fellow crew have heard of an abandoned dungeon with rumors of great treasures inside, yet nobody else but you has dared to check the truth about these rumors — and now you know why: A horde of monsters inside the dungeon got bored and now they crave a good fight.

There is no time for a long strategy session. Use the weapons at hand, making the right combined decisions of how to fight against the various monsters without revealing too much information to them as blind trust in your crew may be the best chance you have to coordinate your strengths.

The Fight is played in fifty levels. Each level takes only a few minutes, with you fighting against a certain number of monsters. Typically, one monster lies face up in the center of play, and your crew needs to beat its strength value in one attack to win the fight. For each attack, you all place one card from your hand face down in front of you. If your revealed fighting total matches or exceeds the value of a face-up monster, you beat it; otherwise, the monster remains face up and keeps fighting.

To win a level, you can discuss your strategy with your crew. You can never talk about your card values in hand, but can debate whether you want to "strike fast" or "take it slow". You can also use available special actions to gain the most benefits from them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Great Board Games
description:
Great Board Games. Over 40 games that you can play. 1895-1955. Complete with rules and counters."

Similar to the author's earlier "Play the Game" book, "Great Board Games" is a collection of 43 vintage games that you can play. There is a color photo of the board for each game, rules, and a few sheets of game pieces to be cut out.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Book, Children's Game, Racing, Wargame
publishers: A & C Black, argos press, H. Proost & Cie, KOSMOS, Macmillan Publishing

name: Bauernschnapsen
description: Bauernschnapsen follows the basic rules of Schnapsen, but is actually a very different game for 3 and 4 players. In the "multiplayer" Bauernschnapsen, players may announce a certain contract of victory conditions (Bettler (Beggar) --> player won't win a single trick; Gang (Walk) --> player wins all tricks; Schnapser --> player wins first three tricks and reaches 66;...) with regional differences regarding which are considered legal options, or play a "normal game" (follows closely the Schnapsen rules). All of which have different victory point values; the highest one announced gets played. Furthermore, an opposing player can announce to "counter" a contract and be the one to play it instead, which doubles the point value. In the 3-player variant, the two other players temporarily ally to win over the announcing player. In the 4-player game, you are permanently allied with the player sitting opposite you. The first player/group to reach 24 points will win the set. After an agreed upon number of won sets (with those won without any points gained by the opposing players, so-called Bummerl, counting double) is reached, the match ends.

name: Somaliland 1940
description:
Italy conquers British Somaliland

Somaliland ’40 simulates the Italian conquest of British Somaliland in August 1940. In this two player game, one player ontrols the Italian forces and the other the British forces.[...]
The map depicts the part of British Somaliland where the harshest combats took place. Each hex is about 10 km across (6.2 miles).
Each game turn represents two days. The ground unit counters principally represent battalions, armored companies and artillery batteries.

(source: rulebook)

name: Choco Challenge
description:
Each year, the most skillful master chocolatiers coming from the most remote corners of the world gather to determine who among them will be able to wear the coveted Dark Choco Crown. In order to win, they will need a good sense of risk, a sprinkle of strategy, and a just a pinch of luck: are you ready to sit down at their table and prove what you're made of?
The most skilled master chocolatiers compete to wear the coveted Dark Choco Crown!

In order to win, one needs strategy, luck, and to know when to take risks.


Draw cards from your own deck. Be careful not to Bust!
Use them to buy exquisite Ingredients to add to your deck.
Score bonus points by conquering precious Desserts!

name: Shape Up!
description:
Circles, triangles or squares? Solid or hollow? Red, green or blue?

Your challenge is to play cards to fill the grid and line up the shapes that will score you the most points — while trying to stop your opponent doing exactly the same thing!

name: Sagrada
description:
Sagrada is a Spanish learning game with German as the source language.

Summary

The players of Sagrada focus on two goals: First, they want to learn or revise the core vocabulary of Spanish nouns (about 800 words). Second, the players want to complete the unfinished church La Sagrada Familia. Towards this end, each player gets a number of jigsaw puzzle pieces which they have to buy during the game. The required money is earned by trading in language cards and asset cards. The game ends when one player has bought and laid out all their puzzle pieces and also manages to correctly solve five of the language cards he/she has collected during the game.

The game mechanics in more detail

A die determines the players' movement on the game board. The board contains the following types of spaces:
Event spaces and special spaces: The player draws a card from the corresponding stack. Event cards must be played immediately, special cards can be kept until needed.
Attraction spaces: The player receives an asset card of the corresponding tourist attraction. Different attractions have cards worth different amounts of money.
Language spaces: The player gets a language card, which they have to learn during the game. Each language card contains two different words or phrases in German and Spanish.
Metro spaces can be used either as a shortcut to a different metro space, or as an event, special or language space (player's choice).
Bank spaces: On a bank space, the player can exchange asset and language cards for money. To do so, they must have learned the language cards. During an exchange attempt, one asset card and two language cards are submitted. The German words are read out, and if the active player correctly translates them to Spanish, he/she receives the amount of money specified on the asset card. If they fail, they get back their cards and can try again later.
Casa de Pledras spaces: The player can pay for one of his puzzle pieces to be added to the puzzle that is laid out on the table (all players contribute to one puzzle).

name: Pre-Fix
description: A card displaying two or three letters is drawn, and players list as many words beginning with those letters as they can within the time limit. Points are awarded for number of words, number of words not found by other players, and length of words.

name: Chicken Soup for the Kid's Soul
description: Chicken Soup for the Kid's Soul: Changing the World One Story at at Time (TM). Like the chicken soup games for Teenage and Family souls, this game is based on the best-selling books. In this case, children ages 8 and up share life experiences about "family and friends", "attitudes and perspectives", "choices", and "overcoming obstacles." Player answer questions about things that are important to kids in order to collect six "Life's Ingredients" cards (happiness, love, hope, joy, faith, and peace). Tin includes game board, 200 cards, 6 pawns, sand timer, pencil, pad and special Chicken Soup d6 die.

name: Kombi-Kolor
description: This game is essentially a clone of Bazaar, with only slight modifications (6 colors and also 6 colors on the cards). There are four piles of cards, the topmost cards face up. All these cards show six colors that is their "price": when the player can pay the coins of these colors they get points (depending on the number of coins left in hand). Players roll the dice and get the coin of the color that's shown on the dice. OR they can use the exchange rates shown on two chosen exchange ratio cards (so e.g. they get 3 blue and a red coin for one yellow and a green coin etc.). The aim of the game is to collect most points until all cards are played.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Gobble, Gobble
description: In Gobble, Gobble players hunt turkeys using cards in their hand that allow them to shoot or other special abilities. Turkeys are of various values and kept when shot by each player in a pile that is summed at the end of the game to determine the winner. There are also Hens which count against you if the Game Warden comes along, but are worth a lot if you can manage to dodge him. The Hens came be passed to other players as well. The game is quick and simple to learn.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting

name: Spine Chilling Games
description:
From the back of the book:

Twelve exciting games await you and your friends inside. Everything you need to play, from colorful game boards, to press-out 3-D dice and props are included. There is even a spooky house to build and a host of gruesome ghouls to move around the boards. Have you got the nerve to cross the Slime Pit, chase the Swamp Ghoul, or dodge the Monster Mummy in the pyramid? If so, Spine Chilling Games could be the most fun you ever had!

Games included:
Monster Mix 'n' Match, Bats in the Belfry, Zombie Zoo, Swamp Ghoul, Create a Creature, Catacombs, Slime Pit, Jekyll and Hyde, Monster Mummy, Monster Dice, Snake Pit and Monster Hunt.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Business: Il gioco del potere
description:
First of "Il Bel Paese", a collection of monthly issues appearing in Italian newspaperkiosks from late 1985. Each is a boardgame inspired by news.
"Business - Il gioco del potere" ("Business- The game of Power") depicts on its map a square grid featuring the most important public and private companies. The size in squares is larger for the most influential ones. Players put counters of their colors to control squares and when they circle a whole area, as in a kind of Go, they gain total control of it taking away all the opponents' counters. Event cards influence the deployement. Duels are done with green and red cards in a kind of "prisoner's dilemma".
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Enclosure, Events, Negotiation, Open Drafting

name: UNITY
description:
UNITY is a board game for 2 to 3 players, in which each player strives to unite his pieces… at any cost. By sacrificing the right pieces at crucial moments, you can shatter your opponents' groups as they coalesce, or eliminate a pesky splinter group of your own pieces — anything to create unity.

In UNITY, each player’s pieces start dispersed on the board. Your goal is to create a single group of connected pieces of your colour of any size (even just one piece).

UNITY was initially designed for 2 players, with the neutral pieces being just unmovable discs, but was later adapted to accommodate a 3rd player.

The Basic and Deluxe editions have been replaced by the new Unified Edition, that contains:

• A board with 91 hexagonal spaces.
• A supply of rectangular walls.
• 15 ring-shaped pieces of each colour (purple, orange, and green).
• 15 asterisk-shaped pieces of each colour.
• One counter of each colour to show which player is which colour.
• A carrying case

name: Can It!
description: The game comes with a small trash can which also serves as the box/case. Inside are three orange flippers used to launch the pieces of trash into the can.

name: Ta Teixh
description: Each player tries to create the longest continuous wall on the board. Players exchange turns putting one piece of their wall on the board, trying to expand their wall and at the same time stop the progress of their opponent's.

name: Alternative Civil War: 1861
description:
Alternative Civil War is a 28mm scale miniature skirmish wargame set in an alternate world. Impossible science collides with ancient powers and mythical beings clash with courageous soldiers over the American Civil War battlegrounds in a conflict that has transcended its own frontiers.

This is a skirmish game of miniatures of the finest quality, cast by some of the best professionals in the industry. The game ranges from 6 to 16 models per side and the rules are easy. It has a deep tactical component, using one or two 20 sided dice to resolve every action in a single roll. An elegant system of alternating turns will keep both players on the edge, avoiding long waits while your opponent finishes his turn and creating a swift and dynamic battle.

The game incorporates the mechanism of a Tactical Impulse Pool: a limited resource that will grant you benefits such as re-rolling, gaining additional actions or activating skills. Players will need to strategize where and when to commit their resources.

name: UFO Defense Protocol
description:
Summary

UFO Defense Protocol is a strategy boardgame for 2 to 7 players, which can be played as a team versus team game (humans versus aliens), or alternatively, as a full cooperative game (all the players against the game).

The game takes place in a situation of emergency.
The existence of aliens has been discovered, and they threaten to invade the planet.
The players either control a secret cell of humans or an imperial alien faction.
They fight each other to protect or conquer the planet.

The game features construction, research, squad combat and air battles.
All decisions and strategic actions are done in simultaneous turns. Ground and air battles still need to be resolved separately.

The game features 7 factions (4 humans, 3 aliens), with their own abilities and special units.



General gameplay

Every turn, Alien factions adapt stronger warships, clone more soldiers, and prepare their mothership.
The objective of the alien team is to successfully complete a mothership and have it land on planet Earth.

To counter the alien invasion, human factions recruit soldiers, launch attack jets and develop secret weapons.
The objective of the human team is to build a spacecraft, and have it destroy the alien colony. They must also down any mothership that would come.

Other victory options are available.
Aliens can win the game if they terrorize enough cities to create such chaos that the human directors will be dismissed.
This happens immediately if the Terror Counter reaches 13.

And any team wins the game if at the end of 12 turns, no team has met victory conditions, and it has the most Prestige.


Game modes: Full Cooperative or Team vs Team

The normal game can be played with any number of players from 2 to 7, and can have an asymetric number of players.

Players can choose to play in the Earth United mode, in full cooperation.
Or they can play in the default Alien Invasion mode, with a team of aliens versus a team of humans.

Each player picks a faction at the beginning of the game.
Earth United is limited to the human factions (4 players).
In Alien Invasion, there are 4 human factions and 3 alien factions available.
publishers: Dreamship Interactive, Role et Strategie Editions

name: Ghost Hunter
description:
So you want to join the Infernal Club? Do you have what it takes? The club members are an unusual bunch to say the least. Drawn from diverse backgrounds, some are explorers, others are scholars, but all the ladies and gentlemen are drawn together by one thing – the occult!

Their curiosity and thirst for knowledge of the arcane arts draws them towards it like so many moths to an open flame. In their plush and exclusive London Club they meet to discuss their latest exploits - the artifacts uncovered, the diabolical schemes foiled, and the supernatural terrors they have hunted.

The unofficial motto of the club is ’Possession is 9/10th of the lore.’ An offhand joke maybe, yet many say it perfectly captures the club’s healthy spirit of competition and the very real danger its members face every time they set out on another paranormal investigation.

In Ghost Hunter players take on the role of new Infernal Club members and set out on a quest to the notorious Blackmoor House to compete against their fellow hunters to capture as many of the unholy spirits that haunt it as possible without succumbing to the terror and ending up haunted for life!

Ghost Hunter is a card game for 2 – 7 players that should last between 10-30 minutes. Players take it in turns to lay higher and higher cards on a central stack. If a player can’t lay an equal or higher card on the stack then they have to pick it up. If a player manages to lay a group of 3 cards at once then they get to capture the stack. Plenty of the cards come with special rules that you can manipulate to turn the game your way. The first player to play all of their cards ends the game and then players count up the scores of all of the cards that they captured minus all of the cards that they didn’t manage to get rid of. The player with the highest score wins the game.

The rules are simple but the strategies can be complex. Skill and luck play their parts in equal measure in this short but engaging card game. It pays to get rid of your cards and be the Ghost Hunter who ends the game but victory is never assured until the final scores are counted.

name: Cardthrower Castle
description:
The card throwing game of fantasy siegecraft.

Each player chooses an army which they can choose to customise if they wish, then takes turn throwing cards across the table at each other's castle. If the castle (enemy deck) is hit, it loses cards based on the accuracy of the hit and type of card thrown. Dead Mammoths deal more damage then severed heads. When a player's castle runs out of cards, it is considered to have been razed to the ground and they lose.

You can use sneaky tactics cards to foil your foes plans and fight ground troops using rock, paper, scissors (each unit getting advantages and disadvantages which decide draws.)

It's a fast paced game which lasts around five minutes per bout, but rest assured, as soon as you're done, you'll want another chance to hone your throwing technique and grind your enemy's castle into dust.

name: Abaddon: Shattered Command
description:
Abaddon: Shattered Command is an expansion for Richard Borg's Abaddon. The expansion adds a new unit, Command Bunker. These immobile fortresses are extremely potent in defense, but have no offensive capability. They provide support to all of your units through the Program Deck. Each Program card adds powerful abilities to affect the battlefield.

In addition to the Command Bunker, unit upgrades have been added. Now your Link or Infantry can be equipped with modified weapons, jump packs, or improved targeting systems.

Also included is a point system for building your own battles, want to fight 8 heavy Links against a horde of infantry? Now you can build that battle.

Terrain rules have been added as well, now terrain can be entered and it can provide bonuses for the occupants.

Finally eight additional scenarios are included. These scenarios feature the rules added in the game.

Included in this expansion:

16 page Rule book-Scenario Book

3 Tile Sheets (Command Bunkers, Terrain, Power Crytstals and Upgrade Markers.)

2 reference sheets

20 card Program Deck.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Punk Rock Book Tour: The Boardgame
description:
Live the adventurous life of a publisher on the road! Meet fans, discover rare books, get peed on by cats! Just make sure you can scrape up enough gas money to get to the next city or it's game over, man, game over.
