A supplement for Pulp Alley miniatures rules.
From the website:
This thrilling Pulp Alley expansion provides rules for BIG guns, strange gadgets, riding mounts, vehicles, custom modifications, and much, much more. From dog-sleds to flying characters, and from airplanes to colossal walking robots, our Pulp Gadgets, Guns, and Vehicles book makes it fast and easy to add even more excitement to your Pulp Alley scenarios.

name: GSBM
description:
A mysterious dungeon emerged from the middle of the continent with great power to summon creatures and control them. All nearby kingdoms have sent heroes. Some are here to destroy the dungeon, some to take that great power. You are one of these heroes. By your king's order, you must defeat all other heroes and monopolize this dungeon.

The dungeon will help you summon powerful creatures, but you need an altar to do this — and if you lose your altars, you can hardly survive this battle. By the same token, you can dominate this dungeon by conquering your enemies' altars. You can also collect victory points by destroying the enemies themselves. Making the most powerful army is one way to win. Now it's time to begin the battle!

GSBM (Great Strategy of Battle Monsters) is a fantasy-based strategy game that gives you extreme freedom to maximize your strategic choices and control the game. Each player forms an army of monsters to compete with other players in phases such as Produce, Summon, Move, Battle, and Conquer; each monster has its own unique skill, allowing you to devise clever strategies by combining it with other skills or tactic cards. Players must manage their resources, action points and five mana elements: water, fire, air, earth, and ether. Using these resources effectively is the key to victory. Players must also use field effects, elemental superiority, unit type differences (infantry/archer/cavalry/flyer), joint attacks, and joint defense to their advantage.

The game offers several victory conditions, so each player can take strategic approaches to different victories based on how the game plays out. The game field is randomized for each new game, altering territorial dynamics between players and providing near-infinite start settings. As players become more skilled with the game, their tactics and strategy develop, allowing them to play against others with more unique and original play styles.

•••

GSBM은 판타지 세계관을 배경으로 한 2~8인용 전략 게임으로서 최대한의 자유도 및 무한한 확장성을 바탕으로, 게이머의 게임 지배력과 전략적 선택가능성을 극대화한 작품입니다. 핸드와 필드 관리, 마나 관리, 승점 관리, 소환 거점 관리 등의 여러 요소가 게임에 녹아 있습니다. 이들을 균형있게 유지해야만 마법진에서 승리의 영광을 눌리 수 있을 것입니다.

name: Incognito: Road Trip
description:
This is a solitaire adventure playable with ordinary playing cards.

Four intrepid heroes are on a cross-country trip with the goal of getting the heir to the kingdom safely across the border. On the way they have to fight enemy soldiers, but this takes a toll on their strength. As they accumulate money, they may be able to hire sympathizers to fight their battles for them, but when they are alone or out of money, they have to fight their way through on their own.

Clubs represent hostile forces, Spades represent the heroes and their sympathizers, Hearts represent hit points, and Diamonds represent money. One card at a time is turned over and placed on the layout in its appropriate place. Every time a Club is turned up, the player has to deal with it using the resources available. The goal is to escape all the hostile forces and get to the border safely without being captured.

name: Ex Libris: Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter.

Game Boy Geek themed book cards that replace their respective counterparts in the base game. These cards have different icons than the base game versions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Winoc
description:
In the famous little town of Bergues in north France, you move your guard around the city wall following one of the two paths after placing some pavements. Your guard needs to finish his move on a door of his fortress to win. Be careful as you are one of four guards on the way to that door! Remember those pavements side and choose the right path to succeed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building

name: Highway to Hell: Perilous Escort
description:
This expansion set for Highway to Hell lets you pick up new characters aboard your thrumming vehicle.

Some will lend you a hand in your quest for justice, others will need your protection, whereas you will have to take the last ones before a court where they will confess their misdeeds.

This expansion set offers to use new strategies in your race for fame with the help of new kinds of passengers.

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Code 3: The Breaking Point
description: The Breaking Point is one of the first three expansions packs for Code 3. It includes a new officer, new chief and new scenario to play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Isles of Terror: Wokou Faction Expansion
description:
Adds a fifth player (sixth if you have the Kolonial Korps).
Contains 7 faction strategy cards, 1 faction ship card, 2 event cards, 1 mission card, faction sheet, faction player board, linen bag, extra resource & success tokens, faction specific action tokens and wooden components for this faction.

Contains the specified amount of cards in both German and English.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Gloomhaven: The Tower of Misfortune (Promo Scenario)
description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was available as part of the 2018, 2019, and 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter campaigns.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tribu de Sinvergüenzas
description:
Tribu de Sinvergüenzas is a drinking game in which you will face three types of challenges: Indictment, Social Defiance, and WTF Questions.

If you dare, you must accuse others, respond with truth, or share the challenge.

At game's end, the player with the most points is expelled from the tribe, while the player with the fewest is named Head of the Scoundrel Tribe and winner of this game.

name: Campaign Trail: Advanced Solo Mode
description:
Advanced Solo Mode is a 50-card deck featuring new rules, new depth and solo mode debates. It can be used in both solo and multiplayer games (with humans). Each advanced solo deck acts as one AI opponent; multiple decks can be used in a game.

The Advanced Solo Mode deck offers an easy, medium, and hard mode. The standard solo play deck (contained in each base game) does not include debates and is approximately medium mode.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Dice Dodgems
description:
Dice Dodgems is a 30 minute strategy game of dodging and bumping for 2-4 players, designed by City Square Studios.

In Dice Dodgems, players control miniature dodgems as they dodge and bump around the arena. The goal of the game is to be the last dodgem standing. The winner is the last player with dice.

While the game's rules are easy to understand for newcomers, the bouncing mechanics and ability to see and predict other dodgems moves make for a deeper strategic experience, with great replay-ability. A chess-like battle can occur when two or more strategic players bounce around the arena.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Medvěd WRR: Poprask na kolejích
description:
"Full steam ahead!" Engineer Crocs ordered his chums. They were busy with keeping the steel locomotive on the rails. The train was full of fairy-tale creatures who have become poor victims of Crocs' villainous plan. Can you save all the creatures before the train reaches its final station, as the WRR? Be quiet so Crocs doesn’t catch you!

Medvěd WRR: Poprask na kolejích (The WRR: Railroad Mayhem) is a fast paced dice game based on the popular Czech book for kids.

The objective of the game is to gain and combine colored cars by rolling dice in a way they make one of the winning combos. The player to do so first wins.

name: Fluxx: More Rules
description: More Rules is an expansion pack for any standalone Fluxx game, with this pack containing ten new rules and three "meta rule" cards.

name: Fluxx: More Actions
description: More Actions is an expansion pack for any standalone Fluxx game, with this pack featuring ten action cards that will spice up whatever version you're playing.

name: Sports Dice: Soccer
description:
Roll your way to victory with Sports Dice Soccer!

Sports Dice Soccer is a fast paced, easy to learn and quick to play dice game that gives players all the action of a real Soccer game. Roll your dice and kick the ball in the opponent’s net to score! The first player with 3 points wins the game.

Sports Dice Soccer is an ideal game for all Soccer fans ages 7 and up. It is the latest addition to the Sports Dice’s series.

—description from the publisher

name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Principi Promo Card
description:
Promo card for the base game originally given out at Modena Play in May 2022.

Ability: When you place a worker in the workshop, draw 2 cards and then discard 2 cards.

name: KUGO
description:
KUGO is a flick based dexterity game made out of all-natural, solid wood. But this isn't just one game. This is a box to make lots of games, You can create minute long flip tricks or trick shots or sets up longer team-based games like "Capture the Flag" or "KUGO K.O." And you even create your very own games!

KUGO gameplay centres around a saucer-shaped disc that we call "The Puck". Flick the puck through tricks, games and obstacles. It's that simple, if you can flick, you can play.

Built for all ages, built to last, use the pieces in the box to build games, create tricks and unleash your imagination in a world of flick-based fun!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Environmental, Party Game
mechanics: Flicking, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Deck of Spies
description:
Recruit, counter, retire, and assassinate to dominate in Deck of Spies, a solo deckbuilding game played with a standard deck of cards.

The top card on the Spy Deck represents a spy that you must outwit. Each turn you must either counter or recruit the spy that is face up on top of the Spy Deck. Optionally, you may be able to retire spies from your hand in addition to your counter or recruit action. If things aren’t going well, you may be forced to assassinate your target.

To win Deck of Spies, at the end of the game you must have more than half of the Key Spies (J,Q,K's) in your deck.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Sipario
description:
Each game round, the player on stage draws Script cards, which indicate the characters to portray and the constraints to follow. Subsequently, with the help of another player, they improvise the scene, taking place according to one of the themes suggested by the other players.

At the end of the round, the player on stage will have succeeded if the other players have guessed the contents of the drawn Script cards, provided that the theme and constraints imposed by the game are respected.

—description from the publisher

name: Chasing Eden (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Chasing Eden is a custom scenario for the Time Stories boardgame.

"Times were very different before The Great Peace and the founding of The Time Agency. A powerful government hierarchy wrestled with outlaws and criminal gangs that refused to be quashed. The law was unrelenting and the streets were heavily policed."

Will your team survive this cyberpunk adventure? Chasing Eden is driven by its simple storytelling and evocative artwork set during the founding of the Time Agency. Good luck solving this mystery, and please send through any feedback you might have!

EDIT: Thanks to all who have played the game and left their feedback!

For those interested, I should have given some greater detail in the original upload. A large part of the inspiration was the movie "Edge of Tomorrow", where the character is forced to repeat the same day (learning something new each time) until he finds the path forward. Admittedly, when I've played other Time Stories scenarios my aim has always been to finish while hopefully not having to repeat the mission, but that is largely because Bob is so cranky :P

I wanted my story to have things that you need to pay attention to on the first run (e.g. how to make money, how to save/gain time, how to become badass enough to win the boss-fight, and what receptacle characters are integral to the story). And for the keen of eye, there are various clues around for the various "vital" decisions. The scenario only has a couple of smaller "puzzles" - the greatest puzzle I wanted to make was the actual progression of the story!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Linkeballen
description:
A strategic cycling parlor game for 2-4 players, 8 years and above

Will your team win the tour?
Going for the yellow or do you choose for the team? Climbing the hills or pushing it on a flat stage?
Keep in mind you’re not the only one cycling the road… A small steering error, misjudgment or a ‘cycling strategy’ can cause a sensational collision.
Let your cycling team ride as fast as possible and win the bike race!

Introduction
In this parlor game you play within the stages as a cycling team. A team consists of three riders. The basic game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The duration of a one stage game with 4 players is 1 to 1.5 hours.
. The results of your team and players standings are recorded. A Tour consists of several stages, with the fastest rider over several stages wearing the yellow jersey. You decide for how long and which stages you want to play.
The game is played with cards. By placing a card on the table you decide how fast you are moving your riders on the trail. You try taking tactical moves and benefit from wind advantage by letting your opponent do the hard work. Cast or save your good cards to démarrage when you feel that your opponent cannot. In short: “Linkeballen”.

Note:
If you have the additions as well, you can play up to 24 players.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Mizerka
description: Mizerka is a plain trick taking game from Poland. it is played with a standard 52 card deck. Possible contracts are; suited, no trump or mizerka which is played in no trump and trying to take the least tricks possible. Bidding is slightly unusual in that the first six cards are dealt and the player to dealers left must then choose which contract to play based on these cards alone, there is also a thirteen card Talon to exchange cards with after the deal.

name: La Vuelta al Mundo en 80 Días
description:
"La Vuelta al Mundo en 80 Días" is a game where the different players should try to make a travel around the world in the lowest possible time. Starting from London, the players should administer money and overcome the differents troubles they were involved. The smartest and luckiest player will reach London on the first position and would be the winner of the game. (From the back of the box).

Spanish:

"La Vuelta al Mundo en 80 Días" es un juego en el que los distintos jugadores deben intentar dar la vuelta al mundo en el menor tiempo posible. Partiendo de Londres, tendrán que administrar su dinero y superar las distintas incidencias que les irán surgiendo, además de los imprevistos que les pondrán los otros jugadores. Ganará la partida, y llegará primero a Londres, el jugador que sea más inteligente y tenga más suerte.

Componentes:

- Un tablero de 64x80 cm, que representa la ruta a seguir en la vuelta al mundo, con seis diferentes zonas de ampliación
- Seis peanas de plástico
- Tres fichas para marcar los turnos
- Dos dados
- Noventa cartas, de los siguientes tipos:
- De "Incidencia", que son distintas en cada zona de ampliación
- De "Equipaje"
- De "Transporte"
- De "Crédito"
- De "Imprevistos"
- De "Última Oportunidad"
- Una plantilla con la tabla de precios
- Billetes de diferentes valores
- Una cubeta de plástico
- Un libro de instrucciones
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Action R.P.S
description:
Action R.P.S is a race game on a modular track bearing rock-paper-scissors (RPS) symbols and a "VS" symbol. Each player has three discs, with each disc having two of the RPS symbols on opposite sides, i.e., rock-paper, paper-scissors, and scissors-rock.

On a player's turn, he advances one of his discs, flipping it in the process; occupied RPS spaces are jumped over when moving. When a disc lands on one of the RPS spaces, the symbol on the disc is compared to that of the space. If the disc beats the space (according to standard RPS rules), the disc advances another space, flipping once again. If the symbols are the same, the disc ends its movement on that space, and if the disc loses, it slides back one space without being flipped. On a "VS" space, the disc ends its movement if the space is vacant and advances if one of its own pieces is on the space; if the space is occupied by an opponent, though, the two players compete in an actual RPS game, with the active player moving forward if he wins and ending his turn otherwise.

Players are trying to land their discs in the final section of the track, which is worth bonus points based on how far the disc advances. Additional spaces along the track bear positive or negative points based on that game's set-up. The game ends once a disc reaches the final space on the track. Players then tally their scores, with discs on the starting spaces losing points. Whoever has the most points wins!

name: Bamberg
description:
Bamberg is a social deduction game based on the witch trials of 17th century Europe.

At the beginning of the game, you will receive a secret role which can be Child, Villager, Witch or Familiar.

Children and Villagers belong to The Town team, whereas Witches and Familiars belong to The Coven team.

At first, you will not know who is on your team and who is against you, but as the game progresses, the event cards will help you discover more about each player’s identity.

At the end of each round, players will vote anonymously for whom to burn at the stake, and the player that receives most votes dies. Only Children and Witches reveal their role when they die.

If all Witches die, The Town wins the game. If all Children die, The Coven wins the game.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Renaissance
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Catan Histories: Struggle for Rome – Terror of the Legions expansion
description: This free web-published mini-expansion features 3 Terror of the Legions cards. Each province has two cities with Eagle Standards. For every three cities with Eagle Standards you conquer, you receive the Terror of the Legions card, which is worth 1 VP. The game end condition is increased from 10 to 11 VP.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Flashpoint!
description: Flashpoint! is a rule book aimed at 25mm squad level combat. The 200 page rulebook contains not only the rules to play, but also weapons specifications, troop types, body armor, accessories, mechanized units and robots. Flashpoint! is set on Earth in the far future (2247), its background is a cyberpunk environment with cartels fighting each other. Players spend share points building up their units before going into battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bohnanza
description:
In 2018, German publisher AMIGO released a special edition of the Bohnanza base game in a marketing partnership with the food production company ültje that contains six bonus peanut cards. ("Peanut" in German is "Erdnuss".)

The game plays as traditional Bohnanza, with players trading cards and planting beans in fields in order to score points. While normally each type of bean must stand on its own in a field, the peanut card can be played on any other type of bean. If a field is harvested with a peanut on top of it, the entire field is worthless (as the peanut thief has been caught in the act). If, however, the peanut is buried between two other beans in that field, then the field is worth one more taler than normal.

AMIGO notes that it produced 10,000 copies of this special edition.

name: Poule Poule: Happy Eggs'mas !
description:
The editing of the film Poule Poule continues! New actors appear: Santa Claus, his faithful elves, gift papers, children and Roger who can't help disguising himself… For a “Happy Eggs’mas”!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Noah's Animal Rescue
description:
NOAH NEEDS YOUR HELP! - In our board game for children, it’s a race to get all of the animals on Noah’s boat before the great flood. Can you save them in time? Gather all the animals together to win. Suitable for two to four players, and suitable for children age 4 and up. Box contains 1 game board, 5 animal tokens (frog, duck, squirrel, rabbit, horse), 1 rain token, 36 terrain cards, 13 rain cards.

LEARN TOGETHER, WIN TOGETHER - Our cooperative game emphasizes play and collaboration instead of competition. Players share ideas and strategies together to overcome the game’s obstacles while learning new skills. Everyone wins together. Our children's board game eliminates competitive stress, empowers young learners and that playing together is fun!

WANT YOUR KID TO DO BETTER IN SCHOOL?- Not only will kids have fun playing Noah’s Animal Rescue, but they will also develop their sharing skills, team communication, strategic thinking, and social skills. Our game is designed to help develop teamwork and confidence. Simple skills like turn-taking, good sportsmanship, problem-solving, and more take place when kids engage in our fun board game.

PLAY TOGETHER AS A FAMILY - Our board game for kids is perfect for family game night, class game time, or playing learning games with friends. Instead of scheduling an extra evening study session, you may want to plan for a fun family game night with Noah’s Animal Rescue. Help by being a good role model and play our preschool board game together!

—description from the publisher

name: Ardillas del Bosque
description:
Ardillas del Bosque ("Chipmunks") is a family game in which each player represents a squirrel that will first hide its fruits in the forest (in addition to its "traps") and then pick them up, trying to steal the fruits of other neighboring squirrels.

The game consists of a very innovative modular board adaptable to the number of players, as well as fruit set by squirrels.

During the turn a player will first place his fruits and trap on the board, and later once all the fruits are placed and "hidden" they begin to steal one by one. The mechanics of the game combines set collection and memory.

Also in the board different animals are represented (one face day animals and the other side night animals) which perform actions that will help or hinder the tasks of the squirrel players.

The one who gets the best combination of fruits will win at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Ardillas del bosque es un juego familiar donde cada jugador representa a una ardilla que primero esconderá sus frutos en el bosque (además de sus "trampas") y después las recogerá, intentando robar los frutos de otras ardillas vecinas.

El juego consta de un tablero modular muy innovador adaptable al número de jugadores, así como conjuntos de frutos por ardillas.

Durante el turno un jugador primero colocará sus frutos y trampa en el tablero y, posteriormente - una vez que todos los frutos están colocados y "escondidos" -, se empiezan a robar uno a uno. La mecánica del juego combina, «set collection» y «memory».

Además en el tablero vienen representados diferentes animales (una cara animales de día y en la otra cara animales de noche) los cuales realizan unas acciones que ayudarán o dificultarán las tareas de las ardillas jugadoras.

Ganará aquel que consiga mejor combinación de frutos al final del juego.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Overlord: 6 juin 1944
description:
This game covers the first few days of the Normandy campaign, at one day per turn and each counter representing a regiment or less.
It uses a similar system to that which appeared in Ardennes 1944.

This is one of Vae Victis' larger games, with several maps and counters to remove from the pages of the magazine itself, along with the usual number that comes with all VV issues.

Note: This is at a lower scale and distinct from - Normandy 44 (Vae Victis #27) which was re-worked as Normandy 44: A Bloody Summer.

name: The Gettysburg Campaign
description:
In the Summer of 1863, General Robert E. Lee lead the Army of Northern Virginia deep into Union territory in hopes of capturing vital northern supply cities and forcing an early end to the American Civil War. The Union army, finding itself in the middle of yet another high level reorganization and command change after the debacle at Chancellorsville, was slow to respond. What followed was the largest and most important single battle of the war, and in American history.

But things could have been different. Find out how in this exciting new game from Deer Valley Game Company. Not another re-make of the Battle of Gettysburg; this game re-creates the entire Gettysburg Campaign - Lee's 1863 Summer Offensive. Now you are in charge!

This operational level game uses the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligance of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location. The game board portrays the eastern part of the country, from southern Pennsylvania to northern Virginia, with a point to point movement system on a 30 x 22 playing map. Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Fixienomics
description:
In Fixienomics, you play as one of the Fixies, creating unusual inventions and trying to eliminate accidents.

Each round, the Fixies bid against each other using Details to create an invention in one of the sectors. From time to time, there are accidents that need to be eliminated, and as with the inventions, the Fixies compete to see which one of them will be able to fix the accident.

name: Jetpack Joyride: Party Expansion
description:
The Party Expansion allows 2 more players to join the race!
Contains 25 additional polyomino tiles, 6 unique Gadgets and 8 unique Lab cards. It contains both English and French versions of the cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Racing, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: The Queen's New Capital
description:
The Queen's New Capital is an engaging deck-building city-development board game with a fast-paced gameplay experience, featuring an animal world inspired by stop-motion art. Players assume the roles of provincial governors, competing to have their respective regions chosen as the Queen's new capital. To secure victory in this contest, they must utilize all their resources and seek assistance whenever possible.

However, this journey will not be without obstacles, as remnants of the old regime still lurk in the shadows, plotting an uprising.

The core game loop of The Queen's New Capital is quite simple: Players draw six cards and play four cards each round. These action cards enable players to construct structures (the primary source of points in the game), recruit leaders with passive abilities, acquire more powerful action cards, and contribute to the kingdom's Political and Warfare crises.

The winner will be the first player to obtain eight Recognition Seals, which are bestowed upon reaching five points in each of the four Province Status tracks: Might, Morale, Influence, and Wealth.

The Queen's New Capital is a strategic game that immerses players in the difficult decisions faced by leaders when overseeing a community's ascent. Going all-in on dazzling new infrastructure may attract thieves and political dissidents, while dedicating all resources to safeguarding the frontiers can impede innovation and development. Striking a balance and establishing a swift engine is the key to achieving victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection

name: Spoils of War: Singing Stone
description:
Available from Bower's Game Corner Presents: Gen Con Video Bonanza 2017 Kickstarter campaign.

Artifact: When a Viking makes a dice bid, you may ask them to reveal 2 dice that match their bid. If they do not, you may look through their Stash and take a Treasure.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Ascension: Lunar Matriarch Promo Card
description:
Starting in June 2015, Stone Blade Entertainment announced a new incentive program for hobby retailers. The company will now offer exclusive monthly promo card kits to participating retailers.

Lunar Matriarch is the card for July 2015.

Cost: 7 Runes

Lifebound Hero

Gain 5 Honor
Once this turn, you may pay up to 5 rune to gain that much honor

4 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Photome's
description:
Photome's, a.k.a. フォトムズ, is a co-operative game in which you place animals to be visible — or place 3D buildings to hide certain animals — to create your ideal city. Use your smartphone to check whether your ideal city is being built properly.

This game won first place out of 213 games in a Board Game Grand Prix event themed around 'Home', sponsored by a real estate company, Lifull Home's.

Publisher's summary
The rules are easy! A somewhat unusual cooperation game using a camera function. You moved to a fashionable city where various animals are entertained.

Take a photo and show off to your friends in this fashionable city where you will live from now on! Can you take nice pictures well?

It is the best award winning work chosen from among 213 submissions of the board game Grand Prix with the theme of "living".

ルールはカンタン！カメラ機能を使ったちょっと変わった協力ゲーム。
さまざまな動物たちであぶれるオシャレな街に引越したあなた。
これから住むこのオシャレな街を、写真に撮って友達に自慢しちゃいましょう！ うまく素敵な写真が撮れるでしょうか？

「住」をテーマにしたボードゲームグランプリの213作品のご応募の中から選ばれた最優秀賞作品です。

name: Cabby!
description:
A unique game from the 30s in that, aside from the basic 'roll and move' mechanism, players are allowed to "cheat".

Each player has a Cab to pick up and drop off passengers for points... they also have a 'scout' car which is used to track down opponents cars which have broken the rules of the game.

There are some limits to how to 'break' the rules (e.g.- if you want to move more than you rolled, it can only be 6 spaces), however, as soon as you move more than you have rolled, you are ready to be arrested by one of your opponent's scout cars and you will have penalties applied.

Once all 28 passengers have been delivered, the game is over... the winner is the player who had the most fares.

Earlier versions of the game allowed up to 6 players, but later versions reduced this to 4.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Perfect Stride
description:
"Partner up with a keen and clever horse. A variety of challenging jumps await. The exciting Perfect Stride horse game starts now! You and up to three competitors play skilled riders. Be ready for the unexpected -- sometimes lucky events occur and sometimes trouble comes your way. Collect the most ribbons to win the game!"

The jump course, made up of up to 10 jumps or obstacles is determined by randomly placing (face down) up to 10 Jump cards in a row. The game contains a total of 20 Jump so chances are, your course will be different every time you play.

In Perfect Stride, game play occurs in two phases.
During the "Set the Pace" phase, all players secretly choose the speed at which they move their horse and simultaneously reveal that speed. This determines the order in which the players will attempt the upcoming jump and how many Skill cards they are allowed to draw. Skill cards will be used during the "Jump" phase to successfully clear the newly revealed jump ahead. Rider Jump Order may also affect the outcome of other events which will occur. The rider in the lead receives the Lead Rider Token and jumps first and can gain bonus points for keeping the lead BUT the faster you ride, the fewer Skill cards you draw. The lead rider also reveals the next jump during the next game phase.

Players then draw their Skill cards and the Jump Phase begins. Each rider in Rider Jump Order, makes an attempt to successfully clear the jump ahead by playing skill cards and activating special card functions. In addition, unknown events will occur (from the Event card deck) which will affect a riders attempt. Those that successfully clear the jump win Ribbon Points. The order in which riders clear the jump determines how many ribbon points they win. The Lead Rider Token may change hands many times during the Jump phase and the rider who is in the lead at the end of the Jump phase will gain bonus ribbons.

Perfect Stride is a game with many levels of strategy with just the right amount of luck blended in. How fast should I ride? Who is in the lead? Should I sacrifice my draw to get ahead of other Riders? Should I save specific Skill cards to use later on? When should I take the lead from another rider? Perfect Stride is a game you will want to play again and again.

Included in the game is a beautifully illustrated 95-card deck, 54 Ribbon Point Cards, 16 Pace Cards, a Lead Rider token and Rulebook.

name: Lion in my Way
description:
There is a journey along a path of hazards and barriers and
players "cooperate" creatively to innovate solutions that let them get home together.

The first path card is laid on the middle of the table and every player plays one tool card from the hand and explains how it could be used to overcome the obstacle on the path card. Then the all players together discuss about the solutions and decide which are the best or how to obsatcle is solved with those tools. If the solution have found all tools are discarded and the next path board is laid out for next round.

There are options for length of play and alternate rules to extend interest in the game. For 2 to 5 players.

Contents:

25 path cards
100 tool cards.

name: Golden Horn Erweiterung Dominio Da Mar
description:
Expansion for Golden Horn: Von Venedig nach Konstantinopel.

From the publisher's website (translated):

20 soldier figures, 16 wooden cubes, as well as 5 new ports are the contents of this extension.

From now on, soldiers on the ships can be included instead of goods. These are required to conquer the new ports which gives extra points at the end of the game. This guarantees even more tension until the very end!

name: Caçadores da Galáxia: Fronteiras
description: Expansion for the game Caçadores da Galáxia. Includes new pilots, new robots, components to add a 5th player and add 2 new modules to the game: expeditions and Mafia+Space police

name: Garden Gnomes: Wizard Warfare
description:
Garden Gnomes: Wizard Warfare is a modified rock-paper-scissors on steroids, with cute garden gnomes casting deadly spells at each other. You have to outguess your opponents and pick spells that counter the spells they have chosen.

Each players represents a tribe of garden gnomes, and each tribe is at war with its neighbors. During initial set-up, each player receives a special power card that determines which type of spells their tribe is skilled at casting; these can be any of the five types: flames, water, plants, insects or earth.

During each round of play, each player selects one of the five different spells to cast against each of their neighbors. (If only one opponent remains, you pick only one spell.) You cannot pick the same spell for each opponent. All spells are then simultaneously revealed, and a winner is determined on each of the battlefronts. (There is also a possibility of a draw, in which case none of the players win, and none of the players lose.) The winning player then deals one damage to the losing player's tribe, and +1 damage if they have the special power for the element they used to win (or +2 if they have two of the same special power).

Each player starts the game with ten tribe-members, and the last tribe alive wins.

name: Gamma Wolves: A Game of Post-Apocalyptic Mecha Warfare
description:
A fast-playing game of mecha skirmish combat in the post-apocalyptic ruins of Earth.

In the blasted, radiation-scorched, wastelands of the Earth's surface, towering mecha do battle, defending the interests of one of the few remaining arcology governments, providing security for wilderness outposts, or seeking out loot and supplies as a mercenary company. With detailed rules for designing and customizing your mecha, from size and propulsion type to payload and pilot skills, and a campaign system that allows pilots to gain experience and skills as they patrol the shattered Earth, Gamma Wolves is a fast-playing game of post-apocalyptic mecha warfare.

The game uses a flexible scale system of standard base sizes to let players use any Mecha models they like in one-off or Campaign games as their pilots earn experience and glory in the Sea or Destruction. Visit Free-Stations to identify and repair Old-Tech, upgrade and maintain a stable of Frames to see you through combat and watch the War-Clock on missions as you fight for the remains of a fallen civilization to save your Arcology.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mukden: Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905
description:
Mukden 1905 is a two-player simulation (easily adapted for solitaire play) of the climactic struggle of the Russo-Japanese War of 1904-05. Both players have the opportunity to attack and defend, but the main burden of the offensive is on the Japanese player. Scale: Each hex represents three miles (4.9 kilometers). The units of maneuver are regiments, brigades, divisions and one (cavalry) corps. Each full turn represents two days of real time.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Decision Games (I), Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: 1976 Formula One Motor Racing
description:
Introduction

Welcome to the Formula 1 championship of 1976. James Hunt and Nikki Lauda are battling out to see who will be the champion for the year. Re-create the drama and excitement of this terrific year of motor racing.

Using your skill in acceleration and braking, managing your tyres and fuel you will battle it out to see who wins the race.

This is an all skill game, with no luck and no dice. You will rely entirely on your skill to out-finesse your opponents and come in first.

1976 Formula One is suitable for players aged 12 and upwards and can be played solo or with 2-8 players.

Components

Full colour race map

8 cars in colours

8 car control mats in matching colours

40 Markers

Setup

Each driver can allocate 12 points between Engines, Brakes and Tyres. Throughout the race, drivers may use these to boost their performance.

Turn Sequence

The lead car moves first, the inside car moves before an outside car. You have 5 seconds to move your car.

The car must move the number of squares indicated on the gear stick.

At the end of the turn the driver sets a new speed, normally plus or minus 1 the current speed.

The next player should already be making their move while you are doing this.

The driver may use one ENGINE point (reduce the marker on the car tile) to accelerate an additional 1 speed

The driver may use one BRAKE point (reduce the marker on the car tile) to decelerate an additional 1 speed

Handling Corners

If the car moves onto the tile too fast then the car crashes.

If the car moves onto the tile at too fast, the driver can use tyre points to stay on the road.

name: Las Pruebas Mágicas del Atelier of Witch Hat
description:
Limited edition version of Love Letter with variable player powers and alternate victory conditions. Art by Kamome Shirahama.

The players are apprentices dedicated to magic learning, to bring happiness to people. Each player has a hand of magic actions ( that represent the spells they know at the moment). On your turn, draw a card from the deck and discard one of the 2 cards in your hand. They played card will have an effect that will help you.
The apprentices still don't know many spells, so you'll have to choose the most apropiate card in each situation. Also, if you deduce the other player's cards, you'll be able to create opportunities to eliminate them (making them lose time with their studies).
If all players except one are eliminated, that one wins. If the deck of cards runs out, the player with the highest value card in hand wins.

Content:
Magic cards (16)
Character cards (5)
Mission cards (8)
Quick reference cards (4)
Instruction manual

name: They're at the Post
description:
From the Box:
"The exciting new game that captures all the fun and suspense of a day at the track. 8 complete races on 4 LP records computerized for over 190 different finishes. The records are specially designed so that no one can pre-determine the race results.

the voice of racing Daryl Wells"

This game plays just as being at the race track. It includes racing programs, bet chits, banker's records and cash. Any number of players can bet on the various horses for each race. When the betting window is closed the LP is put on and the needle dropped and on comes the racing voice, excitingly giving a entire race breakdown.

Each record has more than one spiral on them, so when the needle is placed, no one knows which race will play.
publishers: Arthur Sugarman, Maas Marketing Inc., Ronco

name: Gembloux: The Feint
description:
"Gembloux: The Feint is from Critical Hit and depicts the Battle for the Gembloux Gap between 11-15 May 1940 through eight chronological scenarios and a Platoon Leader campaign game representing the fight for Jandrain on 13 May. GTF also includes an historical booklet and a custom map overlay depicting a typical Belgian village during the period. The Gembloux CG was developed by European designer Pedro Ramis following extensive tours of the battlefield."

Gembloux II The Battle for France 1940 - Gembloux II includes a new board CH1 (their first modular board apparently) instead of the overlay as in the first edition. New counters are included which may provide all of the French counters need to play if you don't have the official French module. Otherwise it is much the same as the first edition.

The game is a Advanced Squad Leader module.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Queen's Blade
description:
Every fourth year, the queen in the country is decided in a fighting competition, the "Queen's Blade." The most powerful fighter will become the ruler of country for next four years. Any female above the age of 12 with power can join Queen's Blade.

It is a 1-on-1 game, although multi-player rules are included. Each player requires one game book from this series (or any Lost Worlds book, really). Each book represents one character and contains a character sheet. At the start of game, each player hands his opponent his book but keeps his character/action sheet. Then both players announce their character's action and resolve the result according to the books. The first character reduced to zero hit points loses the game.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.

name: Endless Nightmare
description:
You’re caught in an endless, ever shifting nightmare hunted by The Shadow – an ominous all devouring presence. You try to outrun it and avoid going insane from the horrors of the nightmare, but it’s just a matter of time until you succumb.

Mechanically Endless Nightmare is a simple push your luck, risk management where the player must strike a balance between spending actions on the threats and resources of the game while trying to run as long as possible before the inevitable defeat.

There are two modes of play: Basic and Active. The Basic Version is a normal board game while the Active version requires real life skills, such as being required to hold your breath while playing through a Nightmare about drowning. The Basic version provides 12 different nightmare scenes each with their own simple special rule based on the theme of the scene. Most plays will take the player through one to five of these scenes. The Active version replaces or changes 8 of the scenes for a total of 20 different nightmare scenes.

Endless Nightmare is an entry in the 2013 Solitaire Print and Play Contest, where it placed second in the No Assembly Required category and won its designer the Best New Designer category.

Endless Nightmare is free to print and play, and a single sheet of paper needs to be printed. Add in 11 small markers (one of which must be different than the others) and a six sided die. To play the Active Version another sheet of paper must be printed and 6 more markers and a stop watch (one is available on most phones) are needed.

name: ALAARM!
description:
Alaarm! - made in prison: The game was developed by prisoners in "Santa-Fu" jail in Hamburg/Germany and is (for real) also played in the cells.

It's a reversed Pachisi variant: You start in the middle of the board ("cells") and have to reach the normal starting position ("getaway car").

Players have to hide in gullies, slide through ventilating tubes to reach the getaway car. However, if two sixes are thrown alarm sounds. Then everything have to go back in the cells.

The winner is the first player to move all pawns "out of jail".

A part of the sales profit of the game goes to the support of crime victims (WEISSER RING e.V. - which is a well known organization in Germany).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Cublino
description:
A different dice game. No lucky dice here, as they are used as tokens in this game. The special thing about the game is, that in order to move the dice forward, they are tilted over their edges. There are two game variants: In the first variant, a player’s dice must reach the opposite end of the board first. If two dice of the opposing players are colliding, the dice showing the lower number has to be removed from the board. The second game variant resembles Halma but is more demanding. Players can hop their dice over any other dice in a straight line attempting to get as many of their own dice as possible to the opposite baseline of the board. The game ends if one player manages to completely occupy the other player’s baseline. However, the player who first manages to do so, needn’t be the winner of the game! The winner is determined by adding up each player’s eye number of dice already on the opposite baseline. Though players will need to make some minor tactical considerations during play, CUBLINO is definitely a great fun to play game. It is a family game for adults and children of 5 years and older. CUBLINO’s elaborate design features slots for the dice and optimized edges for a smooth gaming experience
(From the website of Intellego)

name: Pyrinoes
description:
Pyrinoes is a game for two players that combines two game systems: double-six dominoes and Looney Pyramids. Players begin the game with a supply of dominoes and two colors of pyramids. Players take turns adding pieces from their supply to the chain of played pieces, either by placing dominoes or by creating a "pyrino" out of pyramids. When one person runs out of pieces, the round ends, and the winner scores points. Subsequent rounds are played until one player has earned 100 points. Pyrinoes adds strategic depth to classic Dominoes by giving the players the ability to create a desired piece, but at the risk of revealing critical information to the opponent.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Pyrinoes

name: Faraway
description:
English description:

Have you ever dreamed of being a child again? To see again the world as if it were a game to your service? To play... we are some famous dragon slayers ... in the playground. To forget everything that is not funny and focus only dream about your friends? What the gray world we live hides a multitude of colors? So Faraway is for you.

Faraway is a narrative card game, in which players have to tell stories mixing reality and fantasy, as if to return to their child age. A narrative experience in a group, in which all players participate and contribute to an adventure in which everyone has fun: a collective experience of creation.

Relying on a evocative and elegant illustrations, let's have fun showing many skills: brainstorm, displayed as good storyteller, propose suggestive outcomes, even master the rules and intricacies if yours is the competition. Faraway is a narrative experience for creative, an opportunity to reunite the family, a stimulating way to learn, Faraway is making dreams come true.

The game takes place over several chapters (depending on number of players), usually 6 to the basic game. In chapters, players will have to play cards in their hand in secret, the narrator will take all the cards, shuffle them and reveal. The other players have to vote the letter they deem best represents the next scene (not being able to vote their own). The owners of the two most voted letters, earn a point and make a proposal to continue the story narration. The other players will vote which of these two proposals is the best. The winner will get another point and will be the new narrator.
The same procedure in all chapters.
At the end of the game, the winner is he who has the most points.


Spanish description:

¿Alguna vez has soñado con volver a ser un niño? ¿A volver a ver el mundo como si fuera un juego a tu servicio? ¿A jugar a que tú y tus compañeros sois unos famosos cazadores de dragones... en el patio del recreo? ¿A olvidar todo lo que no sea divertido y centrarte sólo en soñar con tus amigos? ¿A que el mundo gris en el que vivimos esconde un sinfín de colores? Entonces, Faraway es para ti.

Faraway es un juego narrativo de cartas, en el que los jugadores tienen que contar historias mezclando realidad y fantasía, como si volvieran a tener cinco años. Una experiencia narrativa en grupo, en la que todos los jugadores participan y contribuyen a crear una aventura en la que todos se diviertan: una experiencia colectiva de creación.

Apoyándonos en unas evocadoras y cuidadas ilustraciones, vamos a divertirnos demostrando muchas habilidades: aportar ideas, mostrarse como buen narrador, proponer desenlaces sugerentes, incluso dominar las reglas y entresijos si lo tuyo es la competición. Faraway es una experiencia narrativa para los creativos, una oportunidad de reunir a la familia, una estimulante forma de aprender, Faraway es hacer realidad los sueños.

name: Piraten-Beute
description: In Piraten-Beute, a fun memory game about collecting and sharing, the players slip into the role of little pirates who have seized a rich treasure and now must divide it among themselves. Because no one wants to have any duplicate uncovered treasure tiles, you may give the tiles to your fellow players — but they won't always be happy about it. In the end, the player who has collected the most individual pieces of treasure tiles wins.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game, Pirates

name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game – Rods and Boats
description:
Tournament Fishing: Rods and Boats adds a couple new and exciting things to the core game experience!

First of all, the Fishing Pole and Boat cards bring two new cards to each Angler's Starting Deck, which will be different every game. This addition expands the Angler's options and gives a strong boost to the early fishing game.

Secondly, the new 6PM Clock card optionally extends the Tournament another round for both the Solo, Co-op (2 Anglers), and Competative (2-4 Anglers) mode. Give yourselves that one last "Hoorah!" and go out in style. For the Solo/Co-op Tournament, the AI Angler catches a 7th Fish of your choice.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Takumi Zoo
description:
Takumi Zoo is a zoo management themed game, created during the designer's summer break of the first grade, and published while they were in the 4th grade. The game won the kid creator award for the STEAM Toy Contest 2021.

In the game, players will be adding terrain tiles to support different animals. Animals added to a zoo increase the zoo's revenues, allowing them to buy other animals. The zoos have a limited number of space, and players will also remove animals from their zoo to make room for new ones.

The game includes some tiles that have special effects, and bonuses that can be earned for certain groupings of animals.

The player with the most points after 12 rounds wins.

name: Hungry Shark
description:
It’s lunch time and panic spreads through the ocean. Sharks prey on every single fish that swims the sea and only the octopus cop can stop them. All through this frenzy you will have to be fast enough to escape before ending up in a hungry shark’s belly.

Hungry Shark is a family game for ages +6 with an average game time of 10 minutes. This mad and fun game has three different game styles: “childfish”, “gluttonous shark” and “sea bubbles.”

In this game of visual speed you have to count the number of fish that are saved from the hungry shark. Three decks of cards are placed, first the central card is flipped, and then the two cards of the side decks. You have to consider the position of the fish, the eagle shark and the police octopus. The one who guesses the correct answer will get the 3 cards. The one who at the end of the game has taken more cards will win.


"A la hora del almuerzo el pánico llega al fondo del océano. Los tiburones persiguen a todo pez que se mueva para darse un buen atracón y solo el pulpo policía puede pararles. Entre tanto
descontrol, deberás ser el más rápido en contar los peces que logran escapar de acabar en la panza de estos tiburones hambrientos."

Hungry shark es un juego de velocidad para toda la familia a partir de 6 años, de 2 a 6 jugadores compuesto por
54 cartas y una duración media de 10 minutos. Este alocado y divertido juego ofrece 3 modalidades de juego con nivel creciente de dificultad: Pezqueñines, Tiburón comilón y Burbujas marinas.

En este juego de velocidad visual hay que contar el número de peces que se salvan del hambriento tiburón. Se colocan tres mazos de cartas, primero se voltea la carta central, y posteriormente las dos cartas de los mazos laterales. Se tiene que considerar la posición de los peces, el tiburón comilón y el pulpo policía. El que acierte la respuesta correcta conseguirá las 3 cartas. Ganará aquel que al final del juego se haya llevado más cartas.

name: Clear the Decks!
description:
Age of Fighting Sail combat game, 1-4 player cooperative game where all players are on one ship fighting one enemy ship. Play time 30-90 minutes depending on difficulty and number of players (ages 10 and up).

Each player has three cannon and cards include ammunition, officers, marines and tactics. The Enemy ship is created using 1 of 7 difficulty settings and has cannon, structures, crew and events on top of the hull and leak cards.

Players win by destroying each hull section before all their guns are disabled or destroyed.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Proclaim!
description: Players take turns giving clues to their fellow participants. Clue givers try to construct one-word clues that will lead others to guess the Proclaim! word. There are up to 3 rounds for each word, and the earlier the round, the more points that are awarded to the clue givers and correct guessers. The more people that guess the correct Proclaim! word, the fewer points that are awarded to each person, so clues must be clever enough to lead players to different possible answers to maximize their score. Creative, tricky ambiguity is the key to the game. Both the clue giver and guessing players have additional opportunities for extra points. For example, if a guessing player is certain they know the Proclaim! word, they yell “Proclaim!”, and roll the dice to determine the number of points to move forward for a correct guess, or backward for an incorrect guess. Also, the clue giver earns a "unique" bonus if the guessing players each give a different answer. Play continues until the first player has successfully advanced to the finish space on the Proclaim! board.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Targeted Clues

name: Amphorae
description:
Amphorae or Das Zehn Vasen Spiel is tile pickup game. A 7x7 grid is filled with 40 tiles (10 amphora pictures made up of 4 tiles each), with the 9 ‘tic tac toe’ spaces containing hostage tiles to complete the grid. You can move 2 or 3 spaces containing one right hand turn, and you can pick up the last tile you move off.

The object of the game is to pick up complete sets of amphoras.

A player can only keep two tiles in his/her hand Any tile placed in front of you that is less than a set of 3 in an amphora can be picked up by anyone who lands on a hostage tile.

So the trick is to get three tiles all in one amphora in successive turns, and lay them down immediately. These are now worth 1 point and are safe from being stolen.

A completed amphora of 4 tiles is worth 4 points.

name: The Great Muppet Caper Game
description:
From the rules:

Join KERMIT THE FROG, FOZZIE BEAR, MISS PIGGY and THE GREAT GONZO on a wild romp through the streets of London. Your favorite Muppet friends are in search of four very hard-to-capture thieves who are trying to steal a legendary jewel called the "Baseball Diamond". Join the Muppets on their adventure. If you're the first player to catch the four thieves and save the "Baseball Diamond", you'll win the game.

Here's some of the fun you'll have...take a cab and a bus, both of which are controlled by hidden wheels underneath the gameboard...be careful, though...if you spin the wheel too much or too little, you'll miss your bus or fail to hail a cab! Visit the Dubonnet Club with its mysterious spinning room and the Mallory Gallery where the "Baseball Diamond" is hidden. To enter the Gallery, you must make a precarious climb up the side of the Gallery Building. Then before you can save the jewel, you must be sure you own four different Thief cards. If you own the four cards, turn the hidden dial in the Gallery hoping that the jewel will be set free and come rolling out the front door of the Gallery (the jewel will be dislodged only when this hidden dial is spun a certain number of times). The player who frees the jewel from its hiding place wins the game. Have fun!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Big League Hockey Manager: Stanley Cup Expansion
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Big League Manager Stanley Cup® expansion pack adds a new level of skill to the NHL™ General Manager game.

The top two General Managers face each other in the Stanley Cup® final. Its a quick, exciting best-of-seven showdown, as you strategically play your Stanley Cup® cards.

Content: 32 Stanley Cup® Cards / Game Board / Rule Book / Replica Stanley Cup®

name: Siberia / Key West / Bangkok Klongs Expansion
description:
This expansion contains:

2 new investment tiles (warehouses) for Siberia
4 dragonboats for Bangkok Klongs
2 gangster tiles for Key West
categories: Adventure, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Chit-Pull System, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Arsenal: Arena Combat – Core Set
description:
Arsenal: Arena Combat is a 2-6 player customizable card game that uses a hex-map game board, tokens or miniature mechs, counters and 6-sided dice to facilitate play.

In Arsenal, you take on the role of a pilot in a combat mech arena. This arena is represented by a small hex map (the gameboard). You move your Mech around on this map to gain an advantage against your opponent, and then play cards from your hand to attack or defend. You will manage your power levels (the resource used to play cards), and use all manner of tactics to win out against your opponent.

To play Arsenal, each player first chooses a Mech, then they each build a deck from the cards available to that Mech (not all Mechs are created equal). Next you and your opponent(s) shuffle your decks, grab 8 energy cards, a handful of 6-sided dice and damage counters, and put a token on the board that matches your Mech. Then you figure out who's going first and start playing!

- Players take turns moving their Mech around the arena, and playing cards from their hand to represent things like lock-ons, deployable objects, or any number of actions and reactions.
- On your turn, you play attack cards from your hand that represent both your weapons and your ammunition, provided your target is within the attack's effective range.
- When an attack is played, all players have a chance to react to it, by playing their own cards that represent things like taking evasive maneuvers or bracing for impact.
- After everyone has had a chance to react, the attack is resolved: the attacker and defender both roll a number of dice determined by the attack card, range, and other variables. Both players then add up the number of 1's and 6's they rolled.
- The defender must meet or beat the attacker's roll in order to dodge the attack. If they don't, it hits, and their Mech takes damage! Continue until only one Mech (or team) is left standing.

All cards have an energy cost. You have 8 energy to spend on every player's turn, but you also have the option to "burn" any or all of your 8 energy. Doing so could pay off big, but "burned" energy comes back at a much slower rate, leaving you open to counter attack.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Dust Tactics: Allied Taskforce Joe Starter Set
description:
The year is 1947. The war that started a decade ago has now spread worldwide. The discovery of a crashed alien spacecraft in the Antarctic has led to the development of revolutionary combat walkers that surpass the most advanced tank technology. Old alliances have fragmented and new ones arisen as three major blocs, the Allies, the Axis and the Sino-Soviet Union (SSU) fight the world over for VK, a valuable new resource that power their new fighting machines.

Dust Tactics is a miniatures board game for 2 or more players. The Allied Taskforce Joe starter set contains everything you need to start playing Dust Tactics, including 10 highly-detailed plastic miniatures, unit cards, terrain elements, special Dust dice, and the Dust rulebook. Enter the world of Dust and lead your Allied Taskforce into battle against Axis or SSU Battlegroups.

Note: The rules and cards in this box are based on the version 2 rules, but are slightly different from and not completely compatible with the full Dust Tactics version 2 rulebook.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Werewolf: Full Moon Expansion
description:
Werewolf: Full Moon is an expansion to Corey Fields' version of Werewolf.


Instructions Book
28 Cards
2 Wolf Pup cards
2 Spirit cards
1 Elder card
2 Skinwalker card
2 Thief cards
2 Zombie cards
2 Vampyre cards
1 Moderator card
2 Inventor cards
1 Dolos card
2 Drunkard cards
1 Leader card
2 Alpha cards
1 Harlot card
1 Idiot card
1 Lycan card
1 Butcher card
1 Gypsy card
1 Diseased card

name: Bugz
description:
In Bugz, there are ants, beetles and mosquitoes; there are red bugs, green bugs and blue bugs; there are hollow bugs, spotty bugs and solid bugs; and there are small bugs, medium bugs and large bugs. In the game, players take it in turns to try and collect as many bugs as they can – but in order to score points, all the bugs they pick up in a single turn must have at least one feature in common.

To play the game, 20 cards are laid out face-down in a grid. Player 1 then begins the game by turning up 2 cards in place. If these cards share a feature, he can either end his turn and score these, or keep going by turning up another card. If all 3 cards share a feature, once again, he can either end his turn and score these, or keep going, and so on.

The more bugs a player collects in a single turn, the more points he will get. But if at any point the cards he has turned up don’t all share a feature, he must turn them back over and won’t score any points at all.

Players continue taking turns until the grid can no longer be refilled to 20 cards, whereupon the game is over, and the player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Jail Break
description:
Jail Break is a card-based strategic tabletop game that pits you against your friends in a race to escape the world's most dangerous prison.

The game runs 2-6 players and a session can last from 20-40 mins. Your goal is to navigate through the prison in an attempt to gain three resources (blueprint, keycard, too) and then head to the room identified on your blueprint to escape.

But this prison will be unforgiving. With every turn you will have to contend with gang attacks, fellow inmates trying to escape, and officers looking to send you to solitary confinement.

Jail Break is dynamic because you draw a unique mugshot profile, that provides you with a special skill set to use throughout the match in every match. The prison layout will also change with every session (as it is made up from cards) creating a different game each time you play.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Mafia, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Cup
description:
This game is, quite simply, beer pong with special powers. Players take turns bouncing ping pong balls at the opposing goals (cups) that serve as HP. Eliminate the opposing cups first to win.

Players each have a character card granting unique powers, and a deck they customize ahead of time from a large set of options. 10 cards in the deck are special powers and 10 are mana cards that trigger your character's special powers. There are also rules for team variants, and some options to play with a random deck if you don't want to customize a deck for yourself.

The game openly suggests that you play it as a drinking game with alcohol, and players must drink from their HP cups as they are eliminated. One of the character cards has the special power to be the designated driver and never drinks (along with some other special powers too).

Description from the box:

Dungeon Cup is a game that takes the beloved game of Beer Pong and enhances it with a touch of fantasy, roleplaying, strategic card play, team work, and let's not forget, alcohol!

This is a drinking game for 2-4 players. Don't worry though, we have a character for designated drivers too! Seasoned veterans of Beer Pong, Card Game Masters, or Simple Peasants, will all be equals on this battlefield. Some players will win with sheer skills, others a lucky card. Then there are the players with a really high drinking tolerance... So pick a character, and build a deck of cards that suits your play style, or let fate pick your cards for you!
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: DAR: Divide And Rule
description:
Theme : strategic abstract game

Gameplay : Each player chooses a color of jewels. In his turn, the player use the sticks to create 4 territories on the board. He can put a crystal on each territory if he has a majority or equal statut with each player individually.
It's important to place them well to take the control of the most zones.

Goal : to have the most number of points at the end of the game. The player who has the most number of crystals
in a zone gets 3 points. The second get 1 points.
The game ends when all the zones has its winner.

name: デンポー！！ (Denpo!!)
description:
User summary
デンポー！！ (Denpo!!), which literally means "telegram", is a Japanese-word quiz game.

In Japanese the fee for an old-fashioned telegram is determined by number of characters, so people needed to shorten sentences when using it. In this game, players try to convey meaning of the answer with fewest characters possible.

One player is assigned as the Answerer (respondent). The other players see the answer word. Then they reword the answer and write it down in katakana (Japanese syllabic characters) on their board secretly. They may not include the answer itself or direct translation of the answer in their reword.

When all players except the Answerer have finished re-wording, one of them becomes the Caller and reads out the Caller's re-word. If the Answerer replies with correct answer, the Caller scores points. Otherwise the next player becomes the Caller and does the same.

The order of Caller is determined by how short their re-word is. You need to keep your re-word short, but you might assist the following players if your re-word couldn't make the Answerer understood.
user summary

「少ない文字数で伝えるコミュニケーションゲーム」です。

電報は、昔は文字数に応じて料金が決まったため、簡潔に伝えることが必要でした。
昔の人はきっと、なんとかして文字数を削ったことでしょう……
このゲーム「デンポー!!」は、お題を親に伝えるゲームなのですが、
伝達につかう文字数が少ないほど有利に進められるようになっています。
文字数を削って削って、でも要点ははずさない、そんな人が勝者になれるゲームです。

New edition
少ない文字数でお題を知らない人にお題を伝えるゲームです。
お題を知らない人に対してカタカナでヒントを書き順番に渡していきます。お題そのものやお題を含むヒントは書いてはいけません。
お題を伝えるゲームなので伝わってしまった瞬間にお題を当てさせた人に得点が入ってゲームが終了してしまうので、なるべく早い手番でヒントを渡すことが重要です。ヒントを渡す順番は「文字数の少ない人」から順番に渡すことができます。文字数が多すぎるとヒントを渡せないままゲームが終了してしまうし、文字数が少なすぎると伝わらないので伝わるけれどもなるべく短い文字数のヒントを考えて遊ぶゲームです。
publisher's summary
publishers: Kakugari Books, SpielEmbryo (あそびのたまご)

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): High Elves
description:
Warhammer: High Elves is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Rory's Story Cubes: Arcade
description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on its own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling
publishers: Asmodee, Rebel Sp. z o.o., The Creativity Hub

name: Escape Mail
description:
Escape Mail is an escape room in an envelope. Season 1 consists of 12 episodes which all follow the the story of your long lost cousin, JJ Fitzpatrick in your combined search for lost family treasure.

Episode 1 is an envelope addressed to you from your cousin JJ with some mysterious contents, and a letter stating that you and your family are entitled to a wealth of treasure, if you're smart enough to find it. What you don't know yet is just where this adventure will take you! Do you have what it takes to solve the mystery and claim your family's treasure?

The game can be completed in single standalone episodes or the entire 12 episode campaign arc can be purchased.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Gjorn
description:
Gjorn is a fast, quick-to-learn but very tactical card game for 2-4 players. You will win by making tactical decisions. You need to get ahead of your opponent to dominate the battlefield.

There are five different kinds of cards and each card has its own effect.

There are also 2 kinds of tokens coins and fame. Some of the card effects make you lose coins, but you can never lose fame.

You win by collecting coins and fame. Both are worth 1 point

Card effects:

Axe: Capture 3 coins

Shield: Opponents lose 2 coins

Bow: Capture 1 coin and make your opponent lose 1 coin

Horn: Earn 1 fame

Runestone: Win every tie.

Starting the game:
You shuffle all the cards together and every player gets 7 cards. There are 15 rounds now.

In each round, players place a card face down in front of them and reveal it at the same time.

Players compare all their cards in front of them. And whoever has the most cards of a type, or a tie but most runestones, get the effect of the card.

Who has the most points at the end wins.

—description from the designer

name: Nº Problema
description:
Nº Problema (No. Problem) is a game where strategy and chance are perfectly combined. The challenge is to complete as many boxes as possible, one time, with consecutive numbers. It begins by placing the N ° 1 in any box, starting a journey from box to box according to the reference indicated by the die. Número Problema offers two different game sheets, of 100 and 64 boxes respectively.


Fill in as many boxes as possible, one time only, with consecutive numbers. Using 1 or 2 dice, players roll to find the reference (shape) corresponding to where you must write down a previous number on the grid + 1. You can rotate the shape.

The Reset box is used when we cannot complete the writing of a number + 1 in one turn. Each player can choose to cross out a box (up to four times) to continue in play. Each time we use this option we will subtract a point at the end of the game. If you have no Resets available, or do not choose to use it, the game is over.

Highest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mal kurz die Welt ändern: Promokarten – Deutsche Geschichte
description:
2 Karten:

Sophie Scholl - 3 - Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges darf niemand Karten aus der Hand ausspielen.

Johannes Gutenberg - 1 - Diese Karte hat +5, falls genau 1 Karte in der Auslage liegt.

name: Sagrajas 1086
description:
Sagrajas 1086 is a Tactical level board-wargame for two players that reproduces the battle of Sagrajas between the Castilian-Leonese troops and the Almoravides, which resulted in the defeat of the Leonese.

Published in Alea_Magazine, #38 (March, 2022)



Sagrajas 1086 es un board-wargame táctico para dos jugadores que reproduce la batalla de Sagrajas entre las tropas Castellano-Leonesas y los Almoravides, que se saldo con la derrota de los Leoneses.en Alea, #38 (Marzo, 2022)
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Koole Klötze
description:
In Koole Klötze ("Cool Blocks"), you need to quickly build sculptures from random bits of wood and hope that others can figure out what you've created.

To set up, place the numbered hexagon in the center of the table, then lay out six construction cards next to the numbers. Lay the 17 wooden bits in a circle around the cards, then place the arrow next to a bit to create a starting point in the line. Each player takes a set of cards numbered 1-6.

The first player takes the first six bits in line, along with the building platform and sunglasses, then shuffles their deck and secretly looks at the bottommost card. They now have 30 seconds to use the wooden bits to recreate the image on the associated construction card, balancing bits as they wish, but not moving them to create an animated scene.

The other players can each play one card face down into the central hexagon to guess which construction card the active player is building. Once time runs out or everyone has guessed, the active player forecasts how many others correctly guessed the answer, then reveals all the cards. Whoever first guessed the correct answer scores 2 points, with the second correct guesser earning 1 point. If at least one person guessed correctly, the builder scores 1 point, and if they forecast correctly, they score a bonus 1 point.

The builder then places all used bits at the end of the line and passes unused bits to the next player clockwise, with that player taking bits from the line as needed to have six on hand.

After everyone has been builder twice (with 5-6 players) or thrice (with 3-4 players), whoever has the most points wins.

name: Into the Godsgrave
description:
If the cruelty of the Gods had any purpose, it remained a mystery even after their death. They gave us miserable fates and treated us like toys, but we knew it had to end one day – for better or for worse.

So we revolted and slayed them all, for a price well beyond what we could afford. The world is damaged now, bearing the wounds of this impossible battle, but at the same time – we are free and responsible for our own fates for the first time.

Yet from lands far away, followers of New Gods arrive with their true intent unknown, hidden behind their political agendas.

Amongst all of this turmoil are you, a wild bunch of mercenaries, just blindly accepting another job…

As you travel across the world, you will discover and scout unknown lands. Only the Companion App knows what lies ahead and what kind of challenges your journey will bring. You’ll face enemies, complete quests, and discover secrets of Godsgrave. Every time you make a critical decision, the app will remember your choice and adjust the campaign accordingly. Enemies you will encounter will be introduced within the app and quests will be tracked and completed by it too. Dozens of monsters, quests, items and adventures are held in the Story App, to deliver a living and breathing world to explore.

The Lineage and Class of your hero will determine your starting deck. Completing scenarios will allow you to earn rewards and more cards for your deck allowing you to customize your hero to suit your play style. Cards will include items,weapons, abilities, and epic maneuvers called Events. Find your ideal combination from all the Lineages & Class options.
