Each hero brings a different set of skills to the party, which are represented by a dice. Whether you are scouting an area, clashing with an enemy, or bartering with a shopkeeper for a better deal, you will use your Skill Dice.

Every round, as a team you choose a Plan Card which determines the play style of the party for that round. Sometimes you will be more mobile, while next turn you hoard more resources. Carefully plan your game, as every card is different, brings unique Special Effect and provoke various obstacles to overcome.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: MARETTA
description:
Maretta is an escape from the island where desperate castaways will beat each other up for 15-20 minutes.
Among pelicans, sharks, monkeys, inking squid and erupting volcanoes you will gather resources to try to save yourself in a desperate flight towards the sea and towards the steamers.

2 Adventures / 2 different game mechanics:

Escape from Maretta
Escape from Vulcano Island


Type: family+

Mechanics:

Escape from Maretta: Race along a sea track bar and Set-Collecting of Resources
Escape from Vulcan: Pure race to the death


Story

Whether it's the fault of the pelican monkeys or the sharks, since you were shipwrecked on the island of Maretta, there hasn't been a day of calm. You have also tried to collaborate with the castaways: you built your village, collected wood and vines for the fire, found plants and fruits to live on.

Yet it takes so little to send everything up in smoke, yes because we're talking about smoke.
The smoke of a steamer in the distance or the first signs of an imminent eruption are enough to make the "marettosi" nerves explode and then start a mad rush.
Trips, thefts and intrigues are the order of the day, and watch out for the barrels along the way!
Each turn you discard and collect resources. The numbers on the cards influence the movement and allow you to move your opponents against Sharks, Monkeys, Squids, Anchors, Grapples and Pelicans, limiting their action.

Brief description of the game

In the Escape from Maretta you will collect resources to be able to get on the steamer. The more resources you have, the easier it will be to climb, but this won't be enough.
Will you be able to reach the steamer?

In Escape from Vulcano resources will make the mine cart you are traveling on heavier to make you go faster but be careful, too many resources will slow you down.
Will you be able to go faster than the moving Lava?

You can try to live the Experience FROM VULCANO to the STEAMER, the 2 adventures combined.

New Adventure will be released for free using the same box and components. Keep connected!

One example? Thing to be in the middle of the see after a shipwreck and you have to reach the Maretta Island. Can you imagine what can change in the mechanics? We will show you soon ;)

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Racing

name: Sweets in Wonderland
description:
Sweets in Wonderland is a trick-taking game where players draft the conditions of each trick, aiming to achieve the most points.

Specifically, players draft if the trick will be must-follow or can't-follow for a randomly revealed un-dealt card, and if high cards will win or low cards. Players may also play 1 or 2 cards on their turn.

The winner of a trick wins the chips used for drafting the round conditions, and the start player for the draft rotates.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points, determined through a set collection mechanic with the drafting chips, wins.

name: Race to Adventure! Expansion Pack: Dinocalypse Now and the Hollow Earth
description:
Race to Adventure! expands with this double-mini-expansion pack!

In the Dinocalypse Now mini-expansion, you'll dodge psychic dinosaurs as they burst through their time-portal ... and travel to the Century Club's most secret base on the island of Kauai. Can you protect your clues and win the Race all while on the run from a reptilian menace?

In the Hollow Earth mini-expansion, you'll Race into subterranean depths by sinkhole, underground river, and cave entrance. Will you be the one to uncover the lost treasure of the Neanderthals?

name: By Order of the Queen: Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Adds more content, variable difficulty and Imp Lands crossover content to your By Order of the Queen game!

Mini-Expansion Includes:
4 Queen's Orders
18 Event Cards (Difficult)
20 Imp Lands Characters (Alternate Art Hero Cards)
2 Blank Hero Cards
8 Imp Lands Location Cards

name: Vasty Wilds
description:
One day the Humans had fiddled with the Earth until it could take no more, and the Humans ended. Then the Voles created their civilization and fiddled with the smaller things of the Earth until the Voles ended as well. Now the tiny creatures of the forest compete to find the artifacts and knowledge left by the fallen empires so that they too can mess it all up in their turn.

Each game of Vasty Wilds begins with a randomly placed network of Root cards. The players add cards to the board to expand the forest. Each card placement includes movement and other beneficial effects (Progress) for the player and detrimental effects (Misfortune) for her opponents. A player's opponents are in charge of placing her objectives in inconvenient places on the board. The player who collects all of her objectives first wins.

While Vasty Wilds is easy to learn for younger players or beginners, successive plays will reveal more complex strategies for card placement and effect combinations.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That

name: Sneaky Cards 2
description:
Sneaky Cards 2 contains 54 brand new missions for you to complete! Become a secret agent of joy, spreading creativity and kindness to an unsuspecting public. Give a stranger flowers, challenge someone to a dance-off, throw an impromptu surprise party. Complete each objective then pass along the card to an unwitting accomplice, who now becomes part of the game. The fun is ever-expanding, but it all starts with you. Play it forward!

—description from the publisher

name: Lucktails
description:
Lucktails is a baiting game of inconceivable chances.

Are you going to stick to your initial card or switch to one of the two in the middle of the table? Just because you will be taking a chance either way does not mean that you have to rely on blind luck. After all, the longer you "wait and bait" the more players will drop out of the round before you. Each card that they reveal means additional information for you.

—description from the publisher

name: 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game – Set #2
description:
An additional set of cases for 221b Baker Street. This package comprises cases #21-40 and includes case cards, a clue and answer book, and solution checklist.

21. The Adventure of the Rewritten Death (= original Gibsons #21, new Gibsons #17)
22. The Adventure of the Pillaged Pawnbroker (#22)
23. The Adventure of the Luckless Mariner (#23, #18)
24. The Adventure of the Empty-Handed Thief (#24)
25. The Adventure of the Unpaid Fare (#25, #19)
26. The Adventure of the Peculiar Charwoman (#26, #20)
27. The Adventure of the Bashful Benefactor (#27, #21)
28. The Adventure of the Duchess's Demise
29. The Adventure of the Banker's Note (#29, #23)
30. The Adventure of the Deadly Caller
31. The Adventure of the Reporter's List (#31, #24)
32. The Adventure of the Bloodthirsty Bard (#32, #25)
33. The Adventure of the Posthumous Client (#33, #26)
34. The Adventure of the Spinster's Will (#34, #27)
35. The Adventure of the Mettlesome Bride (#35)
36. The Adventure of the Financier's Fall (#36, #28)
37. The Adventure of the Thief's Cipher (#37, #29)
38. The Adventure of the Royal Heir (#38)
39. The Adventure of the Duping Diogenes (#39)
40. The Adventure of the Giant Rat of Sumatra (#40, #30)
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Infantry Combat: The Rifle Platoon
description:
"Infantry Combat: The Rifle Platoon" is "an interactive exercise in small-unit tactics and leadership" written by John F. Antal, the commanding officer of a tank battalion in Korea.

A pair of six-sided dice are required to play this solitaire game which is a variation on the Choose Your Own Adventure game book genre.

In Infantry Combat, you take on the role of a U.S. Army second lieutenant. "Your light infantry battalion has been airlifted into the Middle East on short notice, and now your platoon must defend Wadi Al Sirree against the superior might of an advancing enemy mechanized force . . . The scenario is highly realistic and is supported by maps and appendices with detailed specifications of the equipment and forces involved."

John Antal wrote three books which used this system: Armor Attacks, Infantry Combat, and Combat Team.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A Song of Ice and Fire: The Adventure Game
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. This game has not been released, and since its announced release date has long since passed, this game might never be released. This listing serves as a historical record; you are invited to submit corrections or update this section if additional information comes to light.




Players each play as a unique character from one of the house factions in George R. R. Martin's Westeros universe.

This is an adventure style game where players use a set number of actions per turn to travel, fight, play cards, and rest.

This game is card-driven and the cards allow you to gain items, allies, and stats, as well as attack and hinder your opponents. Many of the cards have conditions which, when successfully met, give you points in three different categories.

The game is divided into three "acts". At the end of Act III, whoever has the highest score in their weakest category wins the game.

This game was first shown at Gencon 2008 where it was available for public playtesting. It was in unpublished prototype form at that time.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Quest Master: Hydra of Warok
description: Quest Master: Hydra of Warok, the expansion from Quest Master, allow the players to warp to the island of the Warok from the main map of Quest Master. The players who warp to the island will be rewarded after slaying Warok.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Manimals: Australien & Neuseeland 1
description:
Manimals is a beautiful animal game that is also well-suited for learning in the classroom or for use in homes. Through the game, players learn the attributes of animals.
Who knows the animals best?

All animal cards are placed face up on the table. One card is flipped. The backside shows a search criterion like, has finger, can swim or has feathers. Players than simultaneously collect animals they believe to fit this criteria. As soon as nobody wants to pick another animal, the backsides of the cards are examined, to check if the choice was correct. The player with the most correct animals scores two points, the second one scores one.

Includes rules for ages 4 and up, as well.

The focus of this edition is: Animals from Australia and New Zealand.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time, Trivia

name: SNCF: The Netherlands
description:
Game description from the publisher:

SNCF: The Netherlands extends the SNCF system to include bankruptcy and receivership.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Loyaulte Me Lie: Bosworth Field, 1485
description:
Loyaulte Me Lie: Bosworth Field, 1485 is a low complexity wargame on the Battle of Bosworth Field on August 22, 1485. The game uses recent archaeological finds on the battlefield to create as accurate of a map as possible.

The game is an introductory level wargame and as a result has a simple 8 page rulebook. The game uses basic hex and counter mechanics with a few special rules to simulate combat of the medieval era. Cavalry charges and infantry shock attacks are given special consideration.

The game is won by killing either Richard III or Henry Tudor or by routing your opponents army. If neither of these objectives have been achieved after 8 turns, the Yorkist side wins.

name: Guild Ball: Engineer Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Engineers play style is one of accuracy and controlling space. They utilise all manner of gadgets, devices and traps to influence the flow and direction of the game. From a distance, the Engineers players move as one giant machine, perfectly in sync with each other...

Resilient in combat, accurate with the ball, the Engineers have a solid play style. Whilst not as mobile as some teams, they are able to move the ball great distances and accurately too. They excel in the mid-game, once all the pieces are in place they can control the pitch while pinging the ball around their opponent.

In the Engineer's Guild you witness first-hand the evolution of Guild Ball. Bringing a whole new definition to "technical play," the Engineers are not afraid to push the boundaries, using new mechanica to give them the edge on the pitch. Some consider the ranged weaponry of the Guild to be an affront to the grand traditions of the game; other more knowledgeable observers realize they bear witness to the future of Guild Ball.

Mastering the Engineers is an exercise in synergy; comfortable on the ball, they are the consummate masters of possession play. Opponents will find themselves held at arms' length; trying to pick their way through Ballista's deadly minefield and Salvo's rain of crossbow bolts just to watch Velocity accelerate away with the precision and power only a machine can achieve.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Engineer's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Come Together
description:
Players explore what fetishes their partner might be into while trying to guess what they will actually be. The base set of Come Together has 142 cards with different sex acts/fetishes on them. Four cards are set out, then players secretly select which card they are most interested in. Then players guess which card their partner chose. Unchosen cards are discarded and replaced, and a secret selection happens again. If players match on the same card twice in a row, they win and probably want to try out whatever the winning match is.

The game is very much not for kids. But with values rooted in sex positive feminism and content that supports a wide variety of sexual interests and gender identities, the game is also very much not like most other "couples" games on the market.

name: Voyages avec Montaigne
description:
Travel around the most beautiful places in XVIth century Europe with Montaigne!
In 1580 and 1581, Michel de Montaigne is travelling Europe on horseback. In a Travel journal, he writes of this extraordinary experience.
Become travelers and follow his steps around France, Germany, Switzerland or Italy, to discover countries through Montaigne’s eyes, meet people he encountered and think with his mind… Until King Henri III calls you back to Bordeaux, as he did with Montaigne asking him to become the city’s mayor, then you will have to end your journey and go back to the South West of France as fast as you can.

This is a multi-purpose card game for 2 to 4 players from 8 years old.
The players manage their best hand cards they will pose in front of them, deploying the many discoveries of their trip (gastronomy, meetings, visits or reading the Montaigne books ...), while observing the choices of other players.
Voyages avec Montaigne offers many mechanics interlaced in a simple and fluid way. Opportunism, interaction and anticipation make the pleasure of a game that suddenly makes one of the greatest French writers of all time very close.

In the game Voyages avec Montaigne, players place cards face up next to the last card they placed, on a line from left to right. This line represents their journey.

On their turn, players take turns with 1 action among 3 :

Travel : place a card from a different city AND pay the cost of the travel (0, 1 or 2 cards discarded)
Stay : placing a card of the same city AND pick 1 new card
Get supplies : not placing a card AND pick and 2 new cards


Players can discard a figure met during his journey to take another action OR take a card from the discard pile.

2 travelling rules must be respected :

At the end of their journey, players must return to Bordeaux and have placed at least on « Citation » card form each of the 3 books of Montaigne
Players cannot go back to a city they have already been.


During their journey, players take one of the Bonus tile available as soon as they reach the objective first or do better than a player who had already achieved the objective (5 discovery bonus, 4 book bonus).

When the « King’s call » special card is revealed, all players must go back to Bordeaux as soon as possible, rules are thus modified :

Action « Stay » is not allowed anymore
Players cannot travel to a city that would take them further away from Bordeaux.


First players returning to Bordeaux get bonus, As soon as all players but one have returned to Bordeaux, the last player only has one turn left to play.

Bonus tiles are awarded to players : most cities visited, the most different theme cards, the most different characters encountered, largest stay.

The player with the highest score wins.

name: Fierce Women
description:
Fierce Women is a social card game that promotes and celebrates the work and contributions of women to society. It empowers its players to break down prejudices about women's abilities, interests and achievements, and inspires new generations of fierce women - all of that while providing great fun!

The Fierce Women deck consists of 60 cards, unique works of art with illustrated portraits and short biographies of women who made great contributions to society in the fields of science, culture, politics, human rights, feminism and art. There are also 10 additional action cards that add complexity to the game.

Simple and fast, yet deep and engaging card game where 2 to 5 players compete to collect sets with value dynamically altered based on other players sets.

—description from the publisher

name: Taco vs. Burrito: Foodie Expansion Pack
description:
New ingredients and more surprises for Taco vs. Burrito.

Contains:
16 Foodie Ingredient Cards
14 Action Cards
2 Instruction Cards

name: SAC: All Out Nuclear War Against the Soviet Union, 1962
description:
"SAC: All Out Nuclear War Against the Soviet Union, 1962" is an introductory level, low complexity wargame simulation. It portrays a “what if” attack by the US Strategic Air Command (SAC) against the USSR. The premise of the game is that the Cuban “missile crisis” escalated to an all-out nuclear war between the Cold War protagonists. The game is designed for two players, one taking on the role of the attacking US forces and the other the defending air defense forces of the Soviet Union. The game can also be played solitaire. The SAC game's design is based on the classic NORAD game, published over four decades ago by Conflict Magazine and Simulations, and designed by Dana Lombardy. My design is a tribute to that classic, but with the gaming perspective "switched" and some new rules "tweaks".

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Monster-Klatsch
description:
Monster High-Five

Be quick and keep an eye on the different groups monsters on the tiles. Does the number of monsters in a group match the number rolled? If so, each player tries to be the first to high-five the correct monster hand. The person who collects the most monster tiles wins.

—description from the publisher

name: ゾンビランドサガ 君の心にナイスゲームSAGA (ZombieLand Saga: Kimi no kokoro ni naisugēmu SAGA)
description:
ゾンビランドサガ 君の心にナイスゲームSAGA (ZombieLand Saga - Kimi no kokoro ni naisugēmu SAGA) (ZombieLand Saga - A nice SAGA game in your heart) is based on the hit anime "Zombieland Saga". You and up to four other players take the role of mysterious Idol Producer Kotaro Tatsumi as he tries to lead the idol group Franchouchou to fame and save Saga - all while making sure no one knows the idol group are zombies.

In this resource management game each player needs to balance their time between training the group, working part-time jobs, and selecting the best girls to perform Lives (concerts).

While the main way to earn fans in this game (Victory Points) is to perform the Lives you must be careful, because after each concert the participating girl's make-up is used up and they turn back into their Zombie form.

name: ParKing
description:
In ParKing each player plays a card per turn, either vehicle or action, to fill the parking slots of his ticket. The vehicles are placed on top of each other in the parking slots so you have to remember the points that add up to know when they are full.
On the other hand, actions can change the course of the game in many ways such as blocking a parking space, removing vehicles from the game or even changing your ticket with another player.
To win, you just need to show your ticket when you think your two parking slots are full.
So print your ticket, fill your parking slots and become the Par-King!

—description from the designer

name: 9 Figure
description:
9 Figure is a fast and simple dexterity game. Every card has a picture of animal, object, or person, consisting mainly of three shapes and colors.

A player rolls two dice. Then all players should simultaneously think and take one correct figure based on the combination of the dice. The player that finds the correct answer will get the point. The player who gets 5 points first wins.

—description from publisher

name: Волк, коза и капуста
description: Seeing a goat, a wolf forgets a thunderstorm. And let the goat into the garden, he’ll wipe the whole cabbage. Enlist the help of a faithful shepherd and make sure that the wolves are fed and the goats are safe!

name: Tiny Epic Mechs: Man vs. Meeple Promo Cards
description:
Promo pilot cards, originally available through Man vs. Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Featuring:
DrakkenStrike: "OVERLOAD: After you damage an opponent with a weapon, you may immediately discard that weapon from the game to double its damage.

Wayfinder: "PULSE VACUUM: When you take damage from a mine or turret, immediate collect one energy and one credit."

OffDutyNinja: "REMOTE DRONE: When you take a Deploy Mine/Turret action, you may instead move any 1 of your mine or turrets up to 2 adjacent spaces into an empty space for free.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: GLADIATOR: Fight To The Finish
description:
Fast-action card game for 2 players, designed to simulate the deadly dance of fighting with sword and shield.

The mechanics seek to solve the problem of realistically capturing the flow of gladiator combat without getting bogged down in lots of charts and dice throws.

Players draw a hand of 9 cards from their own deck and alternate playing attacks, feints, blocks and maneuvers, hoping to catch their opponent with his guard down.

Wounds reduce the size of subsequent hands drawn. The game ends when one player is reduced to zero (killed) – or has stopped the game to plea for his life.

Gladiators may be named and tracked for on-going campaigns or tournament play.

-description from designer

name: East-West
description:
East-West is a precursor to Schotten Totten and Battle Line played with a traditional deck (or a modified short deck). East-West is its own interesting and distinct game. It might even be better than its more famous related games!

In East-West, each player draws a card from a short deck and commits it to one of three shared central cards in an attempt to build better poker hands to win three contested spots. Variant rules improve the game by adding a doubling cube, cards in hand, a full deck and five contested areas instead of three.

The basic game is played with a 32 card deck (7 to Ace in four suits) with three active areas in which players build competing poker hands (using one shared card in each of the areas). A player wins the game if they win at least two of the three hands. Alternately, the game can be played to any point total one wishes. At the end of each game, a player would win 1 point for winning with two of the three hands, or 2 points for winning all three hands. The winner is the first to reach the agreed-upon points total.

—user summary

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.

name: きくり・ざ・ろっく！(Kikuri the Rock!)
description:
This game, roughly translated as Kikuri the Rock!, is a trick-taking game featuring shared hands of cards. Most of the cards exist in two colors - black and pink.

Cards are not dealt to one specific player, but rather a player holds their cards between them and the player on their left. Players should also not sort the cards.

On your turn, you can play the card from either end of either hand - on your left or your right.

The highest card played to a trick takes the 2nd highest card; the 2nd highest card takes the 3rd highest card; and the 3rd highest card takes the 4th highest. However, the lowest card takes the high card from the previous trick.

At the end of the game, black cards are worth negative face value, and pink cards are worth positive points.

name: Up & Across
description:
Up & Across is a two-player, abstract strategy board game on a 7×7 board.
Each player has a choice out of 2 actions. Move 2 towers or move your wizards.

Aim of the game is to bring your wizards to the other side of the board ending on your own towers.
Wizards are only allowed to be moved one step up or one step down on the towers.
Towers with wizards on them can not be moved.

—user summary
publishers: HenMar Games, Tucker's Fun Factory B.V.

name: Satan!
description:
The game comes with a flaming dice pin, which the players wear. When two players meet (recognizing the pin), the game begins when one of them declares "Satan!" Then both players roll three six-sided dice on the nearest convenient surface. Any die that doesn't come up 6 is rerolled. The first player to have all three dice showing sixes (6-6-6) and declare "Satan!" is the winner. If other players hear the initial call, they can declare "Satan!" and join the game.
The game was sold as a joke at GenCon 2003, but turned into a minor hit. Prospective buyers weren't told the rules unless they bought the game, but at $5, it drew in many curious gamers.

name: Floris
description:
Players in Floris collect flower cards to create bouquets — but they need to use every card in hand in order to offer that bouquet for points.

To set up, shuffle the deck, lay five cards in the shape of an X, then stack the deck nearby. On a turn, a player can either take the center card of the X, two outer cards in the X (as long as they're adjacent), or one or two face-up cards from the personal supply of an opponent. After doing this, the player either adds those cards to hand or places them face-up in their own personal supply. The player can then add any number of cards from their personal supply to their hand.

If the player can then make a bouquet of all the cards in hand and their cards contain at least five flowers, they can score if they wish. The cards must show all the same flower, or all types of flowers must be represented in equal numbers (e.g., three lilies and three roses), or at least three types of flowers in ascending numerical order (e.g., one daisy, two roses and three lilies). If the player hands in nine or more flowers, they gain bonus points in addition to one point for each flower.

When the market runs out, players score a final bouquet, then lose points for cards left in hand. Whoever has the highest score wins!

name: Pharao
description:
This is the third in the Pharao-Brettspiele series of games, the other two being Isis and Ramses.
The board is an Ancient Egyptian Senet board, and the game can be played as such if one supplies the throwing sticks (randomizing devices that eventually evolved into dice; available in commercial Senet sets or easily home-made). Note, however, that there are only 4 pieces per player instead of the almost-standard 5 (historically, the number of pieces per player varied between 5 and 10), so a fifth piece would ideally need to be supplied.
H. A. Renz chose, once more, to use the components for an entirely different, modern abstract strategy game. Each player uses two special dice to move both his pieces and his adversary's (this is the only game of the triad to have a random element). The object of the game is to either "push" all adversary pieces into the water (a special square), occupy the "happiness" square with one's last remaining piece, or box the adversary in so he cannot move.
Note how driving towards one victory condition (by adversary elimination) actually opens up a victory opportunity for the adversary --a neat twist.
Remarkably, the starting position is asymmetric because the board is asymmetric. There does not seem to be much of an advantage or handicap to being one side or the other.

name: Merlin
description: Fantasy / historical game set in Arthurian Britain. Each player is a Druid priest influencing the 10 sub-kingdoms of Britain. It is played on a colorful map of Olde Albion.At the start of the game there is one king in each region,and the Druid priests (Merlins) have to decide,which one they pick to advice.There are three different types of kings with power points up to 10.The Druids have to use the power of a king as clever as possible,to gain notoriety when King Arthur is arriving.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Story Dice
description:
A print-and play game for the BGG "Make a Dice Game!" competition.

Each player is given a set of d6.

On each face is a picture representing a story element. Each player in turn secretly rolls the dice, then tells a short story which must contain all of the story elements rolled.

The other players then secretly vote on which story elements they thought the teller had rolled by selecting them on their dice; they each score points equal to the number of elements they guess correctly, with the teller scoring points equal to the highest guesser.

Play continues until each player has had a turn; after which, players (in turn order) vote for the best story by placing their dice in front of one or more other players.

Each die scores one point; the player with the most points wins.

name: Postman Race
description:
User summary:
Postman Race is a race by postmen across the continent. By delivering letters before anyone else, you aim to become the world's best postman.

Publisher summary:
大陸を横断する郵便配達員のレースです。誰よりも早く手紙を届けて、世界一のポストマンになることを目指します。

From the rule book (used with permission):
Postman Race is a demanding and pop race between postmen to deliver a letter across the continent to a castle before anyone else. To cross various landscapes, you need to drive various vehicles. The players are free to choose the vehicle to own, the vehicle to drive, and the route to take. Once in a while, the players' courage is tested to take a reckless chance.

ポストマンレースは、1通の手紙を誰よりも早くお城に届ける、
過酷でポップな大陸横断レースです。様々な地形を乗り越えるために、
多種多様な乗り物をうまく乗り継がなければなりません。
どの乗り物を所有し、どの乗り物に乗り、どのルートを選択するかは
プレイヤーの自由です。ときには無謀な賭けにチャレンジする勇気が試されます。
publishers: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: Meine große Obstgarten Spielesammlung
description:
Meine große Obstgarten Spielesammlung is a gigantic game compilation of memory, card, tactile and dice games that includes both the original Obstgarden game and nine other games in the same box.

German publishers info:
Riesige Spielesammlung rund um den Obstgarten
• 10 in 1: original Obstgarten-Spiel UND 9 weitere, abwechslungsreiche Spielideen in einer Packung
• mit Memo-, Karten-, Fühl- und Würfelspielen
• umfangreiches, hochwertiges Spielmaterial aus Holz und Pappe

name: Unreal Estate: Orphanage
description:
User summary:

Promo card for Unreal Estate. Given out to Kickstarter backers and for backing Tantrum House Board Game Reviews Season 5 on Kickstarter.

Card Text:
Shuffle all cards in players hands, then deal back to each player the number of cards they had.

Consists of 2 identical cards.

name: Space Builder
description:
GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: be the first to build your space city, following the map instructions.
All players place a board before them facing the same way and take a set of building cards. The game is played in multiple rounds. In each round, a “map” card is turned over and placed face up in the centre. Players play at the same time, building their space city with their “building” cards according to the map instructions. Warning! Players may not turn the map card to face a different direction. You have to be fast and observant to avoid construction mistakes!

+++ A very fair game: the winner of the round has to play one more card than the other players in the next round!

—description from the publisher

name: Flucht aus dem Büro
description:
Held up in the office.
Friday afternoon and you are the last one in the office. Time to leave for the weekend. As you are about to leave you notice that the electronic doorlock does not functions and the door does not open.
Apparently your boss has a extra curicilar assignement for you and will only let you go when you have finished them. Not YOU! You'll find your way out of the office, but how?
With the puzzles in this game you will find out, if you can get out of the office.
Using different information and materials, you and your teammates will have to find a way out of the office. It may sound easy, but tricky puzzles stand in the way of your freedom and time is limited. This requires ingenuity, teamwork and a clear mind.

name: Codetalk
description:
CODETALK is a unique Tic-Tac-Toe game for 2 to 4 players.

The basic principle of the game is simple, but because the box grid that the next player can place his or her chip is determined by where the previous player place it, it's a strategic game where you have to think about attack and defense at the same time in a limited area.


GOAL OF THE GAME **



The first person to place 3 or more chips in a row wins.
(Either Horizontally, Vertically, or Diagonally)


SET UP **



Put the Grid Board at the center of the table.
Each player chooses the Colored Chip (Yellow, Red, Blue, Green).
Make sure every color has 20 chips.


PLAYING THE GAME **



1. The grid board has 9 small box grids, and each box grid has 9 numbers.
2. The first player selects one of the box girds and places a chip on one of the 9 numbers in that box grid.
At this time, the player tells the selected box grid and the number where the chip is placed. “No. 3 of Grid 5!”
3. The next player must place a chip within the small box grid number following the number where the previous player placed his or her chip.
(Yes. The previous player placed it on No. 3, so this player can only place it on the box grid 3.)
4. If all the numbers in the box grid are full, you cannot place a chip on the number of that box grid from the next turn.


END OF THE GAME **



1. If someone places 3 chips in a row, the game ends immediately and that player wins.
The chips must be placed in a row either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
[NOTE] This includes cases where the line crosses each small box grid.
2. If all of the chips are used and there is no winner, it is a draw and we should start the game again.


Contact Publisher



MAGICBEANGAMES(Republic of Korea)
e-mail : magicbean@magicbeangame.com

name: Indochina War
description: Indochina simulates two campaigns of the French in Vietnam from 1946-1954 and also allows for the creation of new campaigns. Scale is Bn-Div, hexes are 25 km across and each turn represents one month. 1 map, (15) pages of rules with an additional (9) pages of scenarios/tables, (280) unit counters.

name: Castaways of Deadmans Bay
description:
"The death of the famed pirate William Dread leaves the crew of the Rusty Barnacle fighting over his successor. The only way to survive this fast paced dueling game is to outsmart and trick your way to the top. All ages can enjoy this simple yet addictive battle of wits."

Gameplay:

Castaways puts the players in the muddy boots of 3 eager pirates with aspirations to captain their very own ship. Gameplay is based around building up your attacks and tricking your opponent to defend against the wrong attack. A successful attack could push you off the plank, drop your health or force your crew to desert you. Either way you're shark bait if you can't keep up with your opponent.

The duel is fast paced and mechanics are simple but strategies quickly form as you try to bluff your intentions while predicting your opponents. Younger audiences will find the duel fun and exciting while older audiences will enjoy the trickery when played with a clever opponent.

Characters:

Jennifer Jack Johnson
While simple minded "Jack" found that most problems in life share a simple solution. Jack freely shares his solution with sailors dumb enough to call him by his first name.

Chef Phillipe Forchette
Phillipe was hired to cook for the Queen on the great French galleon La Grandiere. He was quite shocked when he boarded the Castaway by accident. Now the only way home is to be at the helm.

Cannonade Kate
Raised at sea Kate grew up on gunpowder and steel. She's gained a fearsome reputation for crushing ships with her heavy cannon salute and could easily rule the sea- as soon as she has a ship of her own.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Fighting, Pirates
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Borderlands Expansion Set #2
description:
The second expansion for Eon's popular Borderlands game.

Contents:

Tokens for a sixth player
2 Temples
6 Universities
8 Blimps
20 Followers of the Sisterhood
20 Followers of the Brotherhood
40 Books of Knowledge.


By forgoing production for one round you may build a Temple, which allows you to generate Followers. You may use Followers to "convert" enemy territories, boats, ships, and blimps.

By forgoing one attack you may build a University which allows you to gain Books of Knowledge. Books defend against a Follower "conversion".

Expensive (1 gold, 1 Iron, 1 Coal, 2 Books) Blimps are mobile territories, like ships and boats, and can fly and ship anywhere on the map.

Expands:

Borderlands

name: The Battle of Marathon, 490 B.C.
description:
An expansion for The Great Battles of Alexander, this module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr 1. It is the first C3i magazine scenario for Great Battles of History. As with other games in the series, it uses a combat system that emphasizes weapon/armor superiority and maneuverability over quantity.

According to designer Mark Herman, "Hoplite warfare is a rather stolid affair. In most battles it's a question of whether Phalanx "a" can outpush and outsnarl Phalanx "b". This, for the most part, is why we chose not to begin our Great Battles of History series with something like HOPLITE: Classical Greek Warfare. With only a few exceptions, the scenario pickings alternate between dreary and grim. Marathon, one of the pivotal battles in classical history, is one of those exceptions." Marathon features the first bloody meeting between the great Persian Empire and the emerging power of Athens. The Persian army utilized light infantry and light cavalry from across their cosmopolitan empire. The Athenians used the famed Greek hoplites.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Tourspel
description:
Cycling simulation by a small Dutch designer outfit.

Each player takes charge of a team consisting of 1 captain and 3 helpers, or "water carriers". Cyclist move around a 4 lane wide track, by slipstreaming and dice rolling. Bonus and penalty chance cards help or hinder the cyclists, and the player whose captain first crosses the finish line wins the game. Alternative scoring rules allow the simulation of a tour (de France) along more numerous stages.

Like Homas Tour, there are alternative routes to pick from (in this case a fast oval, a longer road-race, and an even longer mountain stage) and there are different road surfaces to deal with. But although movement is also a combination of dice rolling, demarrages and slipstreaming, the mechanism used to resolve dice movement is very different from the usual roll-and-move. A player rolls 4 dice after obligatory slipstreaming, and the highest amount of team members that form a queue determine how many of these dice can be allocated to riders. Only the lowest numbers can be allocated, and you have to move the highest amount of riders that the dice will allow, making sequential positioning a crucial part of the game.

The "deluxe" edition of this game came in a clear plastic tube with magnetic chits representing riders and a 3 color board printed on a ferro-foil mat.

name: Cruel Morning: Shiloh 1862
description:
“I would fight them if they were a million.” - Albert Sidney Johnston on the eve of Shiloh

“Take your damned regiment back to Ohio. There are no Confederates closer than Corinth.” - William Tecumseh Sherman to Jesse Appler of the 53rd Ohio, April 5

On April 5, 1862 the Confederacy appeared to be finished. Forts Henry and Donelson had fallen and a Confederate division had been routed at Mill Springs. The Rebels had lost Columbus, Clarksville, and Nashville. New Orleans and Memphis were under direct threat. Out west the invasion of New Mexico had failed and the Union had triumphed at Pea Ridge. Forts and ports along the seaboard were being captured or raided. In Virginia, George McClellan had at last started his great drive to capture Richmond. On the banks of the Tennessee River a complacent Union army rested and waited for reinforcements before beginning what some thought would be the final push to end the rebellion.

On the morning of April 6 the Confederates attacked that complacent army near Shiloh Church. For two days the biggest battle yet waged by Americans was fought, a battle as large and savage as anything fought by Napoleon. In the end the Union triumphed, but at heavy cost. Ulysses S. Grant was for a time sidelined and Union generals became cautious for months after. Most of all, Shiloh changed the Civil War. Combined with Robert E. Lee’s successful defense of Richmond, Shiloh killed the vain dream of a quick war with conservative ends. The American Civil War became a long contest of wills, ending in the destruction of slavery and economic ruin for the American South.

Rally 'Round the Flag! is a brigade grand tactical system that combines old school hex and counter maneuvers with rules for command and control, leader personalities, and a CRT that favors quality and firepower over raw mass. For Shiloh the series will feature rules for the 47th Tennessee, Lew Wallace’s variable arrival, and Union gunboats among other things. The game comes with multiple scenarios, including a better Confederate attack plan, the battle starting on April 5, and the second day of battle. In addition, rules are included to modify each scenario with a variable arrival for Don Carlos Buell’s Army of the Ohio and part of the Fort Donelson garrison escaping and taking part in the battle. For those wanted to be even more adventurous, units are included from Earl Van Dorn’s Army of the West, and the brigades involved in the siege of Island No. 10.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Atlantico
description:
A game related to the "Atlantico" album by popular Italian singer Marco Mengoni, based on a journey to discover, sense, feel, paint the countries around the Atlantic Ocean, with its beauties.
At each turn, each player can choose whether to reach a destination (Europe, Africa, North America and South America) to collect colored tokens or collect a piece of journal representing people, natural beauties and monuments, by using these tokens.
The aim of the game is to travel and collect journals from each continent, along with some additional objectives, and reach the highest score at the end. The inspirational sentences appearing on the journal cards are taken from Mengoni's songs and enrich the poetic journey of this game.

Description by the designer; edited by Markus from Florence

name: Reversed Front: Dear Revolutionaries
description:
Players have to lead a revolutionary organization, eliminate internal conflicts, expect the help of various countries, develop resistance organizations, use both peace and force to consume the energy of the Red Army, and accelerate the end of CCP's rulings.

Or play the role of the Red Army defending the rule of the CCP, defeating all separatists and revolutionaries with an iron fist, guarding social harmony and stability, national unity and national unity, realizing the great rejuvenation of the eastern mainland, and trying to win Taiwan.

Or play the role of the Taiwanese government, using the power of a maritime nation to intervene in the mainland situation, while attacking CCP agents and appeasers in China, using spy networks and covert actions to win this final battle.

From Novosibirsk to Jakarta, from the Pamirs to Sakhalin, 264 cities and towns across the land and sea in the game, unite the 8 countries in the east, mediate the 7 major powers, and liberate the motherland from the iron curtain built by the trade unions!

There are 9 powers for players to play in the game, and each power has different advantages and disadvantages. Different powers can choose different bases, which also means that the powers that can be relied on are different, and different game strategies will be developed accordingly.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Golden Animals
description:
Golden Animal is an auction game for 3 to 5 players where you try to attract golden animals, such as cheetahs, giraffes, and lions - though also elephants, zebras, and rabbits.

A deck of cards is used for both what you are bidding on and what you may bid with. The auction is broken into three simultaneous lots: a mountain area, a river area, and an in-between area (though these are referential only, and not thematic.)

Players program their bids for each of the three areas, by arranging the cards in their hand. The highest bid for each area will take a card, followed by the next highest bid.

If a player wins food cards or rabbits, these are placed face up in front of a player. If a player wins a rock card, it is added to their hand. If a player wins a gold card, it can be discarded or swapped for another card in their hand.

After the auction, the player return the cards they used in the previous round to their hand (allowing for any additions or exchanges from the rock and gold cards), new cards are added to the areas, and the game play repeats.

After 7 rounds, the players compare who has the most in each of the three food types, and golden animal cards are awarded. Players add the points collected from those to points (both positive and negative) on other cards in their hand, and the player with the most points wins.
user summary

GOLDEN ANIMAL は、世にも珍しい金の動物・GOLDEN ANIMAL を集めて勝利を目指すゲームです。
各プレイヤーは、手札に山カード１枚、川カード１枚。金貨カード複数枚を持っています。そして、自分の手札を好きなように並び替えて全員同時に公開します。山カードと川カードを境に３か所に区切られた各エリアごとに、金貨の合計額で順位を付けて、各ヵ所で競りの商品になっている動物やエサや金貨を獲得していきます。
動物を獲得すると点数を得ることができます。エサを獲得すると獲得した順位によって大量得点を得ることができます。金貨を獲得すると自分の金貨が増えます。最終的に得点の高いプレイヤーの勝利です。
競り・バッティング・拡大再生産をミックスした手軽なパーティゲームです。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Sealed Bid
publishers: Jelly Jelly Games, 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)

name: Papperlapapp
description:
There are 120 cards with one Word and picture on each card. 16 of them are now face-up on the table. Every player manages now to combine all of his hand cards with the cards on the table. e.g. You have the card "Kinder" and on the table is "Garten". Take the matching card and lay the pair in front of you. After one player combined all his cards, every player reads aloud his combinations. Each pair which doesn´t fit is not scored (Dictionary necessary). There is also a variant for the pictures on the cards.

Learn German by playing this game: At least you would understand what a DONAUDAMPFSCHIFFAHRTSGESELLSCHAFTSKAPITÄNSMUTZE is. (why, naturally, it is the hat of the captain of the Donau Steamship Company)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Word Game

name: Mimikri
description:
Mimikri can be played as two variants of traditional chess.

In the first, players know the identity their own pieces but not that of their opponent. Only by studying the opponent's moves, can the pieces be identified.

In the second variant, players know the identity of their opponent's pieces but not of their own. Moves are made blindly. If a player moves a piece inappropriately, the opposing player says "no," the piece is returned to its original position and it becomes the opposing player's turn to move. However, if the move is appropriate, the piece remains in its new position thus revealing its identity. Subsequent moves can be made accordingly. It is now the opposing player's turn to move.

The game was published by 3M exclusively for Germany.

name: Dawgs of War
description:
The Howling Skies are upon us! The greatest dog pilots of our time are battling overhead, each growl and yip bringing them closer and closer. As oil and wood rains down from their fight, I just hope I get to see the action up close some day...

In Dawgs of War from designer Nathan Hansen, you and up to seven additional friends take to the skies for aerial combat in the era of the Great Dog War. Each player takes on the role of a famous canine pilot as you battle both gravity and the other planes. All plays are made at the same time and you’ll be hard-pressed to see the moves coming, as danger can come from any of twelve possible directions. Get ready for the Howling Skies!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Galactic Strike Force: Promo Cards
description:
Double-sided promo card for Galactic Strike Force: one side depicting the Swangee Automaton Tech card, the other side showing the Broodax Repositor Ship card.

The Swangee Automaton allows you to swap the attack and defense values of an opposing ship; and the Broodax ship will automatically move to the sector with the fewest player ships.

These cards were a Kickstarter bonus.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: OK, Chume, Boom!
description:
Abu, the photographer, is going to take some group photos for you.
The problem is, he always commands people to make gestures by his order. You better do what he wants or he will get impatient and mad!

OK, Chume, Boom! is a real-time dexterity game with both cooperation and competition modes. Each round player(s) must perform specific gestures following the icons on the revealed tokens. If someone fails, they won't score points and Abu will get angry little by little. Try hard to follow Abu's orders and become the best photo actor!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Werebeasts: Deluxe Edition
description:
You are a key player in the lucrative but dangerous business of collecting werebeasts. Armed with only your good looks and several cans of indescribably tasty werechow, you must bid for the werebeasts you need — and also for the ones you don't in hopes of throwing your opponents off track.

Your fellow collectors in Werebeasts are also collecting certain creatures that have the most value to them. If you can hide your intentions long enough, you'll be rewarded. If you can make it to the end of the game without getting caught, you just might win.

In addition to the base game, Werebeasts Deluxe Includes:

4 Additional Goal Cards
16 Additional Auction Cards
80 Wooden Werechow Cans (replaces the Werechow cardboard tokens)
